Start.text: Start

Next.text: Next

DlgAccompagny.desc: This character will temporarily join your troop.

DlgRecruitAnnounce.desc: Publish a Vacancy Notice to hire a recruit.

Dig.desc: The pendulum swings when close to special items. The shorter the oscillations, the closer the item is.

CampFireEatArrow.desc: Feed your troop by allocating the necessary amount of food.

ConverterToolActionArrow.desc: Place an ingredient to start production.

StakeToolArrow.desc: Impale a body on the stake

Relationship.desc:
Your Companions can form relationships ranging from love to hate.
Their relationships can evolve through combat interactions as well as their closeness in the camp, affecting the troop's overall happiness.

RelationshipBestFriend.desc: When best friends are in close proximity, they are stronger in battle and happier at camp.

RelationshipHate.desc: When Companions who hate each other are in close proximity at camp, they reduce the troop's happiness.

PrisonerTrust.desc: This prisoner can be wary of the troop or trust them.

RuinsLight.desc:
You will need torches to light your way as you explore Tombs.
If your Light dies out, your troop will panic and flee the Tomb.

NoiseForsakenVillage.desc: Your expedition troop's actions can make noise that might attract Plague-ridden.

NoiseCrimeCave.desc: Your troop's actions can make noise that might attract the owners.

ActionPointBonus.desc: Temporary Valour Points must be used before the battle ends or they will be lost.

Suspicion.desc: A high Suspicion level will cause you to be sought by the Guard, and you will have to pay for your crimes.

SeaLordsReputation.desc: Increasing your Reputation will improve your position on the Lords of the Seas leaderboard and allow you to challenge rivals.

PathMenu.desc: Paths combine the feats you've achieved and show your progress in the various possible routes.

ShowPathTitles.desc: Show the titles available for this path

PathMight.desc:
The path of Power and Glory is fraught with dangers and fearsome enemies, but great rewards await those who prevail.
Forge the best armour, recruit the bravest Companions and fight together so your names echo beyond the farthest reaches of the Five Kingdoms.

PathTrade.desc:
The path of Trade and Craftsmanship offers abundant riches to the humblest individuals, provided they are cunning and ambitious.
Complete the most lucrative missions, trade in every city, track down the rarest and most luxurious items, and your troop will become the most affluent in the Five Kingdoms.

PathCrime.desc:
Loathed by the gentry and cursed by the Guard, the path of Crime and Chaos will take you on a treacherous journey.
But through raids, thefts, caravan attacks and murder, you could well become the defenders of the common folk of the Five Kingdoms... or their persecutors.

PathMystery.desc:
Only the most curious of adventurers dare tread the path of Mysteries and Wisdom.
Follow this winding road and explore uncharted lands, search the mysterious Tombs of the Ancients, uncover the best-kept secrets, and become the most knowledgeable scholars in the Five Kingdoms.

MoraleGalvanized.desc: Your units become galvanised, significantly boosting the damage they deal.

MoraleWin.desc: You win the battle: your opponents are overwhelmed and try to flee.

MoraleMotivation.desc: Your units become motivated, boosting the damage they deal.

Retreat.desc:
Flee the battle!
Your Companions’ armour will take damage, and they risk being injured themselves.
You will also lose <happy>[VALUE]</happy>.

BackToMainUnit.desc: Another Companion has started their turn. Return to the active Companion.

SportTackle.desc: Indicates that the unit will try to make their opponent fall.

SportDodge.desc: Indicates that the unit will try and evade their opponent's tackle.

UnitReinforcements.desc:
Reinforcements will soon join the opposing team.
Remaining reinforcement rounds: [VALUE]

Arena_GroupToDefeat.desc: Defeat this team to move on to the next battle.

Arena_ChampionToDefeat.desc: Defeat the Champion to win in the arena.

Camp.desc: The Camp is a place for your Companions to rest, have a meal, and go about various activities.

Inventory.desc: All your items are stored in your Inventory. Be sure to always have enough Carrying Capacity.

MiniMap.desc: Use the world map to keep track of the places you have explored and the ones still unknown to you.

Grimoire.desc: The Compendium is a collection of all the blueprints, patterns and recipes your troop can learn.

Boat.desc: Manage your ship and delegate roles to your crew.

OutlawsCancel.desc: Use your Krowns and influence to convince this group to let you go.

WolfCancel.desc: Throw the meat on the ground to create a diversion and run away.

BoarCancel.desc: These ravenous boars will eat anything.

WeightOverLimit.text: You are carrying too much weight in your inventory!

CraftUnique.text: You can only have this item once.

CraftNotEnoughMaterials.text: Not enough resources to craft this amount

AttributeUpgrade.desc: You can spend Influence to add 1 to an Aptitude when levelling up.

UnitStatusAfraid.text: This unit fled the troop during combat.

AptitudePoint.desc: Aptitude Points can be used to improve your Companion's attributes.

AdjustedEquipment.desc:
These pieces of equipment are matching.
Their stats are increased by [VALUE]%.

Backstab.desc: Triggered when this unit attacks an engaged enemy from behind.

DeadlyBlow.desc: Triggered if this ability kills the target.

CapaCritical.desc: Triggered if this ability lands a critical hit.

Duel.desc: Can only be used if this unit is engaged in combat.

Vigilance.desc: Cannot be used if this unit is engaged in combat.

NotifySalary.text: During the next Rest, you will have to pay your Companions <gold>::due::</gold>.

NotifyUnitExhausted.text: ::name:: died of exhaustion. You should set up camp and rest!

NotifyLearnStrategy.text: You have learned a new strategy ::strategy::. ::descStrategy::

NotifyMissionCompleted.text: You have just completed the mission ::name::. Report to an emissary to claim your reward.

NotifyMissionFailed.text:
You failed the mission ::name::.
You will not be able to claim a reward.

NotifyMerchantInfluence.text: Your recent dealings have made you famous! You have gained <influence>::count::</influence>

NotifyWantedStart.text: Your recent actions have caught the Guard's attention. You are now wanted!

NotifyWantedForget.text: Your crimes were forgotten. Your stolen item count is reset to zero.

NotifyWantedStop.text: The Guard is busy chasing other criminals at the moment - you are no longer wanted.

NotifyWantedAccumulated.text: Your many transgressions have made you a person of interest!

NotifySeaLordsTuto.text: You received a message: the <narrator>Fan</narrator> would like to meet you at the <narrator>Per-Bast Tavern</narrator>.

NotifySeaLordsNewRival.text:
Your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> is equal to that of ::name:: and his crew.
Eliminate him to take his place on the leaderboard!

NotifySeaLordsNewRivalWoman.text:
Your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> is equal to that of ::name:: and her crew.
Eliminate her to take her place on the leaderboard!

NotifySeaLordsNewRivalPlural.text:
Your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> is equal to that of ::name:: and their crew.
Eliminate them to take their place on the leaderboard!

NotifySeaLordsRivalAggressive.text: ::name:: and his crew now see your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> as a threat. They will track you relentlessly.

NotifySeaLordsRivalAggressiveWoman.text: ::name:: and her crew now see your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> as a threat. They will track you relentlessly.

NotifySeaLordsRivalAggressivePlural.text: ::name:: and their crew now see your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> as a threat. They will track you relentlessly.

NotifySeaLordsRivalDefeated.text: You have defeated ::name:: and taken his place on the Lords of the Seas leaderboard.

NotifySeaLordsRivalDefeatedWoman.text: You have defeated ::name:: and taken her place on the Lords of the Seas leaderboard.

NotifySeaLordsRivalDefeatedPlural.text: You have defeated ::name:: and taken their place on the Lords of the Seas leaderboard.

NotifySeaLordsLostReputation.text: Your decision to flee has made you the laughingstock of Belerion. You lose ::count:: Reputation.

NotifyArmorRepaired.text: Your Companions' armour has been repaired.

NotifyInventoryRepaired.text: The items in your inventory have been repaired.

NotifyInjuriesHealed.text: Your Companions' injuries have been healed.

NotifyPrisonersInjuriesHealed.text: Your prisoners' injuries have been healed.

NotifyHealInjuryFailed.text: The ::item:: remedy had no effect on ::name::

NotifyKnowledge.text: Progress made in your discoveries has earned you a Knowledge Point.

NotifyRenamed.text: ::prev:: has been renamed ::name:: and the other Companions approve.

NotifyRenamedBad.text: ::prev:: has taken the alias ::name:: and their Companions really dislike it.

NotifyExigenceSucceeded.text:
You made the crowd happy!
You get <ap>::amount::</ap>.

NotifyUnitTitle.text: ::name::'s feats have earned him the nickname ::newName::. He earns an Aptitude Point.

NotifyUnitTitleWoman.text: ::name::'s feats have earned her the nickname ::newName::. She earns an Aptitude Point.

NotifyUnitTitleNeutral.text: ::name::'s feats have earned him the nickname ::newName::. He earns an Aptitude Point.

NotifyFirstCaptain.text: Your Companions have become more experienced; you can now appoint one of them as Captain.

NotifyLostCaptain.text: Your troop lost their Captain. They will need some time to regroup.

NotifyNewCaptain.text: It is time to appoint a replacement for your previous Captain.

NotifyFirstLieutenant.text: Your troop is more structured; you can now appoint one of your Companions as a Lieutenant.

NotifySecondLieutenant.text: Your troop is growing! You can now appoint one of your Companions as a second Lieutenant.

NotifyNegociationSuccess.text: Negotiation successful! The emissary has accepted your offer for mission ::name::.

NotifyNegociationFailFirst.text: The emissary refuses your offer for mission ::name::.

NotifyNegociationFail.text: The emissary refuses your offer for mission ::name:: and makes a counteroffer of ::value::.

NotifyForsakenAfterCombat.text:
Your troop has found a way out, and the village slowly regains its peacefulness.
You can now resume your exploration quietly.

NotifyCrimeCave.text: The chest was booby-trapped! ::unitName:: sustained an injury: ::injury::

NotifyLuteWin.text: The crowd seems to love it!

NotifyLutePerfectWin.text: The crowd rewards you with a standing ovation!

NotifyLuteFail.text: The crowd wasn't ready for such a cacophony...

NotifySongUnlock.text: You have learned a new song: ::name::

NotifySongUnlockAch.text: Your feats have inspired you to write a new song: ::name::

NotifyFatPork.text: ::name:: has put on enough weight and can now be slaughtered!

NotifyFleeRuins.text: Your last torch has died out... Your Companions were hurt as they rushed out of the Tomb in a panic!

NotifyWhiplashDeathMultiple.text: Some of your Companions didn't survive the whip: ::names::.

NotifyWhiplashMissTarget.text: A sudden gust of wind flung the whip away from ::name::and onto ::newTarget::'s back!

NotifyPrisonerTrustRecruit.text: The prisoner ::name:: trusts you and has joined the troop!

NotifyWealthFirstAnnounce.text: Word of your Troop's wealth is starting to spread throughout the land.

NotifyWealthSecondAnnounce.text: Word of your wealth has spread throughout the land. You are now attracting unwanted attention.

NotifyWealthTriggered.text: Marauders have been spotted raiding isolated troops!

NotifyBrigandsStealItems.text:
These Marauders have just robbed you.
::items::
To reclaim your belongings, find the Marauder group again.

NotifyBrigandsFleeBattle.text:
A Marauder ran away with some of your items!
You can catch up with him after the battle to reclaim your belongings.

NotifyUnitBurnt.text: You didn't make it in time to stop the Inquisition from purging the world of ::name::'s existence.

NotifyStruckByLighting.text: The troop was touched by the Eye of Alazar. Happiness lost: <happy>::valeur::</happy>.

NotifyAnnounceRecruitConfirm.text:
Vacancy Notice published!
Come back in the next few days to check if a potential recruit has replied.

NotifyAnnounceRecruit.text: Vacancy Notice in ::place:: : ::name:: is waiting for you in the tavern.

NotifyDrinkAction.text: ::name1:: and ::name2:: got drunk and confessed their weaknesses to each other. Sharing this helped them move forward. ::name1:: lost <trait>::t1::</trait> and ::name2:: lost <trait>::t2::</trait>.

NotifyInsultAction.text: ::name1:: and ::name2:: traded insults before the bewildered eyes of the rest of the troop. They are now sworn enemies and have <trait>::trait::</trait>.

NotifyCaptainDuelVictory.text: ::name:: was defeated in a memorable duel.

NotifyBoatStorm.text: A storm is raging. The winds are changing and unpredictable.

NotifyBallistaEquiped.text: You have placed a ballista on your ship. To use it, assign a gunner and acquire ammunition.

NotifyFishingPhase2.text: The fish is biting... This could be a big catch!

NotifySentToReserve.text: ::name:: has been assigned to the Reserve.

NotifyCantSendToCamp.text: ::name:: cannot be assigned to the camp because it is full.

NotifyTavernRank.text: Impressed by the quality of your Tavern, the prestigious Tavern Keepers' Guild has awarded you a new star and has sent you a reward.

NotifyTavernSpecialty.text: ::unitName:: has just prepared a serving of the Tavern's speciality: ::itemName::

NotifyTavernRecipeSecialty.text: You have received and learned the ::itemName:: speciality in your Compendium.

PlaceForsakenVillage.desc: Form a group of scouts who are determined and stealthy enough to explore the abandoned village discreetly.

GamemodeTavern.desc: The Tavern can generate profits during each Rest. The troop manages its menu, staff, layout and progress.

TavernSilver.desc: Can be exchanged for Krowns. The exchange rate increases with the frequency of transfers.

TavernPrestige.desc: A measure of the Tavern's success, this allows you to order better equipment. Based on the number, variety, and satisfaction of patrons.

TavernComfort.desc: A measure of the Tavern's appeal. Impacts the number of patrons and the sale odds.

TavernStars.desc: These stars, awarded by the Tavern Keepers' Guild, represent how your Tavern measures up against your competitors.

TavernSecurity.desc: Impacts satisfaction and the odds of negative events. The more patrons there are, the more Bouncers you need to enforce security measures.

TavernCapacity.desc: Max number of patrons you can accommodate for each Shift.

TavernCustomers.desc: A measure of the Tavern's style. An upscale clientele will tolerate higher prices, while a working-class patronage will tolerate low security.

TavernStatsGeneral.desc: Used to view all details about the Tavern and manage its funds.

TavernGraph.desc: Shows the Tavern's progress over the last 7 Shifts.

FoodRecipe.desc: A Scullion can no longer steal recipes from this Tavern. An infiltration mission can only earn them a profession trait.

TavernSpy.desc: Depending on their profession, an infiltrator employee can steal prestige or a secret recipe from a rival Tavern.

DrinkRecipe.desc: Brewers can no longer steal recipes in this Tavern. An infiltration mission will only reward them with a profession trait.

TavernMenu.desc: Used to determine the dishes and beverages served, manage their production and set their prices.

TavernCommand.desc: Used to move or upgrade Tavern equipment or order new equipment.

TavernStaff.desc: Used to transfer Companions between the troop and the Tavern, as well as recruit civilians.

TavernStats.desc: Manage the Tavern's funds and view its statistics, progress and how often it is visited by each faction.

TavernRanking.desc: Presents rival Taverns and lets you send infiltrators there.

TavernUnitInTransfert.desc: This Companion will reach the Tavern by the next Shift.

TavernUnitInCustomMission.desc: This employee will return to the Tavern once their infiltration mission is over.

TavernUnitInSpying.desc: This employee will return to the Tavern once their infiltration mission is over.

BarrelProgress.desc:
The green part of the meter will be full after the next Shift. Ignores potential sales.
The speed of production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing.

BrewerLevelRequire.text: This Brewer doesn't meet the level requirement to craft this alcohol.

BrewerProducingArrow.text: If a Brewer is assigned to an empty barrel, they will produce alcohol during each Rest. If the barrel is filled and put in reserve, the Brewer will age its contents. The speed of production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing.

ForSale.desc: The barrel's contents are for sale. If a Brewer is assigned to it, they will focus on production.

InCellar.desc: The barrel's contents cannot be sold. Once the barrel is filled, if a Brewer is assigned to it, they will improve its ageing.

TavernCivilian.desc: Civilians cannot learn a new profession or be transferred to the troop.

TavernInjured.desc: An injured employee continues to receive wages, but can no longer work. If the Tavern Keeper is injured, their traits no longer apply but the Tavern continues to operate.

TavernPrisoner.desc: A prisoner working in the Tavern receives lower wages, but costs prestige.

TavernCantProduce.text: Some of the selected recipes cannot be made.

TavernSeasoning.desc: The Scullions use seasoning to improve dishes and sell them at higher prices.

TavernNewService.desc: Starts a new Shift without needing to rest at the camp.

WinHArena.desc:
Rules
1. A team consists of four fighters. After registering, the team cannot be modified for the rest of the competition.
2. Fight three battles in a row to take on the Arena Champion and try to obtain their medal.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.

WinHArenaHard.desc:
Rules
1. A team consists of four fighters. After registering, the team cannot be modified for the rest of the competition.
2. Fight three battles in a row to take on the Arena Champion and try to obtain their medal.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Each time you fail to meet a requirement, a fighter is taken out of combat.

WinHArenaLegend.desc:
Rules
1. Fight three champions in a row during a long and challenging arena battle.
2. Upon joining the fight, each champion adds a new rule to the previous ones and a new round starts.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Every time you fulfil a requirement, your fighters recover some Health.

WinHArenaLegendHard.desc:
Rules
1. Fight three champions in a row during a long and challenging arena battle.
2. Upon joining the fight, each champion adds a new rule to the previous ones and a new round starts.
3. When a fighter has no more Health, they do not die but are instantly taken out of combat.
4. Every time you fulfil a requirement, your fighters recover some Health.
5. Each time you fail to meet a requirement, a fighter is taken out of combat.

WinHSport.desc:
Rules
1. A team is made up of 6 players. Each player has a specific role depending on their Strength or Dexterity.
2. There are 2 balls that both teams fight to control. A player taking a ball to the opponent's end zone scores 2 points for their team, plus 1 additional point if their team also has the other ball.
3. A match is played over 8 rounds. The team with the highest score at the end of the last round wins the game!

Gosenberg2RegionQuestAccuse.desc:
Find the guilty person in the region.
Do you want to accuse this person?

Gosenberg2RegionQuestAccuseTuto.desc:
Search for the culprit throughout the region.
Do you want to accuse this person?

WinHCrimePath.text:
The treasure is in a chest bearing the Gosenberg Wheel.
The keys are in the other chests.
Only chests with symbols are booby-trapped. Only wooden chests contain information.

TutoForge.desc: The metal plates are heating up. Press [LMB] when a plate turns red to forge your item. Press [LMB] when the metal plate gives off sparks to forge an item of superior quality! Hit all the plates at the right time for a chance to forge an item of exceptional quality!

TutoLockpick.desc: Rotate the pick and press [LMB] to insert it into the lock. The closer the pick is to an opening, the more it lifts up. But if it jiggles too much, it might break.

TutoFishing.desc: Use a hook to cast your line in the water with [LMB]. Once the fish is hooked, hold [LMB] to keep the line tight in the central zone. Don't let the fish escape!

TutoMining.desc: Place your cursor on the mining circle. Press [LMB] when the green circle overlaps the grey one to gather a maximum of ore!

TutoRetreat.desc: If you think you are fighting a losing battle, you can leave combat by hitting the Retreat button. You Companions will suffer damage but they will survive!

TutoTerror.desc: When a unit flees in Terror, they disappear from combat but do not leave your troop. They will reappears once the battle has ended.

TutoFall.desc: When a unit falls overboard, they disappear from combat but do not leave your troop. They will reappear once the battle has ended.

TutoRats.desc: Kill the Matriarch to end the fight. At the end of each Round, the Matriarch calls in numerous rats to help her. Try to destroy as many Plague-infested outgrowths as possible before killing the Matriarch to earn more rewards!

TutoElite.desc: Elites are unique enemies who can act more than once during a Round. Pay close attention to the turn order to prepare your strategy.

TutoImportantUnit.desc: Some characters are important. If they die, the battle will end. Important allied characters must be protected, and important enemies captured.

TutoHideout.desc: A Lair is a place teeming with enemies. The more active skulls there are, the more dangerous the lair is. To reduce the number of enemies in a Lair, look for groups with a skull in the region. Eliminate them first to make your final assault easier.

TutoTired.desc: You group is overtired. Your Companions might die of exhaustion if you keep walking! You really should rest.

TutoRest.desc: You can Rest at a Campfire in your camp. Feed your troop and pay their wages to avoid unrest! Resting refills your Fatigue metre, restores Valour Points and speeds up time.

TutoCombatFirst.desc: When your turn comes, play any unit you haven’t used yet in the Round. You can find out which enemy will then come into play. Prepare your strategy!

TutoEngagement.desc: When you perform a melee attack on a free enemy, you engage them. An engaged unit can only attack their engaged opponent and has a higher chance of taking critical damage. Take advantage of this with your other units! An engaged unit is exposing their back. Attack them from behind to get a bonus.

TutoEncircling.desc: Surround an engaged enemy unit with two allies to get a bonus!

TutoSupport.desc: Surround an engaged enemy unit with two allies to get a bonus!

TutoDying.desc: A dying unit can only move. If you heal them before they take damage, they will be able to fight again. If not, they will be permanently lost.

TutoBonusPoints.desc: Some actions grant [ActionPointBonus] that must be used before the battle ends or they will be lost.

TutoRuin.desc: You will need torches to light your way as you explore Tombs. If your Light dies out, your troop will panic and flee the Tomb.

TutoCapture.desc: When an enemy has less than half of their Health left, use Chains or Rope to capture them! Place one of your units next to an engaged enemy to try and capture them.

TutoPassiveFaction.desc: At this level, the enemies develop more complex and specialised battle strategies!

TutoFlee.desc: In Escape Mode, you must reach the escape area and flee with all of your characters, but you can no longer Retreat! Once in the target area, use the Flee skill.

TutoForsakenWorld.desc: Form a group of scouts to explore a village as quietly as possible to avoid attracting the Plague-ridden.

TutoForsakenFight.desc: Block the entrances to prevent the Plague-ridden from entering the building and swarming you! Use the Find a way out skill to change the gauge and escape the building!

TutoLute.text: Learn how to play the lute!
TutoLute.desc: Press [LMB] in time with the notes on each string to play the sheet music. Your reward will depend on the quality of your performance!

TutoWoodCut.desc: Place the cursor on the wood-cutting circle. Press [LMB] when the green circle overlaps the grey one to gather more wood!

TutoSteal.desc:
You can steal items using [RMB].
Each theft increases the Guard's suspicion level.

TutoSport.desc: Grab the ball and bring it to the opponent's end zone to score. The game is divided into 8 Rounds. All units on the ground will stand up again at the beginning of each new Round. Any unit already played who gets the ball can play again.

TutoCaptainDuel.desc: An enemy captain's words announce their next action. Interpret their words correctly and choose the appropriate response: - If you Attack when your opponent Taunts, you will hit them. - If you Parry when they Attack, you'll avoid the hit. - If you Taunt when they Parry, you will gain the Upper Hand. The Upper Hand allows you to hit your enemy: - If you Attack at the same time as them. - If you Parry successfully. You cannot use the same action twice in a row.

TutoCaptainDuelHelp.desc: An enemy captain's words announce their next action. Interpret their words correctly and choose the appropriate response.

TutoStartCaptainDuel.desc: The enemy captain has no [Armor] left. You can challenge them to a duel with a melee unit. Duels are optional. They are a more honourable way to defeat an enemy captain.

TutoNavigation.desc: The ship moves automatically when the sails are up. Its speed depends on the wind direction, which is shown on the compass and the nautical map. To accelerate, you can put out the oars, but this will tire your troop. Your ship's condition will deteriorate if it suffers collisions, is fired upon or encounters rough weather. You can repair or upgrade it at any Dock.

TutoSeaFight.desc: *Falls*: - A unit pushed overboard is left hanging and can no longer use their skills. - They can only be rescued by an ally or killed by an enemy in melee range. *Boarding*: - Ropes can be used to board the enemy ship. - The unit using them disappears into the rigging and drops back down at a distance on the next round, damaging and knocking back nearby units.

TutoBallista.desc: Controls: - Continue steering your ship normally. - Aim the ballista with [KEY_BallistaLeft] and [KEY_BallistaRight]. - Fire with [KEY_BallistaFire]. - Change projectiles with [KEY_BallistaProjectileChange]. Hitting an enemy ship will slow it down and weaken its crew. A projectile's effect can only be applied once to an enemy ship.

TutoBallistaFight.desc: The ballista injures and knocks back all units in its line of fire. It must be loaded before it can be used. A unit cannot load and fire the ballista in the same turn.

TutoUltimate.desc:
When a Companion reaches level 12, they can choose a Bravery, a skill that unlocks new strategies in battle.
Make the most of these skills, as their usage is limited. Your troop can perform only one Bravery per round. Each Companion can use their Bravery only once per battle.

TutoDifficulty.desc:
We have revised the difficulty level of Wartales in the latest update!
Having taken your feedback into consideration, the difficulty has been increased to make sure the game remains challenging past level 5. Thanks to new units and skills, enemy troops will definitely give you a run for your money. You might have to enter into battles more carefully and even rework the composition of your team. Your tactics and strategies will have an even more decisive impact.
You can now change the difficulty level at any time in the Options menu. If you're having a hard time, feel free to retreat and decrease the difficulty until you get the hang of things.
For more details, check out the latest patch notes listing all the difficulty-related changes.

TutoStolenItems.desc:
As long as the Guard is after you, they will remember what you stole. Stolen items that are consumed, sold, discarded or used for crafting will still count towards your total fine until you are no longer wanted.
Fencing an item is the only other way to reduce your fine.

TutoTavern.desc: The Tavern is an establishment managed by the troop, which can generate revenue during each Shift. To operate successfully, a Tavern requires staff, equipment and an extensive menu. The Tavern's reputation is measured by Prestige . Using Prestige, you can unlock equipment and expand the Tavern. The more numerous, varied and satisfied your patrons are, the more Prestige you will earn. The main ways to attract patrons and encourage them to spend money are Comfort , Security and Satisfaction , which are calculated after each Shift.

TutoTavernBrewing.desc: Each barrel with a Brewer assigned to it can produce alcohol. Production is calculated during each Shift, and costs resources. Production depends on the Brewer's level, the type of alcohol and the degree of ageing . When a barrel is put in reserve and a Brewer is assigned to it, its degree of ageing will gradually increase, thereby increasing its value. Ageing alcohol does not cost resources. To acquire new recipes, you can explore the Compendium – or, if your Prestige is high enough, steal secret recipes from rival Taverns.

TutoTavernCooking.desc: Food production depends on the Scullion's capacity, but also on demand. If demand is low, the Scullion will produce less. To increase your sale odds, set reasonable prices and select dishes that your patrons will like. To acquire new recipes, you can explore the Compendium, buy recipes from Taverns in different regions – or, if your Prestige is high enough, steal their secret recipes.

TutoTavernEquipment.desc: Use this window to move, buy or sell Tavern equipment. Increase the Tavern's Prestige to unlock new types of equipment. When the upgraded version of a piece of equipment is available, you can buy it directly or upgrade equipment you already own.

TutoTavernStaff.desc: A Tavern must fill various roles in order to operate. These roles can be filled by your Companions, or by civilians recruited specifically for the Tavern. When the troop is away from the Tavern, transferring a Companion does not take effect until after the next Shift. Civilians are available immediately, but cannot learn a new profession or be transferred to the troop. When a civilian is fired, they receive a small bonus. Employee wages depend on their role, the Tavern's Prestige and their Profession level. Working in the Tavern grants Profession experience.

TutoTavernOverview.desc: Taverns use a special currency: Copper Coins . They can be exchanged for Krowns , but the exchange rate will decline with each additional withdrawal. The rate rises slightly after each Shift. Krowns can only be used to replenish the Tavern's funds when its balance is negative. The exchange rate is then set at 1 for 1 .

TutoTavernFactions.desc: The more visits your Tavern receives from different factions, the more its Prestige will increase. But each faction has its own requirement, and if it's not met, that faction won’t come. Each faction also has certain preferences in terms of food, drink, music and ambiance. If these requirements are met, the faction will be more likely to arrive in numbers. The more your menu reflects your patrons' tastes, the more likely your items will sell.

TutoTavernRanking.desc: Taverns are ranked according to their Prestige . Exceeding the Prestige of other popular Taverns will grant you stars . Besides attracting customers, these stars also come with special rewards. You can send employees to infiltrate rival Taverns. The effects of an infiltration mission depend on the infiltrator’s profession, and its odds of success depend on their Profession level, the Prestige of the targeted Tavern, and how many days the mission lasts.

CookSpecialty.desc: When a speciality is prepared at the Tavern, a serving is set aside for the troop at each Rest. A Tavern's speciality is its trademark, and only one kind can be served at a time.

StartPugilist.desc:
Requires one of the following:
- Must have a Pugilist of level 5 or higher
- Must complete the story for a region
- Must complete a contract in a region other than Tiltren

line0.desc: Lightning bolts strike the field and take any unit they hit out of combat for the remainder of the match.
A special ball is added to the match. It cannot be used to score.

line1.desc: The team holding it at the end of each round earns an extra point.

line0.desc: When a point is scored, the match continues: the ball and players maintain their positions.

line1.desc: The team that just scored plays first, and the goal areas are reversed.

line2.desc: One of the balls is replaced with a sea urchin. It can only be used to knock out enemies, not to shoot or score a point.

line0.desc: Players need to circumvent the obstacles littering the field in order to score.
One ball is made of metal and is too heavy to kick.

line1.desc: The other one is on fire. The carrier must get rid of it to end their turn.

G2Cathedral.world.name: Cathedral of Saint Eleor of Gosenberg

line0.desc: A trained crocswine joins the opposing team. Watch out for its powerful charge.

Merchants.props.tavern.desc: May appear if sufficient comforts are provided.

Bandits.descs.defender: A gang of lawless thieves is holed up here.

Pirates.name: Pirates
Pirates.props.tavern.desc: May appear if security is weak.

Deserters.name: Deserters
Deserters.descs.defender: Former members of the army have settled here.

BelerionVillagersTavern.name: Sailors
BelerionVillagersTavern.props.tavern.desc: May appear if there's fish on the menu.

Legion.name: The Legion
Legion.props.tavern.desc: May appear if a set of dice is available.

Guard.props.tavern.desc: May appear if there's cheap booze on the menu. (maximum: ::PRICE::)

InquisitionArmy.name: The Inquisition
InquisitionArmy.props.tavern.desc: May appear if there's an altar of the Eye.

TrackersGuild.name: Trackers' Guild
TrackersGuild.props.tavern.desc: May appear if there's a variety of drinks on the menu.

RatInvasion.name: Rat Infestation
RatInvasion.descs.defender: Your feet sink into some repulsive muck. The ground shudders...

AlazarSoldiers.name: Alazarian Soldiers
AlazarSoldiers.props.tavern.desc: May appear if a legendary weapon is exhibited.

Courtesans.name: Courtiers
Courtesans.props.tavern.desc: May appear if security is adequate.

Scholars.name: Scholars
