Farmers.name: Peasants
Farmers.props.tavern.desc: May appear if there's cheap food on the menu. (maximum: ::PRICE::)

A1Champion1.props.bountyDesc: It appears that smuggler Kristoff Kruppe was found in Drombach. Several kingdoms would gladly pay to see him gone.

A1DesignedMission2.props.name: The Avengers
A1DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: Brotherhood Mercenaries seem to be looking for a company that took part in the kidnapping of a woman named Corene Winfel. Their investigation methods are scaring the locals.

A1DesignedMission2Alt.props.name: The Avengers
A1DesignedMission2Alt.props.bountyDesc: Brotherhood Mercenaries seem to be looking for a company that killed Brunhilde Adr Alazar. While their goal is noble, their interrogation methods are endangering the locals.

A1DesignedMission1.props.name: Charlatans
A1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: Charlatans are peddling a fake cure for the plague. They must be stopped before their deceit leads to unfortunate consequences.

A1SlavesGuardsArmy.props.desc: Tasked with protecting the property of the good people of Drombach, these soldiers will not let slaves escape.

A1SlavesTrackersArmy.props.desc: These warriors travelled across four kingdoms to free their enslaved brothers and sisters.

A1MoutainAlazarSoldierGroup.props.desc: Lieutenant Damen was appointed to protect the Celestial Mountain Gate and the secret it hides.

A1MountainInquisitionGroup.props.desc: Inquisitor Emeria will stop at nothing to find out what unleashed the Eye's Reckoning.

A1TavernInquisition.props.desc: Clelia and her Inquisitors seem unwilling to share information with you. A few solid whacks should loosen their tongues.

A1LaboratoryPlagueRidden.props.desc: Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory was overrun by these Plague-Ridden, which are now killing Scholars and students inside.

A1DestroyedStablesInquisitors.props.desc: Inquisitors saw the Reckoning strike the Iron Hoof Stables and will not leave until they’ve seen the culprits burn.

Worldmap_edoranRefugees.props.name: Amateur Hunters
Worldmap_edoranRefugees.props.bountyDesc: Unaware of the danger they face, a handful of Edoranians have gone hunting in Sikha's Forest. Someone must warn them lest they get eaten!

DesignedMission1Group.props.name: Desperate Refugees
DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: Bandits have been attacking caravans and travellers along the roads. This must end now or merchants will refuse to travel through Tiltren.

DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Drunkards
DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: A group of drunkards have decided to square off with the Refugees. They must be stopped before things get out of control.

Matthias.props.bountyDesc: Wanted for a string of murders, ::roaming:: is a dangerous individual.

B1Champion1.props.bountyDesc: Ever since he discovered Alazarian powder, Captain Eokeld has been a different man. They say he even slaughtered his own crew.

B1DesignedMission2Legion.props.name: The Emissary
B1DesignedMission2Legion.props.bountyDesc: An Edoranian diplomatic mission was expected in Per-Bast, but never arrived. Find the crew, or whatever is left of it.

B1DesignedMission1.props.name: Heretic Hunters
B1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: A group of Inquisitors has taken upon themselves to burn the Ihrians' pagan idols. Stop them before someone gets hurt.

B1SeaLord01.props.name: Sinan
B1SeaLord01.props.bountyDesc: This pirate is known for kidnapping fishermen and holding them for ransom.

B1SeaLord02.props.name: Adelwis
B1SeaLord02.props.bountyDesc: If there's one thing this Mercenary hates more than pirates, it's competition.

B1SeaLord03.props.name: Drest
B1SeaLord03.props.bountyDesc: Drest was a pirate long before the Ihrians came along. He knows the archipelago like the back of his hand and proves very elusive.

B1SeaLord04.props.name: Hana & Meryem
B1SeaLord04.props.bountyDesc: Their sworn mission is to free the Belerion Archipelago of all forms of authority. To destabilise the dihyas, Meryem and Hana sow terror and panic throughout the region.

B1SeaLord06.props.name: Loderans
B1SeaLord06.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Loderans was a Merchant before he was captured by pirates. But he adapted so well to life with his kidnappers that he eventually became their captain.

B1SeaLord07.props.name: Danzir
B1SeaLord07.props.bountyDesc: Protecting widows and orphans is an afterthought at best for Danzir, who only joined the Guard for the glory he hoped to earn there. He cannot stand it when other people steal his thunder.

B1SeaLord08.props.name: Isha
B1SeaLord08.props.bountyDesc: This former dihya was forced from power by her own people. Her resentment has turned her into a cruel pirate who does everything she can to undermine her former sisters.

B1SeaLord09.props.name: Rodolbert
B1SeaLord09.props.bountyDesc: Condemned to death in Alazar for assassinating a local governor, Rodolbert has found refuge in the archipelago. Now convinced that every sailor he encounters is a Guard attempting to capture him, he indiscriminately attacks anything that floats his way.

B1SeaLord10.props.name: Ganne
B1SeaLord10.props.bountyDesc: Ambushes are Ganne's speciality. Her mentor Drest taught her all there is to know about the archipelago, and she has become an expert at setting nearly unavoidable traps for the region's Merchants.

B1SeaLord11Fake.props.name: Kjerti
B1SeaLord11Fake.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Kjerti has grown so powerful that the Guard have given up on trying to arrest him. Besides having a loyal crew, the pirate is also one of Belerion's greatest fighters.

B1SeaLord11.props.name: Kjerti
B1SeaLord11.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that Kjerti has grown so powerful that the Guard have given up on trying to arrest him. Besides having a loyal crew, the pirate is also one of Belerion's greatest fighters.

E1Champion2.props.bountyDesc: A sounder of boars are preventing the locals from gathering at the statue of Belerion.

E1KnowledgePath1Group1.props.desc: The Inquisition is moving an artefact from one Province to another.

ChampinonKaghal.props.bountyDesc: Brutal and unexplained deaths attributed to the ghost of Harag have been reported in Arthes. This individual must be stopped now.

E1DesignedMission3Group.props.name: Corpse Looters
E1DesignedMission3Group.props.bountyDesc: Some people were spotted looting corpses on a battlefield. This must not be allowed to continue!

E1DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Ghost Hunters
E1DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: Soldiers from Lord Laheart's army have decided to slay the Ghost of Harag. Reason with these fools before they freeze to death in the mountains!

E1DesignedMission1Group.props.name: The Lost Expedition
E1DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: An expedition has given no news for days. Alazar's ambassador is promising a large sum of Krowns to whoever will find them.

AnimalFarmWolves.props.desc: The wolves are trying to enter the building!

LaheartCaravan.props.desc: This group is taking a large amount of food to Laheart's castle.

Worldmap_HamletLaheartTest.props.desc: This group seems surprised to see you.

G1PrisonSawmillBandits.props.desc: Fugitives do not tend to return where they came from!

G1ChampionAlexaGroup.props.bountyDesc: Rumour has it that the old ::roaming:: might be somewhere in this Province. The Legion is willing to pay a handsome reward for her head.

G1DesignedMission1Group.props.name: The New Recruits
G1DesignedMission1Group.props.bountyDesc: The Brotherhood is concerned for a group of young recruits who haven't returned from their training.

G1DesignedMission2Group.props.name: Brothers on a Mission
G1DesignedMission2Group.props.bountyDesc: Protect someone called Sanka Bael by fighting off the Brotherhood, who have come to collect her debt.

G1DesignedMission3Group2.props.name: The Old Pig Keeper
G1DesignedMission3Group2.props.bountyDesc: A farmer is looking for his father-in-law who went missing while gathering wood in the mountain.

G1PoisonersGroups.props.desc: These men's knees are covered in mud.

G1ApothecaryKillersGroup.props.desc: This unknown gang was hiding behind a bush, waiting for you.

G2BoatRookArmy.props.desc: Efficient and remorseless, the Rooks are fearsome assassins who guard their secrets closely.

G2ChampionFenrisDredd.props.bountyDesc: Having escaped captivity, the former slave ::roaming:: swore to have his revenge on Gosenberg. The Broker Council is keen to get to him first, and is demanding his head.

G2DesignedMission3.props.name: Burglars
G2DesignedMission3.props.bountyDesc: A group of greedy burglars are operating in Gosenberg's more affluent districts. The wealthy residents have had enough and are willing to pay to be rid of them.

G2DesignedMission2.props.name: Amateur Teuls
G2DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: Giant crop circles have appeared in the fields; terrified farmers believe them to be the work of the Teuls. Search the area for whoever is responsible.

G2DesignedMission1.props.name: Annoying Jugglers
G2DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: The Broker Council is determined to silence the poet Jan and his troupe who publish satires and pamphlets undermining its power.

G2AmbassadorAttackerArmy.props.desc: Gosenberg residents have decided to take justice into their own hands, and execute the person they believe murdered Broker Hoevendorp.

G2CaveWolf.props.desc: Wolves have made their den in the Great Growler Cave. Ferocious and aggressive, they attack all merchant caravans passing nearby.

H1ChampionGroup.props.bountyDesc: An unusually powerful Plague-ridden is prowling the lands of Ludern. The Guard fears that he will spread the Plague across the entire region.

H1DesignedMission1.props.bountyDesc: Men wanted by the Legion are rumoured to be in Ludern. To avoid conflict with Edoran, the clans have put a bounty on their heads.

H1DesignedMission2.props.bountyDesc: The family of a Gosenberg merchant, who has been in Ludern for many months, is pleading for their father's return.

H1DesignedMission3.props.name: Wolf-eaters
H1DesignedMission3.props.bountyDesc: Trackers said they found wolf carcasses bearing what they believe are human bite marks. The Plague-ridden responsible must be found before they start attacking people!

IR1BorderPostBandit.props.desc: This group of Bandits guards the frontier between Ludern and Tiltren.

Fugitive01Army.props.name: Rojen's Coterie
Fugitive01Army.props.bountyDesc: Using the Brotherhood's banner, Rojen robs and kills the merchants who call on him for protection.

Fugitive02Army.props.name: Sylla's Inquisitors
Fugitive02Army.props.bountyDesc: After three victims were burned at the stake in less than a week with complete disregard for due process, Broker Ald Marheim has ordered the arrest of Sylla and her Inquisitors.

Fugitive03Army.props.name: Meliance's Troop
Fugitive03Army.props.bountyDesc: Former members of Lord Laheart's Army have been sowing havoc and death in the Arthes countryside. Cortia is offering a hefty sum for the head of their leader Meliance.

Fugitive04Army.props.name: Gacius's Cohort
Fugitive04Army.props.bountyDesc: For an unknown reason, Lieutenant Gacius and his cohort of Legionnaires are trying to infiltrate Ludern. The Edoranian General is ready to pay to avoid a diplomatic incident.

Fugitive05Army.props.name: The Old Crone's Crew
Fugitive05Army.props.bountyDesc: The Old Crone and her lackeys are wanted in all of Ludern for a series of crimes, including murder, arson, battery and pony theft.

Fugitive06Army.props.name: Finna's Pack
Fugitive06Army.props.bountyDesc: The Gosenberg Minstrel Guild has raised a large sum of money to be rid of Finna's Pack.

Fugitive07Army.props.name: Bartes’ Gang
Fugitive07Army.props.bountyDesc: Despite many stretches behind bars, Bartes remains as rowdy as ever and burned down the Cortia Tavern to celebrate his release. But this time, the Guard has put a price on his head.

Fugitive08Army.props.name: Eitlingarde’s Followers
Fugitive08Army.props.bountyDesc: Found guilty of sedition in Alazar, Eitlingarde and her Followers are hiding in Arthes until things die down.

Fugitive09Army.props.name: The Ogre's Troop
Fugitive09Army.props.bountyDesc: Children have started disappearing again... This can only mean one thing: the infamous Ogre is back.

Fugitive10Army.props.name: Selestius' Inquisitors
Fugitive10Army.props.bountyDesc: The Inquisition has had enough of Brother Selestius' antics and are calling for the arrest of the fanatical monk before he hurts someone.

Fugitive11Army.props.name: Eligann's Troop
Fugitive11Army.props.bountyDesc: Tired of the ways of the Guard, Eligann and her Troop advocate a more expeditious method.

Fugitive12Army.props.name: Eleora's Cohort
Fugitive12Army.props.bountyDesc: Merchants report seeing a small contingent of Legion troops out and about in Grinmeer. The Broker Council demands that these intruders are driven out.

Fugitive15Army.props.name: Otton's Followers
Fugitive15Army.props.bountyDesc: Otton and his slave traders have apparently already crossed the border into Ludern, with a host of captive peasants.

Fugitive19Army.props.name: Claressia's Cohort
Fugitive19Army.props.bountyDesc: Having murdered their captain, Claressia and her accomplices fled the Edoranian capital to lay low somewhere in Arthes.

Fugitive14Army.props.name: Thenevon's Pack
Fugitive14Army.props.bountyDesc: Vertrusian traders are worried: Thenevon's Pack is wreaking havoc in the region, attacking slave convoys, freeing captives and killing Guards.

Fugitive13Army.props.name: Diewer's Gang
Fugitive13Army.props.bountyDesc: Enraged by their defeat at the Rouste Tournament, Diewer and his gang stole the winner's prize and fled.

Fugitive17Army.props.name: Kothelyn's Band
Fugitive17Army.props.bountyDesc: Passing off a disgusting Edoranian swill as the finest Gosenberg vintage, the bootleggers have accrued considerable wealth at the expense of local Vintners, who are now calling for revenge.

Fugitive18Army.props.name: Maudeg's troops
Fugitive18Army.props.bountyDesc: Not only did Maudeg and his accomplices desert the Ludern Guard, but they also made off with their employers' funds. The Clans want to make an example of them with severe retribution.

Fugitive16Army.props.name: Vesunna's Pack
Fugitive16Army.props.bountyDesc: Claiming they are protecting their gods from raiders, Vesunna and her trackers slaughter anyone who dares enter the Tiltren Tomb.

Notify.text: You have hoisted up a chest.

Start.text: My oh my... You seem to struggle to <narrator>solverise</narrator> this puzzle, my dear Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
Luckily for you, <narrator>I, Solvius, the Greatest Solveriser in the World</narrator> am willing to help.
For a paltry sum, I will solverise this puzzle, which has you so flummoxed!

line0.props.tipText: Pay Solvius to solverise the puzzle.

line1.props.tipText: Persuade Solvius to solverise the puzzle without paying him.

Accept1.text: Let's see... Ah yes... one tile to the left, one tile upwards...

Accept2.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

Convinced1.text:
You are right, my good fellows! A great solveriser does not solverise anything for a few measly Krowns, but for the love of solverising!
Please allow me to work my magic!

Convinced2.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

End.text: Tada! The puzzle have been solverised!

Refuse.text:
Ah! I am ever so proud of you, Mercenaries! The art of Solverising requires a good measure of purposefulness.
Please allow me to observe you.

Start.text:
Might you be looking for work?
Our role as emissaries is to ensure that all service requests are fulfilled. We regularly update our job offers.

MosquitoSting.text: ::name:: was bitten by a cardinal mosquito: <status>::injury::</status>

Start.text:
Do you know Gosenberg City?
I used to be one of the best fighters in Bernna’s Arena.

Next1.text: Impressive, eh?

Start.text:
I'll have you know we don't trade with just anybody.
Only Arena champions can buy my wares.

Alt.text: Oh! Our new champions? What can I do for you?

Start.text:
In these troubled times, the people need entertainment more than ever!
Challenge our champion and some of our best fighters to give them an unforgettable show!

NoBeginArena.text: Our audience will be awfully disappointed.

OnLeaveArena.text: You’re doing great, don’t stop now!

Completed.text:
What a show! What an amazing victory!
Have you ever considered entering the Gosenberg Arena Clash?
Ah! But I digress. Here's Lisbeth's throwing axe, it's yours now!

ArenaLost.text: Go train for a while and come back stronger. The good people of Drombach can wait.

ArenaDiff.text:
Want to go again?
Sign up, our audience is eager to see you in action!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: You are without a doubt the best gladiators in all of Drombach. Our spectators really got their money's worth!

CompletedDiff2.text: Take your reward, and feel free to come back for the love of the fight!

CompletedDiff3.text: I said for the love of the fight because you won't get paid. Not that you don't deserve money, but you've won all the rewards!

ArenaAgain.text: I knew you'd be back! Fighters like you don't care about rewards, right?

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: I wish you'd come every day, Mercenaries! Watching you fight lifts everyone's spirits.

Start.text: I'm going back to Drombach to look for Plague remedies. Tiltren’s stock is dwindling.
I heard that the <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator> did some damage in New-Asthel. I hope my family is all right.
Do you know how much I have to pay for each slave crossing the border? This is preposterous!

Next1.text: They won't let honest citizens work! This kingdom is going to hell in a handcart!

Start.text: Do you really want to enter Alazar? Despite the Eye’s Reckoning?

Give.text:
All right, suit yourselves...
Send my regards to the <narrator>Inquisition</narrator>.

End.text:
What do you want?
You’ve already paid, you can cross the border.

line0.title: To Alazar
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text:
Prince Aerald asked us to rebuild this bridge, but someone messed up the order of materials.
When the cart got here, it was short several sandstone blocks.

Next1.text: Now we need to send word to the castle, then wait for quarry owners to set their prices, for slaves to carve out the blocks, and for caravans to deliver them... It’s going to take weeks!

Next2.text: We’re willing to buy any sandstone you have. We won’t get paid until the bridge is fixed.

Give1.text:
It’s a deal.
We can get back to work now.

Given2.text: Come back in a couple of days and the repairs should be done.

line0.text: Give 20 Sandstone to the workers rebuilding the Pitta Bridge.

Start.text:
Some damage, eh?
Heard bandits were crossing the bridge when they were struck by the Eye’s Reckoning.

Next1.text: Wish they’d walked faster, then the bridge would still be standing!

line0.text: Defeat the cannibals.

line1.text: Comfort Clowilda Ald Alazar to get your bounty back.

Start.text:
Today's our lucky day, lads.
Our meal has come to us.

Alt.text: You shouldn't have followed us here!

Start.text: Mercenaries, you’re here! You must help me! Bandits fell upon my husband and...

Next1.text: You’ve killed them? What about my husband? Where is he?

Start.text:
...
What the...
No! No! <narrator>Noooo</narrator>!

line0.props.tipText: Comfort Clowilda.

line1.props.tipText: Calm Clowilda down.

Next1.text: Thank you... I really needed that.

Next2.text: I knew those barbarians weren’t mere bandits... Thank you for putting an end to this horror.

Next3.text: I can give you this as a token of my gratitude. I hope it’s enough.

Next4.text: My husband was a close cousin of Prince Aerald. I trust the castle will send someone to retrieve his body.

Start.text:
This pillar was carved by the Ancients.
The Scholars milling about are oblivious to your presence.

Alt.text:
This pillar was carved by the Ancients.
Alazar built what’s around it.

MissionDescPrince.text: Talk to Prince Aerald Adr Alazar to get your reward.

line0.text: Defeat Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

line1.text: Talk to High Inquisitor Dexera.

line0.text: Defeat High Inquisitor Dexera.

line1.text: Talk to Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

Start.text: What...

Next1.text: What is this thing?

Start.text: So you've finally discovered the <narrator>Celestium</narrator>.

Next1.text: I figured a locked door would pique your curiosity. Perhaps I should have kept it open...

Start.text:
What...
What is this thing?

Next1.text: What is this place, Prince Aerald? Answer me!

Next2.text: As I told you, it is the <narrator>Celestium</narrator>. A one-of-a-kind place of learning, where the most advanced Alazarian technology meets that of the Ancients. A treasure trove of knowledge.

Next3.text: I could elaborate, but I doubt you would understand. All you’re good for is burning peasants.

Next4.text:
Do not play games with me, Prince.
One needs not be a great Alazarian Scholar to understand that the Eye’s Reckoning was unleashed because of this unholy aberration.

Next4bis.text: You unearthed it from the mountain where the Ancients left it, without knowing what it was or how to control it! And you had the gall to use it!

Next5.text: You’re not entirely wrong, High Inquisitor. However, let me assure you that our understanding of this artefact is growing by the hour. We will find a way to stop it soon enough.

Next6.text: Oh! But I know just what to do. This thing is begging to be reduced to rubble!

Next7.text: Mercenaries! It is time to put an end to this sinful endeavour and destroy this insult to the Great Eye!

Start.text:
You fought bravely, Mercenaries. By destroying this relic, you saved a county from the madness of its prince.
Maybe even the Five Kingdoms.

Next1.text:
What happened in Drombach was a warning sent by the God of Light.
One must stay away from the relics of a civilisation that left only Tombs behind.

Next2.text: As for your reward, I realise it is far from what you deserve, but no matter how many Krowns we could shower you with, it would never come close to rewarding you properly.

Next3.text: We will make an example of Prince Aerald’s heresy. He will be taken to the Holy City at the heart of Edoran, where he will face judgement.

End.text: You have finished the Drombach scenario. It is time to explore other regions.

Start.text:
We were so close! So close to controlling the Eye!
We could have become gods!

This pillar... Did I understand correctly?
Could it really control the Eye?

Those Scholars tried to use an Ancient artefact to bring about, and then stop the Eye’s Reckoning?
But why?

Look who’s paying us a visit!
Our ungodly Mercenaries!

Next1.text: I would have been most disappointed not to run into you heretics.

MissionDesc.text: Defeat High Inquisitor Dexera.

Start.text: Thus died High Inquisitor Dexera.

By the Beast's fangs, we did it!
We saved the pillar, averted the Eye's Reckoning, defeated the Inquisition... I could not have wished for a better outcome!

Next2.text:
Things would have ended very differently without your help.
I thought you were nothing more than vultures in armour, but I must admit I was wrong, Mercenaries.

Next3.text: Please accept this reward and my most humble apologies. I trust you will find this present worthy of your service.

End1.text: You can count on us to continue studying this Ancient pillar.

End2.text: Should Alazar one day harness the power of the God of Light, the kingdom will become invincible thanks to you.

Notif.text: The Eye's Reckoning has left Drombach.

EndSetting.text: You have finished the Drombach scenario. It is time to explore other regions.

Start.text: Help!

And you, Prince Aerald!
I appreciate not having to hunt you down. You came willingly to confess your heresy!
Don’t worry. As soon as we destroy this thing, you’re next.

Next1.text: You have no idea what you’re doing! This relic is our only chance to stop the Eye’s Reckoning!

Next2.text: Your only chance? You are such a shameless liar, Prince Aerald! Is that what you told the Mercenaries? I had time to question your Scholars. They admitted that it is this thing that brought about the wrath of the God of Light!

Next3.text:
And it can put an end to it just the same.
Given a little more time, the Scholars you didn't slaughter will find a way. They are making great strides, my people are about to...

Next4.text:
They are about to die. Just like you.
As for this thing, we will destroy it to please the God of Light!

Next5.text: Tsk! Might as well try to reason with a crocswine!

Next6.text:
Mercenaries! You handle the fanatics.
I will direct the Scholars. <narrator>Buy time until they disable the pillar.</narrator>

Start.text: We’re still hard at work trying to uncover the secrets of the Ancients. But as we’re no longer pressed for time, we can afford to take breaks.
Someday, we will harness the power of the God of Light. We will become gods ourselves!
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

MissionDesc1.text: Greet the army with Professor Berthild.

MissionDesc2.text: Fight the Alazarian soldiers or the Inquisitors.

line0.text: Take on Professor Berthild's mission.

line1.text: Clear the rubble to find survivors.

line2.text: Meet the Guard by the stables.

line3.text: Resolve the conflict between the Scholars and the Inquisitors.

Start.text: Sorry, no time to chat. These stables won’t rebuild themselves!

Oh! I know you! You're the Mercenaries who saved us!
I'm so glad to see you after all this time!

Next1.text:
As you can see, we reopened the stables after the Inquisition left.
There’s still work to do, but repairs are going well.

Start.text: We were on our way to the border crossing when we saw the <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator> strike these stables.

Next1.text: I sent one of our companions to New-Asthel for help, but time is of the essence. Any survivors still under the rubble might suffocate if we wait.

Next2.text: You seem equipped for the task, Mercenaries. Would you mind clearing the debris? I can offer fair payment for your efforts.

Next3.text: Best get to it immediately.

Next4.text: I hear soldiers! Come, Mercenaries. Let’s go greet them.

MissionDesc.text: Clear the rubble to save the stables occupants.

Start.text: This woman's injuries may be superficial, but her mind is deeply troubled.
The Eye... I saw it...
What have I done? What have I done to offend the God of Light?
I’m not a heretic, I swear! Don't hurt me!
<narrator>This fresco is so ancient that it has faded over time. </narrator>
There is nothing but an old blue dress in this chest.
A dusty axe.

Notif.text: There have been reports of terrifying noises coming from <narrator>Old Glorio's sheepfold</narrator>.

line0.text: Find the real Isold among the pretenders.

Start.text: Maybe she wasn't the real Isold after all...
You’re not as stupid as you look, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: But you would’ve been better served to get it wrong. Then we wouldn't have to slaughter you.

Next2.text: The sheepfold is ours! Get back!

Start.text:
Father!
Don’t you recognise me?

Next1.text: I'm Isold! Father! Tell them!

Next2.text: By Saint Eleor! Please, Father! It’s me, your daughter!

Next3.text: I don't know! I can't think straight!

Next4.text:
I don’t know what to do!
These three women claim to be my daughter Isold... And I can't tell which one is telling the truth!

Next5.text:
Oh! Good folks! I'm so ashamed that I can't even recognise my own daughter!
I beg you, take pity on me! I’m but a blind beggar whose beloved child left him long ago.

Next6.text: If only... If only you could help me find my Isold!

line0.props.tipText: Identify the dark-haired Isold as the shepherd’s daughter.

line1.props.tipText: Identify the blond Isold as the shepherd’s daughter.

line2.props.tipText: Identify the red-haired Isold as the shepherd’s daughter.

End1.text:
You saved me!
Isold saved me!
Thank you! Thank you!

EndWrong.text: I'm so happy to have my dear Isold back!

Start.text: These wenches are only after what little he has left!

Next1.text: Please, Mercenaries! You must convince my father that I'm the real Isold. I'll give you what's most precious to me if you make these women leave.

End1.text: Thank you, Mercenaries! Thank you!

End2.text:
Look at those tramps run, as they should!
I will have my revenge.

End3.text: But first, let me give you this reward. It’s the least I can do.

Wait.text: I have so many things to tell my father, so much catching up to do...

Start.text: I risked my life to provide for my father!

Next1.text: I spent ten years in a gang of bandits to put food on the old man's table, and he doesn't even recognise me? I'm willing to give you my weapon to make him come to his senses.

End1.text:
By Saint Jeru’s beard, I thought you were going to pick one of those tramps instead of me.
That would have been too much to bear!

End2.text: My father may not be able to tell me apart from a stranger, but he’s still my father.

End3.text: Take this reward. Thanks to you, he can enjoy whatever time he has left with his daughter.

Wait.text: Ah, it’s good to be back home.

Start.text: Ten years fighting for the Brotherhood! Ten years sending him my wages! And for what? So that this old coot doesn't even recognise me when I come back?

Next1.text: Convince him that I'm the real Isold, Mercenaries, and I’ll give you my old armour.

Alt1.text: I didn't think these hussies would start a fight. Had I known, I would have struck the first blow.

Alt2.text: I met them in an inn on my way home. I guess I told them a bit too much about my life. They then decided to impersonate me and try to trick my father.

Alt3.text: Good thing you came this way. Let me give you your reward before I have a chat with my father.

Wait.text: Let’s just say that I still resent him a bit.

line0.text: Find a way to free the slaves.

line1.text: Free the slaves from the fishery at night.

line2.text: Fight the Harag warriors or the Alazarian army.

Start.text:
The Inquisition is lying!
Having slaves is no heresy, it’s a traditional way of life!

Next1.text: The thief must serve the honest man, the loser must serve the winner! Such is the Alazarian way. Always has been.

Next2.text: Now that we’ve cleared things up, get out of here. The work needs to be done before <narrator>sunset.</narrator>

Slaves.text: Stop talking to the slaves, you’re slowing them down.

EndHarag.text:
I heard that savages came all the way from Harag to steal my slaves!
Good thing the Alazarian army is keeping watch!

Start.text: Someone stole my slaves!
You could free us... But then, what would we do? <narrator>How could I return to Harag?</narrator>

Next1.text:
Praise the Ancients!
Untie me, quick!

Next2.text:
Leave me alone.
I'd rather spend the rest of my life working here than see your faces a moment longer.

Notif.text: You freed a slave.

Start.text: Heard that some <narrator>Harag warriors</narrator> are freeing slaves to honour their gods. If you happen to cross their path, let them know we’re ready for them.

Next1.text:
What? Harag is coming to rescue us?
Quickly! Quickly! The army could be here any minute!

Next2.text: Curse you.

Notif.text: You freed a slave.

Start.text: I ran away twice, and all I got out of it is this cage.

Next1.text:
My brethren are coming to free us?
Praise the Tules!
Open this damn door, don't leave me behind!

Next2.text: I hope the Beast stomps you to death. That’s all a slaver like you deserves.

Notif.text: You freed a slave.

Start.text:
Are you here to hunt the Ghost Pack?
You’ve got the wrong camp, Mercenaries. The Trackers set up theirs in the centre of Drombach.

Next1.text: We too come from Harag, but with a different purpose.

Next2.text:
Despite the many treaties and peace accords between our kingdoms, Alazar keeps buying slaves from the bandits roaming our lands.
We were sent by our clan to free our brothers and sisters who were captured by those miscreants.

Next3.text:
Should you wish to support our cause, we can afford to reward you.
Enter the Icy Bay Fishery after nightfall, free the poor souls they’re holding captive, and bring them to us. We'll make sure that no soldier interrupts you.

End.text: We must tend to our wounds before setting off for Harag. It will be a long and dangerous journey.

line0.text: Go to the <narrator>Icy Bay Fishery</narrator> at night and free the slaves.

line1.text: Free the slaves.

Start.text: In Gosenberg and Alazar, everyone claims that their slaves are all former criminals...

Next1.text:
It’s a lie!
In all of the kingdoms, bandits kidnap peasants and sell them to those barbarians from the North! Curse them all!

Start.text: My own brother was abducted when he was just a boy. He must be a grown man now, I don't even know if I'd recognise him.

Thank you, Mercenaries.
I didn't think I'd ever be free again.
I wonder what Harag is like.
I can't help but worry. I feel like a patrol could show up at any time.

If you wish to benefit from everything the Black Market has to offer, you will have to make your way there. In the meantime, you can deal with me. I take anything and everything, wherever it comes from.

This shelter is the last stop before Mount Ernst and the mountain range that separates us from Edoran.
Be careful if that’s where you’re headed. Travellers often lose their way around here.
I will not to go further south. I’d sooner face the God of Light’s judgement than that of the mountain.
I went on a mission on Mount Ernst before. I lost three toes and two Companions.

line0.text: Take on Inquisitor Emeria’s mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Take on the High Inquisitor’s mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Don't let them burn me! Please!

StartCrawler.text: The creature seems to know what is coming.

Start.text: Walk in the Light, Mercenaries, and you will never have to fear the pyre.

Next1.text: Are you here to save your Companion from the Light's judgement? Your offering had better measure up to their crimes against the Eye.

line0.props.tipText: Pay the fine to free ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1::.

line1.props.tipText: Feed ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1::'s pyre.

line2.props.tipText: ::A1InquisitionCampSlot1:: has an enemy in the troop.

Pay1.text: Good enough, your Companion is free. But remember that the All-Seeing Eye watches your every move.

Give1.text: That's... that's very nice of you! This quality wood will burn bright!

Watch1.text: Come sit with us. Watching the cleansing of a soul is always very moving.

Deliver.text: We will cleanse this heretic's soul as soon as possible.

NoSlotAvailable.text: It wouldn't be proper to burn several heretics at the same time. Come back in ::until_vars.days:: days.

NotCageAvailable.text: We can't take any more heretics at the moment. Come back in ::until_vars.days:: days.

Start.text: Inquisitors say that fire doesn’t hurt true believers. I’m doing my best to pray properly before my time comes.

The Eye’s Reckoning is divine retribution, an answer to the worst heresies. It is the Inquisition’s duty to catch anyone who would dare escape it.
No matter where it happens, the Edoranian Church is watching.

Tavern1.text:
Who is that you are bringing, Mercenaries?
This man, could he be...?

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the New-Asthel innkeeper.

Give1.text:
The New-Asthel innkeeper! We’ve been trying to find him for quite some time.
But tell me, Mercenaries, he seems quite calm for someone who is about to be burnt at the stake. Did you drug him?

Give2.text: He surrendered of his own volition? Praised be Saint Jeru. Perhaps this county isn't completely hopeless after all.

Give3.text:
He can rejoice in the knowledge that our pyre will cleanse his soul, and that he will pass into the Light as surely as any good believer would.
Please accept this reward. You have done us all a great service.

SettingLog.text: You handed the New-Asthel innkeeper over to the Inquisition.

Wait.text: We will prepare a special pyre for the innkeeper.

End1.text:
I am pleased that you answered my call, Mercenaries.
Every blade, every shield is needed in this battle that will see the forces of Light triumph over the darkness of heresy.

End2.text: Because we’re going to war! A war in the name of the God of Light. A war against Drombach, against Prince Aerald Adr Alazar, against the sacrilege that he’s trying to hide from us!

End3.text:
Let us destroy the Celestial Mountain Gate! We will go through this unholy portal and cleanse all heresy from Drombach!
Are you with us?

AcceptEnd.text:
Get ready to give your lives to the God of Light.
We will meet you by the mountain.

MissionDesc1.text: Meet the Inquisitors at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line0.text: Take the innkeeper to the High Inquisitor.

Start.text: The pyre’s flames help me focus. I have much to reflect upon.

Next1.text: You may wonder why I, an Inquisitor, would call upon unbelievers like you.

Next2.text: Well, the reason is that the mission I wish to give you goes against our precepts. I was even forbidden from enlisting the help of other Inquisitors...

Next3.text: I don’t think the Inquisition’s usual methods will appease the God of Light. The Eye’s Reckoning is different in Drombach. More frequent, more powerful... And I want to find out why! Are you ready to follow me?

Alt1.text:
I’m glad that your company answered my call.
I need people I can trust, not mere Mercenaries who might misunderstand my faith...

Alt2.text: The Eye’s Reckoning is very odd in this county. It destroys taverns and stables, kills dozens of people... Elsewhere, the God of Light manifests Himself once or twice a year at most, and only for a handful of heathens.

Alt3.text:
I doubt that merely killing those who survived the Reckoning will be enough to appease the God of Light. We must find what sparked His wrath: the original heresy.
Are you with me?

Accept.text:
Very well.
Our first order of business is to study the victims of the Eye’s Reckoning. Discovering what they have in common could give us insight into the heresy we’re looking for. Protect me on the way and I will examine the bodies.

Start.text:
The people of Drombach should be grateful!
We came from Edoran to save their souls!
<narrator>When the Plague first appeared, we knew nothing about it. It was a distant scourge affecting the Legion and Harag Trackers, little more than a wartime disease – or so we thought.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Alas, we started receiving increasingly alarming reports from the front. Entire regiments were contaminated. The disease, that was merely souring tempers at the beginning, was now forcing them to devour each other.</narrator>

Next3.text:
<narrator>Despite the many remedies used and the Scholars’ ingenuity, the Plague seemed unstoppable. The Legion was wiped out.
The army that had conquered Alazar and destroyed the Northern Kingdom was laid low by nature, at the gates of the capital of Harag.</narrator>

Start.text: <narrator>Critical years followed the end of the war. The Plague crossed Harag’s borders with the retreating Legion.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Scholars tried to find a cure, in vain. We just could not understand where this affliction originated from. Veterans’ tales were muddled, fragmented, full of superstition. Out of desperation, I left Drombach for Ludern...</narrator>

Next3.text: Several pages have been ripped out.

Start.text: It is here, between these walls, that the illustrious Sophy Adr Alazar bested the Plague. Since then, we’ve been striving to walk in her footsteps and improve her original cure.

Next1.text: Thanks to Prince Aerald Adr Alazar’s unconditional support, we are now ready to take another step on the path of Knowledge. Only one thing is still holding us back: the Inquisition.

Next2.text: We cannot take proper initiatives as long as they’re in Drombach! Even our army is under watch! If any of our requests are even slightly out of the ordinary, no one can fulfil them...

Next3.text: But perhaps Mercenaries like you would be discreet enough to break a few religious precepts, as inconspicuously as possible... What say you? I can offer you a princely reward...

Next4.text: Is it a thirst for knowledge I see sparkling in your eyes? We need 3 live Plague-ridden. You will find plenty of them in the cursed village of Asthel, a few miles north of here.

Wait.text:
Did you find our test subjects?
We need them alive, all three of them!

line0.props.tipText: Hand over the <narrator>3 Plague-ridden</narrator>.
line0.props.disableReason: Hand over <narrator>3 Plague-ridden</narrator>.

Give1.text:
This is...
Blessed be the Eye, you did it!
Take your reward, with the gratitude of everyone at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

Give2.text: You can leave without fear. As seasoned Scholars, we have the situation well in hand.

MissionDesc.text: Catch 3 Plague-ridden in the cursed village of Asthel.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring the Plague-ridden subjects to Professor Grind.

MissionDesc3.text: Go to Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

Notify1.text: You received a message from Professor Grind begging you to join him in the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

SettingLog.text: You provided Professor Grind with Plague-ridden subjects.

End1.text: My students’ sacrifice won’t be in vain. As soon as the Inquisition has their back turned, I will resume my research.

End2.text:
Just imagine, Mercenaries!
Imagine a world where we could avert the Plague. The Alazarian army would have a sizeable advantage over the other kingdoms. We could turn this curse into a weapon!

Start.text: I wonder if we’re not making a mistake, studying so many live Plague-ridden subjects...

Next1.text: Don't torment yourself. This experiment was approved by the Prince himself. He knows what he’s doing.

Start.text: The Inquisition claims that studying live specimens is heresy.

Next1.text: That's preposterous! How are we supposed to test the new formula without Plague-ridden subjects who will react to it?

MissionDesc.text: Meet Lieutenant Damen at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

MissionDesc2.text: Climb the Celestial Mountain steps.

line0.text: Meet Lieutenant Damen by the mountain.

line1.text: Talk to Lieutenant Damen at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line2.text: Talk to Inquisitor Emeria at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text:
By the Beast's fangs! I just can't catch a break!
The mine collapsed and...

Next1.text: WHAT? The Inquisition is coming?

Next2.text: Curses, if they manage to get inside the mountain, a war could break out!

Next3.text: We must stop them from reaching the <narrator>gate</narrator> at all costs. Follow me!

Wait1.text: Who let you in? Go away, Mercenaries.

Start.text: Mercenaries! We've found it!

Next1.text: Beyond this gate lies the heresy we’re looking for, I'm sure of it. A sacrilege so great it unleashed the Eye’s Reckoning upon a whole county.

Next2.text:
This discovery would not have been possible without you and your unfailing dedication!
Please accept this reward as a token of my gratitude.

Wait.text: Count on us to open this door! We will call you as soon as it’s done.

SettingLog.text: You let the Inquisition reach the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text: The High Inquisitor always says that every closed door hides a heresy. Just imagine what’s going on behind this one!
It’s an honour to take up arms in the name of the Eye, even more so when we’re fighting heretics.
I have never set foot beyond this gate, and truth be told, I have no way of opening it myself.

Next1.text: Only some Scholars know the code.

End1.text: You saved us, Mercenaries. Thank you for coming to our rescue.

Start.text: My sister is a great Scholar. She's allowed to pass through the gate, but she can't tell me what she's doing there. I probably wouldn't understand anyway.
Now that those goody-two-shoes know that an entire garrison is hiding here, you can bet they'll be back.

Next1.text: The Inquisition believes that every closed door hides a heresy. Just imagine what they’ll think when they see the size of this one! Good thing you drove them back!

Next2.text: We may require your services again in the future, so don't stray too far from Drombach. For everyone’s sake.

Wait.text: Don't bother asking me what’s behind this gate, I’m just standing guard here. I've never been to the other side, and from what I gather, it’ll never happen.

SettingLog.text: You stopped the Inquisition from reaching the Celestial Mountain Gate.

Start.text: There we go, the gate is open.

Next1.text: It was no mean feat, but nothing can stand in the way of the Inquisition’s determination.

Next2.text: After you, Mercenaries! Let us find out what the heretics are hiding and carry out the will of the God of Light!

Start.text:
Remember what you saw in the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.
This county’s Scholars know no bounds. What they’re doing up there is probably worse than you can imagine.
Opening this gate was difficult, but I did it, as promised.
Do you think they wanted to take the artefact from the Tomb atop the mountain?
It is highly possible that the victims of the Eye's Reckoning in Drombach deserved their fate.
What...?

Next1.text: The gate is open! The Inquisition got in!

Next2.text: Quickly! We have to stop them before they put an end to our research!

MissionDesc.text: Climb the stairs at the Celestial Mountain Gate and stop the Inquisition.

Start.text: I can't take their quarrelling any more. Now I even have to sleep next to them so that they won't kill each other!

EndOne.text:
Good riddance! I was this close to blowing up and banging their heads together.
I owe you a beer for your troubles.

EndTwo.text:
You took both of them? By Jeru, you’re brave...
Or you have no idea what you’re getting into.

Wait.text: Good luck, you're going to need it.

line0.text: Hire Heleth or Gunbald to take a load off the jail’s wardens.

Start.text: I can't believe I wasted five years of my life with you!

Next1.text: Wasted? Wasted? Some life that was! We didn't even have a roof over our heads.

Next2.text: But at least we weren't stuck behind bars!

Next3.text: Oh! Sorry I had too much ambition for you.

Next4.text: Shut up, dammit! Those fifteen lashes weren’t enough?

Start.text: All I want is to never see Gunbald again! Doesn’t matter where you’re going.

Gunbald.text: I really want to get out of here, but don’t count on me to make up with this degenerate.

Start.text: I’ll follow anyone, as long as Heleth isn't coming.

Heleth.text:
Heleth is with you?
All right, but I can’t promise I won’t strangle her in her sleep.

Start.text:
Sorry, but we’re not taking anyone else in. Inquisition orders.
They say all criminals need to be burnt to appease the Eye.

Next1.text: Heleth and Gunbald are the only ones left. Even the Inquisition didn't want them.

Recruited.text:
Sorry, but we’re not taking anyone else in. Inquisition orders.
They say all criminals need to be burnt to appease the Eye.

Start.text: We're taking in <inf>outlaws</inf> again! Knock yourselves out, I have a jail to fill!

Deliver.text: It won't be hard for your scoundrel to find a new master. The demand for slaves is higher than ever since the Inquisition left.

NoSlotAvailable.text: You've done so well, the Jail is now full!

Start.text: I'm so proud of what we've accomplished.

Next1.text: You've left your mark on Drombach.

Start.text:
So many buildings need to be rebuilt!
I deserve a little break now and again.
We haven't seen our foreman nor our owner in a while.

Next1.text: I'm not going to work if I don't have to.

Start.text:
I was a Bandit before becoming a slave,
got caught stealing horses.

Next1.text: At least I'm glad it happened before the Inquisition arrived. Criminals are burned at the stake nowadays.

Start.text: Our master freed us. All of a sudden, he let us go just like that.

Next1.text: The others left, but I decided to stay on the condition that I get paid. The mines protect us from the cold and the Eye's Reckoning.

Start.text: Mine to your heart's content, I won't stop you.

Next1.text: This place belongs to our owner, not to us. Do whatever you want with his rocks.

line0.text: Fight the creature behind the sealed door.

line1.text: Decide between the Scholar and the Inquisitor.

Start.text: You feel a draught coming from this wall.
The statue’s head is covered with a thick layer of dust.
The writing beneath the statue was defaced with a chisel.
Something tried to bite you in the dark!
This fresco was vandalised.
Stone gives way to emptiness, and darkness swallows the light of your torches. The path seems to stop here.

A stone bridge appeared, but it’s too short to lead anywhere.
There must be a way to extend it.
The way is blocked on the other side.

Notif.text: The chariot crumbled to dust at the slightest touch.

Start.text: These creatures were devoured by something much bigger.
Remnants of old tools lay next to the skeleton, including a hammer and a chisel.
This part of the wall can rotate. Someone strong enough should be able to move it.

line0.props.tipText: Have a strong Companion rotate the wall.

line1.props.tipText: Slip through the gap.
line1.props.disableReason: There are one or more large animals in your group that cannot make it through.

Failure.text: As the wall rotates, it suddenly snaps shut on ::name::'s fingers (::injury::).

Sneak.text: Your Companions slip through the gap one by one.

Start.text: Since this box was not stolen or broken, it must be better protected than it appears...
Are you sure you want to open this door?

Notif.text: The door has opened.

Start.text: Viviane was consumed by darkness! Consumed!
Do not open this door! Do not let it out!
This Inquisitor sacrificed himself so that I could reach the <narrator>lever</narrator> and shut the door. Without him, none of us would have survived.

Next1.text: I gave him a remedy, but he needs time to recover.

End.text: The others have already left. We will join them as soon as the Inquisitor is stable.

Start.text: In the name of Jeru and the God of Light, you will answer my question, Scholar!

Next1.text: What was that abomination protecting?

Next2.text: You wouldn't understand even if I told you, you zealot!

Start.text: Did the Prince send you? You’ve shown up at a good time, Mercenaries. Perhaps you can get us out of this mess.

Next1.text: Our objective is on the other side of this door, but these foolish Inquisitors attracted a monster. It’s a miracle we managed to escape with our lives!

Next2.text: It’s a miracle we followed you! Without my men’s sacrifice, you would all be dead!

Next3.text: If you hadn't been snooping around, you wouldn't have set off the trap! And the relic would be in our hands!

Next4.text: So it is a relic you’re looking for! What for? Answer me!

Alt0.text: You’ve shown up at a good time, Mercenaries. Perhaps you can get us out of this mess.

Alt1.text: Our objective is on the other side of this door, but these foolish Inquisitors attracted a monster. It’s a miracle we managed to escape with our lives!

Alt2.text: It’s a miracle we followed you! Without my men’s sacrifice, you would all be dead!

Alt3.text: If you hadn't been snooping around, you wouldn't have set off the trap! And the relic would be in our hands!

Alt4.text: So it is a relic you’re looking for! What for? Answer me!

MissionDesc.text: Use the lever and defeat the monster.

Start.text: The door is blocked by some sort of mechanism.
You can hear a huge creature roaming in the dark.
By Saint Jeru! You fight like a soldier, Scholar!

Next1.text:
You handle yourself just as well, Inquisitor.
I thought I was watching Saint Eleor herself.

Next2.text: The Inquisitor and the Scholar are busy congratulating each other.

MissionDesc.text: Choose whom to give the relic of the Drombach Tomb to.

Start.text: I really hope this relic is a useless trinket and that you didn't just doom the whole county.

Oh no, the <narrator>relic</narrator>!...
Is it still in one piece?

Next1.text:
What a strange object...
It looks like...

Next2.text: The Eye, indeed. We believe this is how the Ancients depicted the God of Light.

Next3.text: Based on writings that we managed to decipher, they already knew about the Eye’s Reckoning. This relic could help us stop it.

Next4.text:
Wait.
What did you just say?

Next4bis.text: If this relic can be used to communicate with God, then it’s a sacred artefact! Meaning it rightfully belongs to the Edoranian Church. Give it to me!

Next5.text:
Mercenaries! No!
It may be our only chance to stop the Eye’s Reckoning!

Next6.text:
They can't be trusted!
Leaving such an artefact in the hands of heathens would only worsen the wrath of the God of Light.

line0.props.tipText: Give the relic to the Professor.

line1.props.tipText: Give the relic to the Inquisitor.

Inquisition1.text:
By Saint Septimus, you had me worried!
For a moment there, I thought you were going to give the relic to this miscreant!

Inquisition2.text: Trust me, you made the right choice. Tonight, the relic will depart for the Holy City where it will be stored in a safe place, away from heretics.

Inquisition3.text: Now let’s go. We’re done here.

SettingLogInquisition.text: You handed the relic over to the Inquisition.

Scholars1.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. Your decision probably saved Drombach.

Scholars2.text: I promise to dedicate my life to understanding this artefact, no matter how long it takes.

Scholars3.text:
Let’s go.
I will store the relic in a safe place, as far as possible from the Inquisition.

SettingLogScholars.text: You handed the relic over to the Scholar.

EndScholar.text: I don't have enough men left to fight you, but trust that the Inquisition will know about your sacrilege. You can count on it.

Notif.text: The scrolls have turned to dust.

Start.text: One of your Companion trips over a soft heap lying on the ground.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Notif.text: The rack fell apart at the slightest touch.

Start.text: The door is locked.
Light the brazier?

Accept.text: Some of the statues in this clay battalion are different from others...

Start.text: The inscription reads General Mehyt.
Suddenly, your torches light up a monstrous face.

Notif.text: The whole Tomb is shaking.
The whole Tomb is shaking.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Drombach Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Professor Hadwige.

Start.text: I purchased all of these fine goods in the heart of Ludern. They are most efficient, trust me!
Ludern Mercenaries! Perfect timing, I have something to show you!

Next1.text:
I've been studying the relics we collected, and I discovered that the Ancients knew about the Beast and its Pack.
They left enough instructions for me to create this!

Next2.text: It's just a prototype, but the first tests were quite promising!

Start.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camp hands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

Next1.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

Next2.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
That being said, you can still join us, for old time's sake.

Accept.text: You'll see that our methods are similar to what those savages were doing. We simply rationalised the process. You should talk to dear Winfrith, he's very proud of his work.

Wait.text: Exterminating the Ghost Pack is one thing, but doing it quickly while avoiding casualties is another challenge entirely.

End1.text: You see? Our information is as reliable as the Trackers'. We even managed to replicate their so-called ancestral techniques and to create armour layers.

End2.text: I hope you’ll like it. Winfrith put his heart into it.

Final.text: Feel free to visit us any time. It’s always a pleasure to see you.

TrackIP1.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camp hands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

TrackIP2.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

TrackIP3.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
That being said, you can still join us, for old time's sake.

TrackDone1.text:
Well, well, if it isn't our dear camphands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.

TrackDone2.text: I am pleased to inform you that the same can be said of our research. Thanks to you and the relics found in the Ludern Tomb, our knowledge of the Beast and the Ghost Pack has made great strides.

TrackDone3.text:
The Kingdom of Alazar no longer needs the Trackers, we can now hunt the Ghost Pack on our own.
But since you went ahead and did it anyway, please accept a reward as a token of our gratitude.

Well, well, if it isn't our dear camphands from Harag.
Your group has made good progress since we last met.
