Notify.text: Let the Hunt begin!

Start.text: Set on fire?
There is something behind this boulder.
There is something written on the gravestone.

line0.props.tipText: Scholar Companion required.
line0.props.disableReason: Scholar Companion required.

Next1.text: The inscription reads: Dose who drunk saloot you. Though puzzled, your Companion spots a small object in the dirt.

Start.text: All Rouste matches are cancelled until further notice.

Next1.text: We found ancient relics on the pitch, and we won't let a bunch of yokels step on them.

Antiquity1.text: You found an artefact! By the Beast's fangs, you must analyse it right away! It could be the key to this mystery!

End1.text:
So, Mercenaries? What did you find out about the artefact?
Is it a sword? A key? A trinket, perhaps?

End2.text: By the Beast's fangs! The little fiends!

End3.text: Call off the search! This bloody corkscrew is proof that the whole thing was a prank. Probably from the Laboratory alumni... It's the third time this year!

End4.text: Well, since we're here, we might as well make use of the place. If you want to play Rouste against our team, let me know.

Rouste1.text: But be warned, the players of the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory's team are highly skilled.

Rouste3.text:
Your approach of the game is so innovative that I had to take notes.
Here's your reward, with the compliments of the best minds in Drombach.

Rouste4.text: If you agree to a rematch, I believe we'll show you that we've learned from our defeat.

RousteDiff1.text: Our Scholars still need to blow off steam after being humiliated by our students.

line0.props.tipText: Play Drombach's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff3.text:
You're merciless, Mercenaries!
The reward is yours. I hope you'll enjoy it, it's the last one we have.

RousteEnd1.text: If you wish to challenge our Scholars again, don't expect a reward, you've already won them all.

line0.props.tipText: Play Drombach's team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd3.text: I hope our players will learn from your techniques!

line0.text: Inspect the gravestone found on the Rouste Pitch in Drombach.

line1.text: Inspect the Treasure of the Ancients found near the Rouste Pitch gravestone.

line2.text: Talk to Professor Marah.

line0.text: Win a Rouste match in Drombach.

Start.text: I can't make sense of this gravestone. Something's not right.

Next1.text: I fell for it hook, line and sinker.

Start.text:
We'd been digging here for days.
I need to play Rouste to vent my frustration.
How about a match against our team?

Next1.text: I'm in no hurry to return to the Laboratory. When the others learn we were fooled by our students...

Start.text: I was travelling through the region when I heard about the Rouste Pitch reopening! I couldn't miss it!
Heavy rains revealed this site in the fall. To think we were playing Rouste over a secret Tomb!
I can't believe we're about to uncover an unknown site...

line0.text: Find the bandits lurking on the road to the <narrator>Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory</narrator>.

Start.text: It’s hard to focus with a Princess sobbing in your ears.

Next1.text: She claims that she was attacked by bandits <narrator>on the road to the Laboratory</narrator>. But if you ask me, I bet her escort was struck by the Eye’s Reckoning.

Next2.text: She’s lying because she’s scared the Inquisition will come after her.

End.text:
You killed cannibals? Sends a shiver down my spine, it does.
No wonder the Eye’s Reckoning is upon us.

Start.text: You’ve got to help me! Please!

Next1.text: Wish I could, m'lady. But I'm just a farmer, not a warrior. Best I can do is take you to the village or the castle.

Next2.text:
Then it will be too late!
Those men took my husband. By the time we reach Hulburg, he will be dead.

Next3.text: Don’t worry, Princess. Your husband is a nobleman, they’ll demand a ransom, for sure...

Next4.text:
They were not ordinary bandits! They slaughtered our escort!
If they’re still lurking <narrator>around the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory</narrator>, it’s only a matter of time before they prey upon other travellers!

MissionDesc.text: Save the innkeeper.

MissionDescInquisition.text: Take the innkeeper to the High Inquisitor.

MissionDescPrince.text: Take the innkeeper back to Lady Mayoress Gerslind.

line0.text: Rescue the innkeeper from the bears.

line1.text: Decide the innkeeper’s fate.

Start.text: Why? Why did you save me?

Next1.text: The Eye sent those bears to kill me! I deserve to die after I dared survive His Reckoning!

Next2.text:
I'm a heretic! I have slaves! I made a fortune on my neighbours’ backs! I didn't go to church...
Everything that’s happening to me is my own fault!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the innkeeper to go back to <narrator>New-Asthel</narrator>.

line1.props.tipText: Offer to take the innkeeper to the <narrator>Inquisition</narrator> to be executed.

Convinced1.text:
If... If the townsfolk think I'm a true believer, then it must be true, right?
Maybe the Eye’s Reckoning was targeting someone else? My slacker of a slave, for instance...

Convinced2.text:
Yes! It’s his fault, not mine!
I won't sacrifice myself for that heretic. <narrator>Take me back to the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel!</narrator>

Suggest1.text: You... You think it could save my soul? Oh! Mercenaries! I can't be doomed to wander for all eternity!

Suggest2.text: If there is the slightest chance for me to join the Light, I'll do anything, even meet with the High Inquisitor.

Start.text: If this man really is the innkeeper, he's in a tight spot.

line0.text: Take the redeemed bandit to Saint Serene Church.

Start.text:
Kill me if you want. I won’t try to stop you.
Now that my outlaw days are behind me, I refuse to fight.

Next1.text: My former colleagues were struck down by the <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator> while crossing the Pitta Bridge. That was a wake-up call for me.

Next2.text: If you want to help, take me to <narrator>Saint Serene Church</narrator> in <narrator>New-Asthel</narrator>. I wish to confess my sins to the priestess and take the cloth myself.

line0.props.tipText: Take the bandit to Saint Serene Church in New-Asthel.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Drombach Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Belecos.

line3.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Brighid.

line4.text: Report your victory to Professor Hadwige.

Start.text: War paints have a meaning that foreign eyes cannot perceive.

Next1.text: Only those who have been to the Tules' Glade in Ludern and followed the teachings of a druid can wear them.

Tatoo1.text:
I see that you are worthy of wearing our war paints. Have a seat.
Who among your Companions wants one?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: The people of Drombach have their hands full dealing with the Eye's Reckoning, so we're handling the Ghost Pack to try and ease their burden.

Next1.text: You’re welcome to give us a hand if you so wish. Some of my Trackers were devoured, others struck by lightning during our latest hunt.

Accept.text: I hope this information will be of use to you. Be careful.

Wait.text: This pack is vicious, I hope you know what you’re doing.

End1.text:
Ah, Mercenaries!
It appears your valiant efforts made quite an impression. Some merchants stopped by the camp to tell us of your deeds.

End2.text: Congratulations, this armour layer is yours.

Final.text: As soon as I learn anything new about the Ghost Pack, you'll be the first to know.

Notify.text: Let the Hunt begin!

Start.text:
The people of Drombach have been trading with us since the Eye’s Reckoning first appeared.
They must be afraid of travelling to New-Asthel.

You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didn’t think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

Next1.text: I wish I could say we’ve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars’ intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

Next2.text: Officially, we’re hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time. Maybe you could help us keep up that pretence.

Accept.text: The Eye's Reckoning will probably make things harder for you. Talk to Lerina, she's got something to give you.

Wait.text: How's your gear? Talk to Lerina, if you haven't already.

End1.text:
I knew it. You defeated the Ghost Pack!
Nothing unexpected from those who faced the Beast and lived to tell the tale!

End2.text: I hope this enhancement will demonstrate just how grateful we are for your help. Thanks to you, we can focus on our real mission.

TrackIP1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didn’t think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

TrackIP2.text: I wish I could say we’ve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars’ intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackIP3.text:
Officially, we're hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time.
Good thing you're taking care of the monsters yourself, helps us keep up the pretence. Talk to Lerina, she'll help you.

TrackDone1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!

TrackDone1bis.text: You didn’t waste any time! I heard you killed the Ghost Pack in Drombach?

TrackDone2.text: You have no idea how relieved we are. But first, let me give you the enhancement you deserve.

TrackDone3.text: I wish I could say we’ve been living happily since you left Ludern, but... The Scholars’ intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackDone4.text: Officially, we’re hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time. Good thing you got rid of the monsters for us, or our subterfuge would have been uncovered.

TrackFinished1.text:
You?
Mercenaries! Do you remember us? You helped us take down the Scholars in the <narrator>Ludern Tomb</narrator>!
I didn’t think we'd meet again! Deep in enemy territory, of all places.

TrackFinished2.text: I wish I could say we’ve been living happily since you left, but... The Scholars’ intrusion has enraged the clans. We were sent here to retrieve relics stolen by Alazar over the years.

TrackFinished3.text:
Officially, we’re hunting the Ghost Pack, but our real mission takes up all of our time.
Good thing you got rid of the monsters for us, or our subterfuge would have been uncovered.

Notify.text: Let the Hunt begin!

Start.text: Alazar angered the gods because of all the Ancient Tombs they plundered. Even their own! They definitely deserved the Reckoning!

Next1.text: The consequences of their actions extend far beyond what they imagine. Our druids were able to gain a better understanding of the Beast after it was drawn to Ludern. They gave us an advantage that will come back to bite them.

Next2.text: Take this axe, it was made to kill Pack monsters more efficiently than any other weapon. Instead of destroying us, the Scholars made us stronger.

Reward.text: Harag is much less vulnerable to the Ghost Pack than before, all thanks to Alazar. Ironic, isn't it?

Start.text: I would cut off my own arm if it could take me back to Ludern.
It’s good to see familiar faces in this hostile land.
Senuna wasn't eager to follow Brighid here, but I think she’s adapting quite well.

Sister.text: I thought I told you not to show your faces here again!

Start.text: I said no! I'm not taking on any mission until I get my risk bonus.

Next1.text: I became a mercenary to fight bandits and serve lords. Being struck down by a god wasn’t part of the plan!

Start.text: It’s hard to focus on training when you know that the God of Light is lurking nearby...

Next1.text: I keep jumping at shadows, don’t you?

Start.text:
This region is extremely dangerous. I hope your group is well-trained.
If not, I can help.

Respec.text: I'm pretty sure you’ll find this useful.

Start.text: Waltraud was under too much pressure when she was the arena champion.

Next1.text: We decided to start a new life elsewhere, but I think we didn't move far enough.

Start.text:
How far must I go to find peace? Leave my mountain, now!
If I still wanted to sign my fans' shields, I would've stayed in the valley!

Next1.text:
Oh? That's not why you're here?
Well then... erm...

Next2.text: Sorry for snapping at you, Mercenaries. I thought you were fans. Some of them are willing to brave the blizzard and the Eye's Reckoning to try and convince me to go back...

Next2Bis.text:
But it's because of them that I left!
You can't imagine the pressure I was under. I had to win all of my fights and always be entertaining so that the audience would get their money's worth, and if I happened to lose... It was...

Next3.text:
Help me escape from them! Entertain them for me and earn glory in the arena so that they'll remember your names instead of mine.
Help me live in peace, and I'll teach you everything I know.

End1.text:
Did you beat Lisbeth in the arena?
Did the audience cheer for you? Enough to forget about me?

End2.text: Oh! Blessed be the Eye! I'll finally be rid of my fans! As a token of my gratitude, let me teach you everything I learned during my years as champion.

End3.text: Now that we're done, please leave me alone.

line0.text: Return to the former champion after completing Lisbeth's Arena.

Start.text: <narrator>This dragon skeleton is not how you imagined.</narrator>

Notif.text: Drombach Scholars wish to inform the population that the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory has resumed its activities.

line0.text: Take on Professor Grind's mission.

line1.text: Catch 3 live Plague-ridden subjects and take them to Professor Grind.

line0.text: Meet Professor Grind at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory.

line1.text: Contain the Plague-ridden until the reinforcements arrive.

line2.text: Report to the Inquisitor.

Start.text: I trust you know that it is considered heresy to experiment on live Plague-ridden subjects...

Next1.text: I do not like what you’re implying, Inquisitor! This laboratory is as conscientious as can be. Our experiments dutifully follow the precepts of the Light.

Next2.text: Am I supposed to believe that Plague-ridden spawned out of thin air inside your library?

Next3.text: They attacked from the outside! They probably fled the cursed village because of the Eye’s Reckoning and...

Next4.text: Sure they did.

Next5.text:
Mercenaries.
I want the truth. What did you see?

line0.props.tipText: Tell the truth.

line1.props.tipText: Hide the truth.

Truth2.text: You and your subordinates are under arrest, Professor. Your profane experiments will be destroyed or seized by the Edoranian Church.

Truth3.text: As for you, Mercenaries, it is my pleasure to give you this reward. The Inquisition owes you a great debt...

AcceptTruth1.text: We’ve been wanting to inspect this place for years. Not only to appease the God of Light, but also to find out how far along the Plague cure is...

AcceptTruth2.text: Edoran fears that they were conducting research zealously in an effort to make the Alazarian army impervious to the Plague.

SettingLog.text: You reported Professor Grind’s experiments.

EndTruth.text: I had the Professor and his surviving colleagues sent to the Inquisition camp. Thanks to you, they will be burned at the stake as they should be. Congratulations.

Lie1.text: Really? So they really did attack from the outside.

Lie2.text: I have to admit that I’m quite surprised by your confirmation. The scene around us seems to indicate otherwise.

Lie3.text: So be it... I have no choice but to trust you. But if the Eye’s Reckoning strikes this laboratory, I will know you lied to me.

EndLie.text: It will come as no surprise that I don’t find your story very convincing.

Start.text:
Mercenaries, you’re amazing!
You've saved all of Sophy Adr Alazar’s legacy.

Next1.text: Take this. We usually give it only to the best Scholars, but you deserve it.

Next3.text:
Count on me to continue my research.
Everyone in Alazar will soon be immune to the Plague. We will then have a major advantage over our enemies. We will turn this scourge into a blessing for our kingdom!

SettingLog.text: You covered Professor Grind’s experiments.

Start.text:
It was a massacre.
They didn't stand a chance against the Plague-ridden.
Heretics don’t deserve prayers, so I'm trying to be discreet.
Prince Aerald asked me to translate an Ancient text, but it's by far the most complicated I've had to study in my entire career.

Next1.text: It seems to be some kind of instruction manual filled with technical terms. And... I think some words are missing. I wonder where he found it.

Start.text: Apologies, but Professor Grind’s laboratory is sealed off.
You look well-travelled.

Next1.text: I have here a most important letter that must be delivered in person to my counterpart in Gosenberg.

Next2.text:
This letter details my latest research, discoveries that could change the way we see our world!
Do you feel capable of carrying something so precious?

Accept.text:
Excellent.
You will find my colleague in Gosenberg City, in Grinmeer Province.
She will have your payment.

End1.text: So? Did you deliver my letter?

End2.text: What did she say? Let me guess! Was she amazed?

Wait.text: My name will still be remembered in a hundred years.

Notif.text: You obtained the Astronomer's Letter.

line0.text: Take on the astronomer’s mission.

line1.text: Deliver the Drombach astronomer’s letter to his counterpart in Grinmeer.

Start.text: The dean refuses to fund my expeditions. "You might as well hunt groattles, Professor Maurith," she says.

Next1.text:
But I'm not hunting groattles! <narrator>Dragons</narrator> did exist!
If she'd just let me explore those blasted caves, I'd finally get her proof!

Next3.text:
What if you went for me?
I’ll give you whatever profits your discoveries yield as payment. All I want is to prove that old crone wrong!

Next4.text:
We will do great things together!
I've already listed the locations you need to inspect, three caves where you stand the best chance of finding dragon bones!

Accept.text: Explore the <narrator>Great Growler Grotto</narrator> in Arthes, the <narrator>Great Growler Cave</narrator> in Grinmeer and the <narrator>Fatclaw Cave</narrator> in Ludern.

Bones2.text: I can't believe you found them!

Bones3.text: I knew there was something in that cave!

End1.text: Excellent! Mercenaries, thanks to your efforts, I am well on my way to becoming the greatest expert of pre-Jeru fauna.

End2.text: Stay here. I'm going to arrange the bones into a complete dragon skeleton.

End3.text: Let’s see... That one goes here, this one there...

End4.text: Oh dear... What is this thing?

Final1.text:
Are you waiting for your reward?
Ahem! What you brought me isn’t a dragon, so I'm not sure you deserve anything.

Final2.text: Oh, fine! Here's your reward. And now, go away. I don't need an audience when the dean comes and laughs in my face.

Wait.text: By Jeru, what is this supposed to be?

MissionArthesCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

MissionGrinmeerCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

MissionLudernCave.text: Find the dragon bones buried in the cave.

line0.text: Dig in the <narrator>Great Growler Grotto</narrator> in Arthes, the <narrator>Great Growler Cave</narrator> in Grinmeer and <narrator>Fatclaw Cave</narrator> in Ludern, then bring your findings to Professor Maurith.

Start.text: I can't focus on my research.

Next1.text: I heard that a Broker was murdered in Gosenberg. I hope my mother is all right...

Start.text: I volunteered to take part in Professor Grind’s experiments, but my application was rejected.

Next1.text: Now I’m doomed to study medicine like a mere village apothecary.

A1UniversityBookshelf.npc.name: The History of Tiltren, by Jaffrey of Stromkapp

Start.text: <narrator>The sole purpose of this book is to return our beautiful County of Tiltren to its rightful place among the Five Kingdoms.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>I mean to make copies of my writings, and promptly send them to the universities and laboratories of Alazar, Edoran and Gosenberg, whose so-called Scholars have not deigned to add even the slightest mention of our lands in their chronicles!</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>Yet it is the invasion of Tiltren by General Edor's army that led to all of the others, and even though it lasted only a few days, our county was occupied by a foreign kingdom for over fifty years... </narrator>

Start.text: So you’re looking for the New-Asthel innkeeper?

Next1.text: How do I know you’re not working for the Inquisition? And that you won't burn the man the minute you get your hands on him?

line0.props.tipText: Threaten to fetch the Inquisition immediately.

line1.props.tipText: Use force to make him talk.

Threat1.text: Zealots like you make me sick.

Threat2.text: The poor sod must be dead by now, anyway. Have fun burning his dead body.

Threat3.text: We saw him head toward the peak in the middle of a snow storm, without fire or any gear. The cold probably did him in.

Attack1.text:
All right! I surrender!
Blasted zealots!

Attack2.text: The innkeeper headed towards the mountain peak. He didn’t want to stay here despite the blizzard.

Attack3.text: I bet he’s already dead. And considering what the Inquisition has in store for him, it’s probably best.

Wait.text: You’re here to check out the border? Beyond the mountains is Edoran. The road is pretty much impassable in winter, but invaders have tried to cross over when the weather warms up.

MissionDesc.text: Track down the innkeeper in this area.

line0.text: Question the Valiant Tower soldiers.

Start.text:
The New-Asthel innkeeper?
What do you want from him? Did the Inquisition send you?

Next2.text: Hmpf! I see...

Next4.text:
If you really want to know, our sentries saw your innkeeper. He was running as if the Beast was after him, straight towards the peak.
With no gear or supplies, he’s probably dead by now.

Wait.text: You’re here to check out the border? Edoran is just over the mountain. The road is long and treacherous, but that didn't deter invasion attempts.

MissionDesc.text: Track down the innkeeper in this area.

Start.text: Have we met before?

Next1.text: Wait! Captain, I remember!

Next2.text:
They’re the Mercenaries who <narrator>helped Lady Brunhilde escape from Vertruse</narrator>.
They can be trusted.

End.text:
Lady Brunhilde Adr Alazar went back to the capital to mull over her failure.
But don’t worry about her, that old crone is nothing if not resourceful.

Start.text: Why bother guarding the Edoran border when the Inquisition is already walking our lands?

The Eye's Reckoning seems to strike less frequently here, doesn't it?
Probably because there are fewer people, therefore less heresy.

Notif.text: Creatures are standing in your way.

line0.text: Sleep in the haunted castle.

line1.text: Defeat the Harag spirits.

line2.text: Investigate the escaped spirit.

Start.text: Those Harag spirits look vicious.

Notif.text: One of the Harag spirits fled towards the castle’s forge.

Start.text: Leave while you still can, Mercenaries. Maybe the evil spirits of this place haven’t spotted you yet!

Next1.text: This castle has been haunted since my ancestor left to wage war in the faraway land of Harag only to bring back this curse with him.

Next2.text:
Monsters appear when night falls.
As soon as I dare fall asleep, they swarm the castle to wreak havoc and try to kill me. Others came to help me, but none of them survived...

Start.text: What happened?

I'll tell you the truth.
I'm not a Harag spirit. It was just a disguise...

Next1.text: I made up the whole story to be able to destroy my ancestors’ castle. After enough people had died and gone missing, the Prince would have accepted my request.

Next2.text: Drombach forbids the destruction of buildings dating back to the time when Alazar was still called the Northern Kingdom. But with the old pile still standing, how can I mine the rimesteel deposits that lie below?

Next3.text: Here, take this as thanks for not killing me when you had the chance. I would have deserved to die.

Accept.text: Your Companion is right here, you can take them back.

End.text: I hope we can all put this adventure behind us soon.

Start.text: Fear! Fear the wrath of Harag!

line0.props.tipText: Threaten the Harag spirit.

line1.props.tipText: Convince the Harag spirit to tell the truth.

Wanted.text: You unleashed the wrath of Harag.

Start.text: Choose a Companion who will sleep in the bed.

Notif1.text: Your Companions are awoken by a loud disturbance coming from the ground floor.

Start.text:
What are you doing? No!
You promised to take me to the Inquisition!
We're on high alert: the Inquisition is becoming increasingly resolute.

EndInquisition.text: Do you really think the Inquisition will burn the Prince at the stake? I mean... He's a Prince!

EndPrince.text:
The Inquisition is gone! Gone!
It’s such a relief to see their empty camp, I never tire of it.

Start.text: I feel like I can’t take a single step without being questioned by an Inquisitor.

EndInquisition.text: It feels strange to guard an empty throne... Gives me the creeps.

EndCorene.text: Turns out it’s a Gosenberg lady who’s leading Drombach... I thought it was supposed to be the other way around.

EndPrince.text:
Can you believe it?
Soon the Prince will control the God of Light!
It’s such an honour to serve a man like him!

Start.text: The Prince stopped paying attention to the women I introduce to him! This Divine Reckoning and Inquisition business is distracting him from his main duty.

Next1.text: He may be young, but given the infant mortality rate in our kingdom, he must start producing descendants as soon as possible.

EndInquisition.text: We have to wait for the King to appoint a new governor... I hope he won't take too long.

Start.text: Well I'll be!

Next1.text: You have some nerve to show your face here after what you did!

Next2.text: Do not talk to me again or I will have my new husband quarter you on the spot!

Notif.text: Corene still resents you.

End.text: Do you have a death wish?

Start.text: Drombach is mine to rule since my husband's arrest.

Next1.text: Fate is a strange and unpredictable thing...

Start.text: Well, well... Look who’s here.

Next1.text: I had a feeling the woes befalling our region would attract your ilk.

Next2.text: If I could afford to, I'd send you back where you came from, but it so happens that I need people like you: discreet and daring.

Next3.text: The most brilliant minds of this county are headed toward the Tomb of the Ancients. I want you to join them there and protect them from the creatures roaming the ruins.

Next4.text:
One more thing, Mercenaries.
If I'm entrusting you with this mission, it’s not because I like hiring sellswords. I expect you to be more discreet than my soldiers. Under no circumstance should you draw the Inquisition’s attention.

MissionInquisition.text: My Scholars told me what you did in the Tomb. You gave the Inquisition an invaluable relic. That was a terrible mistake.

MissionPrince.text: My Scholars are already working on the Tomb’s relic and making good progress. It’s just a shame the Inquisition heard about it...

Final1.text: We’re about to leave the castle. You almost missed us, Mercenaries.

Final2.text: We need to go to the <narrator>Celestial Mountain Gate</narrator> without delay. According to our spies, the Inquisition is sending most of their troops there. I guess they got tired of asking me permission to get in...

Final3.text: I need you, Mercenaries. I need all men and women who believe that only Knowledge can save us from the Eye’s Reckoning. If the Inquisition passes the Celestial Mountain Gate, Drombach is doomed.

FinalAccept.text:
Let’s go!
Go on ahead, I’ll meet you there with my soldiers.

EndPrince.text: Research is progressing apace, Mercenaries. I hope to see results before I die.

MissionDesc1.text: Look for the Scholars in the Drombach Tomb.

MissionDescEnd.text: Join Prince Aerald Adr Alazar at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line0.text: Take on the Prince’s mission.

line1.text: Explore the Drombach Tomb and find the Scholars.

line0.text: Take on Prince Aerald Ald Alazar's mission at the Celestial Mountain Gate.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
The closer you are to the Prince, the more suspicious the Inquisition gets.
You have no idea how many patrols come to check on me each day.

Repair.text: It won’t protect you from the Eye’s Reckoning, but it should do.

End.text: You think things will get better? Really?

Start.text: We'll go over the cliffs to cross the border. You should do the same, Mercenaries!

Next1.text:
<narrator>The Inquisition reigns supreme here.</narrator>
If you thought the Guard was ruthless, you're not ready for what the Inquisition has in store for you!

Next2.text: <narrator>Forget about jail. Here, thieves and murderers are burned at the stake!</narrator> Run before they spot you!

line0.props.tipText: Capture the Bandits to hand them over to the Inquisition.

line1.props.tipText: Let the Bandits go.

Start.text: You’re a bit skinny, but you'll do...

Notif.text:
The bandits are running away!
Follow them to their hideout!

Start.text: Turn back, Mercenaries. For your own safety. This mine is about to collapse.
Why is this man not tied up? Where are you taking him?

Next1.text:
To Saint Serene Church?
Are you out of your mind? This bandit must pay for his crimes!

line1.props.tipText: Hand over the bandit.

End.text:
I guess you’re not completely crazy, after all.
From now on, don’t believe outlaws and their false promises.

Start.text: Halt!

Next1.text:
This man with you dared survive the Eye’s Reckoning. He must suffer the same fate as his accomplices.
Hand him over immediately!

line1.props.tipText: Hand over the bandit.

End.text: What you just did makes you cowards, but also true believers.

Start.text:
I don’t sell my relics to just anyone.
I mean, just look at you, Mercenaries! All of your equipment combined isn’t worth even one of my artefacts.

Next1.text:
Oh! You’re here to arrest me?
You’re welcome to try! I bet you won't manage to lay a hand on me.

Start.text: So, Mercenaries! Hiding in Alazar?

Next1.text:
Did you think the <narrator>Winfels</narrator> wouldn't look for you here?
Well, you thought wrong!

Next2.text:
Their terms are crystal clear: we’re to bring back either their dear <narrator>Corene</narrator>, or her captors' heads.
So? Where is she?

line0.props.tipText: Tell the Brotherhood that Corene married Prince Aerald Adr Alazar.

Corene1.text:
She married...
Wait a minute! What did you say?

Corene2.text:
Corene married an Alazarian Prince?
Now that’s an unexpected development...

Corene3.text:
Well then... I suppose we should let the Winfel family know before continuing our mission.
Here, take this for your troubles.

Start.text: Murdering Brunhilde Adr Alazar wasn't enough for you? You had to come all the way here and prance about her kingdom?

Next1.text: Know that her father, the King, is furious. He offered us a hefty sum to find you.

Next2.text: Don’t bother trying to run. We were in Vertruse when you killed her. We've seen your faces.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Brotherhood that you are not involved in the murder.

Brunehilde1.text:
Yeah... On second thought, we could be wrong.
As you say, there were a lot of Mercenaries in Gosenberg at the time.

Brunehilde2.text:
I guess we’ll have to extend our search to regions surrounding Vertruse. Thanks for the tip.
Take this, as an apology for wrongfully accusing you.
No hard feelings, right?

Start.text: One of your Companions is turning into a wild beast, but their life isn’t worth your Krowns?

Next1.text:
We have the solution!
Drawing upon ancient tradition and years of relentless research, my Companions and I have the means to solve all of your problems!

Next2.text: Behold, Mercenaries! Our revolutionary cure for the Plague: the Homeopill!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the charlatans to leave the kingdom before Mercenaries go after them.

Convinced1.text:
The Scholars put a bounty on our heads?
Are you sure?

Convinced2.text: I knew they valued medicine highly, but to send Mercenaries after us...!

Convinced3.text: You can keep the Homeopills, I don't want the border guards to catch us with the stuff.

Start.text:
Those slaves are convicted criminals! They must serve their sentence!
I order you to hand them over!

Next1.text: You dare claim that among the slaves your people buy, none are farmers kidnapped by Bandits?

Next2.text: It's up to the King of Alazar to prevent that! Not to a bunch of savages still caked in swamp mud.

Next3.text:
You there! Mercenaries!
Help us drive away those wretches. We'll pay you well.

Next5.text:
Don't believe anything they say, Mercenaries!
They can't admit that they're abducting farmers in other kingdoms!

Start.text:
I'm sorry.
We were supposed to watch your backs, but there were too many soldiers. Without your help, we would have all died.

Next1.text: This patrol was running towards the fishery. We had no choice but to attack them, or they would have caught you in the act and taken the slaves.

Next2.text:
Even though it didn't exactly go as planned, what matters is the result.
Please accept this reward, as well as our gratitude.

Accept.text: We're going back to the camp, but as soon as the weather allows, we'll run straight to Harag.

Start.text: How stupid do you have to be to come all the way from Harag on mere rumours!

Next1.text: The King of Alazar makes sure that slaves from other kingdoms bear proof of their conviction. Claiming otherwise is absurd!

Next2.text: Now that the problem is solved, we can return these slaves to their owners. Thank you for your cooperation, Mercenaries.

Start.text: I wonder how you found out they were coming this way...

Next1.text: But since you saved us, we'll call it a miracle! Come with me to the Celestial Mountain Gate, I have a reward for you.

Start.text: In the name of the Eye! Let us through, soldier!

Next1.text: This mountain is off limits, by order of Prince Aerald.

Next2.text: Do not oppose the will of the God of Light! Your Prince is just a man and...

Next3.text: And you’re just an Inquisitor.

Next4.text: Is this funny to you?

Next5.text:
Mercenaries! These soldiers are heathens!
They’re trying to hide the heresy taking place in this mountain. Fight by our side!

Next6.text:
Stop!
Mercenaries! What’s in this mountain is beyond their understanding. The Inquisitors must not pass.

Start.text: Good thing I brought reinforcements, right?

Next1.text: Now let’s see what they’re hiding.

Peasants1.text: It’s not a pretty sight. The pony pulling the cart seems to have exploded.

Peasants2.text: I wonder what these <narrator>farmers</narrator> did to deserve to die like this. Maybe they robbed a shrine on the way or insulted a priest.

Wolves1.text:
Are those... <narrator>wolves</narrator>?
Why would the Eye punish wolves?

Wolves2.text: It doesn't make any sense. Jeru’s precepts clearly state that animals cannot commit heresy.

Soldiers1.text:
<narrator>Alazarian soldiers</narrator>, no surprise here.
These men probably blasphemed or committed some kind of crime against the Eye.

Merchants1.text: There’s nothing left of these <narrator>merchants’</narrator> wares. They could have been slavers or fur traders for all we know...

Merchants2.text: That said, slavery goes against the Eye’s teachings, so it could be the reason for their death.

Next1.text: Let’s not tarry.

Next2.text:
But I don't understand. These bodies are nothing like those we saw earlier...
We should keep going.

Next3.text: Could there be a connection with the other Reckonings? We studied three different occurrences, and they didn't seem to have anything in common. It’s as if... as if... the Eye was striking at random.

Next4.text: No! That’s impossible. The God of Light does not punish without cause! There must be another explanation. We will get to the bottom of this!

End1.text: Maybe we’re not approaching the problem the right way. Let’s consider these bodies as a whole.

End2.text: The number of victims and impacts left by the Eye’s Reckoning seems to increase as we move toward the Celestial Mountain...

End3.text: There must be something there... Something especially heretical. I'll meet you there with reinforcements.

Start.text:
The innkeeper?
What do you want with him, Mercenaries?
Did those New-Asthel bumpkins ask you to find him?

Next1.text:
Infidels! I knew it!
They’re hiding from us, trying to escape our scrutiny, but the Eye is already onto them. Their Reckoning draws near! It’s coming!

Next2.text: Leave this cursed county, Mercenaries. Don’t worry about the innkeeper, the Inquisition will deal with him and all of the other heathens in Drombach!

line0.props.tipText: Make up a pious reason.

line1.props.tipText: Use force to make her talk.

Convinced1.text:
Ah! If you want him to be executed, that’s another story!
True believers have to stick together. I'll help you find him.

Convinced2.text: The night the Reckoning struck his tavern, we set off after him. But the wretch knew the area better than us! He gave us the slip and disappeared near <narrator>Valiant Tower</narrator>.

Start.text: All right! Calm down! We'll talk.

Next1.text: The innkeeper made for the mountain, straight to <narrator>Valiant Tower</narrator>. With no furs or cloak, he probably died on the way there.

Next2.text: May you share his fate, heathens!

Start.text: Sorry to make you come all the way here, Mercenaries. One can never be too careful with the Inquisition.

Next1.text: Ever since the <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator> befell Drombach, these zealots have been watching our every move. Woe betide whoever they find suspicious.

Next2.text:
Our innkeeper ran away because of them: he had the misfortune to survive when his tavern was struck by the Eye.
He's a good man and we want to help him, so <narrator>we're willing to pay you to find him</narrator>.

Accept1.text: The night he disappeared, Inquisitor Clelia and her goons were watching the village. She might know something.

Notify.text: Lady Mayoress Gerslind left towards the market.

Refuse1.text: If you change your mind, I'll be on the market square.

MissionDesc.text: Question Inquisitor Clelia about the New-Asthel innkeeper.

End1.text: Oh, I can't wait to see him. Where is he?

End2.text:
Silric! I'm so happy! Mercenaries, you brought him back as promised!
Please accept this reward.

EndAccept.text: Don’t worry about the village. We know how to hide our innkeeper from the Inquisition.

SettingLog.text: You handed the New-Asthel innkeeper over to Lady Mayoress Gerslind.

Start.text: It’s a disaster!

Next1.text:
The Plague-ridden subjects broke out! They attacked my students, my colleagues, the professors...
The newly infected joined their ranks and things got out of hand.

Next2.text: I beg of you! You must help us until reinforcements arrive. If the Plague-ridden subjects get out, the whole county will be overrun!

line0.props.tipText: Fight the Plague-ridden.

Start.text: By Saint Jeru, that was a hard-won fight.

Next1.text:
Take a moment to catch your breath, you fought well.
We'll search the laboratory to make sure there are no Plague-ridden left.

Next2.text: Join us as soon as you can. I want you to tell me what happened.

Start.text: Please! Tell the Inquisitors that the Plague-ridden came from outside. They must not know that we’re studying live subjects. I beg of you, do it for the sake of Knowledge and all the people our cure could save.
I see the army didn’t come alone. You couldn't help but follow!

Next1.text: The <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator> struck these stables. We are duty-bound to inspect the place and make sure that no heretics survived.

Next2.text: Move along, everyone’s dead.

Next3.text:
Dead? Nonsense!
You wouldn’t call the Alazarian army to bury dead bodies.

Next4.text: These men came to rescue injured people. Heretics! You know full well that the God of Light does not punish without cause. If you let them live, the Eye’s Reckoning will strike again!

Next5.text:
They’re not heretics!
Mercenaries! You saw them, didn't you? Did those poor folks look like heathens?

Next6.text:
What they look like is irrelevant. The Eye’s Reckoning does not smite innocents.
Mercenaries! All believers have a duty to carry out the will of the God of Light.

Start.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries.
I’m grateful you didn’t listen to those zealots’ lies.

Next1.text: For weeks, they’ve been burning and torturing those who dare survive the <narrator>Eye’s Reckoning</narrator>, but nothing has changed.

Next2.text: I don’t know what angered the God of Light, but I doubt those poor sods have anything to do with it.

SettingLog.text: You let the Scholars save the stables owners.

Start.text: Praised be Jeru for sending you our way, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: Thanks to you, the heretics who lived here will be burnt at the stake to appease the God of Light. This reward is yours.

Next2.text: Don't ever be fooled by the Scholars’ lies again. The clemency they show heretics is the reason Drombach is beset by the Eye’s Reckoning.

SettingLog.text: You let the Inquisition burn the stables occupants.

NotifInvestigation1.text: An Inquisitor named Emeria is waiting for you in the <narrator>Inquisition Camp</narrator>.

MissionDescInvestigation1.text: Talk to Inquisitor Emeria in the Inquisition Camp.

NotifRuins.text: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar has summoned you to his castle.

MissionDescRuins.text: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar has summoned you to his castle.

MissionDescInquisition.text: Enter the mountain and talk to Inquisitor Emeria.

MissionDescSoldier.text: Enter the Celestial Mountain and talk to Soldier Damen.

InquisitionEnd.text: The High Inquisitor has summoned you to the <narrator>Inquisition Camp</narrator>.

PrinceEnd.text: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar has summoned you to his castle.

MissionDescInquisitionEnd.text: Meet with the High Inquisitor and listen to what she has to say.

MissionDescPrinceEnd.text: Meet with Prince Aerald and listen to what he has to say.

Start.text: We cannot let the Eye's Reckoning get in the way of our fight against the Plague.
Whatever killed this Scholar is long gone. Heavy paw prints lead away from the scene in the snow.
Looting altars of this kind is a grave offence to the God of Light.
In the absence of a church nearby, locals use this altar for rituals and prayer.
This altar is frequently used and well maintained by travellers.
A caravan has been struck down by the Eye's Reckoning!
This patrol was not spared by the Eye's Reckoning. There is almost nothing left of them.
There is a lot of blood, but no body.

line0.props.tipText: Follow the trail of blood.

Start.text: This large chest is covered with debris. Only a dexterous Companion would be able to clear it out quietly.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: Without making a sound, ::name:: clears the debris from the chest.

Failure.text: The moment ::name:: touches a plank, the pile of debris comes crashing down.

Win.text: Your troop has found a way out, and the village slowly regains its peacefulness. You can resume your exploration undetected.

Start.text: Plague-ridden bodies are lying across the basement floor. Only someone agile enough could safely step over them to reach the large wooden chest.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: reaches the chest without alerting the Plague-ridden.

Failure.text: ::name:: trips over a body. The Plague-ridden surround you.

Start.text: The key is out of reach. To get it, you need a Companion strong enough to carry another one.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion

Success.text: You reach the key thanks to ::name::’s strength.

Failure.text: Unable to bear their Companion’s weight, ::name:: drops them to the ground.

Start.text:
You didn't see the wolf until you were inside the building.
Cornered and trapped, the animal becomes agitated, but a determined Companion could calm it down.

line2.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

ConvincedSuccess.text: ::name::’s words managed to win the animal over.

ConvincedFailure.text: Terrified by ::name::’s voice, the wolf decides to jump through a partition rather than stay with your group.

Feeded.text: The wolf seems intrigued by your group.

Start.text: I'm trying to improve the <narrator>cure</narrator>, but with the Inquisition sniffing around, I'm afraid they’ll accuse me of something. If there were at least 5 wounded among you, I could test my new formula without raising suspicion...

line1.props.tipText: Present 5 wounded Companions.

Injuries1.text:
So? Do you feel better?
No nausea, dizziness, oozing rashes on the chest?

Injuries2.text:
Perfect! My new cure didn't kill you. What a relief!
Thank you! I'm nearing my goal.

Alt1.text:
Thanks to you, my remedy is almost ready.
Do you need anything else?

line0.title: Behind the Inquisition’s Back
line0.props.helpTip: Bring at least 5 wounded Companions to Apothecary Salki.

Start.text: The lock is adorned with an Eye.
Don’t get me wrong, Mercenaries. I’m glad to see so many faithful in my humble church.

Next1.text:
The only problem is that they won't leave.
They’re convinced that the Eye’s Reckoning was targeting them.

Next2.text: If no one can talk sense into them, I'm afraid they will end up dying from thirst and hunger in here rather than setting foot outside.

Give1.text: Your generosity knows no bounds, Mercenaries. I pray to the Eye that these supplies will last until His wrath subsides, and that you will find this reward worthy of your efforts.

End.text: I will make sure your donation is shared fairly.

EndAlt1.text: My church seems so empty all of a sudden. Whatever did you tell them, Mercenaries?

EndAlt2.text:
Ah, no matter.
Now I can get back to my prayers without worrying that those devotees will starve to death.
Please take as my thanks.

BanditEnd.text: By Saint Jeru! What did you bring me, Mercenaries?

line0.text: Prevent the faithful from starving to death.

Start.text: We must do penance, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: This past Festival of Light, we sold our sheep for more than they were worth. Taking advantage of gullible people is a terrible sin!

line0.props.tipText: Suggest the farmers make amends.

Convinced.text:
You're right. Donating a sheep as penance should be enough.
Let’s go, son. Without us, Drombach will starve to death.

Start.text:
Oh God of Light!
Oh heavenly Eye!
Hear our prayers and forgive us for straying from the righteous path.
Turn your wrath away from those who repent.

Next1.text:
If you spare us,
we will free our slaves from their chains.
We will shore up our mines securely.
We will pay our workers an honest wage.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the mine owners to make good on their promises right away.

Convinced.text:
Well... so be it!
We'll prove to the God of Light how strong our faith is. With intentions so pure, we should be safe from His wrath.

Start.text: The God of Light is after us! I feel like His gaze is constantly upon us since we performed The Green Night of the Tules!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the jugglers to dedicate their art to the God of Light.

Convinced.text:
Really? You think the God of Light would forgive us if we performed holy plays?
I guess it could work... Yes. It has to work!

Start.text:
Oh joy!
Oh happiness!
We did it! I can feel the Eye’s forgiveness blessing my soul.

Next1.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries! Here’s something my former comrades and I obtained through nefarious means.
I don’t want it anymore!

End.text: I'll talk to the priestess! I bet she’ll be happy to see me!

Note.text: <narrator>For increased efficiency, place four traps in a tight square.</narrator>

Notif.text: You bested the security system and stole the treasure of Saint Serene Church.

Note.text: <narrator>The upper row must have two keys.</narrator>
<narrator>Warning: Do not place any note around the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>An Eye key must be placed next to the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>Fill a whole row with traps to greatly increase the chance that would-be thieves will be injured.</narrator>
<narrator>Place a first booby-trapped sword chest over an Eye key and a second one over another Eye key.</narrator>

<narrator>Do not write instructions yourselves.
These notes were successfully tested on the best thieves of Grinmeer's jail and can be used to find your treasure while resisting looters.
</narrator>
<narrator>Place 2 booby-trapped sword chests around the treasure's key.</narrator>

Start.text:
You would steal Saint Serene's treasure?
Have you no honour, Mercenaries?

Bribe1.text: That's a lot of Krowns you're offering, Mercenaries. It's worth considering...

Bribe2.text:
Fine! We're taking the gold.
Now get lost!

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text: The result is quite satisfying, don’t you think, Mercenaries?

Next1.text:
Everything is ready for your convenience: a chest to store unneeded items, and stools for Companions who are... also unneeded.
As for me, I will arrange journeys from one Travel Post to another.

Next2.text: Is there somewhere you would like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build Travel Posts in other villages to get there quickly.

Start.text: A small ramshackle house stood here before it fell to the Eye’s Reckoning.

Next1.text:
It would be a shame to leave this land unused. Would you like to invest, Mercenaries?
Wouldn’t it be great to have a Travel Post to journey quickly from one place to another?

line0.props.tipText: Build the Drombach Travel Post.

Build.text: Stay here, I'll let the craftsmen know!

Start.text:
Make sure to close the door behind you.
Those nosy Inquisitors are everywhere.

Alt.text: The Inquisitors may be gone, but that doesn't mean you can leave the blasted door wide open!

Repair.text: Your equipment should still last a while.

Start.text:
You’re Mercenaries?
Then follow me, I need to talk to you away from prying ears.

End1.text: So? Any news about our innkeeper?

End2.text: By Saint Eleor, not here! Meet me outside, quickly.

InquisitionEnd.text: I regret asking Mercenaries for help.

Notif.text: Lady Mayoress Gerslind slipped out of the market.

MissionDesc.text: Investigate Valiant Tower to find the New-Asthel innkeeper.

line0.text: Take on Lady Mayoress Gerslind’s mission.

line1.text: Find out what happened to the New-Asthel innkeeper.

Start.text: My customers are so scared of being questioned by the Inquisition that they fled the market!

Next1.text:
Thieves have came back since the Inquisitors left.
By the Eye, we just can't catch a break!

Start.text: I was drinking in the tavern when the Eye’s Reckoning struck. Sobered me up real quick.

Next1.text:
The God of Light is gone?
This calls for a celebration at the tavern!

Start.text: I'll head south as soon as I sell my wares, away from those heretics and this cursed county!
We’re tasked with finding the heathens who angered the God of Light and drew His Reckoning onto the county.

Next1.text: While we’re at it, we’re also checking this market’s morality.

Start.text: Drombach County is in turmoil because of the Eye’s Reckoning. There are plenty of missions to be found, if you know who to ask.

Done.text: I would have made the same choice.

line0.props.tipText: The Iron Hoof Stables were destroyed by the Eye’s Reckoning. There might still be survivors inside.

line1.props.tipText: Apparently, the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel approached several mercenary groups discreetly.

line2.props.tipText: The Scholars at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory want to further their research, but it appears that they would rather avoid the Inquisition’s scrutiny.

line3.props.tipText: Prince Aerald Adr Alazar is doing his utmost to avoid drawing the Inquisition’s attention to the castle. Something is afoot.

Stables.text: The Iron Hoof Stables were destroyed by the Eye’s Reckoning. There might still be survivors inside.

Taverner.text: Apparently, the Lady Mayoress of New-Asthel approached several mercenary groups discreetly.

Laboratory.text: The Scholars at the Sophy Adr Alazar Laboratory want to further their research, but it appears that they would rather avoid the Inquisition’s scrutiny.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>The informant doesn't look happy.</narrator>
I thought it would take longer. Thanks anyway.

End.text: Apologies, but I have nothing for you.

PathCrime1.text: Seeing how easily you dealt with a certain security system, the Informants deemed it inefficient. Still, it appears to have piqued the Scholars' interest in spite of its flaws.

PathCrime2.text: A group of savants decided to buy the system from its inventor in order to perfect it using their Knowledge. I hope you are up to the challenge.

PathCrime3.text: There are precious few Scholars who are competent enough to tackle such a complex matter. You should have no trouble finding them.

PathCrimeEnd1.text:
The shamed inventor left for Belerion. As for the Scholars, they were expelled from their University for losing the dean's treasure.
The mission was a success, Mercenaries.

PathCrimeEnd2.text:
The Informants have always held you in high regard, but I have to say that you really went above and beyond.
On behalf of my colleagues, I thank you.

line0.text: Buy the Scholar's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Scholar's Key.

Start.text: Honestly, I liked it better when my master was hiding in the mountain.

I don’t know if I'm allowed to rent rooms or sell my master’s recipe.
I'm just watching the Tern’s Nest while he’s away.

I got my freedom back after my former master was branded a heretic by the Inquisition.
Lucky break for me...
People are giving me dirty looks, the Lady Mayoress piled a bunch of new instructions on me... I wonder what’s going on.

Next1.text: I'm the new owner of this tavern! Lady Mayoress Gerslind told me so herself!

Start.text: It’s good to see things return to normal.
I can heal any injury, but frostbite is my speciality!

Done.text: Don’t forget to make regular stops on your trip. Frostbite is always a risk when it gets this cold.

Start.text: I'm warning you: if you’re with the Inquisition, I won't even repair your boots.

Repair.text: Sorry for the cold welcome. I'm nervous with those zealots around.

Alt.text: They say the Inquisition is gone... Is it true?

Start.text: My pony froze to death last week. I’ll leave with the next caravan travelling through the village.
No one can make me serve Inquisitors. Not even the Prince.

Alt.text: We haven’t seen the Inquisition around here for a while. Do you know why?

Start.text: We sell all our surplus to help with the cost of rebuilding this ruin.

EndBandit.text: May the Eye grant us victory!

Start.text: I asked Berthram to bring me everything I need to sew warmer clothing. When do you think he will be back?

End.text: Do you... do you think Fergas stands a chance?

Start.text: I know that Fergas and the others are doing their best, but let's face it: we won't survive the winter months if we stay here.

End.text: Fergas is going to get us killed.

Start.text: Any last words, ruffian?

Bandit.text: Why? Why won't you leave us in peace?

Bourgomaster.text: In peace? Why would we do such a thing? You've destroyed our farms, ransacked our villages, stolen our grain and brought Edoranian soldiers in your wake! You've done nothing but cause problems!

Bandit2.text: We had no other choice! You refused to open your doors and take us in! And just as we were starting to rebuild the Haven, you laid waste to the place!

Bourgomaster2.text: What, this ruin? That's enough! You wouldn't survive the winter months if you stayed here. For your insolence and the trouble you've caused, I hereby condemn you to the gallows! As for these Refugees, they must leave Tiltren or suffer the same fate!

Next.text: Ah, Mercenaries! Words cannot express how grateful I am for your help! Thanks to you, the locals will rest easy tonight.

Next2.text: Come back to visit the real Stromkapp when you get a chance. We will welcome our saviours with open arms. Please accept these gifts from our craftsmen and merchants in consideration for your invaluable help!

Notify.text: You have finished the Tiltren scenario. It is time to explore other regions.

Start.text: I wasn't expecting to see so many familiar faces here!

We are trying to rebuild a village from scratch. We've got more than enough farmers, but we are in dire need of skilled craftspeople. If you find a blacksmith amongst the Refugees, please bring them to us. We are in such a bind that we are willing to pay for your help.

line0.props.tipText: Offer Claes’ services.

End.text: I know this man! He was a blacksmith back in Cortia! The Eye smiles upon us! Claes is a very gifted artisan. Here is your reward. You have been more than helpful.

Alt.text: Please, if you meet other Refugees, do what you can to help them.

SettingLog.text: The Deserter blacksmith now works in the Haven.

line0.title: Blacksmith Blackout
line0.props.helpTip: Find a blacksmith among the refugees and take him to the Haven.

Start.text: Ah, mercenaries! Just in the nick of time! Welcome to the Haven. My name is Fergas, I am the former Lord Mayor of Cortia, and I now lead the Refugees.

Next.text: As you have discovered, the locals haven't exactly welcomed us with open arms... I have therefore decided to move our people to this cold and isolated wasteland. But it seems that it is still not far enough for the Lady Mayoress of Stromkapp.

Next2.text: Take our woodcutter camp, for example. We need wood to fortify our new home and survive the winter months, but the local farmers have been harassing us ceaselessly. I fear the worst. We haven't heard from our woodcutters in several days.

Next4.text: Hence the reason for your presence here. This situation could be far too dangerous for the humble farmers we are. I need Mercenaries to find out what happened to our men.

AgainstBandit1.text: My name is Fergas, I am the former Lord Mayor of Cortia, and I now lead the Refugees. It was I who requested your presence.

AgainstBandit2.text: It seems you have chosen to support the citizens of Tiltren rather than our cause. I wish I could change your mind... Perhaps offering you a mission that will be worth your while will do more than a thousand words.

AgainstBandit3.text: We have set up a woodcutter camp to the north. This remote camp was only meant to provide us with the timber necessary for firewood and rebuilding the Haven. But still the Tiltren farmers continue harassing our men. I fear the situation might escalate. We haven't heard back from our woodcutters in several days.

AgainstBandit4.text: I would therefore ask you and your Mercenaries to find out what happened.

Next5.text: Thank you. The woodcutters are just north of here.

EndLumberjack2.text: Thank you for helping our woodcutters. I do not know if their work will be enough to see us through until spring, but at least, you have given us hope.

EndLumberjack3.text: Rumour has it that you would rather defend fairy-tale creatures than help the Refugees. It seems I was wrong about you...

NotInvited.text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

Alt.text: I've been waiting for you. As a matter of fact, we all have... After seeing everything you've done for us Refugees, we have taken an important decision.

Alt2.text: This ruin will not be our Haven! You have shown us that more than a roof over our heads, we need our dignity back!

Alt3.text: We will leave this forsaken place and demand that Stromkapp treat us like the human beings we are! We will not back down! Please, come and support us in this as you have in our previous endeavours!

MissionDesc.text: Go and see what happened to the woodcutters.

line0.text: Take on Refugee Leader Fergas' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.text: Take on Refugee Leader Fergas' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
By the All-seeing Eye! Have you lost your mind?
You can't take me back to Arthes! I'm wanted there!
I am Professor Hermann. It is my honour to represent the great Universities of Edoran, Alazar and Gosenberg. According to our information, we share a common interest in discovery and knowledge.

Next1.text: Our learned Deans have therefore selected you for a mission of crucial importance: recovering an artefact. This item is currently in the hands of the Church, but the clergy refuses to send it to us for research, despite our many requests.

Next2.text: I am sure you will agree this is unacceptable. We have therefore sought to determine the exact whereabouts of this mysterious relic. And we now know where it is!

Next3.text: The artefact is kept in the crypt of Saint Eleor Abbey. You will need to enter the church, take the relic and bring it back to us.

Accept1.text: Here, take this marble piece. Our source assured us that you will need it.

Wait.text: The scholars and academics in all the kingdoms are counting on you!

End1.text: I beg your forgiveness! We unknowingly sent you into a trap...

End2.text: Our leaders will know of your misfortune, and I will investigate the matter further. In the meantime, please accept this reward. We cannot hold this failure against you.

End3.text: We may require your services again in the future. Should you decide not to blame us for this unfortunate incident, we would be thrilled to hire you again.

line0.text: Take on Professor Hermann's mission

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Use the Inquisitor Rendezvous Point item to find where they will be meeting.

line3.text: Follow the trail to find the Inquisitors.

Start.text: We are to let the farmers seek refuge in Tiltren - general's orders.
I'm waiting for other caravans. When passing through a warring county, it's best to do so in a large group. It discourages bandits and you can all pitch in to pay mercenaries.
People are fleeing Arthes, and you're going there?

Give.text:
Very well, at your own risk.
The border is open to you in both directions, you know. Should you regret your boldness, you can return to Tiltren without paying.

End.text: No need to check in with me. You've paid the toll, so the border is open to you.

line0.title: To Edoran
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text: How could they? We didn't even put up a fight, and they still killed our precious Lucilla.

NextStart.text: Mad with grief, her father chased after them toward the mill. I hope he caught up with them. These thieves don't deserve to live!

Give2.text: You can't begin to understand how much this means to me. I can't thank you enough. You deserve much more than this, but it's all I have.

Done.text: My sweet little Lucilla... May the All-seeing Eye watch over you, dear angel...

Start.text: Go away! I'm starving. I'm beginning to lose control. I might kill you!

Kill.text: I heard what my wife told you. She's right, you know. I will eventually turn against her. Do what you must. I'd rather die than hurt her.

Start.text: A plague rat bit my husband while he was out chopping wood, and Stromkapp has cast us out. Ever since, I've had a very hard time finding enough food for him.

Next.text: I've nothing to offer in return, but could you... take care of him?

Done.text: May the All-seeing Eye give me the strength to go on living without him...

line0.title: The Plague-ridden Husband
line0.props.helpTip: Help Kary get rid of her husband.

Start.text: I don't think I thanked you.

Next1.text: It is high time I do so, before we go our separate ways.

Next2.text: I will always remember with great fondness the day we butchered these guards hand in hand. Thanks to you, no one in Tiltren will ever forget my name again. Thank you.

Start.text:
Hey! You! Over here!
Act as if I were an ordinary merchant. Whatever you do, don’t attract the guard's attention.

Next1.text: I have a mission for you from the Baron. If you succeed, he’ll take you under his wing and show you the ropes.

Next2.text: You are to go to Tiltren Jail, recruit a woman named Septelle, just as you would any ordinary mercenary, and bring her back here to collect your reward. Easy enough, right?

Next3.text: But know that this young woman is very special to the Baron. Take good care of her. And don't take too long. I'll be waiting for you.

MissionDesc.text: Recruit Septelle at the Tiltren Jail.

End1.text: Finally! I was wondering what was keeping you, until I heard patrols were being slaughtered everywhere.

End2.text: I hope Septelle had fun.

End3.text: Here is your reward. As promised, the Baron will be in touch. Farewell.

Notification.text: Septelle will not let you talk to this man until she is famous throughout Tiltren.

line0.text: Take on the bandit's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: We are not a charity, you know... You need an official pass to enter Gosenberg... unless you are willing to pay. Up to you.

Next.text: Everything is in order. Welcome to Gosenberg.

line0.title: To Gosenberg
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text: I don't have enough money to cross the border. I don't know where to go from here...
I may not look wealthy, but if you pay for my passage, you won't regret it, trust me!

Next.text: My cousin runs a tavern in the city of Gosenberg. If you can lend me the money, I promise he will pay you back threefold. I'm not lying! He truly does exist, you have to believe me!

End.text: Oh, thank you! I'd given up hope. Come and see us in Gosenberg. My cousin will compensate you adequately.

Start.text: I can't believe Rovand is dead, and we are free!

Next.text: We really owe you one! Here, take this! You deserve it. I'll be sure to tell Fergas and the other Refugees in the Haven what you did.

SettingLog.text: The Refugees no longer have to fear Captain Rovand.

Start.text: I will never help the Refugees after what happened! They are all just like Berthram... Lawless scoundrels, the lot of them!
Nothing is beneath him! Berthram stole two cows and a calf from my brother-in-law. In one night, his family lost everything.

To think that we have to camp out here because of some pig-headed bandit! That Berthram will stop at nothing to terrorise the yokels, but when it comes to facing the Guard, that's a whole other matter. You see that cave, to the north? He's holed up in there...

Next.text: It's been three days and still he won't surrender! Berthram knows he's done for... Yet he continues defending his lair with such doggedness that we have no choice but to starve him to death.

Next2.text: That's why I need Mercenaries! He doesn't know you... He might even let you in if he thinks he can convince you to help him. And once you've gained his trust, you can finish him off for us... We'll make it worth your while, I promise.

Alt.text: Berthram hired you to kill us? No, wait, you don't understand! This man is not some poor Refugee! He's been terrorising the local farmers and stealing their crops. He must die. I will pay you to kill him!

line0.props.tipText: Kill Captain Rovand for Berthram.

MissionDesc.text: Kill Berthram for Captain Rovand.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Captain Rovand.

line0.text: Take on Captain Rovand's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: So Berthram is dead... My men and the good citizens of Tiltren will be glad to hear it.

Next.text: I must commend you for your courage and your devotion to our cause. Here is the reward the Lady Mayoress promised me. You deserve it. Goodbye.

SettingLog.text: The villagers no longer have to fear Berthram.

Start.text: I hate having to strong-arm the farmers. But we have no other choice! The citizens of Tiltren refuse to hire us or share their resources with us.
To think that four years ago, Berthram and I spent our days driving oxen! Seems like a lifetime ago...
Ah! Mercenaries! Did Fergas send you to help us?

Next.text: He didn't? Dammit! ... Wait! Would you be willing to help us if we make it worth your while?

Third.text: You probably saw a campsite on your way here. That's Captain Rovand and his men. If you kill him, you will do much more than save our lives!

Fourth.text: Without Captain Rovand to defend them, the good people of Tiltren would surely share their resources with us Refugees. We wouldn't have to steal or threaten them any more. Kill him for us.

line0.props.tipText: Agree to kill Captain Rovand.

Alt.text: Ah! Mercenaries! Did Fergas send you to help us?

Next2.text: …! Rovand hired you to kill me? I beg of you, don't do this! We do not enjoy bullying the farmers, you know! We have no choice if we want to survive!

Next3.text: Rovand is the one who must die! I will match his offer! In fact, I can pay you more! And you would be doing a good deed.

Next4.text: Once he is gone, the farmers of Tiltren will have no one to protect them. We won't have to force them to share their resources with us. Kill the captain. It's the only solution.

line0.props.tipText: Kill Berthram the Bandit for Captain Rovand.

line1.props.tipText: Agree to kill Captain Rovand for Berthram.

MissionDesc.text: Kill Captain Rovand.

MissionDesc2.text: Talk to Berthram.

line0.text: Take on Berthram's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. I promise I will never steal again. Isabeth told us about the *Haven*, a refuge where pariahs like us can come together and help each other out. That's where we're heading.
Thank you for your help. Recruiting Refugees seemed like a good idea at the time, but being desperate does not make them good thieves.

Next.text: Without your help, my mistake could have cost this poor soul dearly. Please accept this on behalf of our people. It's not much, but I hope the Mercenaries you are will not be too disappointed.

Reward.text: And now, to take these good people to the *Haven*.

Alt.text: Thank you for your help. Recruiting Refugees seemed like a good idea at the time, but being desperate does not make them good thieves.

SettingLog.text: You helped the Bandits save a Refugee.

MissionReport.text: Join Isabeth in the Wealthy Farm.

Start.text: Do not take pity on this scoundrel. He fled his home country to come and steal our crops.

Next.text: This Edoranian leech will be strung up for his crime, and soon we'll all sleep easy.

End.text: Your ill-advised intervention almost cost us our lives. But since you killed the Bandits for us, I am willing to forgive you.

End2.text: Here is a little something for your trouble. Now skedaddle, and leave the good townsfolk in peace!

End3.text: Goodbye.

SettingLog.text: You help the Villagers restore order.

MissionReport.text: Join Oddi at the Wealthy Farm.

Start.text: I am terribly sorry, I shouldn't have agreed to this, but... we'd run out of food, and we were starving!

Help.text: I hear shouting! Could you go and see what that is all about?

Start.text: Are you... Are you Mercenaries? Oh, blessed be the All-seeing Eye! You are our last hope! I swear I will find a way to pay you.

Next.text: You must warn my husband's "friends". They need to come and help him! Yes! Ask them to come. If only they could speak in his favour, reason with the people who want to kill him for a handful of grain...

Accept.text: My husband only told me that his friends live north of the lake, not far from here. Please come back quickly!

Help.text: Oh, by the All-seeing Eye, what is going on out there? You brought his "friends"?

EndBandit.text: Oh, thank you, thank you so much! Had I known that his friends were bandits and that he turned to a life of crime, I would have done everything in my power to stop him!

EndVillager.text: You let them hang my husband! May the Beast take you!

line0.text: Agree to help the convicted man's wife.

line1.text: Warn the convicted man's friends north of the nearby lake.

line2.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Our boss is open to recruiting anyone, including Refugees. The Villagers are blaming us for taking advantage of the situation, but at least, we're not letting these people starve to death...
One of our new recruits hasn't returned from his first assignment... I'm starting to worry. Stealing grain should be quick and easy. Something must have gone terribly wrong.

Next3.text: He probably just got delayed. He seemed capable enough... for a Refugee.

line0.props.tipText: One of your "friends" is to be hung from the gallows.

Next.text: Ah! Caught red-handed on his first try? I never should have recruited a simple farmer... He just doesn’t have it in him.

Next2.text: He cannot hang by my fault! Pack it up, lads, we are leaving! As for you, come and meet me at the farm. We could do with your help!

Bis.text: Oh, you're back? You will always be welcome here. Come back as often as you'd like.

MissionDesc.text: Meet up with Isabeth and the Bandits.

line0.title: Worrisome Delay
line0.props.helpTip: Investigate the missing rookie thief.

Start.text: How I manage to get all this? Ah, hard work, that's the secret! Ha! Ha!
Only Edoranians are daft enough not to believe in the Tules! Had these people been from Belerion, they would never have come here to chop wood!
Mercenaries, you are as much our heroes as those of the Tules. I can only imagine the wrath of these creatures had the refugees continued to fell but one tree.

Next.text: Take this as a token of our gratitude.

Wait.text: Helping the Tules is good luck, believe me.

SettingLog.text: The villagers have preserved the Mount Altis forest.

Start.text: Even in this place lost in the forest, the people of Tiltren still find a way to inconvenience us! No way to chop wood in peace in this Eye-forsaken county!

Bis.text: Huh? The chief is worried about us? And so he should be! The locals are getting more vindictive by the minute. They harass us, and we haven't enough men to send a message and... Wha...?

Bis2.text: ... WATCH OUT! The farmers are back!

Bis3.text: You there! Mercenaries! Since the chief sent you, hurry up and join our lads outside the camp, and stop these fools from getting in!

Waiting.text: Well? What are you waiting for?

End.text: All this talk of Tules was driving me mad. It was high time someone talked some sense into them. Here is your reward - we'll be sure to let the chief know we're safe now you've cleared the way.

MissionDesc.text: Go and check what is happening outside the Woodcutters' Camp.

MissionDesc2.text: Meet your allies at the Woodcutters' Camp.

SettingLog.text: The Refugees can make use of Tiltren wood.

line0.title: A Legendary Presence
line0.props.helpTip: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: My only job is to fend off the Tiltren farmers who come and interfere with the woodcutters' work. Believe me, there's as many of them as there are trees around here.

Bis.text: Tules! That is the most ridiculous excuse I've ever heard! These farmers cannot be serious - they're just trying to scare us away.

Start.text: He... He killed everyone... A real madman... I'm injured... Help me...

Help.text: Thank you. I still can't believe that Ricky used us as bait! He was the one to blame, not us!

Help3.text: If he hadn't killed that little girl to steal her necklace, her father wouldn't have fought back and my friends would still be alive!

Help4.text: Take me with you. I have a score to settle with that traitor!

line0.title: Injured Thief
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with Hakert.

Start.text: Stop right there! This salt mine belongs to Her Ladyship Gontrande. I can't just let you walk in.

Intro.text: As you wish. We can't mine the salt because of these two iron veins, anyway. I really don't understand why you were so keen to go in there!

Wanted.text: You threatened the Lady Mayoress' foreman.

Done.text: You cleared out the iron deposits? Well done! We can get back to work!

End.text: You cleared out the iron deposits? Well done! We can get back to work!

line0.title: Mining Misfortunes
line0.props.helpTip: Destroy the iron veins so that mining can resume.

Start.text: There is a corpse in the campsite. Hakert immediately recognises Ricky, his former accomplice who had betrayed him.

Alone.text: A dead body is lying in the snow. Something seems to be hanging from his belt.

Start.text: If you wish to benefit from everything the Black Market has to offer, you will have to make your way there. In the meantime, you can deal with me. I take anything and everything, wherever it comes from.
What do you want?

MissionDesc.text: Take Septelle back to the Gosenberg border crossing.

CampDialogGuard0.text: What are you waiting for? I'm not going to make a name for myself by standing here!

CampDialogGuard1.text: That was fun, wasn't it? But was this fight memorable enough? No, I think not. We need to persevere.

CampDialogGuard2.text: I wasn't quite sure you’d be up to the task. But you weren't so bad in the end!

CampDialogGuard4.text: Tiltren will never forget my name! And I hope you won't either.

Start.text: The Lady Mayoress has offered a reward for any <inf>outlaw</inf> captured in the region. You should give bounty hunting a try.

Deliver.text: Thanks for contributing to law and order!

NoSlotAvailable.text: All the dungeons are full. Come back later.

line0.title: Hand over a prisoner
line0.props.helpTip: Catch an outlaw and take him back to jail.

Start.text: The match's prize is going to get eaten!

S1PathMight1MercenaryLeader1.npc.name: Ogger, of the Searing Fists gang

Start.text: Don’t trust Seggognia, of the Harag's Bane gang. I've heard about them, and their methods are terrifying.

Next1.text: That was impressive! You defeated all these Bandits with such dexterity!

Next2.text: You truly are the best Mercenaries in the land! You deserve this reward. My men and I can’t pretend this mission's success was our doing. Our honour forbids it.

Next3.text: Maybe our paths will cross again.

Start.text: So you were summoned, too? And the emissary hasn't told you anything either?

Next1.text: It's very strange. We thought we were the only ones hired for this mission, but it seems 3 different Mercenary troops have been asked to dispatch this measly Bandit camp...

Next2.text: But perhaps there is a reason for that... If the Brotherhood is looking for new allies, they will want to assess their capacity for collaboration.

Next3.text: And with *5* groups of Bandits defending this lair, there will be plenty of targets for us all, right?

Next4.text: Let's do this! We’ll meet here once we’ve defeated our enemies. Good luck, everyone!

Next5.text: Yeah, right... Good luck.

S1PathMight1MercenaryLeader2.npc.name: Seggognia, of the Harag's Bane gang

Start.text: What do you want? Don't you have enough brigands to keep you busy?
