If it's a map, you can keep it. There were dozens of them on her ship, all leading exactly nowhere.

End.text:
You're taking Captain Esma with you?
I hope you've got plenty of alcohol. She drinks as much as a whole regiment of Guards.

Start.text:
You haven't got anything to drink, have you?
Come on, don't be stingy! I'll trade you a nice map for a bottle of the good stuff.

Next1.text: That always does a body good!

Next2.text: I'd feel even better if I could have a bite to eat. A nice little dish like we used to eat back home...

Convinced.text:
You drive a hard bargain, mercenaries.
Take my map – I couldn't have hidden it from the guards for much longer anyway.

Give.text:
That was exquisite. My compliments to the chef.
Here, take my map – I couldn't have hidden it from the guards for much longer anyway.

End.text: If you've got another bottle, I'll gladly take it off your hands.

Start.text:
We take ‘em all here.
Pirates or bandits, the bounty's the same.

Deliver.text:
I like to see this prison nice and full.
Nice work, Mercenaries.

NoSlotAvailable.text: We're all full up – come back after the next batch goes to the gallows.

line0.text: Find out how to build the Ancients' ballista.

Start.text: The inscription reads Admiral Enlil.
One of your Companions is struggling with something...
This mechanism is rusted, but three sufficiently strong Companions might be able to activate it.

Failure.text: Your Companions aren't strong enough: ::name:: was injured in the attempt (<status>::injury::</status>).

Start.text: Take

Notif.text: You obtained Belerion's Spear.

Start.text: The door is blocked by some sort of mechanism.
Your Companions advance cautiously, with a feeling they're being watched.
The basin is empty.
This mechanism is rusted, but three sufficiently strong Companions might be able to activate it.

Failure.text: Your Companions aren't strong enough: ::name:: was injured in the attempt (<status>::injury::</status>).

Start.text: The basin is empty.
The basin is empty.
This seaweed is blocking the mill.
Take

Notif.text: You obtained Belerion's Spear.

Start.text: This ballista is missing a part.
The ballista is ready to fire.

NeedReload.text: This ballista is missing a part.

Start.text: Mercenaries, is this... is this what we've been looking for?

Next1.text: By the Beast's fangs! How are we supposed to get this thing out of here? It's impossible!

Start.text: Now I understand why my ancestor only took the bolt...

Next1.text: Maybe if we study this machine closely, we can find a way to build one like it?

Notif.text: You obtained Belerion's Spear.

Start.text: You've disturbed some creatures.

Notif.text: You obtained the Treasure of the Ancients.

Start.text: This tablet! I'm sure this is the key to the mystery. Look! It looks like technical plans!

Next1.text: Can you decipher it? We must understand what the Ancients wrote here! It might be the only way we can build that ballista! Belerion Halios's quest now rests on your shoulders.

Next2.text:
Ahem... I'm going back to tell Dihya Heqet of our discovery. Join us once you've decoded the artefact.
Don't leave without Belerion's Spear.

MissionDesc.text: Decipher the Stone Tablet using the Lectern, then go back to talk with Dihya Heqet.

Start.text: Take

Notif.text: You obtained Belerion's Spear.

Start.text: This fresco would have been very useful to Prince Belerion.
The saurian swallowed the key! Catch it before it escapes!

line0.props.tipText: Choose someone dexterous enough to catch the saurian.

Failure.text: The saurian slipped away from ::name::! It got away with the key!

Success.text: ::name:: managed to catch the saurian and extract the key.

Start.text: The door is locked.

Notif.text: You obtained Belerion's Spear.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: Your Companions stop. Something is running toward them.
The saurian can't get away now!
You can't get to the creature. Maybe if you could lower the water level...
Thick, oily steam rises up from the pot.
No need to disturb the poor man.
This Woodcutter seems exhausted.
What you see here, Mercenaries, is a people preparing its revenge.

Next1.text:
To hell with the Dihyas and their Guard who never deign to come out here. So we're defending ourselves instead.
The pirates think we're weak, but they don't know we have a plan!

Next2.text:
If you're willing to help us, we can pay you.
But we've got to be quick! The whole trap relies on the element of surprise!

End1.text:
Everything is ready.
You've done good work, Mercenaries. You've more than earned your reward.

End2.text:
If you want another one, meet us at nightfall on the <narrator>beach on the south side of the island</narrator>.
Don't forget your weapons... and bring a good torch.

End3.text: I'll send a few men to announce a fake Rouste tournament. The pirates won't be able to resist an easy target.

line0.title: A Belerian Tradition
line0.props.helpTip: Help the farmers of Tule Island to get ready.

line1.title: Premeditated Accident
line1.props.helpTip: Find the farmers on the south coast of Tule Island and give them 1 torch.

Start.text: I'll gather what we need to build the fire and keep it going. If we want it to be visible from the sea, we'd better not skimp on the wood.

Next1.text: I've got a few logs left to split – I wouldn't say no to a bit of help.

Woodcut.text: You're a skilled bunch, Mercenaries! I'll let the referee know we're all done here. I'm eager to see how this Belerian tradition works.

Start.text: I learned this recipe from my grandmother. Back in her day, it was the only way to get goods from Gosenberg...

Next1.text: Take anything you've got that's flammable, and throw it into the pot. We need the fire to take hold even in the rain.

Cookingpot.text: Smells like the pillagers' oil is ready to go. I'll tell the referee.

Start.text:
I've made my own weight in spears since I started this morning!
Maybe you could give me a hand?

Give.text: Not bad, Mercenaries. That should be enough to finish off the survivors. The referee will love it.

Start.text: Let me rest a bit.

Next1.text: Preparing this trap has worn me right out. I don't know how I'm going to be in any state to fight after all this...

Start.text: It's true that the pirates have caused a lot of trouble, but...

Next1.text: Did you know that the Belerians used this technique to pillage defenceless ships?

Next2.text: Mihr be cursed! I feel like a murderer now.

Start.text: Not only have we got rid of the pirates, we did it the Belerian way.

Next1.text: The Ihrians, the other kingdoms... they all look down on us. To them, the Belerians are nothing but a bunch of illiterate fishermen who can barely string a sentence together.

Next2.text: But today, we've shown them that we're more than that. We're tough and we're smart. After this, they won't underestimate us anymore.

Start.text: I'm proud to have risked my life for Rouste.
I hope you're here to play against our team! After all we've done, I can't stand to see the pitch empty.

Glad to see you again, Mercenaries!
Here to enjoy the fruits of your labour?

Next1.text:
Come on, then! Don't be shy!
Our team was starting to worry we wouldn't get to take you on! What better way to thank you than with a nice Rouste match?

Rouste1.text: With team spirit like that, I'm not surprised you crushed those pirates. It's easy to see the bonds between your Companions.

Rouste2.text:
I hope you'll like this reward. It's the latest thing in Belerion.
Come back and play whenever you like – we'll be training hard to be worthy opponents.

RousteDiff1.text: We're ready to face you again! Our training has been much more effective now that we're not interrupted by pirates.

RousteDiff3.text: It's like you were born with a ball in your hands!

RousteDiff4.text: In any case, please accept this reward. It's the last one we've got. Recent events have cleaned out our coffers.

RousteEnd1.text:
Back already?
We're going to need Hessura's help if we want to beat you...

RousteEnd3.text: Don't worry! After all we've been through, one loss isn't going to break our determination to play. Come back whenever you like.

line0.title: Belerian Rouste
line0.props.helpTip: Win a Belerian Rouste match.

Start.text: You're free to join the Hunt, Mercenaries. But I hope for your sake you've got some experience.

Next1.text: The Ghost Pack can cross any body of water – the sounds between the islands are no wider than a stream to them. It's easy to lose the trail.

Next2.text: Even so, our scouts have collected a few bits of information. I hope they're of use to you.

Accept.text: Good luck, Mercenaries. May the Tules protect you.

Wait.text: The Ghost Pack can cross any body of water – the sounds between the islands are no wider than a stream to them.

End.text:
You show real skill for the hunt, Mercenaries. I'm glad you've agreed to join us.
This reinforced lining is for you.

End2.text: You show real skill for the hunt, Mercenaries. I'm glad you've agreed to join us.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Belerion Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Taranis.

Start.text:
The pirates dare attack us! As soon as we leave the camp unmonitored, they come to pillage whatever they can!
Even in Edoran, we're not treated this badly!

Next1.text: We should go back home and let the archipelago handle the Ghost Pack on their own!

Start.text: The animals here are amazing. Have you ever been Saurian hunting? They've got almost the same scales as a crocswine.
War paints are sacred. I can't draw them on the skin of non-initiates.

Next1.text: Only the ritual performed in the Tules' Glade in Ludern would give you the right to receive one.

Tatoo1.text:
We meet at last! All of the druids are talking about you: foreign mercenaries, initiated in our rituals!
Where do you want your war paint?

Tatoo2.text: Anyone else want some war paint?

Start.text:
Aren't you hot?
By Saint Jeru, I feel like I'm boiling in this armour!
It's no use learning to swim: the weight of your armour will drag you right to the bottom. Try not to get pushed overboard when you're fighting pirates.

Is your company really ready to take on Belerion?
Try to be sure – the pirates won't give you any second chances.

Next1.text: Thank you!

Start.text: An altar to the Tules.

line0.props.tipText: Make an offering to the forest gods.

line0.text: Offer 1 Mead to the Tules.

line1.text: Search the bushes.

line2.text: Decide what to do with the bandit.

Start.text:
Ugh... I should have kept my mouth shut, huh?
I thought getting a response might make you toss in a second bottle.

Next1.text: It's wrong to trick the faithful, I know. But with all the things people leave lying under this tree... it's so tempting, and I'm so hungry!

line1.props.tipText: Convince the thief to make amends.

Threat1.text:
You're absolutely right. I'll try to make it up to the residents and the little folk.
Take these offerings as a sign of my good faith.

Threat2.text: Thanks for not killing me or turning me in... I promise you'll never hear from me again.

Start.text: This woman was dead long before the sirens started tearing her apart.
Judging by his colour, this man died by drowning.
The monster! The monster attacked... the ship!

Next1.text: It destroyed everything! The monster's coming back...

Next2.text: <narrator>Neith keeps babbling nonsense and staring into space.</narrator>

MissionDesc1.text: Bring Neith back to her mother, Dihya Heqet.

MissionDesc2.text: Bring Neith back to the pirate.

line0.text: Save Neith from the sirens.

Start.text:
Come, marvel at my power! Step right up!
Come worship this goddess from the northern mountains! Thank the Eye for <narrator>Alazarian powder</narrator>!

We're ready, Mercenaries. Ready to put an end to this!
With this plan, we have a chance to finally rid this island of pirates. We must seize our moment.

Next1.text: See those fires you helped build? They're going to draw the pirates right into the reefs. In the dark, those idiots will mistake them for the lanterns on the Rouste field...

Next2.text:
and their ship will run aground. Then, just as they're struggling to keep their heads above water, we'll finish them off. You're here just in case there are any survivors lively enough to fight back.
Light up the fires to give us the signal.

Day.text: This trap can only work at night. We'll need to be patient.

Start.text: We... We did it! Tule Island is free of pirates!

Next1.text:
Thank you, Mercenaries!
I don't know if you helped us out of concern, pity or greed, but who cares? The result is the same. We are very grateful.

Next2.text:
Take your reward – it's my pleasure to give it to you.
And if you ever feel like a nice relaxing match or two, come back any time! We'd be thrilled to meet you on the pitch.

Start.text:
The Guard controls all the entrances to the village.
Since you're wanted men, maybe don't push your luck.

line0.props.tipText: Force your way through.

Next1.text:
Get back, Pirates!
You're not welcome here!

line0.props.tipText: Force your way through.

line1.props.tipText: Convince the Guard that you're mercenaries.

Convinced1.text:
Mercenaries... huh?
I suppose you could be... you still have most of your teeth...

Convinced2.text:
All right, you can go in.
But I've got my eye on you.

Start.text:
Mercenaries! This way!
We've got to protect the Edoranian Ambassador from these pirates!

Next1.text:
Pirates? Now, now, Captain!
We are but humble merchants, protecting our businesses from new taxes.

Next2.text: You'd rather kill an ambassador than pay your taxes? And you dare to claim you've nothing to do with pirates?

Next3.text:
Unlike pirates, we pay very handsomely, Mercenaries.
And if we sink this ship fast enough, no one will ever know that you helped us...

Start.text:
Thank the Eye.
Without your help, the Smugglers would have sunk our ship.

Next1.text: The Legion is a great army on land, but at sea we're a bit inexperienced. You lent us your experience and skill, and in exchange, I'd like to offer you this gift.

Start.text:
By Hessura, that was an amazing fight!
The Legion is tough – we normally don't mess with them, even at sea.

Next1.text: But this was an emergency, you see. We had to stop their ambassador from signing that border inspection agreement with the Dihyas. It would have put our whole business at risk. Nobody thinks of the poor Smugglers...

Next2.text: Anyway! We'll scuttle this ship now. If anyone asks, tell them you saw it sinking and couldn't do anything to help. That kind of thing happens all the time.

Start.text:
Step aside, Mercenaries!
The Ihrians must answer for their duplicity!

Next1.text:
They lied! They dared defy the god of Light!
At the time of the truce, the Ihrians swore they would worship the Eye! And look at the result!

Next2.text:
These heathens have turned Belerian churches into temples! They've added their false idols alongside the Eye!
They must pay for their heresy and false oaths!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Inquisitors that the Ihrians' current religious practices are only a step in the process.

Convinced1.text:
This heretical fusion... only a stage?
That's an interesting interpretation.
Yes... perhaps we should give them a bit more time to properly convert.

Convinced2.text:
Very well, we'll leave for now.
Take this, your wise judgement has earned our admiration.

Start.text:
By Mihr...! I'm alive.
I don't know how to thank you.

Next1.text: I lost everything in this village... My whole company was killed. All I have left is this spear. And my arms...

Accept.text: You've earned it. I'm going home to Tebessa. My life as a Mercenary is over.

Notif.text: You need Belerion's Spear to defeat the Sea Serpent.

Start.text:
I don't see anything, Mercenaries. No trace of the Sea Serpent.
Are you sure this is the right place?
I... I can't believe we made it.

Next1.text:
Mercenaries... you've defeated the Sea Serpent!
You're heroes... legends!

Next2.text:
Absolute legends.
The jugglers and bards will sing about this battle for generations.

Next2Bis.text: You'll have pride of place in my book. Your names will be known throughout the Five Kingdoms.

Next3.text: I'm proud to have been at your side. This victory will bring more stability to our people than you can imagine. It will show those whose hearts have remained in Ihraa that our history is still being written...

Next3Bis.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. Words cannot express my gratitude and profound respect. I can only hope that you will find this reward worthy of your efforts.

Next4.text: We're going back to Per-Bast to spread the news and bring Hector Halios to safety. After that, I'll make my way back to Zawlin. You will always be welcome there.

Notif.text: You have finished the Belerion Archipelago scenario. It is time to explore other regions.

Start.text: Oh! By the gods!

Next1.text: Hurry, Mercenaries! Attack that creature!

Start.text: What do you want? I don't have time to talk!

Next1.text: Those damn sirens pushed us into the reefs, so we've got a breach to seal and water to bail!

Give1.text:
...! Hessura be praised, that's exactly what we needed.
Don't go anywhere, I'm going to give this to the crew!

Give2.text: So, then, you want to know where poor Neith has disappeared to? I imagine her mother must be worried about her.

Give3.text: Unfortunately, I haven't seen her ship in some time. I don't know where she is, but she's an excellent fighter. You'll find her alive, I'm sure of it.

Give3Alt.text:
That last time our paths crossed, <narrator>Neith was coming back up from Terq on the way to the Smugglers' Bastion</narrator>. That's all I know.
It's a dangerous area... I hope she's all right.

Start.text:
Wha...?
I haven't got time for questions, Mercenaries. Help us or be on your way!

It's a good thing you came through here.
What did you want to know?

Next1.text: Hmm... I'm sorry, but I don't remember seeing Dihya Heqet's daughter. Maybe her patrol was sent to some other area.

Next1Alt.text:
That last time our paths crossed, <narrator>Neith was coming back up from Terq on the way to the Smugglers' Bastion</narrator>. That's all I know.
Don't get your hopes up, there's a lot of pirates out there.

Start.text: Dihya Heqet's daughter? What do you care about her? Who are you?

Next1.text: Don't expect me to give any information to the likes of you. I know there are pirates looking for her.

line0.props.tipText: Claim that you've been sent by Dihya Heqet.

Convinced1.text: The Dihya herself sent you? Hmm... I suppose it's possible.

Convinced2.text: Truth is, the last time I saw Neith was on land. She didn't tell me where her crew was headed next, but I know she talked to some other Guard captains about it. You should ask them.

Convinced2Alt.text:
That last time our paths crossed, <narrator>Neith was coming back up from Terq on the way to the Smugglers' Bastion</narrator>. That's all I know.
Don't get your hopes up, there's a lot of pirates out there.

Start.text:
Mihr be cursed!
You bloody savages!

Next1.text:
I don't know where Neith is! What, d'you think we send messenger gulls back and forth between ships?
I hope you never find her.

Next1Alt.text: The last time I crossed paths with Neith, she was sailing between <narrator>Terq and the Smugglers' Bastion</narrator>. That's all I know.

Start.text:
Well! I see you've saved the farmers all by yourselves. No need for the reinforcements I've spent hours gathering, then!
And the pirates' hideout? Burnt to ash, I hope?

Next1.text:
Hmph... well, if all the pirates are dead, I suppose that's good enough.
You've held up your part of the deal. You're dismissed, I'll bring the farmers back myself.

Next2.text: What? The pirates were out for revenge? Revenge for what? Zawlin has been walking on eggshells for decades for fear of provoking them!

End1.text: We've never destroyed a single one of their boats. If something like that was within our power, I wouldn't have sent mercenaries to exterminate them! Those blackguards are just looking for any excuse to kill innocent people.

End2.text:
And even if it were true, if their fleet had been massacred by some unknown force... Well, that creature, god, or monster, whatever it is, has my gratitude.
Farewell, mercenaries. I have a whole village to reassure.

SettingLog.text: You have defeated the pirates who claimed they were attacked by the Dihya of Zawlin.

Start.text: The Dihya of Zawlin sent you? Ooh, that old tart's got a nerve!

Next1.text: She attacked us first! In one night, she and her damn Guard destroyed half of our fleet.

Next2.text: Zawlin will pay for the deaths of our comrades! This farm is nothing compared to the terror that's about to rain down on that shabby village of hers, and no Mercenary's going to stop us. Especially not a ramshackle lot like you.

Start.text:
A bit of advice, Mercenaries: Get out of here.
We've got bigger problems than you right now.

Notif.text: No trace of any prisoners. But you did find a map.

Start.text:
Oh, thank the gods, you're alive!
I thought you'd never come back from that hellish place.

Next1.text: Thank you for taking care of that... those rats. Take this, on behalf of the temple and the believers you protected.

Start.text: Mercenaries, it's time to go our separate ways. Thanks to you, I'm going to learn what became of my illustrious ancestor, Belerion Halios. The archipelago that bears his name will finally know how his tale ended.

Next1.text: It's hard to express all the emotions I'm feeling... but I can at least give you this reward. I'll be sure to cite all of your names in my book.

Next3.text: What would you say to an even better reward? If you decided to stay with me a little longer...

Next4.text: Good. That's... reassuring! Not that I think this island is cursed, it's just... I imagine there are various wild beasts here...

Next5.text: Let's look for my ancestor's shipwreck. According to the scrolls I've managed to gather, it has to be on this island.

Start.text:
The... the Serpent! It's the <narrator>Sea Serpent</narrator>!
The creature my ancestor fought! The one who defeated him!

Snake2.text: Run! Let's just get as far away as possible and pray to the Eye and Saint Jeru that the monster hasn't seen us!

Snake3.text:
No! …No! We mustn't flee, Mercenaries! We must warn Dihya Heqet of what we've seen here.
We must be worthy of Belerion's legacy! Protecting and serving the archipelago! Bring me back to Per-Bast, for I know what I must do!

MissionDesc1.text: Bring Hector Halios to Dihya Heqet's Palace.

Notify.text: You found something on Sinan's body.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: You couldn't hit me if I were tied to a tree.

Notify.text: You found something on Aldewis's body.

NotifyDuel_Block_1.text: I'm getting too old for this.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: Leave the sea to the experts, ye miserable landlubber!

Notify.text: You found something on Drest's body.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: I'll nail your head to my ship's prow!

Notify.text: You found something on Hana's body.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: I didn't know saurians could wear armour.
I've seen crocswine more graceful than you.

Notify.text: You found something on Loderans's body.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XM.text: I'll kill you like the miserable brute you are!

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XF.text: I'll kill you like the miserable brute you are!

Notify.text: You found something on Danzir's body.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XM.text: I pity you, Mercenary. Always begging for the next bounty.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XF.text: I pity you, Mercenary. Always begging for the next bounty.

NotifyDuel_Insult_2.text: Is it your nerves or the drink that's got you trembling?

Notify.text: You found something on Isha's body.

NotifyDuel_Attack_1.text: I'll kill every last one of you!

NotifyDuel_Block_1.text: Why won't you leave me alone?

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: Alazar's lackey! Murderer! Child of the Beast!

Notify.text: You found something on Rodolbert's body.

NotifyDuel_Attack_2.text: You're not rich enough for me to spare your life.

NotifyDuel_Block_1.text: Give up now! Save us both some time!

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XM.text: Your Companions should have drowned you.

NotifyDuel_Insult_1_XF.text: Your Companions should have drowned you.

Notify.text: You found something on Ganne's body.

NotifyDuel_Attack_1.text: No one can hold a candle to me!

NotifyDuel_Attack_2.text: I'm the Lord of the Seas!

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: Your very presence is an insult to my greatness.

Start.text: I'm… not really… Kjerti… I…

Next1.text: F… Forgive me, Captain. I've failed you…

Notif.text: You found something on the body of Kjerti's first mate.

NotifyDuel_Block_1.text: Look at you, trying so hard…

NotifyDuel_Insult_1.text: How could my first mate have lost to someone as pathetic as you?

NotifyDuel_Insult_2.text: I'll kill you one by one. No one will dare challenge me again!

NotifyDuel_Feint_1.text: I'll be the one and only Lord of the Seas!

CampSmugglersLeftAlive.text: The runaways sent you the present they promised.

CampSmugglersLeftDead.text: You have received a letter: the runaways found nothing but corpses in the Smugglers' Bastion. They have nothing to pay you with.

TulesFarm.text: Blood-curdling screams rang out all night long from Carden's farm.

ForsakenVillage.text: Human cries have been heard in the cursed village of Kervan.

SettingAct2.text: You have received a letter: Dihya Heqet awaits you in her palace.

BelerionStart.text: While searching this ship, your companions find a letter addressed to a woman in Per-Bast named Lahissa. She might pay a good price for it.

MissionDesc2.text: Find Dihya Heqet's daughter in this area.

MissionDesc4.text: Bring the Awkward Poem to Lahissa in Per-Bast.

Start.text: This Smuggler tried to escape by sea, but he didn't have time...

Success.text: You found a chest.

Start.text:
Contraband merchandise.
You could follow the trail of debris to find out where it came from.

Talk.text: Your Companions could rebuild this bridge.

Start.text: These drifting lifeboats are from a merchant ship.
There's no sign of a struggle. This ship's occupants were probably kidnapped by sirens.
This man survived a shipwreck, only to starve to death.
This Plague-ridden seems lost in contemplation of the Eye.

line0.props.tipText: A Companion with enough willpower could kill it discreetly.

line1.props.tipText: Leave the Plague-ridden alone.

line2.props.tipText: Try to communicate with the creature.

KillSuccess.text: ::name:: executed the Plague-ridden without a sound.

Start.text: The creature heard you!
It looks like the blacksmith's accounting ledger.

Next1.text:
Materials: 40 Krowns
Labour: 35 Krowns
Mount trophy on a shield: 50 Krowns
Total cost of Lord Mayor's vault: 125 Krowns

Start.text: Get back! Get back!

line0.props.tipText: Help the Mercenary.

Start.text: The Plague-ridden are protecting their meal.

This shelf is covered with fragile objects.
A dexterous companion could search it without damaging anything.

line0.props.tipText: Select a dexterous Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: has found something!

Failure.text: ::name:: knocked the dishes on the floor.

Start.text:
This barrel smells disgusting, but there's something shiny inside.
Your Companions will need a lot of determination to stick their arm inside.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion with sufficient willpower.

Success.text: ::name:: reaches in without hesitation and pulls out a valuable item.

Failure.text: ::name:: is hit with a wave of nausea and pulls their hand out of the barrel.

Start.text: There's something under this shelf, but you'd need a strong Companion to lift it quietly.

line0.props.tipText: Select a strong Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: lifts the shelf silently.

Failure.text: No sooner is the shelf off the ground than it falls back onto ::name::'s feet with a bang.

Start.text:
The Plague-ridden is wearing a Legion Segmenta.
He will be hard to kill, but two dexterous Companions might be able to hit the armour's weak points.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion with sufficient dexterity.

Success.text: ::name1:: and ::name2:: manage to immobilise the Plague-ridden and cut his throat.

Failure.text: The creature has time to let out a scream before ::name1:: and ::name2:: kill it.

Start.text: I was trained by one of Akhed's greatest apothecaries. You can trust me.

Done.text: You look a lot better all of a sudden.

line0.text: Find the rat hidden in the temple of Hessura.

line1.text: Follow the plagued rat's trail and eliminate it.

Notify.text: The rat has escaped from the temple!
The rat ran away! Find it!

Start.text: Look around you! It must be nearby!

Next1.text: Don't give up! We've got to catch it!

Start.text: The church... I mean, the temple is closed! Come back later.

Next1.text: Wait! You're Mercenaries, right?

Next2.text:
We need help – there's a plagued rat hiding in the nave.
I'll pay you to catch it.

End.text:
The rat ran away, so I consider the problem solved.
Unfortunately for you, it's my colleague who has your reward.

Start.text: We've got to catch that vermin, or it'll infect the whole island!
Watch your step! One bite and you're infected!

Next1.text: You almost had it! Keep it up!

Start.text: Have you come to worship the god of Light or to convert to the cult of Hessura and Mihr?
I will pray to Saint Eleor to protect the Mercenaries who drove the rats from our island.
Without your help, we surely would have been bitten. Or worse.
My colleague tells me that you had to fight a nestful of plagued rats.

Next1.text:
I'm impressed.
And I've witnessed the Light's Reckoning twice, so that's saying something.

Start.text: So what do you think? Pretty nice, right?

Next1.text:
I've had a chest set up to put your larger items in. These stools are for Companions who need a rest.
I can also organise your trips from the Belerion Archipelago to any of your other Travel Posts.

Next2.text: Where would you like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build Travel Posts in other villages to get there quickly.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: Without a Trade Route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text:
The owner of this shop disappeared at sea months ago. Knowing the waters of this archipelago, there's no chance he's coming back.
So I took it upon myself to negotiate a price for this location with his family...

Next1.text:
Now all I need are some moneyed investors to build a <narrator>Travel Post</narrator> here. Interested?
It would make your trips to the continent much easier.

line0.props.tipText: Build the Belerion Travel Post.

Build.text: Take a seat and admire our carpenters' quick work.

Start.text: I wanted to be a blacksmith... not a goldsmith!

Next1.text:
Master Nejta assigned me to handle the patterns on four vases!
Have you any idea how long it takes to set Akhedian steel in rimesteel?

Start.text: When I'm not doing repairs, I teach our techniques to the younger generations. It would be a real shame to lose our ancestors' knowledge.

Repair.text: You should change up your equipment every now and then!

Start.text: We managed to save a lot of seeds from Mihr's Curse. Enjoy the rich flavours of Ihraa.
It's important that the people feel safe. Our presence alone is enough to discourage pirates from raiding Per-Bast.

line1.props.tipText: Tell Lahissa about the poem addressed to her.

Give1.text:
What is it? A poem?
Mihr be cursed, I know who it's from. Let me see.

Give2.text: My laugh is like a seagull's cry?! That idiot's lucky he's already dead...

Give3.text: Thank you for bringing me this, but I'd appreciate it if you could just forget whatever you may have read.

Talk1.text: I don't quite understand what you're trying to tell me. You found a poem addressed to me in a shipwreck, and then you lost it?

Talk2.text: Mihr be cursed, if it's from whom I think it is, I hope those weren't his last words...

EndTalk.text: I would have liked to read that poem...

Start.text: Our island is the richest and most peaceful in the whole archipelago. I won't let pirates attack it.
Nothing like a bit of grilled fish to chase the seasickness away.
The best goods in the Belerion Archipelago, all at unbelievable prices!

You're looking at the list of the <narrator>Lords of the Seas</narrator> – I'm in charge of keeping it up to date.
These are the most fearsome captains in the archipelago. Just hearing their names sets the good people of Belerion shaking in their boots.

Next1.text: To join this highly exclusive group, you'll need to build your <narrator>Reputation</narrator>: discovering new islands, earning your fortune from trade, completing missions, or just smashing every boat you see to smithereens.

Next2.text: But beware: the Lords of the Sea won't tolerate any two members with an equal <narrator>Reputation</narrator>. If that happens, the rivals are expected to engage in a battle to the death. Talk about an epic tradition!

Next3.text: Have a look at the list to see what awaits you.

Alt1.text: I can't wait to meet you, Mercenaries. Your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> is quite promising. I'm sure you'll make for formidable <narrator>Lords of the Seas</narrator>.

Alt2.text: Keep building your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> by discovering new islands, earning your fortune from trade, completing missions, or just smashing every boat you see to smithereens.

Wait.text:
Well, Mercenaries? Has increasing your <narrator>Reputation</narrator> turned out to be tougher than expected?
You'll have to explore, trade, complete missions... and most importantly, win battles at sea.

Start.text: I've got all the information you need about the best missions in Belerion.

Done.text: Haha, I can see you're intrigued!

line0.props.tipText: It seems the Smugglers have had a number of recent orders go missing.

line1.props.tipText: Dihya Ninsun left her city in a rush to travel to some isolated farm.

line2.props.tipText: A man named Hector Halios is looking for a ship and crew to take him to a cursed island.

Smugglers.text: It seems the Smugglers have had a number of recent orders go missing.

ShipWreck.text: Dihya Ninsun left her city in a rush to travel to some isolated farm.

Belerion.text: A man named Hector Halios is looking for a crew bold enough to take him to a cursed island.

DeliverMessage1.text: Already? They never cease to amaze me.

End.text: You know as much as I do, Mercenaries.

Start.text: I suspect that at least a few of my customers are pirates.

Have you heard the rumours?
They say Dihya Heqet's daughter has been lost at sea...

Next1.text: It's only been a few days, so you never know... but just think of the ransom you'd get if you managed to find her...

Next2.text: I see you're true pirates at heart, Mercenaries! I like people like you.

Next3.text: I've got a few leads to help you find the prodigal daughter, starting with the Guard she's a member of. Some of these captains must know where the ship disappeared, so just tell them the Dihya sent you and see what you can find out. I'll mark their locations on your map.

End1.text: So... you found Dihya Heqet's daughter? Were the rumours true?

End2.text:
She doesn't look too well. You haven't damaged the goods, I hope?
And what about these stories of some <narrator>monster</narrator>, Mercenaries?

End3.text: Mihr be cursed, I hope this won't affect the ransom too much...

End4.text: I'll handle the negotiations with the girl's mother. Take your due, and try not to draw too much attention on your way out.

SettingLog.text: You handed Dihya Heqet's daughter over to the pirate.

Wait.text: Don't worry, Dihya Heqet will have no trouble paying.

End5.text: Dihya Heqet's daughter has mysteriously reappeared. Too bad about your bounty, Mercenaries. I hope you weren't counting on it too much.

MissionDesc2.text: Interrogate the Guard ship.

line0.text: Accept Emran the Deceitful's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Are you injured? It would be an honour to patch you up.

Done.text: There you are! Ready to take on any pirate in the archipelago!

Start.text: I can take care of you just fine. I spend my whole life patching up my Companions. And believe me, pirates get hurt plenty often.

Done.text: So? Just like going to a proper apothecary, right?

line0.text: Help the pirates or the villagers.

line1.text: Talk to Konsu the Heretic.

line2.text: Talk to Master Shed.

Start.text: Oh, by Saint Eleor! Why?

My patience has its limits!
Get out of my way!

Next1.text:
We won't let you do this!
This temple is ours! We'll give our lives to protect it!

Next2.text:
Just what do you think you're protecting, idiots?
The god who abandoned us, or the goddess who destroyed our lands?
These demons don't deserve a single prayer.

Next3.text:
Heresy! Apostasy!
You'll regret your vile words!

Next4.text: We'll see about that, blacksmith...

Next5.text:
Mercenaries! Quit eavesdropping and come join the fight.
Get rid of these busybodies, and half the loot's yours.

Next6.text: Wha...? No! Mercenaries! You can't! Don't listen to these pirates. We have to defend the temple!

Start.text:
Well done, Mercenaries. Truly professional work.
Some would have thought it “dishonourable” to slaughter all these villagers...

Next1.text: Grab whatever you like from the altars and corpses. I won't take offence.

End.text: I've seen Mihr's Curse with my own eyes. The gods are our enemies.

Start.text: I know I've got to let you have first crack at looting this place, but with all those offerings, it's hard to resist.
That was one easy fight... especially with you by our side.
S-Stay away from me!
I can't believe we're still alive.
Mihr's Curse destroyed our villages, but that was our ancestors' fault. If only they'd prayed more diligently, made better offerings... I'm sure our goddess would have spared them.
I have to admit, I don't understand why the Ihrians still pray to the gods who betrayed them.

Next1.text: May they find in the Light the salvation they seek.

Start.text:
You're our heroes! You saved us! You saved our temple!
Without our Dihya, we'd given up hope of surviving... but thanks to you, we're now safe and sound.

Next1.text: I... I don't know how to thank you. Would this be enough?

Next3.text: I'm going back to my forge. Come see me if there's anything you need.

Start.text:
If you hadn't shown up, those pirates would have smashed our temple to bits.
I'll forever be grateful.

Repair.text: I'm proud to have repaired your armour.

Start.text:
The captain told me I'd be the blacksmith in our new village.
And here I am!

Repair.text:
Not bad, eh?
And I'm just getting started.

T6bisHallBookshelf.npc.name: Memoir of the Last Dihya of Eksa

Start.text: Eksa, Spring 1003 We still await the late thaw, but already we know that famine will strike our homes this year. I have asked Akhed to provide us with adequate grain, but I fear that Dihya Kishar won't be able to deliver.

Next1.text: Near Eska, Autumn 1021 Despite our devotion and our many offerings, the goddess Mihr has turned a deaf ear to our petitions. She has flooded our city with the same indifference with which she devoured those before. We are now travelling north, in hopes of finding refuge in Akhed.

Next2.text: Akhed, Winter 1054 The Dihyas' Assembly has spoken: we are to lead our people beyond the seas. Alas, I have neither the strength... nor the heart. I haven't laid eyes on Eksa in thirty years, and my sole desire is to return there...

Start.text:
If it weren't for you, there would have been no one to protect us.
We have to face facts... Our Dihya won't be coming back.

Next1.text: I'll set up new elections... someone will have to organise Sarna's defence.

Start.text: This village is ours now. And you're welcome here.

They shouldn't have defied the pirates!
We're all going to die!
These pirates are playing an Ihrian game your companions have never heard of.

You think it's true what he says about pirates?
I think he's just taking the mick.
I didn't know the captain was an arena champion. You learn something new every day.

Sitting on pillows is for weaklings.
Sitting on the ground, now that's for pirates.
Why Ailean the Gladiator? By the Eye! Do I have to go over this again, Mercenaries?

Give.text: Because I was the greatest fighter in the archipelago! The champion of all gladiators! The crowds in the arena, chanting my name...

Next1.text:
I can't believe you don't know who I am.
Still, my combat techniques... Surely you've heard of those!

Next2.text:
Mihr be cursed! This is all Oris's fault! Ever since I lost to that son of a rat, it's as though I'd never existed!
If you do the same to him, I'll teach you all my champion's secrets.

End1.text:
So your companions have humiliated Oris, eh?
Haha! That's the best news I've heard all year.

End2.text:
You deserve a lesson in my combat techniques.
Prepare to learn the secrets of Belerion's former greatest champion!

End4.text: If you want to join my crew, I'll put you on the waiting list.

line0.title: Eternal Glory
line0.props.helpTip: Return to Ailean the Gladiator after completing Oris's Arena.

Start.text: I've got rooms for rent, but be warned... you may have trouble sleeping.
Oh my! He's dead! Finally!

Next1.text: Thanks be to Hessura... we were starting to think Sedjem would hang on forever.

Next2.text: Take your reward, Mercenaries. We can finally have a bit of fun.

Start.text: A... sleeping pirate?

Have you heard of Drest?
I was a member of his crew, back in the day. He was a respectable pirate until he made a <narrator>Reputation</narrator> for himself. Then it all went to his head.
Pirates have nothing to do with the Smugglers. We're not all one big happy family. Around here, it's everyone for themselves. Survival of the fittest an' all.
This music sounds familiar...
Better to leave her alone.
If you must puke, do it outside! I haven't the time to mop up after every customer!

CaptainDead.text:
Mihr be cursed! What have you done?
You think I've got time to haul bodies away?

Start.text:
Mercenaries...
We can always use a few more, eh?

Next1.text: These two here, they watch out for my safety. I can't send them off on some mission far away from me. But you, though...

Next2.text: My old crew is off in Terq, no doubt squandering away all my loot in some tavern. Find those cowards and make them regret their mutiny.

line0.props.tipText: Threaten Captain Sedjem on behalf of his former crew.

Next3.text:
Ah, so those mutineers have asked you to take me out, have they?
Ha! Doesn't surprise me a bit. They never dared confront me directly.
They preferred to tie me up in my sleep and throw me overboard.

Next4.text:
Do you really want to defend a bunch of cowards like them?
Tell you what – turn on them and I'll give you a better reward than what they're offering.

line0.props.tipText: Attack Captain Sedjem.

line1.props.tipText: Agree to handle the mutineers.

End.text: I'm putting a new crew together. If you're into adventure, you could serve under me.

Start.text: As long as he doesn't ask us to attack a Gosenberg caravan, we should treat Sedjem like any other client.
The Brotherhood provides mercenaries to anyone who can pay. And that includes pirates.
The ewe seems to be enjoying the show.

line0.text: Find and kill Captain Sedjem on behalf of the mutineers.

line1.text: Find and kill the mutineers on behalf of Captain Sedjem.

line2.text: Decide what to do about Captain Sedjem and the mutineers.

Start.text: Oh, what's to become of me?

Next1.text: My crew left me here to recover from scurvy, but it's been weeks now and they haven't returned.

Start.text: Keep your distance from Hilel and his crew. They're mutineers – they rebelled against their captain and killed him. You can't trust them.

PiratesDead.text: Hilel and his men got exactly what they deserved. You were right to kill them, Mercenaries.

Start.text:
A bit depressing around here, innit?
Maybe play a little tune to help everyone relax.

SingFailed.text: Hmph... Is that really how they play the lute on the continent? I'm not sure you can play our style properly...

SingSuccess1.text: I saw how our clients cheered up while you were singing. I could use a bard like you full time.

SingSuccess2.text: Take this – it's a very popular song in Akhed. I'm sure you'll do right by it.

SingSuccess3.text: Need anything else, or are you ready to light up the room?

PiratesDead1.text: ... Not quite what I had in mind by lighting up the room... I thought you were going to play the lute, not slaughter my customers!

PiratesDead2.text: Leave the corpses where they are. I'll clean it up when I have time.

line0.text: Play a tune on the lute to cheer everyone up.

Start.text:
According to the innkeeper, Sedjem entered the city with a number of Brotherhood heavy lifters.
It's only a matter of time until the captain gets his hands on us.

Next1.text: That son of a...! I knew we should have cut his head off before we threw him overboard!

Next2.text: We'll need some strong men to face them. We lost too many good fighters in the mutiny...

line0.props.tipText: Threaten the pirates on behalf of their ex-captain

Next3.text:
What?!
Sedjem hired you to kill us? Wait! You can't work for scum like him!

Next4.text:
He wanted to attack Per-Bast – the best-defended city in the archipelago! Where our families live!
We all would have died trying to kill our own relatives!

Next5.text:
That captain is mad as a hatter.
He didn't deserve our loyalty! Drowning was the only solution.
He must die!

line0.props.tipText: Kill the pirates behind the mutiny.

line1.props.tipText: Agree to kill Captain Sedjem.

End.text: We're going to have a little fun before heading back out to hit those merchant ships.

Start.text: Quite a show, Mercenaries. I rather enjoyed it.

Next1.text: Vengeance like that is surely the best kind. It leaves its mark in the minds of would-be traitors and discourages them from doing anything foolish.

Next2.text: Take your reward, Mercenaries. I'm off to find a more loyal crew.

Start.text: Dihya Ninsun went off to inspect Shora's farm. I should have insisted that she take me along.

Alt.text:
Thank you for saving Shora and her cousin.
They're good people.

Done.text: You look in pretty good shape.

Start.text: Leave me be, Mercenaries. I'm worried about these pirates who were attacked by... who knows what. What if it started attacking fishermen? I need to find a solution...

Next1.text: What do you want? A medal? Just because we fought together doesn't make us best mates.

Start.text:
We haven't enough Guards to protect us from the pirates.
I don't know what's stopping the Dihya from asking for help from Per-Bast.

End1.text: So the pirates were attacked... by whom, I wonder?

End2.text:
Our Guard could never have taken down a whole fleet on its own.
Perhaps it's divine punishment?

Start.text: The Guard let you into the village?

Next1.text:
By Hessura! What are they even good for?
I ordered them to keep intruders out while the Dihya was away!

End.text: You've saved Dihya Ninsun and exterminated an entire pirate camp! You're true heroes, mercenaries!

Start.text: My customers are on edge. It seems Shora's farm has been raided by pirates.

Next1.text:
The pirate camp that's been threatening Zawlin for years was destroyed by Mercenaries.
I don't suppose that was you?

Start.text: Were there pirates in Ihraa? I couldn't tell you, I was only a kid at the time of the Great Crossing.
There's always been piracy, but ever since the Ihrians came along, it's been getting worse and worse!

Next1.text:
I'm going to challenge Dihya Ninsun and take her place!
Once I'm in charge, I'll whip the whole place into shape!

End.text:
Finally! Finally, we're rid of those pirates.
Glory to the Dihya and her mercenaries!

Start.text: Young people today don't know what it's like to live with fear in the pit of their stomach. They didn't have to live through Mihr's Curse.

Repair.text: You're ready to set out on your next adventure!

T6terHallBookshelf.npc.name: Memoir of the First Dihya of Tebessa

Start.text: <narrator>Losing our Dihya during the Crossing sent the survivors to the depths of despair. When we first arrived on Brims Island, all they saw were sharp reefs and arid lands. These foreign shores are more hostile to them than even Mihr's Curse.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>So I decided to organise an election for a new Dihya among the tents and campfires. We may not have a temple to purify ourselves, nor the comforting warmth of Hessura to bless us, but we have his crown. </narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>I don't know why the people chose me, but when the priest set Hessura's crown on my head, I felt the god reigniting hope in their hearts. I started as a scribe, then became a Dihya, and we turned Brims into what is now Tebessa.</narrator>

Start.text: Never has a Dihya of Tebessa dared to appear before her people without her crown.

Next1.text: How could anyone respect her authority? We'll sink into anarchy and barbarism!

Start.text: You saved us all! You're heroes, Mercenaries!
Honestly, Mercenaries... Don't waste your time with that crown. No one gives a damn.

Next1.text: The people are eating their fill, the pirates hardly ever attack us... Whether Dihya Saiba wears the sacred crown or not... We'll respect her all the same.

End.text: I would have sold that if I were you. Only the Dihya and her elderly advisor care about it.

Start.text: Do you know why the pirates never attack this island, Mercenaries?

Next1.text:
Because we track them. Capture them. We force them to tell us where their hideouts are, then destroy them.
The other Dihyas are happy to just steer away from their shores, but as far as I'm concerned, that's a cowardly attitude!

Next2.text:
I'd never let someone rip me off without reacting.
<narrator>The crown</narrator> belongs to Tebessa, and I'll kill every bandit and pirate in the archipelago, if that's what it takes to get it back!

Give2.text:
You can't believe what this relic means to my people.
No reward would be enough for what you've done for us, but I hope you'll be satisfied with this token of our gratitude.

End.text: With this crown, I intend to double our efforts to destroy any pirate who dares approach our shores.

line0.text: Find the runaways and bring them back to their parents.

Start.text: Shouldn't we tell the Dihya? Maybe call in some Mercenaries?

Next1.text: We're getting all worked up over nothing. The kids will be back.

Next2.text: What if they never come back? What if they're eaten by savage beasts? Or kidnapped by pirates?

Next3.text:
Let's wait a while longer... They wouldn't be the first runaways to come crawling back with their tails between their legs.
We can all pitch in on a bounty if they aren't back in a week.

AltEnd2.text: If they've already joined the Smugglers, I'm afraid we're out of options.

AltEnd3.text: The Dihya needs to do something! These are our children! They must obey us.

Start.text: After lengthy negotiations, I've agreed to let my daughter join the Guard. It's better than the Smugglers, anyway.

Hearing what my daughter had to say about you, I've changed my mind.
Mercenary work is the way forward!

Next1.text: I even paid her way to Gosenberg so she could join the Brotherhood.

Start.text:
I must thank you, Mercenaries.
It was only through our meeting that I realised an adventurer's life isn't for me.
Thanks to our Dihya's good work, this island has been relatively spared from pirate attacks. But instead of thanking her, our young people complain of boredom!

Having children comes with too many restrictions and worries.
Look at me... do I look happy and free?
This sheep is only skin and bones.

line0.props.tipText: Waste not, want not...

Start.text: This sheep is shaking quite a bit. You are not entirely sure it is edible.

line0.props.tipText: Waste not, want not...

Start.text: If you wish to benefit from everything the Black Market has to offer, you will have to make your way there. In the meantime, you can deal with me. I take anything and everything, wherever it comes from.
This chest is adorned with a vermilion Eye, the symbol of the Inquisition.

Treasure.text: This chest is adorned with a vermilion Eye, the symbol of the Inquisition.

MissionDesc.text: Escort Abbot Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

Start.text:
Not bad, eh?
You have to admit that Gosenberg’s Merchants are a godsend for their neighbours.

Next1.text: Not trying to underplay your help, of course...

Start.text: I wanted to take the cart that was just sitting there, pulled by a hardy-looking pony.

Next1.text: Sadly, it ran away with the cart while I was overseeing the craftsmen.

Start.text: Ah... You're pretty fast... Let me catch my... breath.

Next1.text: Let's see, we're here because... Yes! The ambush! We're going to destroy this bridge - the caravan will be forced to stop, and this time you can attack it without getting it wrong.

Next2.text: Go ahead and demolish those pillars. I... I shall pray for Jeru to give you strength.

Next.text:
Nice work, mercenaries!
Go and stand in front of the bridge. They will be here any minute now.

Wait.text: Are you keen to do battle? So am I! I can feel the Eye's gaze upon us.

End1.text: Praised be Saint Eleor! Praised be our Guide Jeru! Praised be the Great Eye. We've done it! Mercenaries, this is wonderful - it is a blessed day, indeed.

End2.text: Laheart won't dare venture into these parts any more. I'll spread rumours that the caravan was struck by the Eye's Reckoning... Yes! All their soldiers will quiver in fear. I'll do so upon my return.

End3.text: Also, I do not wish to unduly profit from your piety, but would you be so kind as to escort me to Saint Eleor Abbey? I will give you a well-deserved reward as soon as we arrive.

line0.props.tipText: Escort the abbot to Saint Eleor Abbey.

line1.props.tipText: Attack the abbot and keep the food for yourself.

Accept2.text: One last effort, my friends. There may be more soldiers nearby.

Attack.text: No! No! I meant it in all seriousness. I was really going to give you a reward!

StealAttack.text: How dare you steal the people's tax money? You're nothing but miscreants!

MissionDesc.text: Wait for Laheart's caravan to arrive.

MissionDesc2.text: Escort Reverend Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

Notify.text: You killed Abbot Theocene. Here's hoping no one finds out.

SettingLog.text: Abbot Theocene died by your hand.

line0.title: Holy Vandalism
line0.props.helpTip: Destroy the bridge supports.

line0.text: Fight Laheart's Caravan by the destroyed bridge.

line1.text: Talk to Abbot Theocene.

MissionDesc.text: Escort Abbot Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

Start.text: The abbot eyes you suspiciously.
Rebuilding this bridge is crucial to Merchant caravans! If there is only one road we can travel, bandits will know where to ambush us...

Next1.text: We can afford to hire workers, but we’re short on materials. Would you be willing to trade us what we need?

Give1.text:
Perfect. Please accept this small accessory in exchange for your stones.
Not only is it useful, but it will also fetch a good price if you sell it.

Give2.text: Come back in a couple of days, and this bridge will be as "Unstable" as it was before!

BridgeRebuilt.text: Merchants wish to inform you that they have rebuilt the unstable bridge.

line0.text: Give 20 Sandstone to the Merchants rebuilding the unstable bridge.

Start.text:
They destroyed a bridge? By Saint Eleor!
Those so-called lords don’t respect anything!

Well done, Mercenaries!
Go and stand in front of the bridge. They will be here any minute now.

Wait.text: Are you keen to fight? So am I! I can feel the Eye's gaze upon us.

End1.text: Praised be Saint Eleor! Praised be our Guide Jeru! Praised be the Great Eye. We've done it! Mercenaries, this is wonderful - it is a blessed day, indeed.

End2.text: Laheart won't dare venture into these parts any more. I'll spread rumours that the caravan was struck by the Eye's Reckoning... Yes! All their soldiers will quaver in fear. I'll do so upon my return.

End3.text: Also, I do not wish to unduly profit from your piety, but would you be so kind as to escort me to Saint Eleor Abbey? I will give you a well-deserved reward as soon as we arrive.

line0.props.tipText: Escort the abbot to Saint Eleor Abbey.

line1.props.tipText: Attack the abbot and keep the food for yourself.

Accept2.text: One last effort, my friends. There may be more soldiers nearby.

Attack.text: No! No! I meant it in all seriousness. I was really going to give you a reward!

StealAttack.text: How dare you steal the people's tax money? You're nothing but miscreants!

MissionDesc.text: Wait for nightfall and the arrival of Laheart's caravan.

MissionDesc2.text: Escort Reverend Theocene to Saint Eleor Abbey.

Notify.text: You killed Abbot Theocene. Here's hoping no one finds out.

SettingLog.text: Abbot Theocene died by your hand.

line0.text: Destroy the bridge supports.
Fight Laheart’s Caravan by the destroyed bridge.

line1.text: Talk to Abbot Theocene.

Start.text: After Claes fled, the Count’s henchmen needed a new blacksmith to replace him. I haven’t seen my family in weeks.

Repair.text: Your armour is in a much better state now.

Note.text:
<narrator>Sergeant Odrin!
Tell your men not to place any chest to the right of the treasure. It mustn't be destroyed by an explosion.</narrator>

<narrator>Sergeant Odrin,
Do not place any key in this row. I don't have enough for all of these blasted chests.</narrator>

<narrator>If you don't want to lose your hands, keep them off the chest below this one!
Captain Hostes has already booby-trapped it.</narrator>

<narrator>Do not take this Eye-forsaken key with you! I bought this system for a reason!
Keep it in the chest to the right of this one.</narrator>

<narrator>There is a reason the Gosenberger said that two keys must be placed on this diagonal!
Do you think you know better?</narrator>

<narrator>Sergeant!
Stop skimping on Alazarian powder. A servant accidentally triggered the chest to the right of this one, and the explosion barely singed his nose hair.</narrator>
<narrator>The Countess is most displeased with this new investment. Do not mention it in her presence.</narrator>

Notif.text: You bested the security system and stole Lord Laheart's treasure.

Note.text:
<narrator>Sergeant Odrin,
I'm still waiting for you to move this chest. There shouldn't be anything above the key to the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>Sergeant, I trust that you stored the instructions safely and didn't leave them lying around.</narrator>

Start.text:
The robbers are here!
Grab them!

Bribe1.text: Ahem, this is... a tidy sum...

Bribe2.text:
Fine, we didn't see anything.
Now get out before we change our minds.

Start.text: The lock bears Laheart's crest.

MissionDesc.text: Find and attack a black caravan.

line0.text: Take on Captain Hostes' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Follow the Black Caravans to locate the concealed camp.

Start.text: The enemy's castle?! Laheart hates our abbey, he could have me hung! Let's get out of here!

Our spies have spotted strange black caravans around Vernalis' castle. According to our sources, they seem to be ferrying large amounts of gold. This could mean our opponent is getting help from someone outside the region.

Next2.text: These caravans must be stopped if we want Vernalis' finances to dwindle. That is where you come in.

Repeat.text: You are going to accompany me: hidden amongst you, I will look like a mere Mercenary, and we will infiltrate the enemy territory. We will then attack one of these black caravans and get to the bottom of this. Do you accept this mission?

Accept.text: Good. One more thing: it would be best if I did not fight. We cannot run the risk of Vernalis' soldiers recognising me and raising the alarm.

Start.text: Count Laheart is willing to pay handsomely whoever recruits able-bodied men to fight in our ranks.

Next.text: Renegades from both Vernalis' army and ours have gone into hiding in the region. They are capable soldiers, but... they have lost the will to fight.

Next2.text: If you can convince at least two of these groups to join our cause, the others will follow. And the bounty will be yours.

Accept.text: Very well, then! I will show you where you might find them.

Wait.text: We are counting on you, Mercenaries!

Reward.text: Ah! There you are! Have you come to collect your reward? Please also accept Count Laheart's personal thanks.

End.text: Count Laheart's cause is the only worthy one!

EndAlt.text: It's been a while since anyone has seen Deserters in these parts. I wonder where they all went.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

SettingLog.text: You have rallied Deserters to Laheart's cause.

line0.text: Take on Sergeant Odrin's mission.

line1.text: Bribe 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map into joining Count Laheart's army.

line2.text: Report to Sergeant Odrin.

Start.text: Have you heard all these louts complaining about my so-called cruelty? How dare they? Am I supposed to forego my birthright just because Vernalis had a dream?

End1.text: Ah, my heroes! My most precious allies! My devoted Mercenaries!

End2.text: My officers speak very highly of you. They have been tremendously impressed with the missions you have accomplished on our behalf. I have therefore decided to entrust you with a very special task. As a thanks.

End3.text: Would you lay siege to Vernalis with me?

MissionDesc.text: Lay siege to Vernalis' castle.

line0.text: Take on Count Laheart's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Do not think for an instant that this war has changed anything to life in this castle.
Do not mourn Count Laheart and his people. They died because they opposed Jeru's will.

Next.text: You, however, have shown your devotion. The Church will be just as grateful and delighted as I am. Please accept this. I shall pray for all your endeavours.

Wait.text: I shall thank Jeru every day for this victory.

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Arthes. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

Start.text: Now that we have prevailed, I have become a countess, have I not?
If only I could meet my end as swiftly as my husband met his.
Lady Vernalis hasn't yet decided what will become of the countess. I feel sorry for her.
It is a privilege to prepare remedies for Lord Vernalis: I feel closer to the All-Seeing Eye than ever.

Next.text: May the All-Seeing Eye set its gaze upon you.

Start.text: What are you doing? Do you want to get me killed? Let's get out of here!
I only sell my wares to Lord Vernalis' allies: you'll have to prove your worth first!
I am sorry I doubted you. How can I help you?
Ah! It is a pleasure to see such a display. I haven't felt this good in years.

End.text: Here is your reward, my friends, an adequate compensation for your achievements, I dare say. The Legion is grateful they didn't have to step in. The Colonels and the General shall not forget your names!

End2.text: You will always be welcome in Arthes.

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Arthes. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

Start.text: My son... no...
My son is a Chosen One, just like Saint Jeru. Only a heretic would deny him the county. And that drunkard Laheart is exactly that, a heretic!
I must win this war, the All-seeing Eye wills it so. Jeru has revealed unto me that Count Laheart is a heretic. He must be ousted.

Next.text: Do you wish to assist me on my holiest of quests? You have my thanks. All true believers are welcome in my army.

End1.text: Blessed be Jeru, our paths cross once again. Thanks to you, we now have an advantage in this war. Soon, Arthes will rejoice in the one true Faith.

End2.text: Today, you must become the punishing arm of the Eye. Join my ranks one last time, and together we will drive Laheart, the heretic, from these lands.

MissionDesc.text: Attack Laheart's Castle and defeat him for Jeru.

line0.text: Take on Lord Vernalis' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Don't go anywhere near the wells. Don't try to drink their water. They have been poisoned. Only the one in the farmyard is not contaminated.

Next.text: I don't know how the saboteurs did it, but I am sure they were sent by Laheart, the Lord of Cowards! Who else would resort to such underhand tactics against an envoy of the Eye?

Next2.text: These ruffians will come back to finish the job. If you stop them, I promise you a reward worthy of your efforts.

Accept.text:
Glad to hear it!
Be vigilant, their hideout can't be very far!
I will also patrol the area, we need all hands on deck.

End.text: I am happy to see you, Mercenaries. I pray for your continued support.

MissionDesc.text: Find and arrest the saboteurs

line0.text: Take on Lieutenant Asercia's mission.

line1.text: Find and kill the saboteurs around Lord Vernalis' castle.

line2.text: Join Lieutenant Asercia.

Start.text: All able-bodied fighters have already been drafted. We can only recruit among the rabble now.

Next.text:
And that is where you come in...
No! No, I don't mean to include you in the rabble!

Next2.text: Ahem... We need someone to track down the soldiers who have deserted our army and Laheart's in order to convince them to rejoin our ranks.

Next3.text: Simple enough, isn't it?

Accept.text: Here are the last locations where the Deserters were spotted. Bring back at least two groups. The others will follow.

Wait.text: May the gaze of the All-seeing Eye be upon you. We have faith in you.

Reward.text: By Saint Eleor's grace, you have succeeded! We never doubted you. Here is your reward.

End.text: We will call upon you if we have a mission for you.

EndAlt.text: No Deserters have been spotted in these parts for quite some time. I wonder where they all went.

SettingLog.text: You have convinced the Deserters to join Vernalis' ranks.

line0.text: Take on Sergeant Preast's mission.

line1.text: Bribe 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map into joining Lord Vernalis' army.

line2.text: Report to Sergeant Preast.

line0.text: Remove all obstacles to clear the passage between Edoran and Gosenberg.

Start.text: You have entered the wolf's den!
An extremely old altar built to commemorate a deadly rockslide.

By the Beast's fangs!
It's a lucky thing you came along! Those filthy monsters were about to eat us alive!

Next1.text: I don't know how to thank you... Take whatever you like from our camp. Help yourselves!

Next2.text: To think we came here to get away from the Guard!

Start.text:
I... I'm alive...
Praised be Saint Eleor.
Those creatures seem bent on devouring the bandits.
The rats had a hearty meal.
Help! Help! Mercenaries!

Next1.text: Those wretched things ambushed us while we were sleeping! I'm begging you... You've got to help us!

Start.text: This wolf has been nibbled on.

line0.text: Remove all obstacles to clear the passage between Edoran and Gosenberg.

Start.text: You've stirred up the mole-rats!
Saint Eleor herself guided you to us!

Next.text: We thought that we were done for, that everyone would be too busy with the war to ever bother with us. But our Holy Matron guided you! We're alive! Praised be Saint Eleor.

End.text: Praised be Saint Eleor.

line0.title: Buried Alive
line0.props.helpTip: Clear the debris.

Start.text: The light from those blasted torches is burning my eyes. We spent three days in total darkness.
You can hear muffled voices through the debris.
You know, this arena is usually only open to smugglers...

Next1.text: But since you came all this way, it wouldn't be fair to turn you away! Sign up if you want to fight. The rules are the same as in legal arenas.

NoBeginArena.text: Don't make a fuss, Mercenaries! I just told you we're happy for you to fight!

OnLeaveArena.text: Don't get spotted when you leave.

Completed.text: If I'd known you were that good, I would've bet on you, Mercenaries. Too bad!

Completed2.text: Take your reward. If you want another one, come back and face our best fighters.

ArenaLost.text: Don't be disappointed! I bet against you, and your defeat earned me quite a few Krowns.

ArenaDiff.text: You ready to face our fighters once again? I hope you know what you're doing. Kriss, our champion, has improved since last time.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text:
Well fought, Mercenaries!
I bet on you this time, and you didn't let me down!

CompletedDiff2.text: Here's your reward. I hope you like it, because it's the last one we can give you.

ArenaAgain.text:
You're willing to fight for nothing?
No smuggler would do that, believe me!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: Another victory for you! At this rate, you'll be the talk of the land all the way to Belerion!

Start.text:
Are you seriously expecting me to sell you anything?
You're not even smugglers.

Alt.text: Don't be so coy. Now that you beat our champion, you're part of the family.

Start.text: A hideout like this is important for morale.
Why settle for a shack when you can have a whole arena?
You dare come to our arena?

Next1.text: Our champion will take you down a peg or two!

Start.text: This place reminds me of home. Did you see all those Gosenberg crests?
We offer wares of exceptional quality, and I know you will recognise their value.
I thought this travel post had been burned and ransacked!

Next1.text: I'm glad to see a young one take over.

Start.text: No one knows who burned this place to the ground – Lord Laheart or Lord Vernalis. Regardless, its destruction caused a substantial loss of profits for Gosenberg merchants.

Next1.text: But every cloud has a silver lining: after rebuilding this travel post with my own hands, I am now its proud owner.

Next2.text:
Would you like to trade, Mercenaries? You seem quite business-savvy yourselves!
Here, take this as a welcome gift.

Reward.text: Feel free to come by any time. We offer unique wares brought in from all of the Five Kingdoms through the harbour.

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: The chest is sealed by a puzzle. One of the pieces is missing.

Notification.text: The artefact is not inside, but you find a map that could lead you to it.

MissionDesc.text: Use the Inquisition's map to find their rendezvous point.

Start.text: This chest is inaccessible.
This is my house... or what's left of it.

Next1.text: My ingredients must still be in there amongst the rubble. Go ahead and take what you like – it belongs to the troop now.

Next2.text: If I remember correctly, my apothecary's trunk was against the back wall.

Key1.text: I'm afraid I threw away the key in the mountains...

Key2.text: The Inquisitors showed up so fast! I wasn't about to let them get their hands on my most prized possessions.

End.text: Let us leave this place, Companions. This is all in the past now.

Start.text: The tunnel continues into darkness.

Wait, you think I'm wasting my time?
Legionaries promised me a large audience, but... they still haven't started playing!

Next1.text: The Legion's coin will flow!

Start.text: I can't believe we bothered rebuilding this place for nothing!

Next1.text: The Colonel let us fix it up, only to then proclaim that Rouste is unworthy of the Legion!

Next2.text: We have to change Rhoveres' mind! Our soldiers' morale depends on it!

Nego1.text: Find two officers willing to support us. They will have to send a sworn statement to the capital.

Nego2.text: For a <narrator>Corporal</narrator>, Form 6.B is enough, but a <narrator>Lieutenant</narrator> should at least sign Affidavit 5.7.90.G...

End1.text: Excellent work, Mercenaries! You have a knack for negotiation! Now we just need to rally a Corporal to our cause!

End2.text: Excellent work, Mercenaries! Now we just need to pray to the God of Light while we wait for an answer from the Quartermaster.

NotifRouste.text: A message arrived in Arthes from the Quartermaster of the Edoranian Empire: legionaries are allowed to play Rouste.

Rouste1.text: Finally! Mercenaries! We've got the authorisations we need! Colonel Rhoveres can't stop us now!

Rouste2.text:
So? How about a match?
After all this time, our players can't wait to get back on the pitch!

Rouste4.text: Of all the opponents we could've faced, you're certainly the only ones we're happy to lose to. It's a pleasure to offer you this fine reward.

Rouste5.text:
So, what did you think? Not bad, eh?
Come back whenever you want, we're not about to abandon this pitch.

RousteDiff1.text: Can't get enough of the pitch, eh? No surprise there, we feel the same way! So much so that our lads have been constantly training!

line0.props.tipText: Play Arthes' team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff3.text: After this defeat, I'm beginning to wonder whether Colonel Rhoveres was right...

RousteDiff4.text: Take this reward and make good use of it. It's the last one we have, meaning the next matches will be strictly friendly.

line0.props.tipText: Play Arthes' team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd3.text: I'm going to need time to recover from this...

line0.text: Talk to Colonel Rhoveres in the <narrator>Legion Camp</narrator>.

line1.text: Seek out Legion officers and ask for their signatures.

line2.text: Go back to the referee on the <narrator>Rouste Pitch</narrator>.

line0.text: Win a Rouste Match in Arthes.

Start.text: I hope the Colonel will let us play. We worked hard to restore this pitch.

Next1.text: An official request to the Empire? Look, Mercenaries, this could seriously jeopardise my career... I really want to play, but...

Bribe.text: This would make up nicely for any loss I sustain.

Convinced.text:
Yes, you're right.
Worst case scenario, the Quartermaster refuses, right?

Choice.text: Which form do I need to send again?

Wrong1.text:
This is... a requisition form for a new spear?
My career is at stake, but you have no idea what you're doing, do you?

Wrong2.text:
A report for stolen horses?
My career is at stake, but you have no idea what you're doing, do you?

Right.text: Very well, it will be done as soon as possible.

Allowed.text: I can't wait to face you on the pitch!

Start.text: I put my heart and soul into rebuilding this pitch! You wouldn't believe what it looked like when we found it!

The Colonel tricked us!
He never intended to let us play! He was just hoping to keep us busy until the end of the war.
Even at the height of the war, the Trackers cannot abandon their hunt.
You wish to join the Hunt? You are free to do so, but I must warn you, we hunt the Ghost Pack, and this quarry is nothing like ordinary game.

Next.text: These monsters only appear under the cover of darkness and wreak havoc wherever they go. It's a harrowing fight, which has taken many an excellent Tracker.

Next2.text: If you're still determined to partake in the Hunt, I can give you this map. It shows you where the tracks begin.

Accept.text: It will take all that you have to get through it.

Wait.text: Make sure that you are well prepared. I've seen the Pack take Trackers who were much more experienced than you.

End.text: You have my full respect and admiration, mercenaries. It's an honour to give you the blueprints for this upgrade.

AcceptWait.text: You have my full respect and admiration, mercenaries. It's an honour to give you the blueprints for this upgrade.

Notify.text: Let the Hunt begin!

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Arthesian Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Broneith.

Start.text: If this is your first time hunting the Ghost Pack, I suggest you make sure you are fully prepared.
It is my honour to enhance the Trackers' features when they chase after the Ghost Pack.

Next1.text: To sport our war paints, you must first be initiated in our ways by a druid, at the heart of the Tules' Glade in Ludern.

Tatoo1.text:
News reached me that a group of Mercenaries was initiated in Ludern. I see it must be you!
Which of your Companions would like war paints?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: Wouldn't surprise me if Count Laheart or Lord Vernalis ended up hiring us. Not that I would like it, but it's part of the job.

Alt.text: Glad this war is over. They say we have you to thank for that.

Start.text: Those guys over there are rubbish, completely hopeless. Don't make the same mistake: learn new skills if you don’t want to end up like them.

Respec.text: Take your time to get used to your new specialisation before taking on tough opponents.

MissionDesc.text: Arrest Laheart's men in Boethius.

line0.text: Take on Abbot Theocene's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Aaaaaah... It hurts...
No! We can't go in there. The abbot supports Vernalis, he'd report me. Let's go!
I don't want to die... not so soon.

Don't tell the abbot I said this, but Lord Vernalis' sudden vision of Jeru is a bit strange, don't you think? I have been praying daily for over twenty years and the Guide has never once spoken to me.

AbbeyDead.text: Why are you coming back alone? Is the abbot all right? Shouldn't he be here by now?

Start.text: Lord Vernalis sent me to tend to the injured, but without providing me with the resources to do so.

Next.text: I would be very grateful if you could supply me with some flowers, specifically Snow Irises.

Reward.text: Thanks to you, I can finally get to work. Thank you very much. Take this, I hope it will prove useful.

Inactive.text: I'd like to prepare some remedies for you, but the injured are my priority.

AbbeyDead.text: You've come back without the abbot? He is all right, isn't he?

line0.title: First Aid
line0.props.helpTip: Give the apothecary 10 Snow Irises.

Start.text:
Have you come to pray for the soldiers' recovery and the victory of Lord Vernalis?
You really should, you know. Lord Vernalis is a devout man. Jeru came to him in a dream and identified him as the one true ruler of the land.

Next.text: It is my holy duty as an abbot to help him: that is why I am tending to his injured soldiers. But I so wish I could do more. Perhaps, if I paid you to take on a number of specific tasks...

Next2.text: How would you feel about stopping that usurper Laheart from levying his taxes? This would lessen the burden on the farmers, and I could feed the injured properly.

Accept.text: Blessed be Saint Eleor! Laheart's tax collectors never miss a chance to ransack Boethius. I will take you to the hamlet so you don't get lost.

End.text: How exciting that was! I almost felt like I was leading an army! Please accept this well-deserved reward and my blessing.
