Reward.text: Enlisting the help of Companions such as you has been the miracle this Abbey needed. I will immediately send word of your invaluable help to Lord Vernalis!

Inactive.text: Thanks again. May the All-seeing Eye bless you.

SettingLog.text: You helped Abbot Theocene feed Vernalis' soldiers.

Start.text: When my sister was at sea, I used to stay here and weave wool. But with this horse causing all sorts of mayhem, I am too scared to go out and get my loom. This is all I could take with me.
Woe betides anyone mounting the Black Steed! The beast will take them into the night, never to be seen again.

Next.text: Never mind the mercenaries and the ruffians who lurk here! I'd rather die from a human hand than be taken away by a demon!

Start.text: We fled to the South when we saw it.

Next.text: The Black Steed! It was there! Just outside our fishery door.

Next2.text: If you want to live, avoid the river bank at all cost, and do not go anywhere near the fishery.

line0.title: The Black Steed
line0.props.helpTip: Find the Fishery haunted by the Black Steed.

Start.text: This pony seems to have escaped from a battlefield. It looks like it wants to follow you.
The trough is empty.

Throw.text: There are a few handfuls of wheat in the trough.

line0.title: The Empty Trough
line0.props.helpTip: Fill the trough with Wheat.

MissionDesc.text: Speak to Commander Hostes

Start.text: Commander Hostes reaches for his weapon as you approach the chests.

Treasure.text: The glinting gold almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: Commander Hostes reaches for his weapon as you approach the chests.

Treasure.text: The glinting gold almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: You can almost feel Hostes' gaze on you.

Treasure.text: The gold in the chest almost makes you forget Hostes is watching your every move.

Start.text: The woman we fought was a fearsome inquisitor called Octavia. I did not think I would ever see her again, but her presence here confirms one thing: the Inquisition is funding Vernalis.

Next.text: Or they used to, anyway. Now that we know who Vernalis' allies are, we can increase our presence at the border and keep a close eye on the churches and monasteries.

Next2.text: As for the *300* Krowns the inquisitors were kind enough to leave us, I will take them to Count Laheart. This seems fair compensation for all the suffering our army has had to endure.

Next3.text: Here is your share. No mercenary has ever proved more worthy of their stipend.

line0.props.tipText: Accept the reward.

line1.props.tipText: Attack Commander Hostes and take the chests.

Reward.text: I commend you on your bravery and your devotion. It was an honour to fight by your side, Mercenaries.

SettingLogHelp.text: You cut off the funding for Lord Vernalis' army.

Notify.text: You killed Commander Hostes. Let's hope word of your deed doesn't spread too quickly.

SettingLogTraitor.text: Commander Hostes died at your hand.

Steal.text: How dare you steal this gold in front of me? You have no honour.

Start.text: Where is your carriage? Are you here by chance? You should take your leave and be quick about it.

Next.text: Who...? Captain Hostes?

Next2.text: Silly me! Of course, Captain Hostes! Only you could hide amongst a group of Mercenaries, you old weasel!

Next3.text: But your little charade ends here: your grubby Companions are no match for a professional army! Prepare to die!

Start.text: I'm serving under Colonel Rhoveres’ orders for the first time. It’s an honour, everyone in the Legion knows his name.

Rouste1.text: Rouste? Absolutely not, Mercenaries! I refuse to do anything that would go against the Colonel's orders!

Bribe.text:
I admit I wouldn't turn down a few coins...
Well, then, tell me what I need to sign.

Convinced.text:
You think that would make me a leader in the eyes of the General?
All right! Tell me where to sign.

Wrong1.text: Is this right? It says here Report of stolen pony... The Rouste Field referee knows all about paperwork, maybe you should ask him.

Wrong2.text:
This... this is a requisition form for new sleeping bags...
The Rouste Field referee knows all about paperwork, maybe you should ask him.

Right.text: Done. This letter will leave with the next messenger.

Start.text: Apart from the Legion's steeds, all Arthesian horses have been requisitioned for Lords Laheart and Vernalis.

Next.text: These animals could make invaluable companions, but to be honest, they are too old to be of any use on the battlefield. They're yours if you want to buy them. Otherwise, I'm sure they will make a very tasty soup.

Repeat.text: So, new companion or pony soup?

End.text: Shame for the pony soup...

Start.text: The Church has asked the General to let the war decide of the land's fate, but the conflict is dragging on.

Next.text: Because of this so-called Chosen One, the situation has become extremely volatile. And Laheart is a drunkard who will never be able to defeat him. If the situation deteriorates any further, we will have to step in.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

End1.text: Not a moment too soon! You drag your feet to come to me, yet you dash off to sow chaos throughout the land.

End2.text: What? Did you really think the Legion was unaware of your dealings? But worry not. You have unknowingly given us the perfect excuse to take over the region. Laheart and Vernalis have proved to the General that they were incapable of keeping a simple group of Mercenaries at bay.

End3.text: Would you care to finish what you started? The Legion will pay for your service. Quite the prestigious mission for a bunch of scoundrels.

Accept.text: Good. Join us in Cortia. We will take Laheart and Vernalis head on.

MissionDesc.text: Join the Legion and fight Laheart and Vernalis.

EndChaos.text: I'm planning on overseeing the region from this camp. I couldn't care less about what happens to those lords’ old castles.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

EndNeutral1.text: My scouts told me that you played an important part in resolving this conflict.

EndNeutral2.text: Know that the General and I are truly grateful.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Colonel to let Legionaries play Rouste.

Rouste1.text: Mercenaries, I will not let my men roll around in the mud when they're meant to represent the Kingdom. End of discussion. You are dismissed.

line0.text: Take on Colonel Rhoveres' mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: The General does not want us to be directly involved in the conflict, but we must make sure this war does not spread to the other counties of Edoran.

Next.text: There have been more and more sightings of Deserters gathering throughout Arthes. This could become a nuisance for the entire realm.

Next2.text: We are not supposed to attack Deserters as long as they stay put... However, there is nothing to prevent us from hiring Mercenaries to deal with them. Would you be interested?

Accept.text: Very well then. I will add their last known locations to your map. Slay at least two of these groups. That should be enough to deter the others from stirring up trouble.

Wait.text: The Legion expects great things from you.

Reward.text: In the name of the General and the Legion, here is your bounty. You have completed this mission impeccably.

End.text: I have no work for you.

EndAlt.text: What have you done? Oh well. Never mind. At least, the problem is solved. But don't expect a reward.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

SettingLog.text: You have eliminated the Deserters for the Legion.

line0.text: Take on the Legion Sergeant's mission.

line1.text: Defeat 2 of the Deserter groups marked on the map.

line2.text: Report to the Legion Sergeant.

Start.text:
Would you like to buy this map?
It is all I have left from my old life, but my children need food more than they need weapons.

Buy.text: Oh... Did you really just buy it? Thank you, thank you so much.

End.text: My children will not go hungry this week. This is such a relief.

line0.title: Past Career
line0.props.helpTip: Buy the former mercenary's map.

Start.text: It is written Danae Pavii, Edor Military School.
The crate contains a large number of books, some of which are much too technical for you.

line0.title: Buried Memories
line0.props.helpTip: Find a way to open the trapdoor.

Notify.text: The raiders have taken almost everything.

Start.text: Oh no you don't! We got here first! This is our loot!

line1.props.tipText: Force the raiders to give up part of their loot.

Threat.text: Fine! Fine! We'll share, no need for insults!

End.text: Take this, it is half of what we got. Here's hoping we never meet again...

line0.title: Nothing goes to Waste
line0.props.helpTip: Get rid of the raiders.

line0.title: The Starved Neighbours
line0.props.helpTip: Go back and find out what happened while you were gone.

Start.text: We are so *hungry*...
It's my cellar, and I'll do whatever I want with it! If I want to pack it full of Plague-ridden wretches, that is my business.

Next.text: Dammit! They are my neighbours, my friends! You think they weren't here for me during the war? You think I am going to stand idly by while my wife is killing them?

Next2.text: If you really want to make my selfish wife happy, give me some food so they don't go mad. Or timber, so that we can reinforce the cellar door.

line2.props.tipText: Convince the man to let you kill the Plague-ridden people.

Give.text: This should bring back some semblance of peace in my marriage! Here's a little something to compensate you for your efforts.

Convinced.text: Fine, take this key and go slaughter my friends. My wife will be ever so pleased.

RepeartConvinced.text: Fine, take this key and go slaughter my friends. My wife will be ever so pleased.

Give2.text: Everything is fine now. You can leave, we are safe!

NotifGive.text: We heard screams coming from Reed Farm.

End.text: You should be ashamed of yourselves! My poor neighbours...

line0.title: Troublesome Neighbours
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with the Plague-ridden that the man was hiding.

Start.text: I can't live like this any longer!

Next.text: I keep jumping in fear at all hours, thinking that these monsters have escaped from the cellar. You have to reason with my husband. He just will not listen to me!

Reward.text: I am so relieved you killed these monsters. Thank you. Let me pour you a drink: I was saving this for a special occasion!

End.text: With everyone so focused on the war, the Plague-ridden have been left unchecked. Thank the Eye you were here!

End2.text: Are you sure that will do the trick?

line0.text: Dig up the dragon bones.

Start.text: Don't... Don't tell anyone I'm here. Please.

Next.text: I beg you, you must keep this to yourselves. The citizens of Praino are out to kill me. They say I've been contaminated by the Plague, but it's not true.

Next2.text: My parents were already dead... There was nothing left to eat, I had no choice.

line0.props.tipText: Kill the young cannibal.

line1.props.tipText: Tell him that the villagers are planning to come and kill him.

line2.props.tipText: Leave the poor man alone.

Warn.text: Really? I... I must go! Thanks for letting me know.

Spare.text: Th... Thanks. I... I am going to leave Arthes. You'll never hear from me again.

line0.title: Family Meal
line0.props.helpTip: Decide what to do with the cannibal.

Start.text: This man is old. Part of the flesh in his thighs has been carved out.
She was an elderly woman. Her shoulder has been carefully carved out, but from the looks of it, she starved to death.
This wretched lout tried to hide his condition! We never noticed. He could have been contaminated weeks ago! To think of all those who were put at risk...

End.text: These poor souls suffered the worst possible fate, and we can't even provide them with a decent offering.

Reward.text: This will help them on their way to the All-seeing Eye. I thank you on their behalf.

RewardRepeat.text: This will help them on their way to the All-seeing Eye. I thank you on their behalf.

Start.text: Be careful, Mercenaries. A Plague-ridden man is at large in the area. Look at what he has done to his own parents!

Next.text: I am gathering volunteers as we speak to track him down and finish him off.

Next2.text: If you find him before we do, don't spare him. The villagers will be most grateful for your help.

End.text: Thanks for helping us kill this monster. We no longer have to worry about him coming back to haunt us, and his parents can now rest in peace.

End2.text: We have buried their remains according to the rites of the All-seeing Eye. I pray for them to go forth into the Light.

line0.title: Uncanny Cannibalism
line0.props.helpTip: Find and kill the Plague-ridden somewhere in Arthes.

Start.text: What am I to do? Laheart's soldiers will be here soon, and I can't pay the levy.

Next.text: Laheart's soldiers took quite a beating... They chose the wrong person to pick a fight with, right? Take this. I am just happy they didn't get their filthy hands on it.

End.text: You are not Mercenaries! You are heroes!

line0.title: The People's Father
line0.props.helpTip: Find Abbot Theocene and apprise him of the situation.

Start.text: We can't afford to pay... Laheart will burn our houses to the ground and have us flogged if we don't give him anything. Please, inform the abbot of Saint Eleor. He is the only one who cares about us!

Next.text: You defeated a whole patrol! You truly are amazing!

Start.text: There's something different about these boars...
So? What did the Colonel say?

Next1.text:
By the Beast's fangs! He's as stubborn as a crocswine!
We don't have a choice: we must bypass the Colonel and send our request directly to the Legion's Quartermaster.

Next2.text: Find two officers willing to support us. They will have to send a sworn statement to the capital.

Next3.text: For a <narrator>Corporal</narrator>, Form 6.B is enough, but a <narrator>Lieutenant</narrator> should at least sign Affidavit 5.7.90.G...

End1.text: Perfect, Mercenaries! Everything is in place. Our friend the Corporal was very cooperative. Next up, the Lieutenant...

End2.text: Perfect, Mercenaries! Everything is in place. Our friend the Corporal was very cooperative. Now we just have to wait patiently for the Quartermaster's answer.

NotifRouste.text: A message arrived in Arthes from the Legion's Quartermaster: legionaries are now allowed to play Rouste.

Start.text: There you are!

Next1.text: What? You thought we didn’t know you were coming? That we just inadvertently forgot our map in that chest?

Next2.text: I can’t believe such a crude trick actually worked! The Scholars clearly expected too much of you.

Next3.text: Therefore I have no qualms about terminating your contract with them. Your bodies will remind the Scholars to stay out of our business!

Start.text: Rat nest infestations are always more common in times of conflict. Watch your step out there.
A ghost? I am no ghost! I am Kaghal! The best hunter in Harag!

Next1.text: As for you... How dare you track me down, dogs of Edor! I will kill you!

Next2.text: Death to the General! Harag will live!

Start.text: This dated hunter's outfit looks very similar to those represented in the tapestries of the Edoranian War.

End2.text: How many decades has this man lived here alone?

Start.text: I must admit, I didn't expect Laheart and Vernalis to come to an agreement at the eleventh hour. Who knows, maybe they could have found common ground.

Next1.text: But I digress... As County Governor and Legion Officer, I, Colonel Rhoveres, thank you for your invaluable help.

Next2.text: You have more than earned your reward. The General will know of the role you played here

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Arthes. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

Start.text:
Under the General's order, the Legion is taking control of Arthes.
His Lordship will spare your lives if you turn yourself in without a fight.

Next1.text: How dare you, Colonel? I swore allegiance to the General. The Legion is supposed to support me!

Next2.text: This is heresy! The Legion cannot go against Jeru's will. I am his Chosen One, I am the one to rule us all!

Next3.text: I would rather throw my lot in with this mystic fool than give up my birthright to the General!

Next4.text: Shame you took so long to come to this conclusion...

Next5.text: On guard!

Start.text: Long have I prayed to see Count Laheart's soul rejoin the Light.

Next.text: Let us fight for the glory of the All-seeing Eye, Mercenaries!

Start.text: Look at them! Look how weak they have become! This is all your doing, Mercenaries! It is now up to you to finish them off.

Hello, dear colleagues! ...
What am I doing, you ask? Why, I am looting dead bodies, of course!

Next.text: No need to look so appalled! I am sure you have done the same to many of your own victims.

Next2.text: See, I was not mistaken, you really are my *colleagues*.

line0.props.tipText: You have nothing in common with these vultures!

line1.props.tipText: Hire your colleague.

Start.text: There they are! That's the Ghost of Harag! Kill them all!

line1.props.tipText: Try to convince the soldiers that you are actually alive.

Convinced.text: Sorry for the misunderstanding. We are a bit on edge, you see. We are looking for a ghost, but the snow makes it difficult to be sure of anything.

Convinced2.text: Lord Laheart was right. We will never kill a wraith at this rate. We should go back. Take this, maybe you will fare better than we have.

Attacked.text: Ouch... We took a serious beating. And you are not even dead. This is really embarrassing...

Attacked2.text: Lord Laheart was right. We will never kill a wraith at this rate. We should go back. Take this, maybe you will fare better than we have.

Start.text: Exploring the ruins was supposed to be child's play, but... we got lost before we even got there. We've been waiting to be rescued for days!

Next.text: We are exhausted. We do not have enough food to turn back nor any pitons to make it home the short way.

Next2.text: We beg you, please don't leave. Without you, we're all dead.

Give.text: Oh, blessed be the Eye! We are eternally grateful. Take this, it's always useful in the ruins.

AcceptGive.text: Oh! Blessed be the All-seeing Eye. We are eternally grateful. Take this, it's always useful in the ruins.

Start.text: Thanks for saving me. You are good people.

Next.text: You know, I don't regret eating my parents. No. It is their death that keeps me up at night.

Start.text: Phew! I am so relieved. The Plague-ridden should always be culled. Here's a small bounty for your efforts. Goodbye, Mercenaries.
Look! He was trying to escape! Kill him!

Villagers1.text: Please, no! I am not sick, let me go!

PlagueMan1.text: Don't listen to him. He ate his own parents. If we don't kill him now, he will hurt someone else!

Villagers2.text: I didn't kill anyone! My parents had already starved to death. I would have met the same end had I not...

PlagueMan2.text: Mercenaries! The village is offering *10* Krowns for you to slaughter him.

Villagers3.text: I am not a murderer! Mercenaries, you believe me, don't you? You've already spared me once!

Start.text: So, have you killed him? The Plague-ridden man who ate his parents?

Villagers1.text: Ha! Good riddance! You did well. Anyone infected by the Plague needs to be killed as soon as possible to stop them infecting others.

Villagers2.text: Take this. The village's food supplies are running low, but you have done so much for us!

Start.text: Where do you think you are going? Just hand over the reins, nice and slow!
Why has this bridge collapsed? Who are you? Where is our patrol?

MissionDesc.text: Report to the abbot.

Start.text: Mercenaries, I have bad news: there is no sign of the tax collector's carriage. I think the men you slaughtered were only patrolling the area.

Next.text: But let's not dwell on such a trivial mistake! These people – may the Light forgive me for saying this – they deserved to die. Worry not for your salvation, killing heretics is not a sin.

Next2.text: I have another idea: the tax collectors always cross a small bridge not far from here. We could ambush them.

MissionDesc.text: Go to the bridge with the abbot.

Start.text: Who... Who are you?
I got you! Is poisoning wells a joke to you? You are going to regret this!
Mercenaries? Where were you?

Next1.text: You have killed the saboteurs? Unbelievable! I take this path every day, and I never noticed this hole! Nothing gets past you!

Next2.text: Well done, Mercenaries! I am glad I hired you. Here is your reward, with the blessing of Lord Vernalis.

SettingLogVernalisEnd.text: You have prevented the poisoning of Lord Vernalis' last well.

Alt1.text: Ah! Mercenaries! I came to warn you as quickly as I could.

Alt2.text: The saboteurs have contaminated our last well. Your mission is now obsolete.

Alt3.text:
You've already killed them? Oh! Well, that is most inconvenient. If only you'd arrived earlier, this mission wouldn't have been such a failure for all involved.
Take this for your efforts. Thank you for trying to help.

SettingLogLaheartEnd.text: All of Lord Vernalis' wells have been poisoned.

NotSeen1.text: Hang on, Mercenaries! My name is Asertia, I am one of Lord Vernalis' lieutenants. We are looking for the scoundrels who are poisoning our wells. Any clue would be useful.

NotSeen2.text: What? You've killed them? I can't believe it! There was a bounty on their heads. I think it is only fair that you should have it.

NotSeenAlt1.text: In the name of Lord Vernalis, I order you to stop!

NotSeenAlt2.text: Are you the cowards who are poisoning our wells? Have you sold your soul to Count Laheart?

NotSeenAlt3.text: ... You killed the saboteurs? By Jeru! There was a reward for their capture, but that was before they poisoned the last well. Take your share. Their death is a revenge in itself.

CommandantMissionDesc1.text: Find a black caravan and follow it.

DesertersTrigger.text: The Legion invites you to join their ranks.

DesertersVernalis.text: Report to Sergeant Preast to receive your reward.

DesertersLaheart.text: Report to Sergeant Odrin to receive your reward.

DesertersLegion.text: Report to the Legion Sergeant to receive your reward.

LaheartEnd.text: Count Laheart has requested your presence in his castle.

LaheartEndMission.text: Report to Count Laheart in his castle.

VernalisEnd.text: Lord Vernalis has requested your presence in his castle.

VernalisEndMission.text: Join Lord Vernalis in his castle.

ChaosEnd.text: Colonel Rhoveres has requested your presence in the Legion Camp.

ChaosEndMission.text: Report to Colonel Rhoveres in the Legion Camp.

RousteAllowed.text: A message arrived from the Edoranian Quartermaster: legionaries are allowed to play Rouste.

BridgeNotif.text: Rumour has it that some merchants took it upon themselves to rebuild the rickety bridge.

Start.text: I'd rather die than go back to Laheart's army! This man is evil!

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: Yes! You are right! If I joined Vernalis' army, I could take my revenge on Laheart in a dignified way.

Laheart.text: You really think Laheart will win? If this is the only way to end this war, then so be it.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: Why are you looking for us? I'd rather cut my leg off than go back to this degenerate army.

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to come back in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: Fine! No need to insult my mother. I'll go back.

Laheart.text: Pah! I might as well fight under Laheart's banner...

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: I never believed in this *Chosen by Jeru* fable. Vernalis is just power-hungry, like his mother.

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to return to Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: You are right, serving this impostor is better than struggling to survive in the woods.

Laheart.text: If Laheart pays us and treat us better than Vernalis did, we are happy to follow him to Garussa.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: We might be traitors in your eyes, but what would you do if you were in our shoes? They are ordering us to fight a man chosen by Jeru!

line0.props.tipText: Execute Deserters for the Legion.

line1.props.tipText: Convince them to enrol in Vernalis' army.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them to return to Laheart's army.

Vernalis.text: They would be willing to recruit us? Say no more, we're in.

Laheart.text: My family needs the money... I guess this is the price I am willing to pay for eternal damnation.

MissionDesc.text: Deal with the Deserters.

Start.text: Judging by the many footprints along the forest edge, there was a gathering here recently.

Next.text: Wheel marks in the mud lead east. It could be a caravan or a Legion carriage.

Start.text: The poor man looks terrified. Footprints lead away from the trail, towards the north-east.
I wanted to go back down and look for my friends, but my leg... I barely move and it starts bleeding again. I was bitten last night.

Help.text:
My leg feels much better, thank you.
Can I come with you? I want to find my friends.

Refuse.text: Oh, I see... Well, stay on your guard in these dark halls.

End1.text: So, did you find them?

End2.text:
Oh... I see.
I guess I'll just go back home now.

End3.text: Take this, it belonged to the Scholar taking part in this expedition. I have no reason to keep it.

Start.text: A low growl resonates all around you. You are surrounded!
The inscription reads Erkeshet, known as the Builder.
You can see a room below, several metres under your feet. A piton has been driven into the edge of the platform you are standing on, but the rope has been removed.

line0.props.tipText: One of your Companions could be injured in the process.

Start.text: That door is out of reach!
The scholar is holding a parchment on which is scrawled a rune.
A few pieces of wood have been nailed to the wall and are held together by a padlock to create a makeshift barricade.

line0.props.tipText: Will brute force do the trick?

Injured.text: ::name:: was injured as they were trying to break the door open: <status>::injury::</status>

Start.text: This woman was eaten by something.
The ground looks very unstable here. One might easily get hurt.

NotifySlow.text: Your troop made it through unscathed.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: You have triggered a trap. It probably wasn't the right combination...

Start.text: A shadow emerges from the depths of the well. You are under attack!
There is a bucket on the side of the well, but there is no telling what it contains.

Touched.text: Reaching for the bucket, your Companion makes it tumble into the well. The clatter it makes as it falls sends tremors throughout the tomb.

Touched2.text: Drums can be heard in the distance... They are coming...

Start.text: The door is locked.
The door mechanism must be triggered from the other side.
Two gems glimmer in the monster's eye sockets. Taking them should be child's play...

LeftFirst.text: A shiny ruby! Take the other gem?

RightFirst.text: A deep blue sapphire! Take the other gem?

End.text: Now deprived of the gems, the monster's gaze seems less intimidating.

Start.text: You can hear jaws snapping in the dark. You are under attack!
The explorer dragged himself into this room to die.
I am sorry but I cannot come with you. I must get back to my friends.

End1.text: This is where we part ways, Mercenaries.

End2.text: Thank you for helping me look for my friends, though I wish we had found them alive...

End3.text: I hope this present will help you in your adventures. I pray that they will be met with more success than ours.

line0.text: Find the expedition members in the Tomb.

Start.text: This beast gives off a putrid stench.
The water is fresh and pure.

line0.props.tipText: Throw a carcass in the water.

Pig.text: Brown liquids leak from the carcass and spread into the pristine water.

End.text: This water looks contaminated and should not be drunk. Probably because of a dead pig...

Start.text: The water is fresh and pure.

line0.props.tipText: Throw the pig carcass in the water.

Pig.text: Brown liquids leak from the carcass and spread into the pristine water.

End.text: This water looks contaminated and should not be drunk. Probably because of a dead pig...

Start.text: I volunteered to poison the wells. It's far safer than having to fight on the war front.
I can't feel my legs! We've pulled these carcasses over miles on end!

What business have you here, Mercenaries?
Pah! Never mind... How would you like to poison a well? Vernalis is down to his last well. You won't get another chance! And we'll make it worth your while, believe me!

Next.text: Oh, come now, why so glum?! It's not a heroic deed by any stretch of the imagination, But Vernalis is the one who started this war. And we've got to put an end to it one way or another... right?

Next2.text: It'll be easy as pie, you'll see. Just throw any old carcass in the water! We brought this one, but you can also use one of yours.

Attack.text: Poisoning a well is beneath you, is that it? Or are you stupid enough to believe that Vernalis really is Jeru's Chosen One?

Wait.text: Oh, go on! You can do it! Everyone's watching!

Reward.text: Perfect! Now that's proper sabotage! Here, take this gold from my wages. And stay out of sight when you leave. Lieutenant Asercia almost caught us red-handed last time.

SettingLog.text: All of Vernalis' wells have been contaminated.

NotifAsercia.text: The saboteurs have been apprehended. Tortured into making a confession, your accomplices betrayed you. Lieutenant Asercia is now in hot pursuit.

line0.text: Poison Lord Vernalis' well.
Kill the Inquisitors or give them 15 Wood to burn their victim.

line1.text: Talk to the woman.

Start.text: How are we to burn this heretic at the stake?

Next.text:
All our wood was ruined by the rain. If we try to set it on fire now, the prisoner will agonise for hours.
We cannot do such a thing, we are not monsters!

Next2.text: Could you possibly donate a few logs in exchange for our blessing?

Give.text: May the Eye gaze upon you and your Companions and your families and guide you wherever you go!

End.text: Just a last few details to sort out, and we will be ready to rid the world of this wretched creature. We are most grateful for your help.

Start.text: What? Ah! The heretic! Her house has been struck down by the Eye’s Reckoning! We require no further proof of her sins.
I... I am not a heretic! Oh, please! You must believe me! I don't know why my house was beset by the Light!
Thank you! I am so grateful! You saved my life. Here, take this. It is all that I could save when the Inquisition came to get me.

Reward.text: Would... would you take me with you? As one of your Companions, I mean? I could make myself useful! I am well versed in the arcane arts of Alchemy!

Start.text: Pilgrims come to this altar to make offerings to Saint Septimus in the hope that he will protect them on their holiest of journeys.
At this altar, pilgrims offer their gifts to Saint Eleor and pray in the hope that she will guide them on their journey.

This statue honours the greatest hero of the old Empire of Jeru: Belerion Halios.
People still place offerings to him here.
The bodies are riddled with Harag arrows.
Refugees who were fleeing through the mountain. They were killed in their sleep by archers.
You found the previous lighthouse keepers.
These boats probably belong to smugglers.
Usually, I'm only allowed to tend to the animals. But don't let that worry you, man and beast are not that different.

Next.text: There! All bright-eyed and bushy-tailed!

Start.text: <narrator>... Jeru's companions were overcome with fear when the Beast appeared before them. They did not even attempt to fight it, for all knew that no worldly weapon could possibly defeat such a fearsome creature.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Then Jeru stepped forth, facing the monster with nothing but his walking stick in hand. He raised his arms to the heavens and thrice called to the All-seeing Eye.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>The God of Light answered the third call and unleashed His Reckoning unto the Beast. Overwhelmed by the power of the Almighty God, the wretched creature retreated to the darkness, leaving the Guide to continue on his way...</narrator>

Start.text: Despite my old age, I became a priest only recently. I still find some prayers challenging, but I know I can help people and make amends for all the harm I have caused.

Next1.text: In another life, I was a smuggler of the worst sort, the champion of their arena. Ah! How despicable I was among those lowlifes...

Next2.text: If you’re willing to teach these Bandits a lesson by beating them on their own turf, I will share my best arena tactics with you.

End1.text: Did you drum some sense into those scoundrels? Blessed be the All-seeing Eye. I hope they will reflect on their actions.

End2.text: As promised, I will impart my knowledge to you. I trust you will put it to good use in service of the Light.

End3.text: Please use my knowledge to serve justice and faith.

line0.title: An Eye for an Eye
line0.props.helpTip: Return to the priest after completing the Smugglers' Arena.

Start.text: This church is dedicated to Saint Septimus, the seventh son of Jeru, our guide and founder of the Faith of the Light.

Next.text: Jeru and all the other saints are hallowed individuals, but they are only human. The only divine being, the eternal one who will welcome us at death's door, is the All-seeing Eye.

Start.text: I pray each day for this war to end.
I do not believe in Lord Vernalis' so-called vision for one second! Jeru came to him in a dream? How very providential... Everyone knows his mother has always dreamt of becoming a countess...
Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

Start.text: Finally a building in Arthes that’s not on the verge of collapsing!

Next1.text:
You can store your things in the chest and plop your Companions down on these stools for as long as you wish.
But most importantly, I can arrange trips from here to other travel posts you built.

Next2.text: Where would you like to go?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: Before the war, this travel post was bustling with merchants, caravans and travellers.

Next1.text:
I hope to see it rebuilt one day. I could help with that, but you’d need to buy the lot and hire craftsmen.
What do you think?

line0.props.tipText: Build the Arthes Travel Post.

Build.text: Wait here, locals will be happy to work for your shiny Krowns.

Start.text: There were two of us working here until Count Laheart enlisted my cousin in his army. I haven't heard from Claes since.

Repair.text: There, that should do the trick.

Start.text: May the All-seeing Eye strike me down if I lie! I saw him, I swear! Three days ago, I was collecting firewood with my husband when the Hunter's ghost attacked us! We managed to flee to the mountains, but it was a very close call!
Don't believe a word she says... She probably came across a band of Deserters. They have been running rampant in these parts since the beginning of the war.
My meat is quite pungent, I admit, but I can assure you it is still perfectly edible.
The war drags on, and Laheart and Vernalis requisition anything they come across. I barely have anything left to sell, let alone eat...
You seem lost. Are you in need of any particular information about Arthes? Are you looking to take on jobs the Emissary wouldn't dare post?

Done.text: Promising, isn't it? Is there anything else you'd like to know?

line0.props.tipText: Commander Hostes needs to infiltrate the enemy territory.

line1.props.tipText: Abbot Theocene is willing to do anything to help Lord Vernalis win the war.

line2.props.tipText: The Legion is concerned for the fate of Arthes.

line3.props.tipText: Lord Vernalis' wells are giving off a strange smell.

HostesCommandant.text: Commander Hostes needs to infiltrate the enemy territory.

TheoceneAbbot.text: Abbot Theocene is willing to do anything to help Lord Vernalis win the war.

Deserters.text: The Legion is concerned for the fate of Arthes.

Wreckers.text: Lord Vernalis' wells are giving off a strange smell.

DeliverMessage1.text:
<narrator>The Informant snatched the letter as soon as it touched the table.</narrator>
I hope you didn’t open it.

End.text: Unfortunately, I have nothing further to tell you.

PathCrime1.text: I was informed that you have already dealt with one of the security systems. Would you tackle another one?

PathCrime2.text: Because of the war, I wouldn't be surprised if Laheart bought a cheap version of this system. You should probably try another one before drawing any conclusions.

PathCrime3.text: I was told that this key belonged to a Broker. That's all I know.

PathCrimeEnd.text: Keep what you did to yourselves, Mercenaries.

line0.text: Buy the Broker's Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Broker's Key.

Start.text: Look how empty this room is! Before the war, there were two taverns in Cortia, and we were still completely full on market days!
Wait, are you sure you want to go down? What if it is another trap?!

line0.props.tipText: Go down anyway.

MissionDesc.text: Speak with the apothecary's apprentice.

Start.text: What took you so long? Was it that difficult to capture a mere apprentice?

Next2.text: Who are you? Where are my men?

Start.text: This man has been dead for a long time, but you notice he is wearing an apothecary's outfit. He may have relatives who want to know what became of him.
He was... my uncle. He is dead.

Next.text:
How can this be? Why would anyone murder an apothecary?
And who would go to all that trouble to try and kill me, too?

Next2.text: Go on without me, I can't possibly leave him like this. Thank you for bringing me here so I could learn of his fate.

SettingLog.text: You discovered what happened to the apothecary from Marheim.

End.text: Please go, I'd rather do this on my own.

Start.text: Welcome to the local arena! You can register up to four fighters. You are not allowed to kill your opponent, but no holds are barred.

NoBeginArena.text: Too bad... I live for the arena!

OnLeaveArena.text: Feel free to come back when you're up for it!

Completed.text: Congratulations - you are now the reigning champions of the arena! As the rules dictate, you can walk away with the weapon of the previous champion, Smot.

Reward1.text:
If you want to fight again, get ready for an even greater challenge
now that our fighters know you!

ArenaLost.text: So close! All you needed was a bit of luck... or talent!

ArenaDiff.text: Smot is available and wants a rematch. Are you ready?

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: By the Beast's fangs, you don't mess around!

CompletedDiff2.text: Here's your reward. Well deserved, once again.

CompletedDiff3.text: Enjoy it. It's the last one you'll get in this arena. Feel free to come back for the sake of it.

ArenaAgain.text: Do you need exercise, Mercenaries? This arena will gladly be of service. Let me just remind you that there won't be any rewards to claim.

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedAgain.text: As usual, you gave us an amazing tournament. Come back whenever you want!

Start.text: My wares are aplenty, but I only sell to Arena Champions! Prove your worth and come back to see me.

Alt.text: It is a great honour for me to offer you my wares!

Start.text: Yes, I was sold as part of the mill. It was a real selling point for the new owners.
I bought this mill with the gold I earned during my time as a gladiator.

Next1.text: I sometimes miss the atmosphere of the arena, but I don't miss the risk of losing a limb at the slightest mistake.

Next2.text: I can teach you a few of my dagger techniques. But first, you'll need to prove your skills in Smot's Arena.

Next3.text: So I hear the arena was a doddle for you? Ah! In that case, you definitely deserve a small reward from a veteran like myself!

End.text: Passing on my knowledge almost brings a tear to my eye: you are a bit like my successors now.

line0.title: Gladiatorial Legacy
line0.props.helpTip: Return to the former gladiator after completing Smot's Arena.

Start.text: Animals can't pick locks as far as I am aware, so this cage must have been opened by a human.
I tame wild animals for a living... But without a wild animal to tame, I am nothing!

Next1.text: It took me years to perfect this wolf's skills! I taught him everything: to sit up and beg, to walk on embers and even to fish!

Next2.text: If you ever come across my partner, bring him back to me. You can't miss him; he is quite large and wears a collar.

line0.props.tipText: Bring Buddy back to its owner.

line1.props.tipText: Inform him of Buddy's passing

Give1.text: Oh my! Buddy, my little one!

Give2.text: I was so worried I'd never see him again, and yet, here he is!

Give3.text: Thank you, Mercenaries, I have found my purpose again! Take this. It's my most prized possession, after Buddy, of course.

End.text: We're going to get some rest before setting out for Gosenberg.

Warn1.text: Did you have to kill him? Oh! By the All-seeing Eye! No! My poor Buddy!

Warn2.text: Here, take this, I no longer need it. Without my partner, I am no artist. I am nothing!

line0.title: The Wild Animal Tamer
line0.props.helpTip: Find the tamer's wolf somewhere in Vertruse.

Start.text: If we don't find the damn wolf, we'll miss the Arena Clash! This tournament is only held once a year!

Given.text: Glad to see that beast back in its cage.

Dead.text: Dead? Oh, by the All-seeing Eye! That idiot is going to cry his eyes out for hours!

Start.text: How could this animal open its cage unnoticed in the dead of night?

Given.text: Glad to have him back. He was never any good on stage, but with him around, we don't have to take turns keeping watch at night.

Dead.text: Poor Buddy. I'd really started to care for the beast.

Start.text: The canvas covering this tent looks like a tapestry. A very expensive one...

line0.title: An Exquisite Tent
line0.props.helpTip: Retrieve the tapestry covering one of the tents in the camp.

Start.text: Buy something from me. We need the money to pass the Harag border without having to climb the mountains.
Apologies if we made you feel unwelcome. We've been hiding in the forest for a week now. We're a bit on edge.

Next2.text: So, erm... welcome to our camp. Please share a meal with us.

Tent.text: You! Don't touch that, it's ours!

line0.props.tipText: Threaten to take the tapestry.

line1.props.tipText: Take the tapestry forcefully.

line2.props.tipText: Convince them that the weaver needs it back.

Threat1.text: We trusted you! We welcomed you into our camp and this is how you repay us?

Threat2.text: There, take the blasted tapestry and leave!

Convinced1.text: Oh, I had no idea its maker needed it so much. To be honest, I only took it because it was large enough to be used as tent canvas.

Convinced2.text: But you can take it back to him, we will make do without it.

Start.text: Stay away from me!

Next1.text: Leave me in peace! Let me be!

Next2.text: The young man is sobbing and struggles to speak.

MissionDesc.text: Find Corene and free her.

Start.text: You! You abducted me! I will have you hung as soon as...

Next1.text: ... You killed Brunhilde Adr Alazar to free me? But weren't you following her orders?

Next2.text: I am confused... I... I just want to get out of here.

MissionDesc.text: Find Clemens Ald Marheim's men with Corene.

Start.text: It is my duty to protect the Alazar family.
I consider this place as my home: Alazar and Gosenberg formed a single kingdom before it was divided by the Brokers' treachery.
How ironic! Clemens sent my own people to kill me! I don't suppose you mentioned abducting his fiancée...

Next1.text: Aha! Of course you didn't! You are going to slaughter Clemens' men and let me go.

Next2.text: Why, you ask? Because you need me to escape, of course! I'm taking Corene with me, along with any evidence linking you to me. No one will ever know of your actions here.

Next3.text: And if that doesn't convince you to bend the rules, I am offering you a reward and giving you access to Alazar. So, what do you say?

Accept1.text: You are not as stupid as you look. I am proud of you.

Start.text: I agreed to see you as this meeting could be mutually beneficial for us. You see, I need to hire Mercenaries for a very delicate mission.

Next.text: I want you to capture a woman who represents a threat for the future of Alazar and Gosenberg.

Next2.text: Needless to say, her identity is on a need-to-know basis only. You shall bring her back alive, take your reward and never speak of this mission again. Are you interested?

AcceptMission.text: Good, I am pleased. This woman usually travels in a small caravan between the Winfel Estate and Marheim.

Wait.text: Remember, I want her alive.

MissionDesc.text: Ambush the caravan and capture the woman.

End1.text: Well, well! What have we got here?

Give1.text: Hiring you was the right decision, after all! This woman was a source of endless trouble, but thanks to you, she is now my captive.

Give2.text: Please accept this reward and the gratitude of the honourable Adr Alazar family.

SettingLog.text: You helped Brunhilde Adr Alazar capture a woman named Corene.

Narrator.text: A grim smile dances on Brunhilde Adr Alazar's face.

Notify.text: According to a rumour in Vertruse, Broker Clemens Ald Marheim's fiancée has gone missing.

line0.text: Take on Brunhilde Adr Alazar's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: Do you want to add flowers to the bride's crown?

End.text: You have already given flowers.

Start.text: Do you want to add your donation to the bride's banquet?

End.text: You have given your donation.

Start.text: I can't wait for this wedding. It is customary to give slaves and servants a day's leave on such occasions.

Next.text: Shame this family only has two children.

End.text: My Lady doesn't want me to clear these tables, but every time she looks at them, she starts crying again.

Start.text: Are you here to congratulate my daughter? She's marrying into a good family, isn't she?

Next.text: We welcome all donations to her flower crown and the banquet. It'll bring you luck, you know!

line0.title: The Wedding Banquet
line0.props.helpTip: Provide flowers and food to help prepare the wedding.

Start.text: Do not touch these tables! They are all I have left of my daughter!
Our wealth was built on this vineyard. My son is now studying at Gosenberg University, and my daughter is marrying a man of high social standing.

Next.text: But the disease affecting our crop is a great concern. Could it be a bad omen? Should I postpone the wedding?

Start.text:
Oh! Corene! My dearest child!
Where have they taken you?
This is a groattle trap. The pig used as bait looks somewhat appalled.
Shhh! You'll scare the groattle!

Next1.text: This beast, it's half-goat, half-pig and half-rabbit. And it's got golden guts!! If we capture one and gut it, we'll be loaded!

Next2.text: No more working as stable boys! Rich as Brokers we'll be!

Next3.text: Why d'you tell 'em? Now they're gonna to steal our trap!

Next4.text: By the Beast's fangs, you're right! We gotta kill 'em!

line0.props.tipText: Explain that groattles only exist in minstrels' tales.

Convinced1.text: Well... if that's true, does it mean we bought a pig and wasted a whole day here for nothin'?

Convinced2.text: The boss ain't gonna be happy!

Convinced3.text: We can't tell her none of it. Take this, and promise you'll keep your traps shut.

line0.title: Groattle Hunting
line0.props.helpTip: Bring the stable boys to their senses by any means necessary.

Start.text: Sorry! No, please! You win, we shouldn't have attacked you.

End1.text: You take the groattle trap and all our stuff, but please don't kill us!

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: If you have any Antiquities, you should show them to me. None of my competitors can match my prices.
I was experimenting with Alazarian Powder.

Next1.text: I had to run away to avoid paying the Broker Council for the consequences of my research.

Start.text:
Oh! Here come our new members! It's a pleasure to meet you in person!
Welcome to the <narrator>Fellowship of Knowledge</narrator>!

Next1.text:
We are a group of Scholars and like-minded individuals who dedicate our lives to researching Ancient Artefacts.
We are united by our common quest for Knowledge.

Next2.text: As I like to do for all new members, I have a welcome gift for you! Yours is this amazing <narrator>Ancient Pendulum</narrator> and its <narrator>instructions</narrator>. We haven't quite managed to unlock its secrets yet, but I am certain you will be able to!

Next3.text:
Your reaction is perfectly natural: who wouldn't be amazed by Ancient technology?
Well then, don't let me keep you! It's time for you to take your first steps on the path of archaeology, find out what your gift can do, decipher its instructions...

Next4.text:
So many exciting adventures, don't you think?
That's another facet of the Fellowship of Knowledge!

Tresor1Wait1.text:
So? Have you discovered the Pendulum's purpose? Oh! Praised be Saint Jeru and the God of Light! You are amazing, Mercenaries!
As soon as we find another page of the journal, you can be sure we will give it to you!

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 9 of the <narrator>Mysteries and Wisdom</narrator> Path.

Tresor2Next1.text:
Well? Have you discovered the Pendulum's purpose? Oh! Praised be Saint Jeru and the God of Light! You are amazing, Mercenaries!
As soon as we find another page of the journal, you can be sure we will give it to you!

Tresor2Next2.text: What really matters to the Fellowship is Knowledge. Material things are superfluous. Here! It just so happens that we found a second page of the instruction manual. I bet you can't wait to decipher it.

Tresor2Next3.text: Be brave, Mercenaries! The path of Knowledge may be fraught with hardships, but it will take you farther than any other!

Tresor2Wait1.text: You discovered another secret location? By the All-seeing Eye, I must find more pages of this instruction manual!

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 10 of the <narrator>Mysteries and Wisdom</narrator> Path.

Tresor3Next2.text: Why not complete your artefact collection? We've just found a third <narrator>Instruction Page</narrator> that was placed in the middle of a completely unrelated codex.

Tresor3Next3.text: I can't wait for you to find this new Artefact! I've already started writing a treatise about the first two!

Tresor3Wait1.text: You found the Artefact in Arthes? I can't say I'm surprised. Saint Eleor Abbey was built on the ruins of a city that the Ancients called Lahearta.

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 11 of the <narrator>Mysteries and Wisdom</narrator> Path.

Tresor4Next1.text: You found the Artefact in Arthes? I can't say I'm surprised. Saint Eleor Abbey was built on the ruins of a city that the Ancients called Lahearta.

Tresor4Next2.text: By the way, while studying the archives of this very same abbey, we found a page that looks a lot like the ones you already have...

Tresor4Next3.text:
Marvellous!
I have a feeling the relic you'll find will be even more fascinating than the others!

Tresor4Wait1.text: I'm still eagerly awaiting news of your adventures. It's like reading a multi-part story...

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop must reach Tier 12 of the <narrator>Mysteries and Wisdom</narrator> Path.

Tresor5Next1.text: I'm still eagerly awaiting news of your adventures. It's like reading a multi-part story...

Tresor5Next2.text:
Ahem!
I've got a new <narrator>Instruction Page</narrator> for you. I'm afraid it's the last one...

Tresor5Next3.text: Meaning this will be our final collaboration. I hope you'll find an Artefact as astonishing as the others.

Final1.text: I came across a caravan of merchants who told me that you found another Artefact. Is it true?

Final2.text: The Fellowship of Knowledge will never forget what your troop contributed to our understanding of the mysterious Ancient civilisation. You are now among its most distinguished members.

line0.text: Accept Professor Hermann's gifts.

line1.text: Find the treasure of the Ancients using Chronicler Erius' Journal - I and the Pendulum.

line0.text: Accept Professor Hermann's gifts.

line1.text: Find the treasure of the Ancients using Chronicler Erius' Journal - II and the Pendulum.

line0.text: Accept Professor Hermann's gifts.

line1.text: Find the treasure of the Ancients using Chronicler Erius' Journal - III and the Pendulum.

line0.text: Accept Professor Hermann's gifts.

line1.text: Find the treasure of the Ancients using Chronicler Erius' Journal - IV and the Pendulum.

line0.text: Accept Professor Hermann's gifts.

line1.text: Find the treasure of the Ancients using Chronicler Erius' Journal - V and the Pendulum.

Start.text:
I've been studying the smooth tablet for years.
Unfortunately, I think only a special quill can reveal it.
We came all the way here! We won't be intimidated!

Living in Gosenberg is a privilege! Thanks to the Brokers, everyone affected by the Plague is offered treatment. All they have to do in return is to isolate in an abbey for a short while. Needless to say, that is a small price to pay!

Scapegoat.text: They... They're not going to kill us, are they?

ChoiceInProgress.text: Saint Lenaid, defender of craftsmen and labourers, protect us from the Vintners and guide the Mercenaries in their choices!

EndConvinced.text: We thought our end had come! Thank you for saving us, Mercenaries. We will make offerings to the All-seeing Eye in your honour as soon as we are back on our feet.

Start.text: You're not going to stop us from killing the Plague-ridden, are you?

line0.props.tipText: Convince the Vintners that the Plague-ridden have done nothing wrong.

line1.props.tipText: Drive the farmers away from the abbey.

Convince.text: I guess it would have been difficult for them to poison our fields without leaving the abbey... Besides, other regions should have been affected, too. You're making a good point here.

Convince2.text: Very well, we'll let them be. Half of your due will go the abbot, as an apology. I hope it'll be enough to stop him from reporting us to the Inquisition.

SettingLogConvinced.text: You convinced the vintners to spare the lives of the Plague-ridden.

Execute.text: One less thing to worry about! I was worried you might be swayed by the abbot, but you are sensible people!

Execute2.text: Here is your payment, you've earned it. As for us, we will try and buy healthy vines in other provinces. Here's hoping the Inquisition will not hear of what happened in the abbey.

SettingLogKilled.text: You helped the Vintners get their revenge.

MissionDesc.text: Talk to the Saint Lenaid Abbot.

Start.text: I will not let them lay a finger on these poor souls! Whatever is killing their crop is a botanical disease, not a medical one!

line0.props.tipText: Kill the priest and let the Vintners slay the Plague-ridden.

End.text: I was worried you were going to side with the Vintners. Thank you for sparing the sick.

End2.text: I do not know what they promised you, but here is what I hope is a fair compensation.

SettingLogConvinced.text: You convinced the vintners to spare the lives of the Plague-ridden.

SettingLogFight.text: You protected the Plague-ridden from the Vintners.

Purifiers.text: The Purifiers have already been paid. We're just waiting for them to come and free our sick from the Plague.

Start.text: Do not fear these poor souls. They were infected by the Plague but they are well-fed: they are no more dangerous than you or I.
Out of the way, Abbot. We demand justice.

Priest1.text: You slaughtered our defenders, forced your way into an abbey and now you threaten to kill innocent people. How dare you speak of Justice ?

Farmer1.text: We... we have no choice! The Plague-ridden spread their disease and wreaked havoc on our lands. It is our duty, our right, to punish them!

Priest2.text: How could these people, who have been confined in this abbey for weeks, spread the Plague to your fields? You have no evidence to substantiate this claim.

Farmer2.text: Of course we do! Gosenberg is the only kingdom where the Plague-ridden are looked after for so long. It is hardly a coincidence if we are the only ones who lost our crop!

Priest3.text: This is absurd! Only Vertruse is affected. The vines from other provinces are perfectly healthy! The disease affecting your vineyards has nothing to do with the Plague.

Farmer3.text: There is only one way to be sure: kill all the Plague-ridden and see if it rids us of the disease. Only then will we truly know!

Priest4.text: For the Eye's sake! Mercenaries, stop them from killing these poor souls! Can't you see that the men you are escorting have lost their minds!

MissionDesc.text: Decide in favour of the Plague-ridden or the Vintners.

line0.title: The Scapegoats
line0.props.helpTip: Take a side in the argument.

Start.text: If you wish to benefit from everything the Black Market has to offer, you will have to make your way there. In the meantime, you can deal with me. I take anything and everything, wherever it comes from.
Hey! You! Are you the ones who killed these Bandits?

Next1.text: Blessed be the All-seeing Eye! Thank you! They slipped through the Guard's net so many times, I thought they'd never get caught.

Next2.text: Sorry to be a bother, but would you mind untying me?

End1.text:
Ah! Thanks a lot. I couldn't feel my ankles.
Try as I might, these shackles were too strong.

End2.text: Ironically, I was stuck here because of a key! When the Bandits saw it, they figured that I was rich even though I have no idea what it actually opens.

End3.text: It's a family heirloom that we keep as a mere lucky charm. If you want it, you are welcome to it. It has completely failed its purpose.

Accept.text: I'll go back to my fishery now. It's not far from Smot's Arena. If you ever happen to go there, come and pay me a visit.

line0.title: The Unlucky Charm
line0.props.helpTip: Pick open the chains restraining the fisherman.

Start.text: Someone dug a hole in the jail floor. It is too dark to see where it leads.

End.text: Someone dug a hole in the jail floor. It is too dark to see where it leads.

Start.text: You can hire me if you want, but I won't rat on my friends.
Go on, laugh all you want!

Next.text: You don't know what it's like not to be re-elected! I was going to lose everything because of those blasted sewers! I had to prepare for my life after politics!

Start.text: I just don't understand! We had six prisoners yesterday, and today, there's only one left!

Next1.text: The lock is intact, and the remaining scoundrel refuses to explain anything. We couldn't get him to talk, and believe me, we tortured him properly!

End1.text: You found them? By Saint Lenaid's hammer! You made short work of that!

End2.text: Take this reward. You deserve it. If you were merciful enough to take some of them alive, you can speak to my colleague and claim their bounties.

Alt1.text: What the... Where have the prisoners gone? The lock is intact!

line0.text: Find out how the prisoners escaped.

line1.text: Find the Sawmill described by the fugitive.

line2.text: Report to the warden.

Start.text: We reward anyone who brings in <inf>outlaws</inf>. As you can see, we've got room to spare.

Deliver.text: Looks like this scoundrel deserves his place here.

NoSlotAvailable.text: You've done so well, the Jail is now full!

line0.title: Left Behind
line0.props.helpTip: Tend to the fugitive and interrogate her.

Start.text: I broke my leg while trying to escape the jail, and my accomplices left me behind. The gutless oafs!

Next1.text: I'll tell you everything I know if you give me some medicine!

line0.props.tipText: Heal the woman.

line1.props.tipText: Convince the woman to talk.

Next2.text: We'd been digging together for weeks. They said we were going to form a gang and set up our lair in an abandoned sawmill near the Tiltren border.

Next3.text: But when they saw my broken leg, they abandoned me without a second thought. Dispatch them or take them back to jail and let them rot there! I'd be most grateful.

line0.props.tipText: Let the fugitive go.

line1.props.tipText: Try to capture the fugitive.

line0.text: Find out who the sawmill workers really are.

line1.text: Decide what to do with the sawmill workers.

Start.text: Move along, Mercenaries. Our sawmill has no need of your services.

Next1.text: Hello, Mercenaries... Oh... You know who we are.

Next2.text: So that whiner ratted us out, eh? We should've slashed her throat when we had a chance.

Next3.text: But surely we can come to an agreement? After all, we are all sensible people.

Next4.text: How about we pay you off nicely, and you let us leave the province unnoticed? The Guard will be rid of us, it'll free up more room in the local jail, you'll be rich and we'll be on our way. It's a win for everyone involved, really.

line0.props.tipText: Capture as many fugitives as possible.

Wait.text: We'll gather our belongings and go.

Start.text: Ah! Are you Mercenaries? Good... Very good.
Yes, these machines aren't working. But that's none of your business!
You should focus on the disease affecting the vines instead, Mercenaries.
The door is blocked by some sort of mechanism.
There is something written on the bowl.

Read.text: The inscription reads: Skilled negotiators or wealthy travellers, welcome!

Done.text:
You hear a faint click as soon as the bowl is filled with your Krowns.
Before your Companions can react, the gold coins are swallowed by the Ancient shrine.

Start.text:
I'm trying to get in, but I can't open this blasted door.
I guess you’re supposed to make an offering, but what could an Ancient want?

End.text:
You did it!
The treasure is mine!

Notif.text: The merchant ran into the depths of the Tomb.

Start.text: There is something under the mud. You will have to clear it away.
Suddenly, your torches light up a monstrous face.
The room below is flooded and none of your Companions can swim.

It’s a statue of Nepti.
He’s holding a gem in his right hand, but his left hand is empty.

line0.props.tipText: Place a ruby in the statue’s left hand.

line1.props.tipText: Place a sapphire in the statue’s left hand.

line2.props.tipText: Place sandstone in the statue’s left hand.

Bad.text: Your Companions swear they saw the statue slap ::name:: (::injury::).

EndRuby1.text:
This is Nepti's statue.
Do you want to retrieve the gems?

EndSapphir1.text:
This is Nepti's statue.
Do you want to retrieve the gems?

End.text: This is Nepti's statue.

Start.text: You can hear water behind the wall.
The staircase is flooded.

Something is following you.
Your Companions speed up, but it’s too late: the creatures are upon you.
Among rusted items, you find Krowns that look strangely familiar.

Notify.text: You fished up... somebody.

Start.text: The merchant must have been swept away by the current.
The hallway collapsed, but you can feel a slight draft.

Water.text: Your Companions can hear water flowing inside the Tomb.
Your Companions can hear the sound of a siphon.

Start.text: The staircase is flooded.
Something is blocking the door from the other side.
The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: The atmosphere in the halls is strained. Your Companions can sense eyes watching them.
It's easy enough for Broker Ald Marheim to say we should be patient. He's not the one who's about to lose it all!

Farmer2.text: I won't stand idly by while my crops wither away! Those responsible must be punished!

Farmer3.text: By the All-seeing Eye, we will fight back! Grab your pitchforks! To the abbey! We'll knock the doors down!

Farmer4.text: First off, we need to deal with the Brotherhood. These blasted Mercenaries guard the abbey day and night.

Farmer1.text: We could hire our own goons to dispatch them. If we all pitch in, we'll have enough to employ the best!

Mission.text: Did you hear everything we said? Good, at least you know what you're getting yourselves into. Fighting the Brotherhood is not for the faint-hearted.

Accept.text: Great. We shouldn't dally. Let's go.

MissionDesc.text: Help the Vintners enter Saint Lenaid's Abbey.

line0.text: Take on Jehan Molen's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: The nest obstructs waste water drainage.
The creatures are protecting their nest.
Of course we reported the attack! That's the first thing I did after chasing this ruffian away!

Next1.text: The Guard searched the area all day with no luck. They suggested we hire some Mercenaries. This is preposterous! Where does our tax money go if not in our protection?

Start.text: I saved my mistress by pure reflex. But frankly, when I thought about it later, I regretted it.

Next.text: Risking my life with two months to go before I can be a free woman again? How stupid of me!

Start.text: It may not be obvious at first glance, but I was a scholar before becoming a slave. One piece of advice: however rich or intelligent you are, never gamble on arena fights.
You're Mercenaries, right? I need your help and I'm willing to pay. Just name your price!

Next1.text: My vineyard's the only healthy one left in the whole province. So I have to guard it at night in case some jealous so-and-so tries to get to my crop.

Next2.text: But I was attacked! I was knocked unconscious, and if my daughter and slaves hadn't chased the rascal away, I'd probably be dead!

Next3.text: I can deal with thieves, but murderers?! That's a task for professionals like you. Do you think you could guard my vineyard at night?

Accept.text: Perfect! You must be in the fields by nightfall and guard the place until dawn.

Wait.text: Any news on my attackers? You enlisted the help of the Trackers?

End1.text: So this tuber has special properties...?

End2.text: Wait! You mean this repulsive root is responsible for our ordeal?

End3.text: The men in my field... I saw them trying to plant the blasted thing! They were knowingly poisoning my vines! This is extremely serious! Broker Ald Marheim must be notified at once.

End4.text: Here is your reward. Take it and enjoy it while I go to the castle. Stay alert, the Broker could send for you at any time.

SettingLog.text: You discovered that plants from Alazar are smothering the Vertrusian vineyards.

MissionDesc.text: Protect the vineyards from 8pm until 7am.

line0.text: Take on Rosel Loop's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line0.title: Empty casks
line0.props.helpTip: Bring 30 Gosenberg Wines or find the caravan near the Grinmeer border.

line1.title: Rouste
line1.props.helpTip: Win a Rouste match in Vertruse.

Start.text: Gosenbergers undeniably have a drinking problem.

Next1.text: But what can I say? It's good for business.

Start.text: Not one drop of alcohol! The tournament is doomed!
It's over! We're calling off the whole thing. Go home!

Next1.text: We're out of wine! The casks are empty, there's nothing left!

Next2.text: Grinmeer vintners were supposed to send us a caravan, but it never arrived! We don't even know if it crossed the <narrator>border</narrator>.

Start.text: Without booze, Rouste has no flavour.
I came from the other end of the province to play!

Next1.text: And what do I find? Empty casks!

Start.text: The vineyard disease destroyed the entire crop this year.

Next1.text: And now, Gosenberg City doesn't even bother fulfilling our orders!

Start.text:
You...
This is...

Next1.text:
Wine! Wine's here, lads!
Let the Rouste begin!

Next2.text: Join us, Mercenaries! You'll see, our players are completely different after a drink or two!

Rouste1.text: Our players may be vintners, but they turn into warriors the minute they set foot on the pitch. Are you ready to face them?

Rouste2.text:
I think we just witnessed the greatest Rouste match in Vertrusian history!
This trophy is yours!

Rouste3.text: If you want a rematch, know that our vintners haven't shown you the full extent of their talent yet! After a few more drinks, you'll be facing wild beasts!

RousteDiff1.text: Our lads want a rematch and this time, they almost finished the wine you brought. There will be blood!

line0.props.tipText: Play Vertruse's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff2.text:
What's your secret, Mercenaries? This match was even more amazing than the last!
Here's your reward. You've earned it!

RousteDiff3.text: You won all of the rewards we had to offer, but feel free to come back and play! If only to enjoy the atmosphere.

RousteEnd1.text: Would you like to play a friendly match? No stakes, just for the love of the game!

line0.props.tipText: Play Vertruse's team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd2.text: We never tire of watching you play, Mercenaries.

Start.text: Not to be finicky, but I've had better wine.
Just because you saved the day doesn't mean I'll let you win on the pitch.
Ah! We can finally play in proper conditions!

Without you, I'd have had to close up shop.
Is there something you'd like? A cup, perhaps?
The stable boy pretends he doesn't know you.
I'll never believe a minstrel's tales again. Not after the earful we got from the boss!
I entertain my hosts with tales and fables in exchange for a hot meal.

Next.text: I recently told the story of the Groattle, a beast that hides in the mountains and plays nasty tricks on farmers.

Next2.text: The stable boys in particular seemed to enjoy it.

Start.text: You haven't seen two stable boys on your way here, by any chance? They've been gone for a while, and I am starting to worry.

Next1.text: They are decent lads, but not the sharpest tools in the box. I am concerned they took the minstrel's story a bit too seriously.

Next2.text: And I did warn them of the dangers of Brownrock Mine.

End.text: I am so glad to have my stable boys back. Thank you for bringing these gullible fools back in one piece.

End2.text: The stable boys are strangely quiet in your presence.

line0.text: Investigate the missing stable boys near Brownrock Mine.

line1.text: Make sure the stable boys are back.

Start.text: Do you need a new mount or have one that needs tending to?
We work for a pittance all day and sometimes all night, in stuffy galleries that could collapse at any moment.

Next1.text: We won't go back to work until the boss agrees to our conditions! We want more Krowns, enhanced safety measures and a day off for the festival of Light.

Next2.text: If you negotiate for us, we will pay you handsomely.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the strikers to resume work.

End1.text: That miser is threatening to buy slaves? If there's any chance to change his mind, we must try. For our families.

End2.text: Tell him to calm down, we'll get back to work.

Reward2.text:
It's a miracle! We've been trying to convince him for weeks!
Brokers beware, these Mercenaries are master negotiators! Take this reward, with our heartfelt thanks.

Wait.text: Please do come by again, we may have bonuses to negotiate.

Stop.text: Hey! Oi! You blacklegs! Do you mind?

line0.title: Workers Union
line0.props.helpTip: Put an end to the strike to resume mining operations.

Start.text: I knew I should have bought slaves!

Next1.text: Look at them! Striking! How will I feed my family if all work at the mine has stopped? Help me! You simply must!

line0.props.tipText: Scare the boss into agreeing to the strikers' demands.

End1.text: These wretches are threatening to bury me alive in my own mine? The louts! They are insane!

End2.text: I should have known. The strike itself was an act of wanton savagery. Thank the Eye you warned me. I probably owe you my life.

Reward.text: You obviously know how to handle such situations! Here is your reward: Krowns that won't end up in these slackers' pockets!

Wait.text: We're back in business!

Wanted.text: You threatened the owner of the mine.

Start.text: We are drapers. If you wish to buy fabric, I can assure you ours is of the finest quality!
Why? Why me? Why today, when I thought my wealth made! Why must Fate punish me so?

Next1.text: Five years I spent on this tapestry! This masterpiece was supposed to make me famous throughout Gosenberg. A lifetime's work gone overnight!

Next2.text: The Guard told me to stop looking. They said my tapestry was long gone across the border, likely never to be seen again. I am left with nothing!

End.text: But... that's my tapestry! ... Words cannot express how grateful I am! I hope this reward speaks for itself.

End2.text: I am still struggling to catch my breath after what I've experienced.

Start.text: I wasn't ready for my first encounter with the Ghost Pack. Not only did I nearly die, but I also became a burden for my colleagues.
You can join the Hunt if you wish, but be warned.

Next1.text: We're not tracking regular game, this the Ghost Pack. These creatures only appear in the dead of night. They spring out of the mist and bring terror and misery to all who cross their path.

Next2.text: This indicates where the freshest traces of the Pack are: you will have to go up the whole trail to fight it.

Accept.text: In that case, I wish you good luck. You'll need it.

Wait.text: Make sure you are well prepared for this fight, or you won't make it.

End.text: To be honest, I didn't think you'd make it back alive. But obviously, I misjudged you. Not only did you survive but you also defeated the Ghost Pack. This armour layer is yours.

End2.text: To be quite honest, I didn't think I would see you alive again. I misjudged you: not only did you save your own skin, but you also triumphed over the Ghost Pack.

line0.title: Hunt down the Pack of Vertruse

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Vertruse Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Istos.

Start.text: No one is safe from the Ghost Pack, not even in the most sheltered and peaceful regions like Vertruse.

line0.props.tipText: Ask about the strange tuber

Ask1.text: I'm surprised you're asking about this plant.

Ask2.text: It is a weed that only grows in Alazar. It is not sold anywhere nor is it edible. Even the pigs won't eat it.

Ask3.text: But it is nonetheless an astonishing plant. It can survive and thrive in the driest soils. It can spread its roots far and wide to absorb any moisture in the ground. Of course, this means that the surrounding plants quickly wither.

Notify.text: Noises can be heard from outside the camp.

MissionDesc.text: Investigate the camp surroundings

Start.text: War paints are more than mere decorations, but foreigners cannot understand their true significance.

Next1.text: All of these Trackers have been initiated in our ways by a druid in the Tules' Glade in Ludern.

Tatoo1.text: Have you undergone your initiation in the Tules Glade? If so, which of your Companions would like to be adorned with war paints?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

Start.text: We're next. I hope I remember everything.
My parents lost everything to the vineyard disease. I decided to join the Brotherhood to lighten their burden.

Next1.text: but to be honest, it's a bit daunting.

Start.text:
You’re not bothering me, I just finished eating my mutton stew.
What would you like to work on today? A specific skill? A weapon upgrade?

Respec.text: With this, you've got everything you need. Come back whenever, a spot of exercise helps with digestion.

Start.text: I can't believe it! You came! Make yourselves at home! You're family now!
It's strange. I thought I saw something shining in the water.

Next.text: I'm still a bit shaken by what's happened. I didn't think I'd see him again!

Chest.text: I can't believe it! They've been living on a chest this whole time?

line0.title: Shining in the Water
line0.props.helpTip: Find out what the fisherman is looking at.

Start.text: My brother has gone missing. He went to visit a friend in the Vertrusian Jail two weeks ago, but we haven't heard from him since.

Next1.text: My brother told me you saved him. I am forever in your debt.

Start.text: The lock is adorned with bunches of grapes.
<narrator>The Northern Kingdom's conversion to the worship of the Light is nothing more than political hypocrisy.</narrator>

Next1.text: The Wayward Servant parable from The Saga of Saint Jeru, verse 27 is very clear on this matter: slave owners are to be punished as harshly as murderers.

Next2.text: <narrator>Proponents of this vile practice claim that it is condoned by tradition, or by the nature of the slaves themselves, who are said to be criminals repaying a debt equal to their crimes. But what crime can justify enslavement?...</narrator>

Start.text: I am still cross with you, you know? For abducting me.

Next1.text: When Clemens said he intended to name our first born after you, I refused categorically.

Next2.text: While I no longer wish to see you hung, there is only so much I can take.

Start.text: You should reconsider my offer: without our scholars, you are finished.

Next2.text: Vertruse is nothing without its vineyards... Not only do you risk a peasant uprising, but you could also lose everything you have, including your Broker title.

Next3.text: In light of your situation, my price is more than reasonable.

Next4.text: I am well aware of this, Lady Adr Alazar. But I beg of you, give me more time. The decision must be approved by the Broker Council. As for myself, I am already engaged...

Next5.text: My daughter will not wait forever just as your farmers won't sit idly while their fields wither.

Next6.text: You must decide. Hurry before there are no vineyards left to save.

Start.text: I am sorry, but I do not have time to see you.

Next1.text: The scourge raging through our vineyards is taking up all my attention.

Next2.text: By the Beast's fangs! Where is that apothecary?
