Start.text: Hello there!

Questioned.text: No one around here is mourning the loss of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp. She despised the poor.

line0.props.tipText: This character can die in combat without causing the mission to fail.

Recruit1.text: Yorvenn is like a brother to me - should you have need of my bow, I'll follow you.

line1.props.tipText: This character can die in combat without causing the mission to fail.

Start.text:
I sure am glad we made it out alive!
Thank you for taking me with you to free Yorvenn and not sacrificing me. I wanted to give you a little something to show my thanks.

End.text: What can I do for you, my friends?

Questioned.text: No one around here is mourning the loss of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp. She despised the poor.

Notify.text: ::G2SmallChurchCryptMember2:: has left your company.

Start.text: Apparently, I'm too old... Too old! I was the grand champion of Bernna's arena, three-time winner of the Arena Clash! And these yokels don't want me on their team?

Next1.text: I was about to teach them my best tricks... That's not about to happen now! I don't trust Rouste players anymore. My knowledge will go to the next champion of <narrator>Bernna's Arena.</narrator> And that's final.

Next3.text: Did you give 'em a beating? Good! Kogo and Toro were unbearable!

Next4.text: Come here, and I'll tell you all about it.

End.text: Don't worry about me. I'll wait for one of the players to break a leg. Their team will have no choice but to take me.

line0.text: Come back and talk to the old gladiator after finishing Bernna's Arena.

Start.text:
Why not meet some local growers while you're at the tournament?
Enjoy the many talents of our Gosenbergers.
This pony is the Rouste tournament prize.
Have you seen the pitch after a game of Rouste? There's swamps in Harag wot look nicer! If Broker Bernna didn't pay to rent my land, those chaps would never set foot there.

Questioned.text: Broker Bernna cares about the common folk. Between the Rouste games and the arena, he makes sure no one gets bored.

Start.text: I told my husband to get paid in advance! With all the rumours about Bernna's Arena, we can't be sure of anything.

I sell refreshments to the crowd and the players.
Have as many drinks as you like - it eases the pain.

Want to join a Rouste match?
Step right up! Don't be shy! The more the merrier.

Next1.text: A game of Rouste is played in teams of 8: 6 on the pitch and 2 substitutes. The aim is to get the ball to the opponent's end zone! Anyone can play, so long as they don't mind losing an ear or a nose.

Next2.text: There's an amazing reward for the winning team: a fine pony for ploughing fields, generously donated by Broker Bernna!

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

End1.text:
Oh my! Looks like you've mastered the art of the Rouste, Mercenaries!
The pony is yours.

End2.text: You know, Grinmeer isn't the only place where people play Rouste. You should try to challenge teams in other regions.

Questioned.text: Broker Bernna seemed to be low on Krowns lately... but, lo and behold, he donates a pony! It's a good thing he's back on track - we were this close to awarding the winners with a bundle of carrots.

SettingLog.text: <narrator>Broker Bernna</narrator> suddenly and inexplicably got rich.

NotifRouste.text: You have unlocked Rouste Pitches in other regions.

Again2.text: Get in position! Our players prepared for your return.

line0.props.tipText: Play Rouste again in Hard mode.

AgainReward1.text:
That was probably the most amazing match I've ever seen.
This reward is yours.

AgainReward2.text: If you want to play our local team again, I'm sorry to say you won't get a reward. You've already won everything.

Last1.text: Feel like playing Rouste? I hope your players are ready, because ours have fully recovered from their injuries!

line1.props.tipText: Play Rouste again in Hard mode.

Last2.text:
Great game, Mercenaries!
Come back and challenge Grinmeer's team whenever you want.

line0.title: Folk Practice
line0.props.helpTip: Win the Rouste game.

Start.text:
I did warn him.
He may be my child, but I can't deny he's as dumb as a pony.

Next1.text: Had he listened, I could've made a decent fighter out of him. Instead I've got a weepy son and no one to pass on my knowledge to. It's not how I imagined my retirement back when I was champion of Hoevendorp's Arena.

Next2.text:
Would you lot be interested? Hmm...
Prove to me you deserve my knowledge. Win the <narrator>Arena Clash</narrator> and I'll make you the heirs to my legacy.

Next3.text: I was looking forward to your arrival! The Merchants who come through here speak of nothing but you.

Next4.text: Are you still interested in my knowledge and experience?

End.text: I'm glad to know that my expertise will live on.

line0.text: Go back and talk to the former champion after winning the Arena Clash.

Start.text: I failed my exams to get into university. Whatever will I make of my life now?

Beautiful Grinmeer ponies! Stalwart beasts of the finest calibre!
You can't pass up this opportunity.

Questioned.text: Oh, I don't know much about what goes on in the city... I only go there to sell meat.

Start.text: Aren't you the mercenaries who paid my toll to Tiltren?

Next1.text:
It is you! I recognise you!
Don't go anywhere - I've got something for you.

Next2.text:
So, it was worth helping me, eh? Hahaha!
Have a nice glass of wine to celebrate.

Next3.text: If you want to order a drink, ask my cousin. I'm in charge of cleaning the tankards and bowls.

line0.text: Talk to the refugee.

Start.text: Don't trust those university folk...! Hic! The Earth... is round!

Questioned.text: Broker Hoevendorp - hic! - didn't want to fund my research! Hic! I hate her!

Astronomer1.text: Huh? What? The astronomer from Drombach? What does he want from me?

Astronomer2.text: What? You got this letter from him? Hic! Did the Eye’s Reckoning hit him on the head?

Astronomer3.text: The Earth is not flat nor round, but shaped like a rounded anvil... I hope you didn't –hic– come all this way just for that nonsense! This reward isn't worth it.

Wait.text: Let me drink in peace.

line0.text: Share with the drunk Scholar what her colleague in Drombach discovered.

Start.text: You're investigating Broker Hoevendorp's death, aren't you? I may know people who can help you, but I'am afraid I don't know how to contact the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator>.

Done.text: Hopefully it'll put you on the right track.

line0.props.tipText: The Broker's son disappeared on the night of his mother's murder.

line1.props.tipText: The Guards are trying to save the Alazarian Ambassador from the mob.

line2.props.tipText: Broker Bernna needs new champions to have any chance of winning the Arena Clash.

Sister.text: The Broker's son disappeared on the night of his mother's murder.

Alazar.text: The Guards are trying to save the Alazarian Aambassador from the mob.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>The Informant hesitates before grabbing the letter.</narrator>
I... Thank you.

End.text: Apologies, but I have nothing for you.

Start.text:
Say, Mercenaries. Have you run into a refugee from Edoran who wanted to get to Gosenberg?
I haven't heard from my cousin in weeks...

Alt.text: You're the ones who got my cousin across the border? By Jeru! When he told me how much he promised you... ! I hope you're here to spend it.

Questioned.text: Now Broker Hoevendorp is dead, I don't know who'll pay her son's debts. Just in my joint, his tab's a mile long. Think I should worry?

Start.text: This hat belongs to Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp. An animal could use it to sniff him out.

line0.props.tipText: Reveal a scent trail.
line0.props.disableReason: Requires a wolf, a boar or a crocswine.

Inspect.text: Your trusty companion has a lead!

MissionDesc.text: Follow the scent to find Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp.

line0.text: Use an animal to sniff out Lyderic.

line1.text: Report to Adelise.

Start.text: A little coin for the artists?

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Next.text: Art lovers, are you? You're not alone - people from the merchant city love our shows.

Questionned.text: We haven't seen the Broker's son since his mother's death. It's a shame, he was a generous tipper. Give him my regards if you see him at <narrator>Hoevendorp Manor</narrator>.

End.text: Artists don't have a real job and spend their days loafing, so they don't need to eat. If you catch my drift...

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Start.text: <narrator>The performers are re-enacting the history of Gosenberg.</narrator>

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line1.text:
Treachery, Gosenberg!
You betray your king just as war is upon us!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line2.text: Upon you, Alazar! We have joined General Edor's alliance to reclaim our freedom.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line3.text: The old Northern Kingdom has ceased to exist. Keep your mountains and your science, wicked king! We'll keep our plains and our Krowns.

Start.text: Another company awaits their turn.
I hope you enjoyed the performance.

Questioned.text: Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's death comes as no surprise. Rumour has it the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> tried setting fire to her manor once before.

Start.text: You wish to congratulate us on our performance?

line0.props.disableReason: Test

Alt.text: You wish to congratulate us on our performance?

line0.props.disableReason: You must take part in the Brotherhood's investigation to question this person.

Questioned.text: Lyderic? You're looking for him?

Next1.text:
I'll do anything to help you find my beloved.
Ask me whatever you want!

Accept1.text: The last time I saw him was the night his mother was murdered. He forgot to take his <narrator>hat</narrator>. Perhaps some animal could follow his scent?

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Hoevendorp son</narrator> disappeared on the night his mother, Broker Hoevendorp, was killed.

MissionDesc.text: Use the hat left behind by Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp to track him down.

End.text: I was told that Lady Malvina gave you a reward. Does that mean you've found Lyderic?

line0.props.tipText: Spare Adelise with a less sordid tale.

line1.props.tipText: Tell Adelise the truth.

EndLie.text:
He went to Alazar on a secret mission? How brave!
I will pray to Saint Eleor for his safe return.

EndTruth2.text: No! No, it can't be! Lyderic wouldn't do that to me! We were in love!

Start.text: Fine people of Gosenberg, citizens, merchants and artisans... The moment you've all been waiting for!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Next1.text: The one! The only! The incomparable Buddy!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Next2.text: Buddy is thrilled to be here.

Alt1.text: Fine people of Gosenberg, citizens, merchants and artisans... Unfortunately, we won't be able to perform our usual act.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Alt2.text: In lieu of our greatest artist, Buddy, his handler will delight you with their amazing juggling routine.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Start.text: <narrator>This scene from the life of Jeru required a large investment.</narrator>

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line1.text: O Jeru, I shall risk my very life to protect you!

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line2.text:
Alas, brave Eleor! I am but a poor man.
I cannot afford a Mercenary to guard me from monsters and heathens.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line3.text: Krowns are of no consequence! The Eye came to me and I answered the call.

line0.props.tipText: Watch the performance

Line4.text: In His great wisdom, the God of Light asked me to lend you my shield so the Light may shine upon our lands once more.

line0.text: Get rid of the wolves in the Great Growler Cave for Tierry.

Start.text:
My father just lost his Broker title! Now we're mere citizens.
Look at this ridiculous outfit!

Questioned.text: How would I know? Commoners aren't welcome in the Brokers' Palace!

Notif.text: Your questions made Hella cry.

Start.text: You ought to leave her be.

All our servants fled when my father was stripped of his Broker title.
Now I have to mop the floors myself.

Questioned.text: I don't know who killed Broker Wylla, but it wouldn't surprise me if they were from Alazar. Ever since Gosenberg became independent, they've been trying to get their hands on Vertruse and Grinmeer.

Start.text:
Mercenaries? What are your rates?
I've lost a great deal of Krowns, but I still have an estate to maintain.

Next1.text: The Broker Council told me that if another Merchant was attacked on my land, I would go straight to jail!

Next2.text: Would you get rid of a few wolves for a fair reward? There's a pack holed up in the <narrator>Great Growler Cave</narrator>. They're especially aggressive toward caravans.

line0.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

End1.text:
You got rid of the wolves in the Great Growler Cave? Ah! What a relief! The Broker Council will be pleased.
Here's the reward I promised.

Accept.text: Without your help, I could've ended up in jail for negligence. My family has fallen from grace enough as it is.

Questioned1.text: Why don't I sell my estate? It's not like I haven't tried!

Questioned2.text: An Alazarian princess was about to buy the estate, but that cursed Wylla passed a law making it illegal to sell our land to foreign realms. I can only hope that a Broker takes interest in this heap of stones.

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp prevented <narrator>Alazar</narrator> from buying land in Gosenberg.

Start.text: Each year, the city of Gosenberg expands, gaining on the forest a bit more.

Next1.text: Wild animals are driven away and begin to roam the roadways. The Ghost Pack is getting dangerously close to the outskirts of town.

Next2.text: If you want to help, we've received troubling reports from the Broker Council.

Accept.text: Follow the directions on this note and exterminate the Ghost Pack.

Wait.text: Be careful, Mercenaries. The Pack is just as deadly here as it is elsewhere.

End.text: To be honest, I didn't think you'd make it back alive. Obviously, I misjudged you. Not only did you survive but you also defeated the Ghost Pack. This armour layer is yours.

End2.text: To be honest, I didn't think you'd make it back alive. Obviously, I misjudged you. Not only did you survive but you also defeated the Ghost Pack.

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Grinmeer Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Pritona.

Start.text: At last, a foreigner to trade with! All those Merchants, they know nothing but Krowns!
War paints are more than mere decorations, but foreigners cannot understand their true significance.

Next1.text: All of these Trackers have been initiated in our ways by a druid in the Tules' Glade in Ludern.

Tatoo1.text: Have you undergone your initiation in the Tules' Glade? If so, which of your Companions would like to be adorned with war paints?

Tatoo2.text: Does anyone else among your Companions want an ornament?

line0.text: Accuse and condemn Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's killer.

Start.text: <narrator>This fresco depicts a time when the Brokers of Gosenberg (left) betrayed the kingdom of Alazar on behalf of Edoran (right).</narrator>
The role of the Broker Council is to run the city and maintain some measure of civil peace there. Each member - Brokers such as myself - has a duty to listen to the residents' demands.

Next1.text: Yes, Mercenaries? Do you have a grievance?

Questioned.text: The Brotherhood reports didn't tell us much more than what we already knew. At the time of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's brutal murder, all the other Brokers were here and stayed well into the night.

Start.text: You may not pass.

Questioned.text: There's no excuse for poking around state documents, not even the death of Broker Hoevendorp.

Start.text: Only members of the Broker Council are allowed in.

Questioned.text: Watch it! Some might think you're implying that a council member is under suspicion.

Start.text: This fresco is incredible. I've never seen anything like it in Harag.
Broker Bernna is back in business! Despite rumours he was ruined, just last week he bought a new travel post.

Next1.text: I'll take advantage of his newfound prosperity to ask him to insure my first ship - that witch Wylla laughed in my face, but hopefully he'll agree.

Questioned.text: Allegedly, all the Brokers were still at the palace when Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was killed. I do wonder why she wasn't with them.

Start.text: Good to see you again!

Questioned.text: You should head to <narrator>Hoevendorp Manor</narrator>. The Broker's daughter has a search going there.

Questioned2.text: Not to be rude, but you can go whistle.

Start.text: Good to see you again!

Questioned.text: We were there on the night of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's death. I remember Broker Bernna was also there, but I don't think I saw the Broker's son or the Alazarian Ambassador.

Start.text: How have they still not found Broker Hoevendorp's killer?

Next1.text: Just look around you! The streets empty the minute the sun sets! Everyone's afraid to go outside! It's already taking a toll on business.

Next2.text: I commiserate, dear lady, but I can assure you the Broker Council is doing everything in its power to resolve this.

Next5.text: The discussion could last a while longer.

Start.text: Wise Broker Council, citizens of Gosenberg, the Mercenaries have given me proof of their claims.

Next1.text: This contract confirms the sale of Bernna's Arena, dated a few weeks before her assassination.

Next2.text: Broker Bernna sold his arena?

Next3.text: That would explain his sudden wealth...

Next4.text: The crowd and the Brokers are somewhat agitated.

Next5.text: I was unaware this document existed until the <narrator>Rooks</narrator> raided our home and took it. These Mercenaries fought hard to recover it.

Next6.text: This contract proves that Broker Bernna is guilty. He's the one who told the Rooks to assassinate my mother and take the document linking him to her.

Notify.text: Malvina shows the crowd the Sales Contract.

Start.text:
Enough!
Silence!

Next1.text: Yes! I killed Wylla Ald Hoevendorp! Yes! I hired the Rooks to do it!

Next2.text: She sullied our good name and ruined our family, just like she'd done with the Armemans!

Next3.text: I sold her my arena with the proviso that she would only announce the news after the Arena Clash, giving me a chance to go out on top by winning the fight.

Next4.text: But I was never going to let her enjoy my ancestors' legacy. The Rooks cost a great deal, but they got the job done...

BadEnd1.text: I realise this is disturbing, but it could be an unfortunate accident!

BadEnd2.text: My involvement hasn't been established. The Mercenaries' accusations have been very unreliable so far.

Start.text:
<narrator>The room is packed. Many locals have come to attend these proceedings.
The Broker Council seems restless.</narrator>

Next0.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::, you are accused of murdering our colleague, Broker Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.

Next1.text: The Mercenaries who accuse you claim to have evidence of your guilt.

Next3.text: If, by the Eye's grace, they manage to prove this, they will receive the sum promised by the Broker Council. If they fail, if this assembly finds that they made slanderous allegations against you, they will be ordered to pay <gold>300</gold> to our great city.

Next4.text: And now, having reviewed the rules of this court, we can begin.

Start.text: Firstly, Mercenaries, let's revisit the circumstances which led to the death of our esteemed colleague, Wylla Ald Hoevendorp.

Next1.text: In all likelihood, Wylla Ald Hoevendorp was killed in the middle of the street, in the more affluent part of our city. Is this man the one accused of dealing the fatal blow?

line0.props.tipText: Yes, he's the one.

line1.props.tipText: No, he wasn't at the scene.

Next2.text: You see! I wasn't even there! Even these Mercenaries admit it. How could I have killed the Broker?

Next2Bis.text:
Silence!
Mercenaries, I don't understand. Where was the accused that night?

line0.props.tipText: The accused was at the Broker's Palace.

line1.props.tipText: The accused was in the Midnight Gardens.

line2.props.tipText: The accused was at home.

line3.props.tipText: The accused was at the Hoevendorp Mine.

AlazarRight.text: Yes, I was at home. I even had an appointment with Broker Hoevendorp, but she never came. May the Eye welcome her into the Light.

AlazarWrong.text: That's ridiculous! I was home that night. All my servants can confirm this.

SonRight.text: I'm ashamed, but the Mercenaries speak the truth. That night I was held captive in the Midnight Gardens.

SonWrong.text: What? That's preposterous! I was kidnapped and held captive by those wretches in the Midnight Gardens! How could I have killed my mother?

RivalRight.text: I was indeed here in the palace, along with my esteemed colleagues. You can vouch for it yourself, Broker Ald Marheim.

RivalWrong.text: Ah! Mercenaries, I expected more from you! This entire Council could have answered that question, as I was at the Brokers' Palace with them that night.

LeagueRight.text: The Mercenaries are right. That night, the People's Fellowship occupied the Hoevendorp Mine, on the other side of Grinmeer.

LeagueWrong.text: That's not true! The Fellowship was out of town that night. We were on the opposite end of Grinmeer Province, in the Hoevendorp Mine.

People.text: How, by Saint Septimus, could I have been there when I was at the Artists' Square! The performers, the crowd, they all saw me!

Guard.text: Don't listen to these lies! I was at the Guard post all night. My superior can vouch for me!

Noble.text: Don't be absurd! That night, I was at a colleague's for business. I didn't return home until the next morning.

Scholar.text: Lies! Poppycock! I spent the night studying flat Earth physics with other students. The results of our research can prove it.

MiddleEnd1.text: I believe the accused has evidence to prove you wrong, Mercenaries. Hopefully, there will be no more setbacks.

MiddleEnd2.text: Esteemed colleagues, I shall let you carry on.

BadEnd1.text: Mercenaries, are you absolutely certain you want to accuse this person? It appears your accusation is unfounded, and this response alone entirely refutes it.

BadEnd2.text: The Broker Council cannot assemble at the drop of a hat. This court is not intended to hear the fabrications of reward-starved Mercenaries.

BadEnd3.text: The Broker Council hereby acquits the accused ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: and sentences you, Mercenaries, to pay a fine of <gold>300</gold> to the city of Gosenberg.

line1.props.tipText: The accused was in the Midnight Gardens.

line2.props.tipText: The accused was at home.

line3.props.tipText: The accused was at the Hoevendorp Mine.

People_F.text: How, by Saint Septimus, could I have been there when I was at the Artists' Square! The performers, the crowd, they all saw me!

Noble_F.text: Don't be absurd! That night, I was at a colleague's for business. I didn't return home until the next morning.

Scholar_F.text: Lies! Poppycock! I spent the night studying flat Earth physics with other students. The results of our research can prove it.

LeagueRight_F.text:
The Mercenaries are right. We freed the slaves.
But then, how could we have murdered the Broker on the other side of Grinmeer at the same time?

LeagueWrong_F.text: That's not true! The Fellowship was out of town that night. We were on the opposite end of Grinmeer Province, in the Hoevendorp Mine.

MiddleEnd1_F.text: I believe the accused has evidence to prove you wrong, Mercenaries. Hopefully, there will be no more setbacks.

MiddleEnd2_F.text: Esteemed colleagues, I shall let you carry on.

BadEnd1_F.text: Mercenaries, are you absolutely certain you want to accuse this person? It appears your accusation is unfounded, and this response alone entirely refutes it.

BadEnd2_F.text: The Broker Council cannot assemble at the drop of a hat. This court is not intended to hear the fabrications of reward-starved Mercenaries.

BadEnd3_F.text: The Broker Council hereby acquits the accused ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: and sentences you, Mercenaries, to pay a fine of <gold>300</gold> to the city of Gosenberg.

Start.text: So the defendant wasn't there when our late colleague was brutally murdered...

Next0.text: Please explain to this Council how the man you're accusing was able to kill Wylla Ald Hoevendorp and the twelve Brothers protecting her without being at the scene.

line0.props.tipText: With the help of Bandits.

line1.props.tipText: With the help of Mercenaries.

line2.props.tipText: With the help of the Rooks.

line3.props.tipText: With the help of the People's Fellowship.

Next1.text: I fail to see the legitimacy of your claim, Mercenaries. While it would be possible for a large group of these scoundrels to overcome the bodyguards and kill the Broker, what links them to the defendant?

line0.props.tipText: The defendant hired them to assassinate Broker Hoevendorp.

line1.props.tipText: The defendant is their leader.

line2.props.tipText: The defendant is a member of the group.

Alt1.text: The defendant claims he can prove that he wasn't at the scene.

Alt2.text: Are you simply mistaken, Mercenaries, or are you wasting our time on purpose?

Alt3.text: Please explain to this Council how the man you're accusing was able to kill Wylla Ald Hoevendorp and the twelve Brothers protecting her without being at the scene.

line0.props.tipText: With the help of Bandits.

line1.props.tipText: With the help of Mercenaries.

line2.props.tipText: With the help of the Rooks.

line3.props.tipText: With the help of the People's Fellowship.

AlazarRight1.text: Don't be absurd! This is the oldest accusation in the book. I was almost lynched right there on the street because of such falsehoods.

AlazarRight2.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::, please refrain from speaking out of turn.

AlazarRight3.text: However common this accusation may be does not make it baseless. Under these circumstances, it even seems legitimate.

AlazarRight4.text: On that note, Broker Rijkman, you have the floor.

AlazarWrong1.text: Alazar would never stoop to hiring wretches to assassinate such an important Gosenberger. We have much more respect for the Council than you think, Mercenaries.

AlazarWrong2.text: Must I explain to the esteemed members of the Broker Council why this accusation is preposterous? Do you really think Alazar would risk letting their Ambassador take an active part in a guild of assassins?

AlazarWrong3.text: Must I explain to the esteemed members of the Broker Council why this accusation is preposterous? There is not one shred of truth in the Mercenaries' claims.

RivalRight.text: What? The Rooks? That's completely untrue! I don't know the Rooks! I've never even heard of them!

RivalWrong1.text: You Mercenaries have quite an imagination! Esteemed Council! Why would I bother hiring someone to commit murder when I'm surrounded by gladiators who would gladly kill for me?

RivalWrong2.text: Haha! How entertaining, Mercenaries! Assuming I was part of such a group, I certainly would not have asked them to kill someone so close to me.

RivalWrong3.text:
Haha! I'm glad I chose you as my champions, you turned out to be quite entertaining.
Just pay your fine, and let's put an end to this farce.

SonRight.text: Wait! I admit I know quite a few Bandits in this city, but I owe them so much money that they would never take such a risk for me!

SonWrong1.text: This is ridiculous! How could I afford to hire a killer when I'm so deep in debt? No one works for free in this city.

SonWrong2.text: How can you accuse me of such a thing, Mercenaries? Was I not hounded by the very same Bandits, long before my mother's death?

SonWrong3.text: Esteemed Council, do not listen to them, I beg of you! They're lying, trying to mislead you! You cannot believe a word they say. Their accusations are nothing more than slander.

LeagueRight.text:
Preposterous!
How could the People's Fellowship free slaves and assassinate Broker Hoevendorp at the same time? These events took place in two different locations, hours away from each other!

LeagueWrong1.text: Not even I can bribe the People's Fellowship. If that's what you think, Mercenaries, then you really don't understand our cause.

LeagueWrong2.text: Are you even aware of the disastrous decisions these Council parasites took this moon alone? Do you think I have time for anything else than defending the people?

LeagueWrong3.text: Esteemed Council! If I'm convicted on such flimsy grounds, the people will see how little you think of them. You will have an uprising on your hands, I guarantee it.

GoodEnd2.text: Every time you open your mouth, I'm increasingly inclined to believe the Mercenaries.

GoodEnd3.text: On that note, Broker Rijkman, you have the floor.

BadEnd1.text: I'm afraid ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: is right, we're wasting our time.

BadEnd2.text: Broker Rijkman, do you have anything to add, or can we demand that the Mercenaries pay the <gold>300</gold> fine without further ado?

Start.text: Thank you, Broker Handelaar.

Next1.text: Mercenaries, you have diligently explained how the defendant may have committed the crime.

Next2.text: Now I would like to know why he would have wanted our esteemed colleague dead. Why her and not another member of this Council?

line0.props.tipText: The defendant wanted to steal from the Broker.

line1.props.tipText: The defendant wanted revenge.

line2.props.tipText: The defendant wanted his inheritance to be restored.

line3.props.tipText: The defendant acted on behalf of another kingdom.

line5.props.tipText: The defendant wanted to get Bernna's Arena back.

AlazarRight1.text: I can't deny that the relations between our two kingdoms have been fraught since the decisions this Council took with Broker Hoevendorp's strong support.

AlazarRight2.text: But as foreigners, the Mercenaries forget all of the other bonds that unite us. That night, I did summon the Broker to the Embassy in order to sign an important treaty.

AlazarRight3.text: Go there, and you will find scrolls confirming my claims. They should convince this noble Council that I had no reason to kill the Broker before she ratified the treaty.

AlazarRight5.text: Guards! Go to the Embassy at once and fetch those documents.

AlazarWrong1.text: Nonsense. Alazar had many reasons to despise the Broker, but this is not one of them.

AlazarWrong2.text: How many insults must I suffer through before this Council admits that the Mercenaries are wrong?

SonRight1.text: I... Yes, my mother did threaten to disown me... but killing her never even crossed my mind!

SonRight2.text: Even if she thought I didn't deserved to be her heir, I would never have her killed!

SonRight3.text: I couldn't afford to, anyway! Every single Bandit in this city wants me dead. None of them would agree to murder someone for me.

SonRight3bis.text: I believe a simple examination of Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp's accounts and debts should allow us to refute the accusations made against him. What say you, my esteemed colleagues?

SonWrong1.text: Esteemed Broker Council, I would like to know how this ridiculous accusation pertains to me!

RivalRight1.text: The arena... How could you...? You... You have no proof!

line0.props.tipText: Have Malvina testify

RivalWrong1.text: I admit that the defection of my best fighters was a hard blow.

RivalWrong2.text: Still, you of all people should know that I'm perfectly capable of overcoming this setback. Did you not help me in that regard, Mercenaries?

RivalWrong3.text: Once I'd found better champions, fighters and spectators flocked to the arena again.

RivalWrong4.text: It's true that you could have had your revenge in the arena, Broker Bernna.

RivalAltWrong1.text: Haha! Mercenaries, it's as if you were born to entertain the good people of Gosenberg. You never cease to amuse me.

RivalAltWrong2.text: The Council does not take kindly to such mockery, Mercenaries.

RivalAltWrong3.text:
So it is time to put an end to it.
Esteemed colleagues, are you ready to deliver your verdict?

LeagueRight1.text: Yes, were I the killer, there is no doubt my motives would have been political. This Broker – may the Beast devour her soul – was working against the interests of the common folk!

LeagueRight2.text: But it doesn't matter considering we were all the way across the province that day!

LeagueRight3.text: Your objections have been heard, ::G2TrialPalaceAccused::. Nevertheless, I want to check with the Guard regarding this mine and slave business.

LeagueWrong1.text: Broker Council! Are you going to let these impostors accuse an honest citizen? While there was no love lost between the Broker and myself, it was not for political reasons!

Next1_F.text: Mercenaries, you have diligently explained how the defendant may have committed the crime.

Next2_F.text: Now I would like to know why she would have wanted our esteemed colleague dead. Why her and not another member of this Council?

line3.props.tipText: The defendant acted on behalf of another kingdom.

line5.props.tipText: The defendant wanted to get Bernna's Arena back.

BadEnding1.text: As the answers given by the Mercenaries during these proceedings were found lacking, the Broker Council is unable to convict ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's murder.

BadEnding2.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: can walk away a free man. As for the accusers, they are hereby sentenced to pay <gold>300</gold> to the city of Gosenberg for slander.

GoodEndAlazar1.text: Thanks to the Guard's swift assistance, the Brokers' Court obtained the treaty that the Ambassador and Broker Ald Hoevendorp were about to sign.

GoodEndAlazar2.text:
<narrator>What the Ambassador said was true.</narrator>
If you have nothing to add, Mercenaries, this court is ready to deliver its verdict.

GoodEndAlazar3.text: Despite your thorough investigation, Mercenaries, it appears you were mistaken. The Ambassador had a very good reason not to kill Broker Hoevendorp that night.

GoodEndAlazar4.text: For this reason, and in the absence of conclusive evidence, we find the defendant ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: not guilty.

GoodEndAlazar5.text: As for you, Mercenaries, you are hereby sentenced to pay a <gold>300</gold> fine to the city of Gosenberg.

GoodEndSon1.text: Despite your thorough investigation, it appears very unlikely that Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp had the means to murder his mother.

GoodEndSon2.text: We checked his financial records with the Gosenberg Treasury and confirmed that he could not afford to hire killers.

GoodEndSon3.text:
For this reason, Lyderic Ald Hoevendorp is free to leave this court.
As for you, Mercenaries, you are hereby sentenced to pay a <gold>300</gold> fine to the city of Gosenberg.

GoodEndRival1.text: It is with great dismay that the Broker Council finds that Broker Hoevendorp's killer is none other than one of her colleagues.

GoodEndRival2.text: But as the law of Gosenberg applies to all equally, we have no choice but to sentence Broker Godrik Ald Bernna to death.

GoodEndRival3.text: As for you, Mercenaries, the Broker Council and the city of Gosenberg thank you for solving this most despicable crime.

GoodEndLeague1.text: The captain of the Guard was kind enough to inform us that an attack took place in the Hoevendorp Mine on the night of the Broker's murder.

GoodEndLeague2.text: One of the recaptured slaves even swore he recognised the defendant. It is therefore impossible for ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: to have committed this crime.

GoodEndLeague3.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: can now leave the Brokers' Palace and await a subsequent trial regarding their involvement with the People's Fellowship.

GoodEndLeague4.text: As for you, Mercenaries, even though you helped arrest a member of the People's Fellowship, you were mistaken as to their crimes.

GoodEndLeague5.text: Consequently, you will have to pay a <gold>300</gold> fine before leaving this court.

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Grinmeer. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

BadEnding1_F.text: As the answers given by the Mercenaries during these proceedings were found lacking, the Broker Council is unable to convict ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: of Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's murder.

BadEnding2_F.text: ::G2TrialPalaceAccused:: can walk away a free woman. As for the accusers, they are hereby sentenced to pay <gold>300</gold> to the city of Gosenberg for slander.

G2UniversityBookshelf1.npc.name: A History of the Kingdom of Gosenberg - I

Start.text: <narrator>The Northern Kingdom was the largest and most powerful in the known world. Ruled by the Alazar family from time immemorial, it inspired both fear and respect in its neighbours.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>But discontent was brewing among its people. The Merchants and bourgeois who fostered the Kingdom's wealth were burdened by heavy taxes that left them with little of their hard-earned Krowns.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>So when General Edor set his sights on this ageing kingdom, Merchants leapt at the chance.</narrator>

G2UniversityBookshelf2.npc.name: A History of the Kingdom of Gosenberg - II

Start.text: <narrator>Deprived of Grinmeer and Vertruse, what little the Alazars still held onto was inevitably taken by General Edor. The great kingdom was annihilated.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Today, the Kingdom of Alazar is but a shadow of its former self, and its rulers can only mourn its bygone glory.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>It would come as no surprise if Alazar tried to reunify the Northern Kingdom.</narrator>

Start.text:
<narrator>This is a portrait of Professor Virgil.
Although he has been missing for over a decade, many scholars still believe he is alive.</narrator>
The lock is adorned with a scroll.
If you wanted to study the Ancients, you should have applied for a position in Alazar. Their knowledge on the subject is much more advanced than ours.

Next1.text: Have you ever been to their mountains?

Next2.text: All the knowledge in the world couldn't convince me to live in a place covered in snow all year long.

Start.text: The Universities of Gosenberg and Alazar never stopped working together, not after our kingdoms were divided nor during the war.

Say, you're Mercenaries, aren't you?
You wouldn't happen to have a few bodies to donate?

Next1.text: Since Gosenbergers are so reluctant to hand over their dead, we don't have enough corpses for our medical students to dissect. I can't bear to think what will happen when they need to trepan a living patient.

Next2.text: Provide what I need to teach my students properly, and I might be able to provide information about Wylla Ald Hoevendorp... I performed the autopsy on her body.

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to expect something from you.

Given1.text:
You didn't expose them to direct sunlight, I hope? ...
Well, it's better than nothing.

Given2.text: So, I suppose you wish to know more about Broker Hoevendorp?

Questioned.text: All of the wounds on Wylla Ald Hoevendorp's body targeted vital points, a sign of remarkable dexterity from her attackers. If you ask me, someone hired the <narrator>Rooks</narrator> for this job.

SettingLog.text: Someone may have hired the <narrator>Rooks</narrator> to kill Broker Hoevendorp.

line0.text: Give 5corpses to Professor Meren.

Start.text: Try as I might, I can't get those Harag savages to rename their marsh boar.

Next.text: Crocswine! How could anyone take my bestiary seriously?

Start.text: We're competing with the Edoran University to compile the first contemporary bestiary.

Next1.text: Isn't this contest of intellects exciting?

Start.text:
The Scholars knew that thieves would try robbing this place!
Prepare to die.

Bribe1.text: If you promise to leave quietly, this sum should be enough to convince us.

Bribe2.text: It's a deal, then. Leave and don't come back.

Start.text: A message was left on the body: Stay away from the Magnificent, it's the Rooks' territory! I don't want to provoke them! If I see any of you hanging around there, I'll cut your family jewels off!

line0.text: Dig up the dragon bones.

Start.text: The half-eaten body of a slave who took shelter in the wrong place.
Go away, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: You're sticking your nose where it doesn't belong.

Start.text: Your presence here is bad for business.
Fifteen years a slave! Fifteen years toiling in a mine! Fifteen years without seeing the light of day!

Next1.text: And the Broker Council wants me to give up on my revenge? I'll kill them all!

Start.text: We don't much like meddlers around here.
Your mother never told you to stay away from smugglers?

I'm ever astonished by the Merchants' persistent propensity to treat their sick.
Lucky for you, I've got a few remedies left.

We got here first! Get out of Grinmeer or it'll be the last place you ever visit!
This investigation's reward is ours!

line1.props.tipText: Tell your competitors what you know.

Convinced.text: I didn't think you would stoop to investigating for us, but I'm not complaining.

Start.text: I hear your troop is investigating? Come on then, give us a few tips! Mercenaries have to stick together, right?

line0.props.tipText: Tell your competitors what you know.

Convinced.text: Now that's the kind of colleagues I like. Reasonable and hard-working!

Start.text: Say whatever you want, Mercenaries, but we won't surrender! Our children and elders are counting on us to put food on the table.

Next1.text: We didn't become thieves for fun, you know. If we had enough money to feed our families, we wouldn't steal from the rich!

Give2.text: I don't know what to say, no one has ever helped us before.

Give4.text:
We're very grateful, even though it won't keep us fed for long. But at least, it gives us time to look for honest work.
Take this. I hope we won't need it again.

Start.text: Did you see those beautiful crop circles? Not bad, eh? You can see them even better from the hill. You should set up camp there and enjoy the view.

Next1.text: What? People think the Tules did it? Nonsense! All it takes is a rope, a plank and a good torch. No need to be a spirit of nature!

Next2.text: I don't see why we should stop! We can have fun in our own fields, can't we? If we want to spoil the crops, that's our problem, and a bunch of superstitious city folks have no say in it.

line0.props.tipText: Threaten the farmers.

line1.props.tipText: Suggest another way of having fun.

Scared.text:
No! Please don't harm us! We just wanted to have a bit of fun, we're not here to fight.
The harvest is in a few days, everything will be gone soon. Here, you can keep our tools.

Give.text:
You're right. A good drink keeps you busy for a while and it's much less tiring.
The crop circles will be gone soon anyway, we're harvesting in a few days. You should go up the hill to take a look one last time. We'll even get you some food.

Start.text: As artists, it is our duty to give a voice to the suffering of our peers. We will never forsake this commitment, even if it means hiding in these woods forever.

Next1.text: Our works are the embers of the wrath that will ignite the people's uprising!

line0.props.tipText: Find the right words to convince Jan the Rabble-rouser to leave.

Scared.text:
You're right. In another region, our audience will be larger and our voices louder.
We're leaving! By tonight, we'll have crossed the border. Take this and don't forget us.

Start.text: What did you find? Let me see!

Next1.text: This is... We own Bernna's Arena? I had no idea. Why is this not known to everyone in this city?

Next2.text: Did my mother buy the arena without disclosing it to the public? Curses! I wondered how Godrik Ald Bernna avoided the poor house, but this is the answer: he sold his arena!

Next3.text: Take your reward, Mercenaries. And report this to the Guard. I believe you have everything you need to prove who the murderer is.

Start.text: I must commend you, Mercenaries. This is remarkable work. The Guard...
Mercenaries! Mercenaries!

Next1.text: You have to catch the fugitives!

Next2.text: The Rooks didn't come for me! They stole something in my mother's belongings.

Next3.text: I saw them run towards the Magnificent. Hurry and retrieve what they took! It must be linked to my mother's murder.

Start.text: Don't let them escape!

Next1.text: Mercenaries! These men are murderers! Stop them! Protect the Hoevendorp heiress!

Start.text: I thought the Mercenaries were supposed to investigate the Broker's murder?

Don't worry, Mercenaries.
We'll stay here until the investigation is over. You can count on us to stop anyone who tries to raid the Embassy.
All right, then! Take the Ambassador and escort him safely to the Guard Post.

Next1.text: The peace between Alazar and Gosenberg depends on his survival! Make haste before more rioters arrive!

End.text: Run! Quickly!

Start.text:
Hand over the Ambassador!
He must pay for his crimes!

Next1.text: By Jeru, you took your time, Mercenaries!

Next2.text: Let's push back the mob, then you will escort the Ambassador.

Start.text: Death to the Ambassador!

Next1.text: Alazarian murderer!

Next2.text: Die! Die!

Start.text: Help! Help me, Mercenaries! Heathens! They're attacking us!

Next1.text: Hand over the <narrator>emblem</narrator>, Inquisitors! This insult to Alazar must be destroyed!

Next2.text:
You would destroy a sacred depiction of the divine All-seeing Eye? Blasphemy!
Mercenaries! Help!

Next3.text:
Stop squealing like pigs, Inquisitors!
Mercenaries, we want this emblem. Name your price.

Start.text:
The Eye bless you, Mercenaries.
Not only have you saved lives, but thanks to you, the Light will now shine across Gosenberg. Please accept this reward and our prayers.

Next1.text: The <narrator>emblem</narrator> we're carrying is meant to adorn the future Gosenberg Cathedral. Broker Hoevendorp commissioned it from the Edoranian Church.

Next2.text: Truth be told, this is more than a merely spiritual gesture: it will strengthen the bonds between Edoran and Gosenberg as much as it will loosen them with Alazar. What those soldiers did is proof that their king is outraged by this turn of events. But thanks to you, faith prevails. Now, we just need to reach the city.

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp offended the <narrator>King of Alazar</narrator> by getting closer to Edoran.

Start.text: By the All-Seeing Eye! We were supposed to remain unseen, but we almost ruined everything! Good thing you came this way.

Next1.text: Our mission was to steal this emblem discreetly, but the Inquisitors spotted us immediately. They protected this piece of quartzite as if it were the Eye itself!

Next2.text: Thanks to you, we can destroy it and rectify the harm Broker Hoevendorp caused our king when she commissioned the Edoranian clergy to make this blasted thing. It's painful to see our former provinces get closer to the enemy by claiming to embrace their faith.

SettingLog.text: Broker Hoevendorp offended the <narrator>King of Alazar</narrator> by strengthening ties with Edoran.

Start.text: Are you here for the Arena Clash?

Next1.text: Perfect! So you're going to represent me, right?... Right?

Next2.text: Please, I'm in desperate need of skilled champions to restore my arena's reputation. I beg you! Do this for me, and I swear the reward will be worth it.

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

Accepted1.text: Thank you! You won't be disappointed, I promise. All I ask is that you win! It should be easy enough for warriors like you.

ComeAgain.text: So, have you made your decision? Are you going to represent me? Please say yes! I really need you!

line1.props.disableReason: This person seems to want something from you.

MissionDesc.text: Win the Arena Clash.

Start.text: Well, well, Mercenaries! I hear you're having a grand old time? I'm not paying you to visit brothels! I demand to know where my brother is.

Next1.text: ... Son of a crocswine!

Next3.text: First that juggler, then the brothel, and now debts? By Saint Eleor, please tell me this isn't true.

Next4.text: Fine! In this case, take your reward. No point spending another Krown if all it does is sully my family's good name. I hope for his sake the Bandits get him before I do!

Next5.text: To think I suspected him of being involved in my mother's murder! With so much debt, he couldn't even get slaves to work for him.

SettingLog.text: The <narrator>Hoevendorp son</narrator> could never afford to hire assassins.

Start.text: <narrator>This pig is probably the most magnificent animal you've ever seen, the epitome of porcine beauty. It must be extremely valuable.</narrator>

We fought for our freedom!
We killed to reclaim our dignity!

Next1.text: Never again will we be slaves. We would rather die!

Next1bis.text: Come at us if you dare. You'll meet the same fate as the mine's foremen.

Next2.text: Oiiinnnk!

Negociated1.text: What do you mean, you just want the pig? Are you serious?

Negociated2.text: Well then, go ahead and take it. We'll find something else for dinner.

Exchanged1.text: You're not here to kill or capture us? Really? You're only interested in this pig?

Start.text: No surrender! We won't go back to the mines! We'd rather die free than remain slaves!

Next1.text: If it's really what you want...

Next2.text: Mercenaries! Over here! <narrator>The All-seeing Eye guides us! The All-seeing Eye guides us!</narrator>

Next3.text: Not this chanting again?! You've lost your mind! Mercenaries! Help us stop these fanatics. You'll be rewarded handsomely!

Next4.text: Stand by us, Mercenaries! <narrator>The All-seeing Eye guides us!</narrator> We're just reclaiming our freedom!

Start.text: Well! That was a mighty thrashing you gave them, good sirs!

Next1.text: Thanks to you, no one will end up in jail tonight. Our people had time to run away.

Next2.text: I'm sure the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> will want to meet you. I don't know how to contact them, but they often hang around the <narrator>church of the Saving Eye</narrator>.

Start.text: Halt!

Next1.text: Guards! Surround these peasants and do not let anyone through.

Next2.text: This pyre is an act of rebellion against the Broker Council and an insult to the late Broker Ald Hoevendorp.

Next3.text: Everyone involved must be arrested and put in chains, starting with you, Mercenaries.

line0.props.tipText: Deny being involved.

Convinced1.text: Please forgive us for accusing you so hastily, Mercenaries.

Convinced2.text: But we must stay alert, as a seditious group named the <narrator>People's Fellowship</narrator> roams this neighbourhood stirring up the baser instincts of the common folk.

Convinced3.text: Take my advice: don't hang around these parts. Here, even the priests from the <narrator>Church of the Saving Eye</narrator> are suspicious.

Tournament.text: The Arena Clash is starting in Hoevendorp's Arena.

MissionDesc.text: Take part in the Arena Clash.

MissionDesc2.text: Escort the Ambassador safely to the Postern.

NotifStart.text: The Brotherhood summons all mercenary bands to their fortress.

MissionDescStart.text: Answer the Brotherhood's call and join them in their fortress.

MissionDescEnd.text: Meet the Brotherhood in their fortress.

NotifEnd.text: You received a letter from the Brotherhood: they are waiting for news of your investigation.

NotifRobbery.text: The city's bells ring, and the rumour spreads: someone is attacking Hoevendorp Manor.

ArenaSettingEnd.text: Bernna's and Hoevendorp's Arenas are setting up new fights.

MissionDescPathMight4.text: Return to the Brotherhood's Commander to settle the score.

PathMight4Start.text: You've received a letter bearing the Brotherhood's seal: the Commander awaits in the Brotherhood's <narrator>Armoury</narrator>.

Start.text: These wounds are not a common sight in Grinmeer. The creature that inflicted them also left tracks in the grass.

line1.props.tipText:
You will be taken to the Brokers' Court with the accused.
If you fail to prove them guilty, <narrator>you will lose <gold>300</gold></narrator>.

Start.text: This altar is dedicated to the art of the Rouste: participants come here to pray for their victory in the local tournament.
Merchants left offerings to Jeru to ask for his protection on the road.
This camp was attacked by wild animals.
This camp was abandoned recently. Perhaps it belonged to a slave?

Well, well, it's not every day that we see fighters like you! You're not from around here, are you?
Don't worry, our new champion never turns down a challenge!

NoBeginArena.text: Come back when you feel brave enough!

OnLeaveArena.text: What a shame to stop when you're doing so well!

Completed.text: Your trip to Ludern certainly wasn't wasted, Mercenaries! Beating a champion like that...

Completed2.text: His weapon is yours, I hope you will wield it with pride.

Completed3.text: Come back whenever you want, Mercenaries!

ArenaLost.text: What a show! Too bad you didn't win.

ArenaDiff.text:
Do you want to try again, Mercenaries?
Get ready, because our fighters know you now!

line0.props.tipText: Take on the Arena again in Hard mode.

CompletedDiff1.text: Mercenaries! That was the best fight I've ever seen, and I was a Tracker in my youth!

CompletedDiff3.text: You can challenge Nairolf again, but only for the sake of it. You've already won all of the prizes our arena could offer.

ArenaAgain.text:
Do you miss the thrill of battle? The audience would love to watch you again.
But do note that there are no rewards left to win.

CompletedAgain.text: It's always a pleasure to see you in action. Feel free to come back, everyone loves you here.

Start.text:
If you want me to sell you anything, you'll have to prove yourselves.
This shop is for champions only.

Alt.text: I like having reputable customers.

line0.title: Invasive Species
line0.props.helpTip: Get rid of the bears that have made their den in this cave.

line0.text: Dig up the dragon bones.

Start.text: The bears don't look too pleased to see you.

line0.text: Take on Tracker Voseg's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: I can offer you a hunt, if you feel ready to take on the Ghost Pack.

Next1.text: The Tomb of the Ancients is our priority, so your help with these monsters will be appreciated.

Next2.text: Be careful. The Tracker Brotherhood was founded in Ludern for good reason. The Pack monsters run rampant here.

Wait1.text: Be careful. The Tracker Brotherhood was founded in Ludern for good reason. The Pack monsters run rampant here.

End1.text: Glad to see you are still alive. Did the Pack seem different to you this time? Maybe more unsettled or aggressive?

End2.text: Nah, forget that. Here's your reward. You've earned it.

Wait2.text: I have no other hunts for you.

Notify.text: Let the Hunt begin!

line0.title: Hunting down the Pack of Ludern

line0.text: Agree to join the Hunt.

line1.text: Follow instructions from the Ludern Hunt item to find and defeat the Ghost Pack.

line2.text: Report your victory to Master Tracker Thenevon.

Start.text: How are you, Mercenaries? Did you miss me?

Next1.text: I'm still recovering from my wounds. The apothecaries want me to stay in the camp for a few weeks, but I don't think I can wait that long.

Start.text: A man wearing strange clothes was lurking around the Tomb. We tried to intercept him, but the wretch saw us coming!

Next1.text: He managed to escape in the swamp, where the fog is thickest. When we finally gave up the chase, my sister Senuna was missing.

Next2.text: We are tasked to keep intruders out of the Tomb. We can't leave it unguarded while we're looking for Senuna, that's why we need you! We Trackers are willing to pay whatever it takes to find one of our own.

Next3.text: Could she still be with the intruder? He might lead you to her. We suspect he's a smuggler. You should ask people travelling on the roads of Ludern, maybe they'll know something.

Next4.text: Could she still be with the intruder? He might lead you to her. We suspect he's a smuggler. You should ask people travelling on the roads of Ludern, maybe they'll know something.

EndSenunaLives.text: You're coming to say hello? Make yourselves at home, our camp is your camp.

EndSenunaDead.text: What brings you here? Looking at you reminds me of what I've lost.

Start.text: I followed Senuna to the hill in Garussa before losing sight of her. This fog in the swamp... From children to Trackers, anyone would feel their blood run cold in there.

End.text: We're so glad to have Senuna back.

Start.text: You have something to trade? Strangers usually don't.

MissionDesc.text: Follow the Trackers there.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Brighid's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Follow the trail from the monster's remains.

Start.text: Are you here for a Hunt?

Next1.text: Sorry, but our scouts keep bringing us conflicting reports. I don't know what's going on, but until I get a better sense of the situation, I'd rather not send anyone after the Ghost Pack.

Track1.text: I'm glad you're here, we'll need all the best Trackers we can get.

Track2.text: The Guard told us about a monstrous carcass surrounded by strange tracks. The Pack attacks are intensifying, so this hunt could be even more dangerous than usual.

Track3.text: Are you well prepared, Mercenaries? Make sure you are and let us know. We will leave together.

Track4.text: Great, just follow us to avoid getting lost.

Start.text: Trackers are like family. Whichever clan we come from, when we're hunting the Ghost Pack, we're closer than brothers. Don't you feel the same about your Companions?

Next.text: I won't take part in this Hunt. Someone has to guard the camp.

Start.text: It's a relief to see you, Mercenaries! Now that you're here, everything will be fine.

Alt.text: You? You couldn't save my sister, and you think you'll survive a Hunt? You'd better leave right now!

Start.text: My saviours! My heroes!

Next1.text: Haha! Never thought I would stoop so low, but I have to say you deserve those titles.

Start.text: Worrying news from Ludern... Something's not right.

Next1.text: I have a bad feeling about this. It's all bringing back unpleasant memories.

Next2.text: I've been a Tracker for thirty years – a true veteran, as Edoranians say – but only once in my career have I seen such unrest.

Next3.text: What happened then... I'm the only one left to tell the tale.

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: My family was ready to die for me...
Please! No! Don't tell anyone!

line0.props.tipText: Tell the Guard that you found the woman they're looking for.

Start.text: I can't believe it. There are no marks left. I'm doing well, I even feel like eating bread!

Warn.text: Let's talk to the Guard, they have no reason to look for me now.

Start.text: We're here for Moritagre's wife. We're not leaving without her.

Next1.text: Witnesses saw a Plague-ridden monster bite her, there's no doubt she's been contaminated.

Next2.text: We sympathise with her family, but according to Harag's law, it is forbidden to protect someone who could be a danger to the community. She must die.

End1.text: You cured this woman? What sorcery is this?!

End2.text: I see, you had one of those Alazarian remedies.

End3.text: That's very generous of you, Mercenaries. But moving forward, I'd think twice about how I use my resources, if I were you. It's next to impossible to find these in Ludern.

End4.text: And now, we'll take our leave. We're done here.

Dead1.text: We'd rather follow the rituals when putting convicts to death, but they left us no choice.

Dead2.text: On behalf of Harag's judges, let me give you this.

Start.text: As I told the judge and the Guard, my wife is not here.

Next1.text: You little weasels!

Next2.text: We won't let you take my wife!

End1.text: Mercenaries... I don't even know where to start. You just saved our whole family!

End2.text: That we crossed paths was a gift from the gods! In turn, I have one for you. Please accept it.

End3.text: I feel like I just woke up from a nightmare.

Start.text: It’s because of me that Murwen was so attached to Grit. I captured him to keep her company while I was away.

Next1.text: My daughter and I grew apart during all of the years I spent fighting in the arena to keep my title. I wasn't even there for her when Grit died.

Next2.text: My life as a champion is over. If you want to learn my secret techniques, I'll be glad to teach you. On one condition, though: you must become champions of the Ludern arena to prove that you’re up to such rigorous training.

End1.text:
You did it?
I hope you didn’t win only because the new champion is too weak...

End2.text: Anyway, here’s your reward: everything I learned over the years spent away from my family.

End3.text: I'm doing my best to support Murwen.

End3Alt.text: Thank you for everything you've done. I was at my wit’s end trying to help Murwen.

line0.text: Return to the former champion after completing Nairolf's Arena.

Start.text: The ungrateful creature doesn't seem to recognise you.
Grit had been my companion and friend since I was a child.

Next1.text: He was the best boar that ever lived. He deserves to be buried with honours.

Give1.text: It means a lot to me. He would have loved these flowers.

Give2.text: I think this funeral will help me move on. I feel ready to adopt a new pet.

Give3.text: Find me a crocswine, and I'll get you something special for your four-legged companions.

line0.props.disableReason: Give a crocswine.

End1.text: What a beautiful beast ! A fine successor to Grit. Here's your reward. Promise me you'll take good care of your animals.

Wait.text: I love my new friend.

line0.title: Mourning a Friend
line0.props.helpTip: Give 5 Comfrey to Murwen.

line1.title: A New Life
line1.props.helpTip: Catch a crocswine and bring it to Murwen.

line0.title: Caged Ghosts
line0.props.helpTip: Find out what is happening here.

Start.text: The cage holding this monster captive is made of a metal very similar to the one covering Professor Winfrith's chains.
The cage holding this monster captive is made of a metal very similar to the one covering Professor Winfrith's chains.
Dammit! What's going on here?

Next1.text: These creatures... No cage could ever hold them. I don't understand.

Next2.text: I don't know how or why these monsters are caged like this, but we must free them before they attract others!

Final1.text: Who are you, and what is the meaning of this? Answer me!

Final2.text: What you see here, Trackers, is the result of almost half a century of research. This bait is one of the greatest accomplishments of the University of Alazar, second only to the cure for the Plague.

Final3.text: Bait? Why would you want to lure the Ghost Pack here? Don't you think we have enough of them to deal with as it is?

Final4.text: The Ghost Pack? No scholar worth their salt still cares about the Ghost Pack. What we're trying to lure here is much more prestigious.

Final5.text: Presti-- You're trying to lure the Beast to Ludern? Do you want to wipe out the entire region?

Final6.text: Mercenaries! If they go through with this, it will spell disaster for our kingdom! Please help us, we'll give you anything you want!

Final7.text: Nonsense! It's a perfectly calculated risk! Pay no heed to the protests of uneducated knaves. We who dedicate our lives to the pursuit of knowledge know what we're doing! This bait must be protected!

End1.text: Excellent job, Mercenaries. You bought us some precious time.

End2.text: Let's not lose any more! Everyone to the cages! We must destroy them before...

End3.text: Did you hear that?

SettingLog.text: You sided with the Trackers against the Alazarian scholars.

Start.text: I wouldn't touch that if I were you, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: I did warn you to stay away!

End1.text: Your skill is undeniable, Mercenaries. Thank you for your unwavering support to our greater cause, the pursuit of Knowledge. I hope this humble compensation will help you wait for a more adequate reward.

End2.text: What...? We've tarried too long! Run away! Now!

End3.text: Run! Run!

SettingLog.text: You let the Alazarian scholars carry out their plan.

MissionDesc.text: Find and free the man captured by Ludern.

line0.text: Take on Professor Hadwige's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Search the area south of the Stone Court to find the fugitive.

Start.text: Are you planning to go to Ludern?

Next1.text: I may have a mission for you. You'd need to free an innocent man from an unjust fate. You would be handsomely rewarded. Are you interested?

Next2.text: As you know, Alazarian commoners are forbidden from entering Harag.

Next3.text: Despite our many warnings, one of our soldiers made the terrible mistake of crossing the border.

Next4.text: His family is very worried and fears he might be dead, but our sources have given us hope: he is awaiting his trial at the Stone Court. Bring this man back to us.

End1.text: Have you rescued our soldier?

End2.text: Oh, I see he can no longer disclose anyone's plans...

End3.text: You could have spared yourself the hassle of freeing him, I suppose.

End4.text: But never mind, we have him now. Our Scholars will find a use for him. As for you, here is your reward, with the compliments of Alazar and its university.

SettingLog.text: You handed the soldier over to Alazar.

EndScholar.text: Ah, my favourite mercenaries! What do you want?

Alt1.text: The man with you... I have need of him.

Start.text: I beg of you, let me pray in peace! I'm on my way to visit the village of Garussa, the Eye's protection will be most welcome.
I'm waiting for the merchant to finish praying.

Next1.text: I was told to go to the Vertrusian Tracker camp, but I don't know how to get there.

Next2.text: She should be able to help, don't you think?

Start.text: Don't insist. The border is closed. The roads to Garussa are overrun with a Plague-ridden horde, you will have to wait until they've left.
The toll applies to all kingdoms. I hope you have enough to pay up.

Give.text: Everything is in order. You can go through.

End.text: No need to check in with me. You've paid the toll, so the border is open to you.

line0.title: To Harag
line0.props.helpTip: Pay the toll (200 or a Border Pass).

Start.text: This Alazarian soldier seems nervous.

Notification.text: People reported hearing screams coming from the Hangman's Tree.

Start.text: There is no sign of the Merchant, but you could swear you saw a toe sticking out of a Plague-ridden's mouth.
These Plague-ridden monsters seem busy.
Help! Help! Please help me!
Oh dear! I thought those monsters were going to eat me.

Next1.text: Thank the Eye you came to my rescue!

Next2.text: I'd like to give you a token of my gratitude. How about this? My customers love it.

Accept.text: I just need a moment to gather my wits, and then I'm leaving this Eye-forsaken place!

End.text: I just need a moment to gather my wits, and then I'm leaving this Eye-forsaken place!

MissionDesc.text: Meet the Alazarian Scholars in front of the Ludern Tomb.

line0.text: Take on Professor Winfrith's mission.

line1.text: Use Winfrith's Map to find where they will be meeting.

line2.text: Follow the trail to the Ghost Pack.

line0.text: Take on Professor Winfrith's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Explore the Ludern Tomb with Professor Winfrith.

Start.text: Good to see you answer promptly when called, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: You may not be aware of it, but you've been a great help, and you've shown us that you are both reliable and competent.

Next2.text: That is precisely what I require for a very special mission. Have you ever hunted the Ghost Pack?

NextAccept1.text: First off, you will escort me to the beginning of the trail.

NextAccept2.text: Here's a map of the place drawn by our sources. Lead the way.

AltStart.text: So you came! I wasn't sure you would.

AltNext1.text: I don't know if it's deliberate or if you've grown fond of Harag's savages, but you've been a thorn in our side all along.

AltNext2.text: Unfortunately for me, you are the only mercenaries capable of seeing this mission through...

AltNext3.text: To prevent any unfortunate slip-ups on your part, you will only be briefed moments before the mission starts. Do I make myself clear?

AltAcceptMission1.text: First off, you will escort me to a specific location.

AltAcceptMission2.text: Here's a map of the place drawn by our sources. Lead the way.

Start.text: It would have been a shame to lose such reliable allies, I am pleased to see you safe and sound.

Next1.text: What a tear-jerking reunion!

Next2.text: Let's get straight to the point. Thanks to you, the Beast showed up in Ludern, and the whole region was thrown into disarray by its unexplained appearance.

Next3.text: It's all going according to plan: while the Trackers and the Guard are giving this Calamity their undivided attention, their precious Tomb is left unguarded.

Next4.text: Do you understand what this means, Mercenaries? For the first time in history, the Ludern Tomb is within our grasp. The treasures, wisdom and secrets within... will soon be known to us!

Next5.text: Would you like the honour of unveiling them with us? You have our trust, and we wouldn't turn down a few extra blades.

Accept.text: Time is of the essence! We managed to lure the Beast here, but it won't stay long. As soon as the Trackers realise it's gone, they will come back to defend their Tomb.

Start.text: Where did the Beast go? I have no idea.

Next1.text: This monster is both invincible and uncontrollable. We found a way to lure it where we want, but keeping it there is something else entirely...

Next2.text: Actually, according to our estimates, the Beast has already left the region.

Start.text: I'm not sure I would have made it without your help. Be killed by Trackers or eaten alive by Plague-ridden monsters... I would have been hard-pressed to choose...

Next1.text: Fortunately, and thanks to your most heroic intervention, I managed to give Winfrith and Hadwige all of the topological data collected around the Tomb.

Start.text: It's so good to see you, Mercenaries! I've been talking Winfrith and Hadwige's ear off about your heroic deeds in the village.

Next1.text: They were very disappointed by my failed experiment, though. Instead of luring the Beast, all I did was drive the crocswine mad. Good thing they had a better plan...

Notify.text: People reported hearing screams coming from the Nerprun Mine.

line0.title: Blocked Path
line0.props.helpTip: Uncover the origin of the noise the miners heard.

Notify.text: People reported hearing screams coming from the mine.

Start.text: These rats attacked the miners... and it looks like they won.
I don't see what all the fuss is about. We hear strange noises in the mines all the time! Why fret about those in particular?

Next1.text: Oh all right, I admit we were right to be wary of those noises. Thank you, Mercenaries.

Start.text: I swear the noise I heard came from a monster. Maybe a Plague-ridden or a groattle? We must warn the Guard immediately!

Next1.text: Ah! I knew it! The tunnel was overrun with monsters!

Start.text: We've been trying to come to a decision for two days. Maybe you can help?

Next1.text: We closed off the secondary tunnel after hearing very unsettling noises, but since then, not a peep.

Next2.text: We're hesitant to call upon the Guard or the Trackers, because if we raise the alarm for no reason... we'll be the laughingstock of the whole village. But if we destroy the barricade and a huge mischief of rats contaminates the region... everyone will blame us!

Next3.text: Do you think... you could take a look for us?

BarricadeDestroyed.text: You destroyed the barricade... because you're going to check if there's anything inside the tunnel, right? You won't leave us to deal with this on our own, will you?

End1.text: Mole-rats? Oh no! We'll be on our guard from now on.

End2.text: Thanks for checking, we owe you.

Final.text: I hope the mole-rats didn't eat our tools.

Start.text: You feel a draft blowing through the nest.
You found where the noises came from.

line0.title: The Ultimate Weapon
line0.props.helpTip: Bring 20 Mosquito proboscises to Nalyd.

Start.text: My weapon? Oh! It's called Bog Thunder. Legend has it my family inherited it from the Tules.

Next1.text: This weapon is vital to anyone travelling through the swamp... I can give it to you, but you'll have to do something for me in return.

Next2.text: I'm gathering alchemical reagents to sell at the border, and mosquito proboscises are in high demand right now. Bring me a few.

End1.text: Wonderful! Thanks to these proboscises, I will be able to leave swampy Ludern and move far away to sunny Gosenberg!

End2.text: Bog Thunder is yours! Take it, I insist. I can't be seen around the city with such a weapon.

line0.title: Historical Secrets
line0.props.helpTip: Use 1 Golden Key to open the trapdoor.

Start.text: Watch your step! This place is steeped in history!

Next1.text: Not much remains of the war between Harag and Edoran, most of it was destroyed or swallowed by the swamps.

Next2.text: Isn't it incredible that a 30-year conflict between two powerful kingdoms can vanish from the land and our memories a mere fifty years later? Quite humbling, isn't it?

Start.text: <narrator>The conquest of Harag was child's play. Their clans, spread out across the marshland, offered little resistance on the battlefield, barely slowing down our Legion's progress.</narrator>

line0.props.tipText: Continue reading the Journal.

Next1.text: <narrator>I'm almost ashamed to have been named Governor of Ludern, as we were victorious, not because of our strength but because of our enemy's weakness.</narrator>

line0.props.tipText: Continue reading the Journal.

Next2.text: Nevertheless, I promise to hold this office with dignity. I aim to usher this backward region into the modern era by building a village that will rival those of the other civilised lands. I think I shall call it Lethyre.

Start.text: <narrator>The new recruits have just arrived from Arthes. Judging by the expression on their faces, they are not impressed by us.</narrator>

Next1.text: <narrator>Ever since the Plague decimated Lethyre, troop morale has been low. Ludern resistance attacks have intensified, cardinal mosquitoes are harassing us ceaselessly, and even the crocswine have grown bolder and are snapping at our troops.</narrator>

Next2.text: <narrator>I'm not as strong as I used to be, and I fear the same is true of General Edor. We have no choice but to call a truce.</narrator>

Start.text: I can't believe it! How did you find this entrance? This room is... a real treasure trove!

Next.text: Look at all this! Scrolls! Maps! And this, isn't it a plan outlining the siege of Garussa? ... There's even a report signed by General Edor himself!

Start.text: Help us! Please! They'll be back any minute!

Next1.text: I beg of you! In the name of the Eye, open this cage!

line0.title: Locked Cage
line0.props.helpTip: Use 1Ornate Key to free the prisoners.

Start.text: They were planning to sell us as slaves! Slaves!

Next1.text: And those damned clans! These two-faced Trackers who claim to fight against such cruelty, they didn't lift a finger!

Next2.text: Let's go back to our people at the Sawmill. They must be worried sick.

Next3.text: Thank you, Mercenaries. We will never forget what you've done for us. You will be forever in our prayers.

Start.text: I don't concern myself with local affairs. I just do my job, buying and selling, no questions asked.
These heretics arrested me for trying to save their souls!

Next1.text: Get me out of here, and I swear by the All-Seeing Eye that I will pledge to you everything the Inquisition has taught me.

Start.text: I am legally obligated to give you a reward for each <inf>outlaw</inf> you bring in.

Deliver.text: Here's your reward. I hope the new guy will be quiet, for a change.

NoSlotAvailable.text: Sorry, but we can't take any more prisoners. You can keep this one.

Start.text: Listen to this silence, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: No one has set foot within these walls for a thousand years, maybe more!

Next2.text: All that we know about the people buried here comes from the legends of those Harag boors. Today, you and I will uncover the truth!

Start.text:
I can't quite believe we are actually here.
I never thought I would have this honour.

Next1.text: We're about to explore the Tomb of a man and a woman revered as guardian gods in Ludern, and are among the foremost deities of Harag.

Start.text: The inscription reads Narses. Maybe the name of the man this statue?
This inscription reads Horoun. Maybe the name of the woman this statue?
Please! Don't kill me! I know it's sacrilege to even enter this place, but I beg of you, hear me out!

Next1.text: I was standing watch outside to stop Smugglers or Alazarians from sneaking inside when this vile creature attacked me.

Next2.text: A rat! A Plagued Rat! It lunged at me and knocked me over, then ran inside the Tomb. I tried to catch it, of course, but it managed to escape. And then... I realised it bit me.

Next3.text: If you give me a cure, I promise to help you. Otherwise, at least let me go buy one from the Smugglers.

line0.props.tipText: Give the man a cure.

line1.props.tipText: Let the man go.

Leave.text: Thank you for giving me a chance. Whoever you are, I bid you farewell.

Start.text: Old moth-eaten drapes and a myriad of spider webs block the way.

Move.text: ::name:: caught their foot in the obstacle: <status>::injury::</status>

FireNotif.text: The spider webs burst into flames: the path is clear.

Start.text: These warriors were buried at the same time as the main occupants of the Tomb. Hard to say whether it was an honour or a sacrifice.
A Scholar Companion might be able to decipher the inscriptions on this headstone.

Next1.text: The inscription reads: Horoun, you who walked the path of the stars first… soon reunited… together. The rest is unreadable.

Start.text: The grave is empty? That's... impossible! The goddess's body should be here!

Next.text: Those damn scholars! They had the gall to move her! We must find them before they take her from Ludern!

Start.text: What do you mean, the grave is empty? That's impossible!

Next1.text: By the All-seeing Eye, it's true! The grave really is empty!

Next2.text: I don't understand. The sarcophagi of the Ancients always contain a body! This woman must be somewhere around here! Let's look for her, human remains are vital to our research.

Start.text: Don't tell me this grave is empty!

Next1.text: Curses, I can't believe it! Where are the bodies?

Next2.text: My patience has run out, Mercenaries. What should have been the discovery of the century is turning into a humiliating failure! We must find these bodies!

Start.text: No body here either? Dammit!

Next1.text: How on earth did the Scholars manage to plunder both sarcophagi so quickly? How?!
