Next2.text: We have to find them before they take the remains to Alazar! Quickly, they can't have gone far!

Start.text: A Scholar Companion might be able to decipher the inscriptions on this headstone.

Next1.text: The inscription reads: Beware whom you challenge, intruder! Know that Narses never lets an offence go unpunished.

Notify.text: The sarcophagus was booby-trapped: ::name:: was injured (<status>::injury::</status>)

Start.text: No body here either? Curses!

Next1.text: How on earth did the Scholars manage to plunder both sarcophagi so quickly? What?

Next2.text: We must find them before they take the remains to Alazar! Quickly, they can't have gone far!

Start.text: Don't tell me this grave is empty!

Next1.text: Curses, I can't believe it! Someone booby-trapped the sarcophagus, but what's the point if it's already empty?

Next2.text: My patience has run out, Mercenaries. What should have been the discovery of the century is turning into a humiliating failure! We must find the bodies!

Start.text: What do you mean, the grave is empty? That's impossible.

Next1.text: By the All-seeing Eye, it's true! The grave really is empty!

Next2.text: I don't understand. The sarcophagi of the Ancients always contain a body! This man must be somewhere around here! Let's look for him, human remains are vital to our research.

Start.text: The grave is empty? That's... impossible! The god's body should be here!

Next1.text: Those damn Scholars! They had the gall to move him! We must find them before they take him from Ludern!

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: The door is locked.
This Plagued Rat has strayed far from its nest. It looks frightened and vulnerable.
Three paths open up before you. A banner hangs in front of each one. Which way will you go?

Notification.text: But how did you get back here?

Start.text: There was something in the folds of this banner.
This grave was emptied recently. You can still see the imprints left by the two bodies and the weapons buried with them.
Finally! Finally! We found them, blessed be the All-seeing Eye!

Next1.text: I was starting to lose hope! Good thing this room was the last one. Grab what you can, I'll handle the bodies and scrolls. Hurry!

Next2.text: We'll leave as soon as you're ready. Let's not waste any more time, the Trackers could return at any moment.

Start.text: Drats! We almost had them!

Next1.text: I was hoping we would find the gods' bodies here, but they really did take them...

Next2.text: The Scholars stole everything! Their weapons, scrolls, jewellery, everything...

Next3.text: No... Wait! Look down this hallway. They dropped some of their loot when they fled... Which means we interrupted them!

Next4.text: If there's still a chance to catch them, we must try. Let's get out of here. Quickly!

Start.text: ::H1RuinsRoom13Tracker:: wants to speak to you.
You are being followed... Your Companions can hear a raspy breath echoing against the walls.

Next1.text: Suddenly, your torches illuminate a distorted face.

Start.text: The atmosphere in the halls is strained. Your Companions can sense eyes watching them. A pot shatters on the floor, giving away the creatures that were following them.
The atmosphere in the halls is strained. Your Companions can sense eyes watching them. A pot shatters on the floor, giving away the creatures that were following them.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Brighid's mission.

line1.text: Enter the Tomb and help the Trackers protect it.

line0.text: Take on Professor Winfrith's mission.

line1.text: Enter the Tomb and help the Scholars uncover its secrets.

Start.text: Entering the Tombs is taboo for our people. The gods built them and still dwell there as spirits.

Next1.text: I've never had the honour of going inside. You must be the first strangers who are allowed to set foot in there. What an unsettling day...

Next2.text: But we must punish the raiders and stop them from causing any further harm in Ludern. Are you ready?

Start.text: I can't help but think this whole thing is a huge waste of resources and manpower. Everything would have been so simple if the people of Harag weren't so headstrong and superstitious.

Next1.text: Now that they've seen how determined we are, I hope they will know better than to stand between Alazarian Scholars and their tombs.

Next2.text: I'm heading back to Alazar to report on our success. Winfrith will see to the artefact shipment. Take this as a parting gift.

End.text: I'm heading back to Alazar to report on our success. Winfrith will see to the artefact shipment.

Start.text: The secrets of this Tomb are finally within our reach! Everything we've done, all the risks we've taken, all the gold we've spent... Our efforts will finally pay off!

Next1.text: Join me one last time and together, we will uncover the secrets of this Tomb, avoid its traps, and defeat its creatures to unveil the treasures hidden within.

Next2.text: The University of Alazar and its leaders are forever in your debt. You won't be disappointed by their reward!

Start.text: Take this, it's dark inside. We cannot come with you, we must patrol the grounds. The Beast could return.

End.text: Don't worry about us. Be careful.

Start.text:
Oh, poor fellow!
It must be hard to lose all of your friends, then see your beliefs quashed by a bunch of strangers.

Next1.text: Good thing we freed him from this torment.

Next2.text: Mercenaries, you carried out your mission most honourably! Thanks to you, the University of Alazar now has new mummies and hundreds of scrolls to study. Who knows what knowledge we may yet glean from the Ancients?

Next3.text: As for your reward, how about their relics? As beautiful as they are, they hold little interest for us.

Next4.text: The time has come to part ways, Mercenaries. Before you go, I would like to bestow upon you the title of Knights of Alazar on behalf of our Kingdom and University. Bear it with pride.

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Ludern. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

Start.text: So it was you...

Next1.text: The night the Beast appeared and killed the best Trackers in Ludern, it was you.

Next2.text: Why? So that you could sneak inside our most sacred place and plunder it?

Next3.text: No words can express the contempt and disgust I'm feeling.

Next4.text: I'll not waste another second talking to rats like you. Death is all you deserve.

Start.text: We did it! You did it!

Next1.text: I would love nothing more than to invite you to a great feast to celebrate this victory, but there's still much to be done. The artefacts and bodies stolen by the Scholars must be returned to their rightful place.

Next2.text: Here's your reward, as promised... I would also like you to have the gods' relics. You deserve them more than anyone.

Next3.text: You're part of our people now, and I say this in earnest. You protected us from the Scholars and the Beast, while keeping the gods safe. Who else if not you could be called Children of Harag?

Notify.text: You have finished The Fate of Ludern. It is time to go forth and explore other regions.

Start.text: Halt! Stop right there!

Next1.text: What the...

Next2.text: Oh, by the All-seeing Eye! You again!

Next3.text: Are you running away with your tail between your legs, Scholars?

Next4.text: After unleashing the Beast on Ludern, desecrating the Tomb and stealing the bodies of our gods, you have the nerve to make off like thieves?

Next5.text: Mercenaries! Will you bring justice to Ludern and its Trackers?

Start.text: Trust me! If you go into this Tomb, I will follow you!

End1.text: I think we've seen everything we wanted to see.

End2.text: This is where we part ways.

Start.text: Who goes there? What do you want?

Next1.text: Oh! Oh, please excuse me, I'm on edge. Our little community is beset by misfortune. We used to make a point of welcoming newcomers with our faith and hearts on our sleeves,

Next2.text: but these abductions... have made us wary. Bandits attack anyone who leaves the Sawmill. Just this month, two of our faithful were abducted. If you find them, Mercenaries, I beg of you, bring them back to us.

End1.text: You brought them back safe and sound! They told us how you defeated those Bandits. We still can't believe how brave you were.

End2.text: Praised be Saint Jeru for guiding you to us. I don't know how to thank you... Maybe you will find this useful?

Wait.text: I will hold a ceremony in your honour. Would you like to stay and attend the sermon? It shouldn't last more than an hour or two.

line0.text: Find the Faithful abducted by Bandits.

line1.text: Go back to speak with the Community of the Light.

Start.text: During the war, Edoranian missionaries converted many to the Faith of the Light.

Next1.text: But our community has been losing members by the day, ever since the two kingdoms called a truce.

Start.text: The Guard doesn't care if we disappear!

Next1.text: Banning us from cities is one thing, but leaving us to fend for ourselves against Bandits...

End1.text: I'm listening to the retelling of your adventures for the fourth time. This tale never gets old.

Start.text: You came to visit us?

Next1.text: Welcome, I can't thank you enough for what you've done.

Start.text: I try not to dwell on what could have happened to me.

Next1.text: Every time my mind wanders to that cage, I start working, I pray or I think about your troop to lift my spirits.

line0.title: Strategic Retreat
line0.props.helpTip: Protect the fleeing Smugglers.

line1.title: Closed Trapdoor
line1.props.helpTip: Use 1 Lockpick to get into the farm's basement.

Start.text: The lock is covered in mud.
Come in, this hideout is no longer safe, now that the Guard is on our heels.

Next1.text: I am looking for a way out of Ludern, and Mercenaries such as you would certainly make things easier for us.

Next2.text: Protect us until we get to safety, and you can have half of our supplies.

Start.text: I hate Ludern. This land is cursed.
We Smugglers are the only ones providing the people of Harag with Plague remedies. To think that the Guard wonders why no one wants to rat us out!

I thought I heard a noise...
Kill those rats!

Bribe1.text: Anyone would be hard-pressed to turn down that many Krowns...

Bribe2.text: You're in luck, we're letting you go. This time.

Note.text: We're missing a bomb! The inventor played us for fools!

Notif.text: You bested the security system and stole the Smugglers' treasure.

Note.text: <narrator>The wealthy merchant is surrounded by bandits.</narrator>
<narrator>A Light key is preyed upon by a danger coming from below, while another is under threat from the left.</narrator>

<narrator>Encrypting the instructions should be enough, those Harag savages can barely read.
We'll need them when we come back for the treasure.</narrator>
<narrator>The wealthy merchant's key is protected by three different guardians.</narrator>
<narrator>The wealthy merchant is standing next to a colleague.</narrator>
<narrator>There is only one peasant to protect the wealthy merchant's key.</narrator>
<narrator>The Light keys are grouped together.</narrator>

Start.text: Looks like these crocswine have laid claim to the Rouste Pitch.

line0.title: That'll do, Pigs
line0.props.helpTip: Rid the pitch of crocswine.

line0.text: Win a Rouste Match in Ludern.

Start.text:
I didn't know Harag savages knew anything about Rouste.
Do you think they play like in Gosenberg?
Good thing crocswine don't care about alcohol casks! Can you imagine if players didn't have anything to drink?
Thanks for taking out the vermin. I was worried we wouldn't hold out until the Trackers arrived.

Next1.text: ... By the way, you didn't recover a ball in one of those beasties' bellies by any chance? I can't find it anywhere.

line1.props.tipText: Keep the Chewed-Up Ball.

BallYes2.text:
I think this ball is too damaged to play with. I'm going to check if we have another one.
Thanks anyway.

BallYes3.text: If you want to play Rouste, let me know.

BallNope1.text: Players will have to use a ball from storage while I rummage through crocswine dung.

BallNope2.text: Let me know when you're ready for a match. Ludern's team will be happy to face their saviours.

Rouste1.text: You want to play against us? I hope you've been training, because most of our players used to be Trackers.

Rouste3.text:
A crushing victory!
Take this reward, I made it myself from an old ball.

Rouste4.text: Come play with us whenever you want. The local team is enraged by your score, so they won't go down easy next time!

RousteDiff1.text: Feel like playing again? Watch out, our players really want to win this time.

line0.props.tipText: Play Ludern's team in Hard mode.

RousteDiff2.text: You set the bar very high, Mercenaries! I thought a team of former Trackers would give you more trouble.

RousteDiff3.text: Enjoy your reward, it's the last one you'll get on this pitch. Next time you face our team, it'll be only for sport.

RousteEnd1.text: How about a friendly match? Be careful though, our Trackers always take it very seriously!

line0.props.tipText: Play Ludern's team in Hard mode.

RousteEnd2.text: Another great match! I hope you enjoyed it as much as I did.

Start.text: This pitch was built on crocswine mating grounds.

Next1.text: We would have picked a better spot, but this one was designated by the Tules.

Start.text: I hope we'll have time for a few matches before the crocswine come back.
Hey! You! Mercenaries! Are you here to play Rouste?

Next1.text: Then help us drive out those nasty crocswine! They've overrun the pitch!

line0.props.tipText: Dispatch the crocswine.

Start.text: My mother died twenty years ago! I saw her get eaten alive by the Plague-ridden!

Next1.text: But now, my father wants to go and rescue her.

Next2.text: Whenever I turn my back, he grabs his bow and tries to jump out the window. He's going to drive me as mad as he is.

Next.text: It's strange, I don't remember ever seeing my father so calm. Whatever you've done, you have my thanks.

Start.text: I must find Bionn! She deserves to rest in peace!

Next.text: Bionn was the greatest Tracker in the world and the best person to ever live in this Eye-forsaken kingdom. Why won't they let me help her?

line0.props.tipText: Convince the old fool that his wife is dead (without proof).

line1.props.tipText: Give Bionn's Torque as proof of her death.

Convince1.text: ... You're right. She must be dead, it's been such a long time.

Convince2.text:
I was deluding myself. To think that I caused my daughter and son-in-law such grief...
Take this. I set it aside for the day I would be reunited with Bionn, but I don't want to keep it any more.

Give1.text: It's... her torque. Oh! My dearest Bionn! I hope you found peace.

Give2.text: For years, the guilt of leaving her to her fate had been eating away at me.

Give3.text: Take this. I was keeping it for my future grandchildren, but you're family now.

End.text: I miss Bionn every single day, ever since we were torn apart. But thanks to you, I now know she's waiting for me in the afterlife.

line0.title: Mad Love
line0.props.helpTip: Find out what happened to Bionn or convince the man that she's dead.

Start.text: Don't let my father-in-law distract you, he's half-senile. Instead, have a look at our fine beasts.
I'm still an apprentice, so I'm not allowed to handle pigments. My duties are limited to cleaning the coal oven and doing the laundry.

Next1.text: But I'm not your average servant! One day, I will be a druid, and then even Trackers will bow before me.

Start.text: What brings you here? This is a sacred place.

Next1.text: Oh? You're interested in our war paints? You're not like most strangers! Usually, people from other kingdoms find our customs barbaric.

Next2.text: I could show you how we prepare the pigments, if you promise not to touch anything.

Accept1.text: Very well, let's begin. The only problem is that I'm out of raw materials...

Accept2.text: For the most common colour, I need to make bone char using – you've guessed it – bones. Just bring me a few animal carcasses. The swamp and the forest are hunting grounds where prey can be found in abundance.

line0.props.tipText: You might even be rewarded with a tattoo in return.

End1.text: These carcasses will do nicely. Now we'll bury them and leave them to burn for a few hours, shielded from the wind and sun.

End2.text: The resulting bone char is of a pure black colour, aptly called bone black. We use it as paint pigments, but some clans prefer turning it into tattoo ink.

End3.text: All right, it's time to reap the rewards of your work: the char is perfect. Are you ready for your transformation?

line0.props.tipText: Accept the war paint.

line1.props.tipText: Decline the offer.

RefuseEnd.text: Maybe I got a little ahead of myself. Thanks again for the bones. If you change your mind, you know where to find me.

line0.title: Bone Black
line0.props.helpTip: Bring 20 Animal Carcasses.

Start.text: I love studying combat techniques from other regions.
Looking to improve your skills? We offer various technical manuals and we can also upgrade your weapons, at a very affordable price.

Respec.text: Come back whenever you want. The Brotherhood has camps in each kingdom.

Start.text: The man is shaking with fear in his cage. The judges seem to be ignoring him.

Next.text: The man leaps out and run as soon as the cage opens.

End.text: The man doesn't recognise you and keeps on mumbling gibberish.

MissionDesc.text: Find the soldier.

MissionDesc1.text: Take the soldier to the Ludern judges.

MissionDesc2.text: Take the soldier to Professor Hadwige.

line0.text: Pick open the cage holding the soldier captive.

line1.text: Search the area south of the Stone Court to find the fugitive.

line2.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text: We found this man alone among the dismembered bodies of his companions.

Next1.text: We have no idea how he got there, but his clothes speak for themselves: any stranger from Alazar setting foot in Harag is to be punished by death.

Start.text: Leave us, Mercenaries. We are preparing to hold criminal proceedings. An Alazarian soldier made his way into our territory, this is a very serious matter.

CageOpened1.text: What happened? Where is the prisoner?

CageOpened2.text: He escaped? We must catch him before he kills anyone else!

CageOpened3.text: This man was surrounded by dismembered bodies when he was found! Maybe he butchered his own companions using some unknown weapon!

CageOpened4.text: Catch him before it's too late, Mercenaries! We must protect the good people of Garussa!

CageOpenedWait.text: Catch him before it's too late, Mercenaries! We must protect the good people of Garussa!

End1.text: Did you catch him?

End2.text: Phew! I don't know what we would’ve done if you hadn't been here at the exact moment the prisoner escaped!

End3.text: We will resume our little interrogation. We need to find out why Alazar sent him and his companions, and what happened to them. Take this. We're just glad we got our hands on him.

SettingLog.text: You handed the Alazarian soldier over to the Ludern judges.

EndDruids.text: We must find out if he was the one who killed his companions.

EndScholar.text: Disappeared? Curses! We never should’ve relied on foreigners!

Start.text: The look in this Plague-ridden's eyes is different from the other afflicted. It chills your Companions' souls.
More Mercenaries? Do you think you're the first ones the Legion sent after us?

Next1.text: We've killed wretches like you in all of the provinces and counties on this blasted continent!

Next2.text: But we won't give up! If necessary, we'll go to the end of the world to find our one true Colonel! And when we come back, Alexa Grathan will make the General shake in his boots!

line0.props.tipText: Convince them that Colonel Alexa Grathan is not here.

Convinced1.text: Are you sure? Our intel mentioned a mountain, though. Or maybe it's not in Ludern...

Convinced2.text: All right, we'll take our search elsewhere. Thank you for your help. Since our coup, no one has offered to help us.

Start.text: Are you looking to buy something? Might I interest you in these splendid tools from Gosenberg? Just look at this little scythe and...

Next1.text: Oh! You're not interested... I should've known, people around here would rather hunt than plough the fields...

Next2.text: Pah! No matter, I won't be discouraged. Who knows, maybe the next customer will finally buy something!

line0.props.tipText: Convince the poor sod that he's wasting time and money.

line1.props.tipText: Pay for his junk without taking it.

Convince1.text: You may be right. I've been in Ludern for three months and I've only sold a few rakes. Maybe it's time to stop dreaming.

Convince2.text: How disappointing! Take this, it's free. At least I won't have to lug it back to Gosenberg.

Buy1.text: What? You really want to buy everything? But... you're also letting me keep my wares? Well, I suppose mercenaries don't have much use for rakes.

Buy2.text: Thank you, my friends! I can already imagine the pride on my children's faces when I return to them rich as a Broker.

BuyAccept.text: Take this, I insist! It brought me luck, so it's only right that I pass it on to you.

Start.text: You... must... help us.

Next1.text: Find them! Find the Smugglers...

Next2.text: They have the potions! Give us the potions!

GiveMeat1.text: Goodness! I feel much better. Hunger drives you mad! As soon as you skip a meal, you devolve into an animal.

GiveMeat2.text: Thanks to you, we've caught a break. I hope it will give us enough time to find these forsaken Smugglers.

GiveMeat3.text: Take this. We must spare the rest of our Krowns so that we can afford potions to fight the Plague.

Start.text: Oh! Blessed be the Eye! I feel reborn!

GivePotion2.text: Can you see a change? Has the swelling gone down? I think we'll be right as rain after a good night's sleep!

GivePotion3.text: No need to look for the Smugglers now. We can give you what we planned to barter with them. Thank you, Mercenaries. I'm not sure we would've found them in time...

Start.text: The Guard wasn't lying - it's a ghost wolf carcass, all right.

Next1.text: Unsettling to find it here... There hasn't been a hunt in a while. I can't imagine what killed it, out here in the middle of nowhere. These wheel tracks are the only clue.

Next2.text: Let's get to the bottom of this. Find the merchant or traveller who came here before us. They might've seen something.

Start.text: Senuna! By the gods! You're alive!

Next1.text: Since the Mercenaries never returned, I abandoned my post to try and find out more. The Smugglers told me about this village...

Next2.text: You shouldn't have abandoned our companions. The Mercenaries and I did rather well. They even thought to let the trespasser get eaten. Well done, by the way.

Next3.text: I see. Don't feel sorry for that man. He's one of the vermin crossing our borders to try and raid our Tombs. In killing them, you do Harag a great service.

Accept.text: I hope this reward will be of use to you. We'll return to our camp. Perhaps we'll meet again.

SettingLog.text: You saved Senuna from the Cursed Village.

Start.text: Is there... no one else with you? Where's Senuna?

Next1.text: Oh... She didn't make it. I... I suppose she followed the trespasser in there?

Next2.text: I hope that rat's dying moments were agonising! Not only did he try to loot our sacred Tomb, but he drew my sister into his madness as well!

Next3.text: And you lot... you're completely useless! Look at the state of you, and for what?! Take your reward and don't come begging for what I promised - I wanted my sister back alive!

SettingLog.text: You didn't save Senuna from the cursed village.

Start.text:
Phew! We made it. Thank you!
I can't bear to think of the terrible fate that awaited me had you not been there.

Next1.text: Sure, I made my way into Ludern illegally. But does that mean I deserved to die eaten by Plague-ridden monsters or hanged by Trackers?

Next2.text:
No! Absolutely not!
I'm glad you understood that. I suppose I owe you a little something for your troubles.

Accept.text: Well, I'll take my leave, now we're even. And... er... avoid telling the Companions about that madwoman. It's for the best, believe me.

SettingLog.text: You saved the Scholar from the Cursed Village.

Start.text: Why is he still alive? Why did you protect him?

Next1.text: By the Eye, there is no need for another tantrum! We just made it out of a cursed village! Can't you just be grateful to the Mercenaries?

Next2.text: I'll be grateful to them when you're dead, you Alazarian scum! Whether you like it or not, Mercenaries, I will kill him!

Next3.text: Mercenaries! Don't let her do this! I'm willing to go right now, and leave Ludern forever! She's a madwoman, and all I ask is to live in peace!

SenunaLives.text: A wise decision, Mercenaries. Truly, you share our values and our struggles. Take this - I'm sure my brother didn't promise you as much.

SettingLog1.text: You saved Senuna from the Cursed Village.

ScholarLives.text: By the Eye, I'm still shaking. Many thanks, Mercenaries. Here, this is all I have on me. I hope it's more than what the Trackers promised you.

SettingLog2.text: You saved the Scholar from the Cursed Village.

Start.text: That was a very impressive fight!

Next1.text: The skilful way you narrowly escaped death...

Next2.text: But let us tarry no longer! We must think of your reward. Give me the creatures you have captured.

Reward.text: That should do it. Here's your reward. You certainly earned it.

Accept.text: One last thing: If I were you, I'd avoid North Ludern over the next few days. In fact, I would simply leave the region entirely...

SettingLog.text: You helped Professor Winfrith capture Ghost Pack monsters.

Start.text: This Ghost Pack is ideal for what you are trying to accomplish, Mercenaries.

Next1.text: I need three of these monsters... alive.

Next2.text: Don't give me that look! These abominations can be captured, just like any other animal! If you have the right tools, that is.

Next3.text: Look at these chains: they were made in a secret alchemical alloy, created by the most eminent of our Scholars. To this day, it is the only metal capable of holding these monsters. Take these, and capture the Ghost Pack.

line0.props.tipText: Take the chains and start fighting.

NotifyObjectiveFight.text: You must capture at least 3 Ghost Units.

Start.text: What a massacre! As surprising as it sounds, there was a survivor. You may have heard of him...

Next1.text: As for what happened here... Let's say you will find out shortly. I hope for your sake that you will be more competent than your predecessors.

Next2.text: Let's follow the trail. We can talk again once we find the Ghost Pack.

Start.text: Ah, Mercenaries! Looking for a Plague remedy, are we? Don't bother asking anyone else - we're the only ones who sell it around here.

line0.props.tipText: Ask the Smugglers about the missing Tracker.

Next1.text: A fugitive in the mist... Doesn't ring a bell, to be honest. Anything else I can do for you?

line0.props.tipText: Threaten the Smugglers into talking.

line1.props.tipText: Persuade the Smugglers to talk.

Convinced1.text: Oh, such flattery! Although it is true we have a knack for being in the right place at the right time.

Convinced2.text: We did see some bloke getting chased by a Tracker, but he wasn't one of ours.

Convinced3.text: The two of them went around the hill behind the Moritagre Farm, straight to the cursed village of Lethyre.

Convinced4.text: If you decide to go after them, you'll need what we're selling. The place is crawling with Plague-ridden monsters.

Threat1.text: Hey, take it easy! There's no need for that!

Threat2.text: We did see some bloke getting chased by a Tracker, but he wasn't one of ours.

Threat3.text: The two of them went around the hill behind the Moritagre Farm, straight to the cursed village of Lethyre.

Threat4.text: If you decide to go after them, you'll need what we're selling. The place is crawling with Plague-ridden monsters.

Wanted.text: You threatened the denizens of Harag.

Notify.text: The man you didn't denounce to the town of Nerprun has sent you your reward.

Start.text: You've done it! Mercenaries, you saved us all!

Next1.text: The others are already headed to the market. Let's make haste and join them.

Start.text: We got you! Mercenaries, it's your lucky day - these Smugglers have a bounty on their heads!

Next1.text: No need! We've already hired them. Right, Mercenaries?

Next2.text: How did you...! You've been careful not to say why you were wanted, haven't you?

Next3.text: Look at them, Mercenaries. They're nothing but profiteers charging a fortune for the Plague cure. No! They raid our Tombs, where the gods dwell, and then sell our relics to the highest bidder!

Next4.text: Relics? Those little shards of baked clay? I'm surprised we can even find buyers for that rubbish! You should be thanking us - we're cleaning up your old ruins.

Next5.text: How dare you? Mercenaries! You can't defend Bandits who scorn our gods and our relics!

Start.text:
Thank you for your help. We couldn't have fought off the Guard without you.
We'll manage from here on out. The secret dock should be close.

Next1.text: As for your reward... It awaits you in the basement.

Start.text: We heard a commotion! What happened?

Next1.text: You killed the Smugglers?

Next2.text: They got what they deserved... We've been looking for them for weeks. Take this as a token of our gratitude.

EndFight1.text: That was an impressive fight. We're glad to be rid of those Smugglers.

EndFight2.text: Good work taking out that group - here's your bounty.

MissionDescDeadCity.text: Find Senuna in the Cursed Village.

NotifyGhostTrack.text: You received a strange letter. Someone is waiting for you in the Secluded Cottage.

MissionDescGhostTrack.text: Go to the Secluded Cottage in Ludern.

NotifyBeastTrack.text: Rumour has it that the Ludern Trackers are gathering in their largest camp.

MissionDescBeastTrack.text: Investigate the situation at the Large Tracker Camp.

NotifyTrackerConclusion.text: You received a message from the Garussa Clan. They require your presence posthaste.

MissionDescTrackerConclusion.text: Respond to the Garussa Clan's request by going to the Swamp Threshold Market.

NotifyScholarConclusion.text: You received a message. The Alazarian Scholars will meet you in the Secluded Cottage.

MissionDescScholarConclusion.text: Find the Alazarian Scholars in their lair.

MissionDescBeastCamp.text: You may not want to tread here.

NotifyBeastLeave.text: When your troop emerges from the fog, the Beast has disappeared. The only sign that it was ever here is this camp, reduced to smithereens.

Start.text: The expression on this man's face is even more terrifying than his wounds.
Clay figurines representing a Tule gathering have been placed in front of the altar. These swamp spirits are very popular in Ludern.
Someone has placed a crocswine figurine among the offerings.
This altar is dedicated to the Tule Queen.
Someone slit this merchant's throat before devouring his leg.
Hunters don't seem to use this camp year round.
There are carcasses all over. This must be a hunting camp.
This camp looks like a drop-off site for Smugglers.
A massacre took place here. All these soldiers are wearing Alazarian armour.

End.text: A massacre took place here. All these soldiers are wearing Alazarian armour.

Start.text: As your Companions rummage through the room, one of the shelves starts shifting forward slowly. A suitably brawny Companion should be able to prop it back up.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Nothing.text: The shelf comes crashing down, its vials shatter on the floor and the noise echoes throughout the village.

Success.text: ::name:: stops the shelf from falling and props it back up.

Failure.text: ::name:: is almost crushed by the falling shelf, which comes crashing down on the floor.

Start.text: In the centre of the room stands a Plague-ridden man oblivious to your presence. You can leave unseen or try to slay him stealthily.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: sneaks up behind the Plague-ridden man and kills him silently.

Fail.text: The wooden floor is merciless and creaks under ::name::'s weight. Each step seems louder than the previous one. The Plague-ridden man lets out a blood-curdling scream before dying.

Start.text: A gust of wind fills the room. You hear a sinister creak... The door through which your Companions entered is closing! It could slam shut at any moment and reveal your presence, but perhaps one of your Companions is nimble enough to stop it in time.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Nothing.text: The door slams shut. The noise echoes throughout the village for what seems like an eternity.

Success.text: ::name:: reaches the door just in time to close it cautiously.

Failure.text: The door slams shut, but the noise is deafened by the crash of ::name::'s body slamming against the rotten wood.

Start.text: This bag is full of crockery, trinkets and rusty tools. However, something shiny catches your eye at the very bottom, among the useless knick-knacks. A willing and very determined Companion should be able to grab it.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: With a lot of patience and restraint, ::name:: manages to fish out the item.

Failure.text: ::name::'s hands rummage noisily in the bag, jangling louder than church bells.

Start.text: This time I've got you! You can't escape!

Next1.text: You're completely insane! The Plague-ridden will be here any minute!

Next2.text: That's your problem! You're the one who chose to come here, Scholar. You should've known it'd be crawling with plague rats.

Next3.text: Shhh! For the Eye's sake, be quiet!

Next4.text: Mercenaries! Shut her up! I'll give you anything you want, but we must leave before...

Next5.text: Argh! They're already here!

Start.text: As they make to leave, your Companions are shocked to find the door jammed shut. Someone strong enough could lift it off its hinges. Otherwise, you'll have to go through that fissure in the wall.

line0.props.tipText: Jump through the fissure.

line1.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

JumpFail.text: Following your Companions, ::name:: jumps with the grace of a crocswine and is injured as they land.

DoorSuccess.text: ::name:: is exceptionally strong and manages to lift the door off of its hinges. The path is clear.

DoorFail.text: ::name:: lets out a scream that echoes throughout the village as the door falls on their feet. Despite this injury, the path is now clear.

Notify.text: As the door closes, your Companions hear a distressing sound...

Start.text: This armour has rusted to encase the weapon. Prying it out will be no mean feat, but perhaps a determined Companion could manage it.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: slowly wrests the weapon from the rusty gauntlet without making a sound.

Failure.text: In their haste, ::name:: pries away not only the weapon, but also the gauntlet, the breastplate and the leg guards, which come tumbling down in a thunderous crash of metal.

Start.text: This chest looks tempting, but you will have to avoid all sorts of debris to reach it. A nimble Companion might be able to cross without making any noise.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: ::name:: seems to float above the debris and reaches the chest without making a sound.

Fail.text: ::name:: seems to stumble on each and every piece of debris, making a deafening racket.

Start.text: Your Companions' eyes immediately turn to this worm-eaten beam. The slightest gust of wind or vibration could bring it down. If your troop wants to explore this room, a suitably stalwart companion will need to hold it in place.

line0.props.tipText: Select a Companion.

Success.text: Arching their back against the beam, ::name:: prevents the ceiling from coming down.

Failure.text: Unfortunately, ::name:: just isn't strong enough. The beam and ceiling come down in a thunderous crash.

Start.text:
<narrator>As you come closer, you hear a voice whispering.</narrator>
You... you aren't Plague-ridden?
Oh I beg you, get me out of here!

line0.props.tipText: Destroying these planks will make noise.

Start.text:
With all the Plague-ridden about, I couldn't call for help.
Truth be told, I thought I’d starve to death behind these planks.

Next.text:
You saved my life, Mercenaries. Thank you for taking such a risk.
Take this. I found it in the village before I became trapped.

Reward.text: I'll be on my way now. You should do the same, what with all the noise we just made...

Start.text: You won't find any Plague remedies in this shop. Alazar refuses to give us any. Try the Smugglers.

Next.text: Your wounds have been dressed - you're ready to start fighting again.

Start.text: Without a trade route, the only things I can sell are local products. Goods that come from afar tend to rot along the way.

Next1.text:
Are you looking for exotic wares? Then you won't be disappointed, Mercenaries!
Thanks to the Trade Routes you opened, I can now sell you everything you might need.

line0.text: Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your first Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your second Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your third Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fourth Trade Route.
Provide 1000 and 1500 to build your fifth Trade Route.

Start.text: So, what do you think? Quaint, isn't it?

Next1.text: I made sure to furnish it with everything you might need: a chest for your belongings and stools for Companions you don't want to take with you. And of course, you can call on me at any time to arrange trips from one travel post to another.

Next2.text: Are you ready to travel?

line0.props.disableReason: Build travel posts in other villages to travel there quickly.

Start.text: When I was young, I travelled the world on the Ghost Pack's trail. You won't find a better steward in all of Ludern.

Next1.text: All you have to do is buy the land and pay craftsmen, and you'll soon have a travel post at your disposal in Garussa.

line0.props.tipText: Build the Ludern Travel Post.

Build.text:
Don't worry, I know what I'm doing.
This travel post will be up and running in no time.

line0.title: Tomb Raiders
line0.props.helpTip: Look for the Smugglers' hideout.

Start.text: Sheesh, what with the Plague-ridden hordes and the crocswines, we already had a lot on our plates... But Smugglers, too? They better hope the Guard finds them before I do!
We're looking for a hideout used by a group of Smugglers.

Next1.text: Normally we turn a blind eye - but these ones crossed a line.

Next2.text: Under the guise of supplying us with a cure for the Plague, they sneaked into the Tombs of the Ancients to raid them!

Next3.text: We've been monitoring the Smugglers lurking in the region. They think their accomplices are holed up in North Ludern. If you find that hideout, exterminate those inside. We'll make it worth your while.

End.text: We're keeping a close watch on the other groups of Smugglers.

Start.text: Alazar won't sell us their damned medication because we sealed off the Tombs of the Ancients.
The Tombs of the Ancients are sacred. These outsiders are not worthy of entering them.
The Scholars said we could make it... But it was impossible! There were so many monsters! ... They said we were pursuing knowledge! ... Knowledge!

line0.props.tipText: It shouldn't be too hard.

Start.text: So, you're still alive, I see! Tules be damned! There's just no killing you!

Next1.text:
This little reunion will have to wait, Voseg.
We have precious little time.

Next2.text: The Beast you saw, that invincible monster... We now know why Alazar lured it here.

Next3.text: Their aim was simple: distract us so that their Scholars could get their hands on what they've been eyeing for centuries... The Tomb of the Ancients.

Next4.text: The woman who fled during the fight will stop at nothing to reach her goal. We are sure of it.

Next5.text: We will go to the Tomb and stop her from desecrating this holy place. Come with us. We fully trust your men and their skills.

Accept.text: Good. We'll meet in front of the Tomb. You are now permitted to enter.

MissionDesc.text: Find the Trackers outside the Ludern Tomb.

line0.text: Take on Master Tracker Brighid's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

line2.text: Explore the Ludern Tomb and protect it from the Alazarian Scholars.

Start.text: We should set the Beast loose on their precious university. We'll see how they like that diversion!
So, heroes of Ludern, are you ready to save us once again?
A diversion. Alazar thinks the Beast, Killer of Realms, is a diversion.
I don't sell crocswine meat: it tastes like swamp water.
You are not from Edoran, right? We fought those vermin for 30 years. I won't start selling them our products now!
These pelts are so pristine that Gosenberg traders are willing to fight Plague-ridden hordes and swamp creatures to buy them.
Ludern is probably the most hostile, dangerous region you'll ever see. But it also holds very profitable missions.

Done.text: I'm sure I would have made the same choice.

line0.props.tipText: We haven't heard from the Nerprun Clan since the landslide... The survivors seem to be completely isolated.

line1.props.tipText: The Trackers who keep watch over the entrance to the Ludern Tomb have reported that one of their colleagues went missing.

line2.props.tipText: A person of influence seems to be waiting for something at the border crossing between Harag and Gosenberg.

BoarVillage.text: We haven't heard from the Nerprun Clan since the landslide... the survivors seem to be completely isolated.

DeadCity.text: The Trackers who keep watch over the entrance to the Ludern Tomb have reported that one of their colleagues went missing.

LostSoldier.text: A person of influence seems to be waiting for something at the border crossing between Harag and Gosenberg.

DeliverMission1.text:
<narrator>A strange smile spreads across the Informant's face as she grabs the letter.</narrator>
I didn't think I'd receive word so quickly.

End.text: I believe you know all there is to know about this region.

PathCrime1.text:
It looks like you are keen to drive our dear inventor to madness.
Would you like to keep at it? He's close to admitting defeat, and it just so happens that I got my hands on another key.

PathCrime2.text:
His previous clients are furious. Especially the Smugglers, they don't like being taken for a ride...
For his sake, I hope your next targets will be more forgiving.

PathCrime3.text: This key could belong to any priest... Good luck.

PathCrimeEnd.text: So, you robbed Saint Serene Church? Better hope the Eye's Reckoning doesn't smite you.

line0.text: Buy the Holy Key from the Informant.

line1.text: Find and thwart the security system matching the Holy Key.

Start.text: My grandfather was a soldier in the Edoranian Legion. He fell in love with my grandmother during the war. You know what he did? The blighter switched sides!
Here's a piece of friendly advice: Maintain your armour properly. The cardinal mosquito of Ludern can pierce through plate and armour.

Repair.text: Now, that's a job well done!

Start.text: I crossed Arthes and Tiltren to get here. But nobody wants me.

Next1.text: I'm on my last legs... There's nothing waiting for me in Edoran. The war between Lord Laheart and Lord Vernalis destroyed what little I had.

Next2.text: Take pity, Mercenaries. Convince the judge to let me stay. Don't let him send me back.

line0.title: Asylum Seeker
line0.props.helpTip: Convince the Judge to let the Refugee stay.

Start.text: He said I could stay? Jeru - erm... the Ancients and Tules bless you!

End2.text: Here, this is the only thing still connecting me to my old life. Now that I'm starting a new one, it's of no use to me.

Wait.text: Will I become a Tracker? A Woodcutter...? What do they do in Harag?

Start.text: The refugee? The Guard will return him to the border. Our chief went to warn them.

line0.props.tipText: Ask why he's expelling the Refugee.

Questioned1.text:
Is this a joke, Mercenaries?
He's Edoranian! His ancestors occupied Ludern and slaughtered my people for 30 years.

line0.props.tipText: Convince the judge to let the refugee stay.

Questioned2.text: I dare say your reasoning makes sense, Mercenaries. This poor man is a humble farmer, so young he cannot have taken part in the Edoranian War...

Questioned3.text: All right, we'll keep him. But trust me, life is hard in Ludern. He'll regret not getting arrested in Tiltren.

Start.text: Living in the swamp isn't always easy, but it's our clan's way. The elders say what doesn't kill you makes you stronger.
These beasts... Don't be fooled. They're smarter than your average boar. See how they cut us off from any retreat.

Next.text: Come and see me again if you're injured. I'm not going anywhere, anyway.

Start.text: Are you ready to light the warning beacon?

line0.props.tipText: Once the beacon is lit, the crocswine will attack the town.

MissionDescWood.text: Bring 20 Wood to Chief Bricta.

MissionDescTalk1.text: Talk to the merchant asking for your help.

MissionDescBoar.text: Light the warning beacon and trigger the fight with the boars.

line0.text: Take on Chief Bricta's mission.

line1.text: Follow mission instructions to complete this objective.

Start.text:
<narrator>The merchant looks uneasy.</narrator>
Ah! You don't see creatures like that in Gosenberg!

Help.text: Ahem... Could we find somewhere more private to talk? Just a moment...

Wood1.text: It's possible that I'm not actually a merchant and that - perhaps - I'm not unconnected to the crocswine attack...

Wood2.text:
All right, I admit it! It's all my fault!
I made a mistake! It was an accident! I thought this experiment posed no risk, that the reagents were safe... But my measurements were off.

Wood3.text: I am an Alazarian Scholar of note. I hold a university professorship! But these barbarians don't care. If they find out I'm responsible for their troubles, they'll have me hang!

Wood4.text:
Let me slip away quietly before they start asking questions. Distract them when the reinforcements arrive!
I beg you! I have a family! I'll give you all the Krowns I have.

Wait.text:
Let me slip away quietly before they start asking questions. Distract them when the reinforcements arrive!
I beg you! I have a family! I'll give you all the Krowns I have.

End.text: You remember our agreement, right? Go on... Distract them! I'll make myself scarce. Thanks again. I knew I could count on you.

T4terMarketplaceLeader.npc.name: Bricta, Chief of the Nerprun Clan

Start.text: You managed to get in despite the crocswine? I don't know what's gotten into them. Those wretched things usually stick to the swamp!

Next1.text: For days now, they've been attacking anyone who tries to leave the village. The minute we let our guard down, they try to get inside the houses.

Next2.text: The situation is dire. We're out of wood to light the warning beacon, and there aren't enough of us to wait for reinforcements. A little help would be appreciated.

Next3.text: Ah! How kind of you! First we need to deal with the warning beacon. We've already cut up everything we had - only our walls are left! Find us some wood so we can warn the other clans.

Wood1.text: This firewood could be our salvation! Thank you, Mercenaries.

Wood2.text: Meet me in front of the fire. I'm going to prepare it.

Wait.text: Rest for a bit. The fire will be ready soon.

Start.text: Perfect, the oil and wood are all set. Once they see the warning beacon, the Yeble and Garussa Clans will rush to our aid! There'll be enough of us to slay the crocswine.

Next1.text: But in the meantime, everything rests on your weapons. Flames drive the crocswine mad. As soon as the fire is blazing, they'll attack.

Next2.text: Steel yourselves. It's going to be a long fight. You can ignite the warning beacon whenever you're ready.

Start.text: Do you think we stand a chance? What if the other clans don't come?

Next.text: I didn't doubt it for a second! The clans always come to each other's aid!

Start.text: Would you like to buy something? Please do! If you can help us, I'll sell you anything.

Next.text: Our heroes have returned? I pray to the Tules as often as I can to show my thanks.

Start.text: I nearly broke my leg on the way! Twice even! I'm too old to be running like that!

Next1.text: I was having a bath when I saw the beacon. I had to get dressed on the way. The market vendors won't soon forget that.

Next2.text: Poor souls...

End.text: Rescuing other clans is expected of us all. Nerprun would have done the same for Yeble or Garussa.

Start.text: Cheers, Mercenaries!
Solidarity is what's held Harag together for a thousand years!

Next.text: When a clan is attacked, the others stand ready to lend their aid. Always!

Start.text: Don't be shy, Mercenaries! Help yourselves. This feast was prepared for you.

Next1.text: All this is in your honour. Without your help, we all would've ended up as crocswine food. You are part of the clan now - part of the family, so to speak. So, please accept this gift as a token of our appreciation.

line0.props.tipText: Report the Alazarian Scholar and his dubious experiments.

line1.props.tipText: Silently accept the reward.

Accuse1.text: What? That scum is responsible for everything? By the Groattle's antlers, get him!

Accuse3.text: We'll make do without a judge. It'll be sorted quickly, believe me. His death will make this feast all the merrier!

SettingLogAccuse.text: You saved the Nerprun Clan and reported the culprit.

SettingLogSpare.text: You saved the Nerprun Clan and spared the culprit.

Wait.text: You're part of the family now. Call on us for anything and we'll be there.

Start.text: I don't trade with no-name Mercenaries. Build a reputation for yourselves among warriors and come back to challenge our champions. Then we can talk business.

Next1.text: You qualify for participation, that's it! You can't expect me to sell you my wares when you haven't even won a fight!

Alt.text:
Buy whatever you want! That's what my shop is for.
And remember, I'll be allowed to offer you unique items after each new challenge!

End.text: I didn't think anyone would ever defeat Hiltrerd... I suppose I can sell you everything I have, now.

Start.text: Only the elite can fight in this arena. Mercenaries like you have to settle for regional arenas.

Welcome1.text: Try to build your reputation. Who knows, maybe one day you will be among our honoured guests.

line0.props.disableReason: Your troop has not yet reached Tier 8 of the <narrator>Power and Glory</narrator> Path.

FirstLevel1.text: Oh! It's you, Mercenaries. I take it you received my letter?

FirstLevel2.text: It is my honour to tell you that you are now among the chosen few allowed to fight in the Arena of Legends. This is a privilege bestowed only upon the strongest warriors in the Five Kingdoms.

FirstLevel3.text: There are no ordinary fighters here! Contestants like you must face champions from other regions in a series of back-to-back fights with various configurations. For now, your rank only allows you to join the <narrator>Fifth League</narrator>. Are you up to the challenge?

FirstLevelReward1.text: By Saint Jeru, that was incredible! No one has ever defeated those champions so quickly.

FirstLevelReward2.text: Here is your reward. I hope you will find it worthy of your talents.

FirstLevelReward3.text: Feel free to fight the Fifth League champions again. You need to improve your reputation before you can challenge the Fourth League.

FirstLevelRewardDiff1.text: Well now! The Fifth League really is too easy for you. I can't wait to see how you'll fare in the next one!

FirstLevelRewardDiff2.text: Please allow me to give you this reward.

FirstLevelRewardDiff3.text: You can take on this league again if you're not tired of it, or move on to the Fourth League, provided your reputation is good enough.

SecondLevel1.text: You have enough reputation to challenge the <narrator>Fourth League</narrator> of champions, but you can continue fighting in the fifth league if you so wish.

SecondLevelReward1.text: Most contestants can't get past Kogo and Toro. You definitely deserve your reward.

SecondLevelReward2.text: You can continue challenging the Fourth League champions, who now know how you fight! As soon as your reputation increases enough, I will summon the Third League.

SecondLevelRewardDiff1.text: Again? By Saint Jeru, I thought our arena would offer you a greater challenge! Take this reward, with our compliments.

SecondLevelRewardDiff2.text: Enjoy this reward, as it is the last one you can get from the Fourth League.

ThirdLevel1.text: The <narrator>Third League</narrator> champions await! I don't want to spoil the surprise, but you're in for a tough fight, this time!

ThirdLevelReward1.text: Ah... I guess it wasn't that tough for you, eh? Take your reward. No one can deny you earned this victory.

ThirdLevelReward2.text: I hope Elicia will get over it, she looked really down... Maybe you could fight her again to cheer her up?

ThirdLevelRewardDiff1.text: This time, it's Trivette who looks disheartened. She won't be happy to hear that you got a reward for humiliating her...

ThirdLevelRewardDiff2.text: I wonder how many champions will give up on their careers after facing you...

FourthLevel1.text: Time to get serious, Mercenaries! <narrator>The Second and First Leagues</narrator> are on a whole other level. Are you well prepared?

FourthLevelReward1.text: A masterful fight! Our champions gave it their best, but you were even more fearsome! I bet you'll like this round's prize!

FourthLevelReward2.text: So? What do you think? It was worth fighting Smot's rats, wasn't it?

FourthLevelRewardDiff1.text: You are truly formidable fighters, Mercenaries. Maybe you should open your own arena when you retire?

FourthLevelRewardDiff2.text: Should you ever need a servant or a referee, you know where to find me!

FifthLevel1.text: We have reached the final stage: you can now take on the <narrator>First League</narrator>.

FifthLevel2.text:
Few have managed to get this far.
Honestly, I wasn't sure I would see it in my lifetime.

FifthLevel3.text: A special champion has arrived here for this occasion. She's the best warrior in all of the Five Kingdoms, if you ask me, made of the same stuff as the legendary Belerion.

FifthLevel4.text: So, do you still feel up to challenging the <narrator>First League</narrator>? Do you have a good strategy? Is your gear in perfect condition?

FifthLevelReward1.text: I can't believe it! You defeated Hiltrerd! That's... I think that might be a first.

FifthLevelReward2.text:
You are champions among champions!
Please allow me to give you this trophy. It's a great honour.

FifthLevelReward3.text:
So, you managed to conquer the Arena of Legends...
What would you like to do now? Challenge our champions again, maybe?

FifthLevelRewardDiff1.text: I had no doubt that you would win! The champions of the Fourth and Fifth League even came to congratulate you!

FifthLevelRewardDiff2.text: You will always be welcome here, but as you just won the hardest fight we can offer, I'm afraid we are now unworthy of your prowess.

RedoLevel.text: Your reputation as warriors is not good enough to join a more prestigious league. But maybe you feel like challenging one of the previous leagues? Fighting the same configuration a second time earns you an extra reward.

RedoEnd.text: Is there a particular league you'd like to challenge? All of them are now available.

NoBeginArena.text:
I understand.
Challenges of this kind are always intimidating.

OnLeaveArena.text: The Arena of Legends is home to the very best. Forfeiting is not unusual at all.

ArenaLost.text: Maybe we should have waited a bit before letting you take on our champions...

ArenaRedo.text: I will never tire of this show! I almost regret not having a reward to give you...

line0.text: Challenge and defeat the Fifth League.
Challenge and defeat the Fourth League.
Challenge and defeat the Third League.
Challenge and defeat the Second League.
Challenge and defeat the First League.

Start.text: Mercenaries? Are you trying to avoid the Border Toll? Are you climbing Mount Altis because you have no Border Pass?

Next1.text: The Guard would be completely swamped without us...

Next2.text: Go on, hand over <gold>200</gold>, and let’s be done with it.

Give1.text: Ah, what fine folk you are!

Give2.text: You go on through! Quickly now.

Start.text: Pay up or leave!

Next1.text: The door's open, what are you waiting for? Leave!

Start.text: You pay or you leave...

Next1.text: What are you still doing here?

Start.text: Don't touch the crocswine. It bites.
The creature has its eyes on you...

line0.props.tipText: Touch the crocswine

Start.text: The door is sealed shut by some sort of mechanism.

Unlocked.text: The mechanism clicks into place, and the door opens.

Trapped.text: Nothing happens. Maybe the combination was incorrect?

Start.text: Outsiders? Sit down, make yourselves at home! It's not often we get news from the outside world.

Unless you like smelly swamps and giant mosquitoes, you should turn back.
To the north of here lies Ludern, one of the worst quagmires in the world.

Next1.text: I see you are well-travelled! Where would you like to go: south to Tiltren or north to Ludern?

CrimePath1Started.text: You've received a letter bearing the Baron's seal: a client requests your presence at the Gosenberg border crossing.

CrimePath1MissionDesc1.text: Go to the Gosenberg border crossing to meet with your client.

CrimePath1MissionDesc2.text: Attack the Guard and make sure Septelle is never forgotten again.

CrimePath1NotifLieutenant.text: The lieutenant lets you know that he's ready to negotiate and is in a field west of Stromkapp.

CrimePath1MissionDesc3.text: Take Septelle to meet with Lieutenant Perault.

CrimePath1MissionDesc4.text: Take Septelle back to the Gosenberg border crossing.

TradePath1Started.text: You've received a letter bearing the seal of a Gosenberg family: a client requests your presence at the Stromkapp Tavern.

TradePath1MissionDesc1.text: Go to the Stromkapp Tavern to meet with a mysterious client.

TradePath1MissionDesc2.text: Negotiate the terms of a trade partnership between a Tiltren merchant and Aldeberth.

TradePath1MissionDesc3.text: Negotiate the terms of a trade partnership between a Marheim merchant and Aldeberth.

TradePath1MissionDesc4.text: Meet with Aldeberth in the Tiltren Tavern.

TradePath1MissionDesc5.text: Go back to speak with the Tiltren merchant.

TradePath1MissionDesc6.text: Go back to speak with the Marheim merchant.

MightPath1Started.text: You've received a letter bearing the Brotherhood's seal: a client requests your presence at the Mother Bear Tavern.

MightPath1MissionDesc1.text: Go to the Marheim Tavern to meet with the Brotherhood.

MightPath1MissionDesc2.text: Defeat the groups of Bandits so that you can easily assault the lair.

MightPath1MissionDesc3.text: While you were busy, the Harag's Bane gang defeated a group of Bandits.

MightPath1MissionDesc4.text: Join the Harag's Bane gang outside the Bandits' Lair.

MightPath1MissionDesc5.text: Go to the Marheim Tavern to collect your reward from the Brotherhood.

MightPath3MissionDesc1.text: Go to the Armoury on the first floor of the Brotherhood Fortress.

MightPath3MissionDesc2.text: Go to the Brotherhood's Rouste Pitch to play a game.

MightPath4MissionDesc1.text: Go to the Armoury on the first floor of the Brotherhood Fortress.

KnowledgePath1Started.text: You've received a letter bearing the Universities' seal: a client requests your presence at the Edoranian border crossing.

KnowledgePath1MissionDesc1.text: Go to the border crossing to meet with your client.

KnowledgePath1MissionDesc2.text: Find the artefact hidden in Saint Eleor Abbey.

KnowledgePath1End.text: You won't learn anything new here. You must inform your client of what happened.

TradePathBuilding.text: You can now access the special building of the Trade and Craftsmanship Path in Arthes.

KnowledgePathBuilding.text: You can now access the special building of the Mysteries and Wisdom Path in Vertruse.

KnowledgePathMission.text: Visit <narrator>the Fellowship of Knowledge</narrator> in Vertruse.

CrimePathBuilding.text: You can now access the special building of the Crime and Chaos Path in Tiltren.

MightPathBuilding.text: You can now access the special building of the Power and Glory Path in Grinmeer.

DragonBonesMission.text: Take the dragon bones to Professor Maurith.

MightPathArena1.text: You have received a letter bearing the Arena of Legends seal. You can now challenge its champions.

MightPathArena2.text: You have received a letter bearing the Arena of Legends seal. You can now challenge the Fourth League of champions.

MightPathArena3.text: You have received a letter bearing the Arena of Legends seal. You can now challenge the Third League of champions.

MightPathArena4.text: You have received a letter bearing the Arena of Legends seal. You can now challenge the Second League of champions.

MightPathArena5.text: You have received a letter bearing the Arena of Legends seal. You can now challenge the First League of champions.

MissionDescMightPathArena1.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and win a fight.

MissionDescMightPathArena2.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Fourth League.

MissionDescMightPathArena3.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Third League.

MissionDescMightPathArena4.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the Second League.

MissionDescMightPathArena5.text: Go to the Arena of Legends and defeat the First League.

KnowledgePath1.text: You've received a letter: an organisation called the <narrator>Fellowship of Knowledge</narrator> invites you to join them.

MissionDescKnowledgePath1.text: Meet the members of the Fellowship of Knowledge.

KnowledgePath2.text: You have received a letter: Professor Hermann awaits you at the <narrator>Fellowship of Knowledge</narrator>.

MissionDescKnowledgeEnd.text: Return to Professor Hermann at the <narrator>Fellowship of Knowledge</narrator>.

TradePath1.text: You've received a letter: the Pedlars' Guild spokespersons await you at your Travel Post.

MissionDescTradePath1.text: Talk to a Pedlars' Guild spokesperson.

CrimePath1.text: You've received a letter: the Tiltren Informant has news for you.

MissionDescCrimePath1.text: Talk to the Tiltren Informant at the Stromkapp Tavern.

CrimePath2.text: You've received a letter: the Arthes Informant has news for you.

MissionDescCrimePath2.text: Talk to the Arthes Informant at the Cortia Tavern.

CrimePath3.text: You've received a letter: the Vertruse Informant has news for you.

MissionDescCrimePath3.text: Talk to the Vertruse Informant at the Marheim Tavern.

CrimePath4.text: You've received a letter: the Ludern Informant has news for you.

MissionDescCrimePath4.text: Talk to the Ludern Informant at the Garussa Tavern.

CrimePath5.text: You've received a letter: the Drombach Informant has news for you.

MissionDescCrimePath5.text: Talk to the Drombach Informant at the New-Asthel Tavern.

MissionDescCrimeEnd.text: Return to the Drombach Informant in New-Asthel.

NotifE1CavePath.text: You have opened a new route between Edoran and Gosenberg.

NotifBelerion.text: Rumour has it that a Belerian ship has washed up on the southern coast of Tiltren.

NotifDLCTavern1.text: Rumour has it there's a Tavern for sale in Stromkapp.

NotifDLCTavern2.text: Rumour has it there's a Tavern for sale in Marheim.

NotifDLCTavern3.text: Rumour has it there's a Tavern for sale in Gosenberg City.

MissionDescTavern3.text: Purchase the ruined Tavern in Gosenberg City.

Start.text: How dare you attack the Brothers?

Next1.text: Wait! What? Was it the Brotherhood who put a price on our heads?

Start.text: Do not oppose the will of the All-Seeing Eye!

Next1.text: Tis the Eye's command that heresy be purged by fire!

Start.text: Defending the weak and the fatherless is easy on a full belly!

Next1.text: But when you go hungry, chivalry and fealty go out the window!

Start.text: Out of our way, peasants! You cannot begin to understand the noble intentions we pursue!

Next1.text: Colonel Deteore's legacy is rotting away in the Ludern swamps! We must wrest her belongings from the mud and the hands of these savages!

Start.text: The Guard was already after me long before you were born!

Next1.text: If you think you can do better than your predecessors, you're as foolish as they are.

Start.text: I will not back down! Animals must be treated with respect!

Next1.text: Minstrels are treating them like dirt! They beat them if they don't comply, deprive them of food, all for the plebs’ entertainment!

Next2.text: Our cause is worthy, you will not stop me!

Start.text: I can't stand these yokels and their constant moaning. You have burned down the Tavern!, Bartes is a drunk!, He gives the Brotherhood a bad name...

Next1.text: They'll rebuild that hovel in no time!

Next2.text: I don't get what they're complaining about!

Start.text:
Oh! Mercenaries?
Has the good king of Alazar finally forked out the Krowns?

Next1.text: Had he given us the raise we deserve, I wouldn't have spat in his face!

Next2.text: Believe me, whatever the old miser promised you for our heads is nowhere near enough!

Start.text: You're too late to save the children: they've gone up North with the slave traders.

Next1.text: Don't look so disappointed, Mercenaries. Most parents would be dismayed to see their offspring return so quickly...

Next2.text: In these times of famine, I barely have to negotiate to buy their young ones. These peasants are all very keen to sell off a few mouths they won't have to feed.

Start.text: Run, heretics! Fear the divine wrath of the All-Seeing Eye and Saint Jeru!

Next1.text: These lands must be cleansed of ungodly souls! Blood will wash away their sins.

Next2.text: Death to the heretic Trackers! Let the Light sweep away their pagan idols and bestial gods!

Start.text: Why confront us? We are only doing what the Guard dares not do!

Next1.text: Trials, prison... It's all pointless! Look at what has become of this Province! Look! Honest folk can't live here in peace!

Next2.text: It's high time someone rid us of the bandits, the raiders, the thieves... Pure and simple extermination... These parasites deserve nothing less!

Start.text: Go away, Mercenaries. This is no concern of yours. The Legion alone will deal with this matter.

Next1.text: What? The Broker Council wants to drive us out? They have no right! The Legion can go wherever it pleases in Gosenberg! This land is theirs only because we allow it.

Next2.text: Go on, then! Fight me! And they better not come crying when Alexa Grathan tries to take over their kingdom, too!

Start.text:
Slave traders? You must be joking, Mercenaries!
We are but humble traders looking to satisfy our clients.

Next1.text: There aren't enough convicted criminals in chains to meet the demand. If the laws weren't so strict, people like us could stay nice and warm in our homes.

Next2.text: This is no mean feat! These Harag savages can sure put up a fight, the risks are great and the journey perilous. Now, if you don't mind, we'll take our catch and leave...

Start.text: It's true what they say, isn't it? The Legion never gives up...

Next1.text: We've been in hiding for over five years but they've still managed to track us down.

Next2.text: Ha! No matter. We're tired of running from these bloodhounds! If this is our last stand, then so be it! We won't go down without a fight!

Start.text: I'd recognise your stench anywhere. People like you reek of greed and indifference.

Next1.text: For the right price, you'll turn a blind eye to what your employers are selling.

Next2.text: Who cares about slaves as long as you bring in the Krowns!

Next3.text: You're no better than them. I will enjoy killing you.

Start.text: I warn you, Mercenaries! Call me a sore loser and I'll have your head!

Next1.text: Victory was ours! We were this close to winning the Rouste Tournament! But those blasted craftsmen cheated! They should consider themselves lucky we didn't kill them all before we left.

Next2.text: These Krowns are ours. If they want them back, they'll have to pry them from our cold, dead fingers!

Start.text: Looking for a little tipple? I should warn you, this Gosenberg wine is for connoisseurs. Only the most discerning palates will truly appreciate it.

Next1.text: What do you mean, “vinegar”? Since when are Mercenaries wine specialists?

Next2.text: The Gosenberg Vintners' claims are baseless! Who says they didn't get their barrels from us anyway? Huh?

Start.text: If you're here to recover what we took from the Guard, you're too late.

Next1.text: We've paid for safe passage into Gosenberg, and the Brotherhood has agreed to let us join them. The Ludern Guard will have no further trouble from us.

Next2.text: You understand, don't you? Who'd want to stay here when our neighbours live on fertile lands with more Krowns than they know what to do with?

Start.text: Don't come any closer! Back off! No one will disturb the Ancients' sleep!

Next1.text: Whoever you are, you will not enter and defile our gods!

Next2.text: Not you, nor anybody! From this day forth, we will protect the Tombs with our lives!

Start.text:
Tavern Keeper, would you be so kind as to show these peasants out?
I don't care for their smell.

line0.props.tipText: Ban Peasants from the Tavern.

line0.text: No Farmers for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line1.props.tipText: Ban Nobles from the Tavern.

line0.text: No Nobles for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line2.props.tipText: Deny the request.

line0.text: Annoyed, the Nobles will spend less freely for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

Start.text: By the Beast's fangs, look what I've found! One of your patrons forgot their coin purse!

line0.props.tipText: Say thank you and keep the purse for yourself.

line1.props.tipText: Send a Bouncer to bring the customer their purse back.

TavernEvent.text: The owner of the forgotten coin purse has sent you a reward.
Your Bouncer kept the customer's lost purse for himself.

Start.text:
Ahem! Tavern Keepers! I have a special request for you.
Princess Edda Adr Alazar is currently visiting Gosenberg City. Could you reserve your Tavern for her personal use?

line0.props.tipText: Reserve the Tavern for exclusive use by the princess.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to turn your patrons out.

TavernEvent.text: Princess Edda Adr Alazar was thrilled with her time at your Tavern.
Princess Edda Adr Alazar cancelled her visit at the last minute, leaving you with no patrons.

Start.text: Please send the bill to my father. I haven't any money on me.

line0.props.tipText: Send the young man's tab to his father.

line1.props.tipText: Pay up, kid!

TavernEvent.text: The young man's father paid his son's tab.
The young man's father refused to pay his son's tab.

Start.text: Residents called us in after seeing plague-infected rats in the streets.

Next1.text: You should let me inspect your establishment. You can never be too careful with the Plague.

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Purifier to inspect your Tavern.

line1.props.tipText: No need to frighten your customers.

TavernEvent.text: Plague-ridden rats attacked your customers.
No plague-ridden rats have turned up.

Start.text: I've been dining in your lovely Tavern ever since it first opened. I simply had to come here to celebrate my eighty-third winter!

Next1.text: I don't suppose you'd have a special tipple on hand for your most loyal customer?

line0.props.tipText: Give your customer a free bottle of wine.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line1.props.tipText: Pay for your customer's meal and drinks.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

line2.props.tipText: This lady is a customer, not your beloved granny!

TavernEvent.text: You have inherited a loyal customer.

Start.text: Your Tavern would be absolutely perfect for the new show my troupe and I have put together. How about hosting me and my incredible performing bears?

line0.props.tipText: Agree to host the trained bear show.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to let bears into your Tavern.

TavernEvent.text: The jugglers' bears attacked some of your customers.
Your customers loved the bear tamers' performance.

Start.text: Shhhh. Don't look at me. Just act as if I weren't here…

Next1.text: We wouldn't want your customers to suspect they're eating side by side with the People's Fellowship. Some of them might be inclined to report us to the Brokers.

line0.props.tipText: Let the People's Fellowship prepare their revolution in peace.

line1.props.tipText: Report the People's Fellowship to the Grinmeer Guard.

TavernEvent.text: To thank you for your hospitality, the People's Fellowship have sabotaged a rival Tavern.
The People's Fellowship have been apprehended, and you're being accused of aiding and abetting them.
In retaliation, the People's Fellowship have punctured your liquor barrels.
Agents of the People's Fellowship have been arrested thanks to your tip.

Start.text:
Your Tavern is a den of iniquity!
Instead of studying, our students spend their time drinking and gambling in this dive!
This has to stop!

line0.props.tipText: Ban University scholars from your Tavern.

line0.text: No Scholars for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line1.props.tipText: Promise to keep the students' drinking in check.

line0.text: Scholars will spend less freely for ::vars.days:: Shifts.

line2.props.tipText: Refuse to turn away your most loyal customers.

Start.text:
Your Tavern plays host to all manner of blasphemous depravity!
Atone for your sins, Mercenaries, or the Eye's Reckoning shall purify this place in your stead!

line0.props.tipText: Prohibit all blasphemous activities.

line1.props.tipText: Ignore this fanatic's threats.

TavernEvent.text: Your Tavern was struck by lightning. Could this be the Eye's Reckoning?
You've avoided the Eye's Reckoning.

Start.text:
Your neighbours are complaining about the noise, Mercenaries.
It must stop! Now.

line0.props.tipText: Bribe the Guard with a free round.

line1.props.tipText: Make everyone quiet down to avoid any problems.

Start.text: We've had a tough hunt this time, Mercenaries. We're tired, and some of us are injured.

Next1.text: I know our presence can be frightening to the people of other kingdoms, but we need some time to recover in your Tavern. We're willing to pay extra.

line0.props.tipText: Letting in such a big group of Trackers is out of the question.

line1.props.tipText: Hunting down the Ghost Pack is important for everyone's safety.

line0.text: Who knows what consequences this choice may have?

TavernEvent.text: The Trackers defeated the Ghost Pack and have given you a trophy in thanks.

Start.text:
This food smells a bit off, don't you think?
I'm not sure I want to eat this…

line0.props.tipText: Replace the customer's order.

line1.props.tipText: Defend your Cook's integrity.

TavernEvent.text: One of your dishes made a customer sick.

Start.text: How dare you serve your customers in such a dump? Your Tavern is disgusting!

Next1.text: I'm surprised I don't see mice eating right on the tables! This is unacceptable!

line0.props.tipText: Ask your Bouncers to do a bit of cleaning.

line1.props.tipText: Pay villagers to clean the place.

line2.props.tipText: A Tavern's not a Tavern without a little grit and grime.

TavernEvent.text: Drawn by the filth, mice have invaded your Tavern.

Start.text: Tavern Keeper… are there some Inquisitors behind me? Do you think they've seen me? Are they looking this way?

Next1.text: Oh, by Saint Jeru! Please let me hide in your cellar! Just until they find some other victim to burn! I'll give you everything I have.

line0.props.tipText: Hide the heretic.

line1.props.tipText: Report the heretic to the Inquisition.

Start.text: Arr! Your Tavern's not bad, but it could be even better! If your Tavern Keeper knew the rules of arm wrestling, he could teach them to your customers. Everyone would have a much better time!

line0.props.tipText: Pay the Pirate to acquire his knowledge.

line1.props.tipText: Pirate games have a reputation for turning ugly.

Start.text:
I must say, your cooking is very good! But there's so much meat…
Why not put some fish on the menu? Travellers from Belerion would become your most loyal customers!

line0.props.tipText: Thank the Ihrian for her advice

Start.text:
Have you heard about the Great Scholar of Alazar's magical stones? No?
All the most successful Tavern Keepers have at least one!

Next1.text:
Simply place a stone somewhere in your establishment, and well-to-do customers will come running. Not bad, right?
So… How many shall I put you down for?

line0.props.tipText: Refuse to buy the stone.

line1.props.tipText: Buy one of the Great Scholar of Alazar's magical stones.

Start.text:
All of this good food reminds me of a riddle. Want to hear it?
If you can solve it, I'll give you a reward.

Next0.text:
Wonderful!
Now, listen carefully, Mercenaries. Really focus.

Next1.text: You have to cross a river with a wolf, a crocswine, and a crate of apples. But you can only carry one person at a time. How many crossings do you need to get them all across in one piece?

line0.props.tipText: Answer that five crossings are required.

line1.props.tipText: Answer that seven crossings are required.

line2.props.tipText: Answer that only one crossing is required.

Failure.text: Sorry, you lose! You can only carry one person at a time. But neither the wolf, nor the crocswine, nor the crate of apples are people!

Success.text:
That's right! Neither the wolf, nor the crocswine, nor the crate of apples are people!
Take this, with my compliments!

Start.text: After eating and drinking at all the questionable eateries in the Five Kingdoms, I've finally found a Tavern worthy of my talent. Your Tavern, Mercenaries!

Next1.text: No reason to hesitate – I'm any Tavern Keeper's dream Cook!

line0.props.tipText: Recruit the famous Cook.

line1.props.tipText: You already have what you need in the kitchen.

Start.text: Your Bouncers are managing all right, but they should leave it to the professionals. See, I've got decades of Tavern-minding experience under my belt. With a bloke like me around, you'll never have problems again.

line0.props.tipText: Hire the Bouncer.

line1.props.tipText: Refuse to hire another Bouncer.

Start.text: For a modest fee, my troupe and I are willing to perform any piece from our repertoire!

Next1.text: Come on, then! We're not expensive, and it'll add a little atmosphere. Just choose which piece you'd like us to put on.

line0.props.tipText: Choose a very serious and slightly boring religious piece.

line1.props.tipText: Choose a silly, light-hearted farce.

line2.props.tipText: You can't afford to hire jugglers.

Start.text: It's true… I haven't any coin to pay for my meal...

Next1.text: But wait! Don't report me to the Guard right away! I'm a carpenter by trade. I can take on a few jobs for you to pay my debt!

line0.props.tipText: Ask the carpenter to reinforce the door.

line1.props.tipText: Ask the carpenter to sand the tables.

Start.text:
